TECH

Harry Potter, but use AI to make it Balenciaga <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31079355.2922000/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80TXY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA3OTM1NS4yOTIyMDAw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Df95cbff6> Harry Potter Balenciaga characters <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31079355.2922000/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80TXY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA3OTM1NS4yOTIyMDAw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ef95cbff6> Illustration: Francis Scialabba, Source: demonflyingfox/Youtube
Artificial intelligence is being used to create Balenciaga-fied versions of movies and TV shows—a lucky hit of positive publicity for the high-fashion brand that was wrapped up in scandals last year.

A timeline for those of you out touching grass:

YouTube channel demonflyingfox posted “Harry Potter by Balenciaga <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31079355.2922000/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bkQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA3OTM1NS4yOTIyMDAw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B830bae07>” three weeks ago (it now has over four million views), and it—along with a similar channel called Abandoned Films <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31079355.2922000/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80TXc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA3OTM1NS4yOTIyMDAw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B04067436> that started posting content at the same time —has since continued posting Balenciaga crossovers, including for Star Wars and Lord of the Rings.

And about two weeks ago, an AI-generated photo of Pope Francis <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31079355.2922000/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Qlk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA3OTM1NS4yOTIyMDAw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cafae9623> in a Balenciaga coat went mega-viral on Twitter after first being posted on Reddit and Facebook.

How do they do it? By using AI image generators such as Midjourney and AI voice generators like Eleven Labs—which Abandoned Films tagged in the LOTR video where a snatched Boromir says, “One does not simply walk into a Balenciaga fashion show.”

Balenciaga could use the hype: The brand was boycotted by customers after its 2022 holiday campaign featured child models holding bags shaped like teddy bears wearing bondage gear. These AI crossover videos could distract <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31079355.2922000/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80TXk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA3OTM1NS4yOTIyMDAw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce8c5d0ac> from the scandals, judging by praiseful comments on the videos like “This is better than any actual commercial for Balenciaga.”—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31079355.2922000/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80TXo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA3OTM1NS4yOTIyMDAw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C107d0e97>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31079355.2922000/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80TUE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA3OTM1NS4yOTIyMDAw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8b23bebe>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31079355.2922000/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80TUI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA3OTM1NS4yOTIyMDAw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C19c3ec43>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Parks and Recreation/NBC via Giphy
Stat: Despite advice to the contrary from every personal finance guru on the internet, most people don’t ask for more money when they’re offered a job: 58% of men and 61% of women said they didn’t when they were last hired, according to a recent Pew Research Center survey <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31079355.2922000/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80TVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA3OTM1NS4yOTIyMDAw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce552f5a2>. But even when they do ask for more cash, women are less likely to get it than men are. Of those that did negotiate, 38% of women said they were only given the original offer compared to 31% of men.

Quote: “Queen Camilla”

We expected the biggest news about the invitations to the coronation for the UK’s King Charles III to be whether one made its way to Harry and Meghan’s mailbox in Montecito, but the wording of the invite itself is also getting headlines <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31079355.2922000/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80TUg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA3OTM1NS4yOTIyMDAw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc7f6e1cc>. Why? Because it refers to monarch’s wife as “Queen Camilla” rather than as “Queen Consort,” the title she has been using since Queen Elizabeth’s death. Given Camilla’s sometimes fraught relationship with the British press and public (and the late Princess Diana), only 7% of Britons thought she should become queen when the pair married in 2005—so her first official use of the title is drawing some attention.

Read: How cellphones have changed our brains. (BBC <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31079355.2922000/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80TUk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA3OTM1NS4yOTIyMDAw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0a025e0f>)

Markets: The gas tank fueling a four-day winning streak hit empty <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SUs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C26c2dd43> yesterday, as stocks were dragged lower by banks. Significant news on the jobs front, though: The number of US job openings dropped below 10 million for the first time since 2021, showing that perhaps this hot labor market is starting to cool off due to the Fed’s rate hikes.

 

GOVERNMENT

Trump pleads not guilty to 34 felony counts <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SUw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D89306940> Trump in court <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SUw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E89306940> Pool/Getty Images
In a historic day for the US, a former president appeared as a criminal defendant in a courtroom.

Donald Trump was charged <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SU0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3f5ade81> with 34 felony counts of falsifying business records at his arraignment at the Manhattan Criminal Court. He pleaded not guilty to each of them.

Breaking down the criminal case against Trump

We knew that Trump was indicted but not the specific charges against him, which were kept under seal…until yesterday. Here’s what we learned from the 16-page indictment:

The case is extremely complex. But at its core, Trump is accused of falsely labeling business records in order to get around campaign finance laws. And both those points are key, because for the charges to rise from a misdemeanor to a felony, prosecutors have to show that the defendant falsified business records with the intent of committing or concealing a separate crime.

So, what was Trump trying to conceal? According to prosecutors, reimbursement for a $130,000 payment Trump’s former lawyer, Michael Cohen, sent to adult film actress Stormy Daniels in exchange for silence about her alleged affair with Trump. The payment took place in the final days of his 2016 presidential bid, and Trump’s company falsely classified the series of transactions used to reimburse Cohen as legal expenses.

Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg, the architect of the case, has gotten heat from Republicans and (more quietly) some Democrats for bringing a case that possibly relies on an untested legal theory. In response, Bragg emphasized the importance of prosecuting the alleged business fraud due to New York’s status as a global center of commerce.

Next steps

Trump’s lightning-quick NYC trip concluded without taking in a Broadway show or $0.99 pizza slice: He was back in Florida by the evening to give a speech at his Mar-a-Lago estate, where he accused Democrats of using law enforcement to intefere with elections. Trump, portraying himself as a victim of a liberal “witch hunt,” has already used his arraignment as a fundraising opportunity for his presidential campaign by selling “not-guilty” T-shirts <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SU4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Caaaf0e7c> that feature a fake mug shot (no mug shot was taken today).

Looking ahead...Trump’s legal team will use various tactics <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SU8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cea9ff62c> to get this case thrown out before it even goes to trial. If it does goes to trial, that’s months away at the earliest.—SK, NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SVA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C66462462>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SVE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf230e8de>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SVI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccfe54c61>   

TOGETHER WITH TAXACT

T-minus 2 weeks ’til T-Day <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYWM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMyJmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdd180367> TaxAct <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYWM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMyJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6cd0ad79>
We aren’t talkin’ about Tater Tot Day or Tuna Rights Day (which are in February and April, FYI). We’re talkin’ about good ol’ Tax Day.

Sure, that April 18 deadline is still a baker’s dozen days away, but TaxAct can help you file quickly and confidently <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYWM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMyJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5f9ceed1> in no time. They offer a Maximum Refund Guarantee to help you get the most out of your tax return, plus a $100k Accuracy Guarantee.

And with Xpert Assist <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYWM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMyJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf1a13e7a>, TaxAct’s team of experts can answer any tax questions you might have, like “Can I write off my home office plants?” or “My cat counts as a dependent…right?”

Get ready for the big day with TaxAct. Start your return today <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYWM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMyJmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8c599956>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines Illustration of Wisconsin court house Francis Scialabba
Wisconsin’s Supreme Court turns blue after pricey election. Liberal Judge Janet Protasiewicz defeated <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SVM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C09e75a4b> her conservative opponent in the most expensive judicial election in US history (more than $40 million was spent on the contest). Why so much attention? The state’s Supreme Court, now 4–3 in favor of progressives, will likely overturn Wisconsin’s abortion ban and strike down GOP-drawn legislative maps that Protasiewicz has called “rigged.” In the other big Midwestern election yesterday, Chicago residents chose Brandon Johnson <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SVQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbc8893f5> as their next mayor.

Johnson & Johnson proposes monster $8.9 billion talc settlement. The healthcare giant offered $8.9 billion <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3ac67a38> to settle lawsuits from tens of thousands of people who claim that its talc-based powders and other products gave them cancer. It’s a huge increase from the $2 billion J&J originally offered, and would be one of the largest product liability settlements <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SVY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C86510804> in history, according to the WSJ. To clinch the settlement, J&J needs support from more than 75% of the voting claimants—and it thinks it has it.

Finland officially joins NATO: The world’s happiest country became the 31st nation <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SVc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C15874c17> to join the world’s largest security alliance, doubling NATO’s border with Russia. NATO was formed in 1949 to serve as a counterweight against the Soviet Union, and it was Russia’s invasion of Ukraine last year that prompted Finland to link up with the organization. The arrival of Finland, which since World War II has played it neutral wrt Russia, highlights how much Vladimir Putin has isolated himself from Europe in the past year.

CRIMINAL

From ‘30 Under 30’ to alleged fraudster <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SVg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2De2987551> Charlie Javice of Frank <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SVg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ee2987551> LinkedIn
It was a busy Tuesday for New York white-collar crime lawyers. Federal prosecutors arrested and charged <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SVk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf6d81f9f> Charlie Javice, founder of the now-defunct college financial planning site Frank, with four counts of fraud yesterday. The SEC also filed civil charges against Javice, who in 2019 was on the Forbes 30 Under 30 list.

Quick refresher course: JPMorgan bought Frank for $175 million in 2021 to gain access to its huge email list. But a few months later, it sued Javice, claiming Frank’s client roster was bogus. JPMorgan said it realized the 4.25 million users the founder had touted were fudged when it tried to email 400,000 of them and 70% of the emails bounced back (can confirm: that’s bad). The bank alleges that less than 10% of Frank’s user base was real.

In their case, prosecutors claim that Javice tried to convince an employee to pad the customer numbers, which were allegedly closer to 300,000. But when the employee raised legal concerns, Javice assured them, “We don’t want to end up in orange jumpsuits.”

Javice is hoping to make another “under 30” list…Three of the four counts each carry up to 30 years in prison.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SVo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C122073e5>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SS0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B2658e29c>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SV8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf238c945>  

SPORTS

Money is pouring into women’s sports <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SjA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D28b23976> Photo from an NWSL game <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SjA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E28b23976> Icon Sportswire/Getty Images
Women’s soccer scored a landmark investment as interest in women’s sports reaches new heights seemingly every day. Private equity firm Sixth Street committed to spend $125 million <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SjE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7ecec414> on a new Bay Area franchise for the National Women’s Soccer League.

It’s the biggest institutional investment made in a pro women’s sports team, Sixth Street said. Just how big is it? The $53 million the firm is spending on a league expansion fee is nearly 10x the $5 million expansion fee paid for a Kansas City franchise in 2021.

Big picture: Investors see major opportunities in the growth of women’s sports. With more eyeballs comes more lucrative TV contracts—and there have been plenty of eyeballs.

The LSU–Iowa NCAA tournament final drew an average of 9.9 million viewers on ESPN, smashing the record for the most-watched women’s college basketball game in history.

More than 87,000 people packed into Wembley Stadium in London for the 2022 Women’s Euro final, breaking the attendance record for a women’s or men’s Euro final.

More than 1.1 billion viewers around the world watched the 2019 Women’s World Cup. That number will almost certainly balloon for this summer’s tournament.

Looking ahead…Sixth Street CEO Alan Waxman is (unsurprisingly) bullish on women’s soccer in the US. He predicts that the NWSL will reach parity “with every metric” with the MLS in 10 years.—NF

TOGETHER WITH ELECTRIC

Electric <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80RE4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMyJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1adacc25>
Keep IT cool: Feeling the heat from juggling all things IT <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80RE4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMyJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3e5a1a96>? Lower the temp with Electric’s lightning-fast support and 105% ROI. IT leaders of US-based companies with 10–500 employees who attend a qualified meeting before April 30 can keep cool all summer long with a free YETI Cooler. Don’t miss out <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80RE4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMyJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C283d8505>.



GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Food prices at Augusta National Jared C. Tilton/Getty Images
Stat: It’s a tradition unlike any other—marveling at how inflation never seems to affect concession prices at the Masters. Ahead of the golf tournament on Thursday, photos went viral <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SjU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb889e8c2> of the ultra-cheap menu featured at Augusta National’s food stands. An egg salad sandwich costs $1.50, a beer goes for $5, and buying all 25 items on the menu costs $66 in total.

Quote: “I developed games to escape. This was my own world I created.”

Klaus Teuber, who created the board game Catan, died at 70 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SjY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5e5593fc>. He explained to the New Yorker in 2014 that his frustration with his job as a dental technician inspired him to dream up a new (well, old) world. Fueled by escapism, Teuber ended up developing the most beloved resource management game of all time.

Read: How “Blurred Lines,” which came out 10 years ago, predicted everything bad about the past decade in pop culture. (Pitchfork <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Sjc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf4d91ebf>)

Around 5,000 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SmE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca10ec31e> GM white-collar workers accepted buyouts from the automaker. Virgin Orbit <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SmI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cecf67673>, Richard Branson’s satellite launch company, filed for bankruptcy. It botched a mission back in January and couldn’t snag financing that would’ve kept it afloat.

WORK

How the WFH revolution has permanently changed downtowns A halal cart worker checks his phone as people walk past across the road from the unveiling on The Broadway Grand Gallery in Times Square
Now that we’ve rolled past the third anniversary of the beginning of the Covid-19 pandemic, it’s become clear that crowded offices are about as likely to make a comeback as Internet Explorer. In January 2023, six times more work was happening remotely than it was in January 2019, according to WFH Research, a data-collection project.

With more Americans working from their homes, downtown businesses survived the 2020 lockdowns still haven’t fully bounced back.

Morning Brew reporter Sam Klebanov talked to small business owners in office-heavy New York City neighborhoods about what the WFH revolution has meant for them.

Here’s what they said <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31068001.3360432/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80SmM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA2ODAwMS4zMzYwNDMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ec2116184>.

Markets: Markets were a mixed bag <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Rng_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9be4232e> yesterday as investors absorbed the surprise decision by OPEC+ to cut oil production, which is likely to drive up the cost of oil. Airline stocks took a hit on the prospect of higher fuel costs, and the tech-heavy Nasdaq—the hero of last quarter—started Q2 with a down day. Meanwhile, the WWE’s stock got body-slammed after news broke that it agreed to combine with UFC to create a $21.4 billion entertainment company.

 

GOVERNMENT

Trump heads to the courthouse <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Rnk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D347e4c84> Donald Trump <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Rnk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E347e4c84> Eva Marie Uzcategui/Getty Images
In a first for presidential history, Donald Trump will be charged with a crime today. The former president flew into his hometown, New York City, yesterday and is set to appear <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Rno_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb955e543> at the criminal courthouse in lower Manhattan to plead “not guilty” this afternoon.

What will go down today

Today’s courthouse visit is expected to be a short one: Trump will likely be released without bail soon after he’s arraigned.

The charges against him, which are currently in a sealed indictment, will be read at the arraignment—but we already know the prosecutor was investigating hush money paid to adult film actress Stormy Daniels in the final days of Trump’s 2016 presidential run. Then he’ll enter a “not guilty” plea, according to his attorney.

Before the arraignment, the former president will be fingerprinted and possibly photographed for a mug shot, per the usual protocol. Mug shots aren’t released publicly in New York, and it’s unlikely that Trump will be handcuffed and perp-walked in front of the media, to the disappointment of NYC photojournalists.

But he won’t hide from the cameras: Trump plans to hold a press conference in the evening after he returns to his Florida estate, Mar-a-Lago.

Some media outlets asked for permission to bring cameras into the courtroom, an exception to the rules that Trump’s lawyers say would create a “circus-like atmosphere” if granted.

Exactly the atmosphere the Big Apple is gearing up for

Authorities barricaded the courthouse and Trump Tower (where the ex-POTUS crashed for the night) in anticipation of Trump supporter protests and his critics’ counterprotests.

“Be on your best behavior,” Mayor Eric Adams said to one high-profile protester in town for the arraignment: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA).

Looking ahead…Trump has lawyered up with some of the best names in the white-collar defense business, digging in for a long fight that will likely begin with a motion to dismiss the charges, which he claims are politically motivated.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80RkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1834c6b4>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80RkI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C608da1dc>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80RkM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1cf21fee>   

TOGETHER WITH MONOGRAM

The Nasdaq awaits… <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80REo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODEmbHA9dGl0bGU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ced3f64cb> Monogram <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80REo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODEmbHA9aW1hZ2U/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6394b48d>
Monogram plans to list on the Nasdaq this year, but Brew readers don’t have to wait ’til then to invest.

You can invest right now <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80REs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODEmbHA9dGV4dDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1ebd6d08> alongside 17,000+ others backing Monogram’s plan to reinvent the $19.4b joint replacement industry.

Monogram aims to launch the first active-cutting robotic surgical assistant on the market <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80REs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODEmbHA9dGV4dDI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C740e4d7a> to install their personalized, 3D-printed joint implants. That’s perfect timing, considering 50% of joint replacement surgeries will involve robotics by 2030. They even showed off their robot’s potential with a live surgery on a cadaver in front of a 5,000-person digital audience this year.

In a world where 100,000 joint surgeries fail every year, there’s never been a greater kneed for Monogram’s tech.

Invest in Monogram before their intended Nasdaq listing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80REs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODEmbHA9dGV4dDM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C965130fb>. This opportunity closes on May 10.



WORLD

Tour de headlines A Tesla factory in California JOSH EDELSON/AFP via Getty Images
Tesla ordered to pay almost $3.2 million to a worker who was racially harassed. The amount a California jury decided <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80RkQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C51143b90> yesterday former employee Owen Diaz should get sounds like a lot—until you hear that a different jury said he should be awarded $137 million two years ago. Diaz, a Black man who had worked as an elevator operator at a Tesla plant and claimed he was subject to racial abuse, opted for a new trial on damages after a judge said the law required the amount be cut to $15 million despite “disturbing” evidence in the case.

Musk let the doge out on Twitter. For some users yesterday, Twitter’s bird logo was swapped <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80RkU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce2bd6ad5>out for a shiba inu—specifically the shiba inu image best known from the “doge” meme and the volatile cryptocurrency it later inspired. Dogecoin surged 30% following the switcheroo. Notably, Musk owns a shiba inu named Floki and on Friday, lawyers for Musk and Tesla asked a federal court to throw out its $258 billion lawsuit about…Musk manipulating the price of dogecoin with his internet antics.

Paris to say au revoir to e-scooters. Paris is set to ban rental electric scooters <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Rzc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C422003be> as of Sept. 1, following a referendum where a whopping 89% of voters cast their ballots in favor of taking them off the streets. But the vote had a very low turnout with just over 100,000 people participating out of Paris’s ~1.38 million registered voters—even though scooter companies offered registered voters free rides. Online voting, popular with younger voters, was not permitted. The vote was closely watched by other cities in Europe mulling similar scooter prohibitions.

SPACE

Here’s who NASA picked to go to the moon <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80RkY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Db496380d> The four astronauts chosen for Artemis II <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80RkY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Eb496380d> Mark Felix/Getty Images
NASA revealed its team <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Rkc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbcdce39b> yesterday for its upcoming mission around the moon—one small step toward humankind making its first lunar footprints since 1972.

The Artemis II flight test, scheduled for 2024, will ferry its four-person crew to the moon, make a pass close to its surface, and bring them back to Earth over the span of about ten days. It’s part two of a three-part mission to land astronauts on the moon’s surface in 2025—the first time since Neil Armstrong’s day. Part one was a success last year, when an unmanned spacecraft orbited the moon.

So, who’s going to space?

The four lucky Sailor Moons are: Reid Wiseman, Victor Glover, Christina Hammock Koch, and Jeremy Hansen. The crew includes the first woman, the first person of color, and the first Canadian to ever go on a lunar mission.

Why one Canadian? Hansen’s spot on the Artemis II mission cost the Canadian Space Agency an arm and a—well, actually just an arm. In 2020, the CSA sealed the deal <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Rkg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1960a672> by agreeing to give NASA a robotic arm the agency needed for its small, moon-orbiting space station.

P.S. “Astronaut” was US kids’ fifth top answer to “What do you want to be when you grow up?” when Lego and Harris Poll asked <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Rkk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc962bab5> in 2019. No. 1 was “YouTuber/Vlogger.”—JW

TOGETHER WITH FIDELITY TRADER

Award-winning trading. Enjoy a smoother trading experience with Fidelity <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80REw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODEmbHA9dGV4dDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfc1b0119>. MUSIC

Apple joins the Wolf Gang <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Rk0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Da85a0aac> Mozart in Amadeus movie <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Rk0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ea85a0aac> Amadeus/Orion Pictures
In its latest push into audio, Apple launched a dedicated app for classical music last week. And classical music snobs…actually like it <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Rk4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C368ac499>.

Here’s why: The app, called Apple Music Classical, lets you find the classical music you want to listen to. While that doesn’t sound earth-shattering, it is a huge deal, because searching for classical music on services like Spotify was worse than using Bing pre-ChatGPT.

The issue is classical music’s metadata—how it’s labeled and categorized.

Streaming apps are optimized for pop songs that have limited metadata (song/artist/album, typically).

But a piece of classical music has a lot more metadata linked to it, including the composer, the orchestra, the conductor, the movement, the nickname, and the key.

So, it gets messy. Imagine sifting through more than 490 covers of a Dua Lipa track for your favorite rendition. That’s how many recordings of Beethoven’s Piano Concerto No. 5 are on Apple <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Rk8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ceb9f8e5f>, CNET notes.

To help it fix the metadata problem, Apple bought Primephonic, a Dutch startup that had built the back-end data infrastructure needed to surface the most useful search results.

Tack on human editors curating their favorite recordings, and Apple’s hoping its new app will attract both the Lydia Tár types and newbies looking to see what all the Mozart fuss is about.—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80RlA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb58bbf21>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80RlE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C815d28e5>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80RlI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3b9dda0d>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators A chicken sandwich with chicken that's too big Hannah Minn
Stat: Despite what the wing slingers at Hooters would have you believe, when it comes to chicken breasts, bigger isn’t always better. Fast-food joints like KFC and Chick-fil-A need four-pound chickens to make their chicken sandwiches, but they’re in short supply <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80RlM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6b9feadf> as producers have shifted their focus to larger birds (they cost about the same amount to raise, but the bigger birds sell for more). Data from the Dept. of Agriculture shows that small chickens accounted for almost 30% of chickens slaughtered weekly in 2005 but only ~15% in 2023, per the WSJ.

Quote: “Any action that supports those efforts simply to retaliate for a position the company took sounds not just anti-business, but it sounds anti-Florida.”

Disney’s returned CEO Bob Iger made it clear he was back at the company’s shareholder meeting yesterday and that Mickey plans to take no prisoners <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80RlQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6235754b> in the ongoing battle with Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis. To recap: Disney spoke out against the so-called “Don’t Say Gay” bill, prompting the governor to install a new board to govern the special tax district that includes Disney World (the board was picked by Disney, not the state, for the previous 55 years)—but Disney outfoxed DeSantis with a legal maneuver that stripped the new board of power. DeSantis has asked the state’s inspector general to determine whether that legal move was…legal.

Listen: The cellphone is 50 years old. Here’s what its creator has to say. (NPR <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31052283.103981/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80RlU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA1MjI4My4xMDM5ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc975875d>)

  TOGETHER WITH

Facet <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ejI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0NzgxJmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9365d7d5>  
Good morning. I don’t wanna steal any thunder from the Week Ahead section, but when putting together this newsletter, I was thinking about just how packed this first week of April is: Trump’s arraignment tomorrow, Passover, Easter prep, the Masters, and probably a bunch of unexpected things that will pop up. Friday will be here before we know it.

—Neal Freyman

P.S. If you want more context on these stories and other headlines that we can’t squeeze into the newsletter, check out the Brew’s daily podcast <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zOHM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C66813b56> that I co-host. Today’s epi will be up around 10am ET.

Here's what these numbers mean. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zMT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMxMDQxMjY1LjI5NDQ3ODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C149a7498>

Markets: Investors have to feel pretty good heading into the first trading day of the second quarter. After all, last month saw the biggest banking failures since the financial crisis, and the S&P still closed up 3.5%. You can thank two companies <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Qno_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7f6f4104> for that: Microsoft and Apple. These tech giants accounted for about half of the S&P’s gain in March.

Energy: Oil prices jumped <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccdeb0d6b> as much as 8% last night after OPEC and its allies made the surprising decision to cut output. The White House can’t be happy with the Saudis, since the production cut could be inflationary and lead to higher gas prices for Americans.

 

MEDIA

UFC and WWE could be the ultimate tag team <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QkI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Da2627352> Vince McMahon <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QkI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ea2627352> Ethan Miller/Getty Images
Endeavor Group, the parent company of UFC, is nearing a blockbuster deal to buy WWE <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QkM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ceb25ed19>and could announce an agreement imminently, CNBC reported yesterday, which coincidentally(?) was the second day of WrestleMania, WWE’s biggest event.

A deal would mean that three huge personalities in media—Endeavor CEO Ari Emanuel, UFC President Dana White, and WWE Executive Chairman Vince McMahon—will be working at the same company. Not even Erik Spoelstra could manage all that ego in one office.

A deal would also spawn a combat sports entertainment behemoth. WWE would have an enterprise value of $9.3 billion in the acquisition, CNBC reported, a significant premium over its current market value of $6.79 billion. And UFC, the largest global mixed martial arts organization, would be valued at more than $12 billion.

So, how would this all shake out?

The plan is to combine WWE and UFC into one publicly traded firm.

Emanuel, a Hollywood power broker, would remain CEO of Endeavor and also lead the new company.

Dana White would stay president of UFC and WWE CEO Nick Khan will become president of the wrestling unit.

But it’s McMahon who comes out of this impending deal looking like a Logan Roy-level mastermind. With Endeavor scooping up 51% of the new company, he’ll cash out on the humble wrestling promotion he bought from his dad <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QkQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ceb6f98de> in 1982 for $1 million and built into an entertainment juggernaut. McMahon had been shopping around WWE for months, and raised eyebrows when he asked $9 billion for his company. But Endeavor came in from the top rope to give him what he was looking for...and more.

There is controversy surrounding these big personalities

McMahon had temporarily retired in July following a scandal over hush money payments sent to women who accused him of sexual harassment and misconduct. White, meanwhile, was filmed slapping his wife on New Year’s Eve 2022 during an argument (he apologized for his behavior).

Bottom line: Many corporate mergers come labeled with imagined “synergies,” but a UFC–WWE tie-up might truly be a 1+1=3 scenario. WWE could piggyback off of UFC’s success in bringing in sponsorship revenue, and it’s also exploring legalizing betting on its matches in several states.

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QkU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce60e8911>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QkY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9dd8e00d>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Qkc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1388bbb2>  

WORLD

Tour de headlines A rainbow shines amidst the remains of a neighborhood damaged by a tornado on March 31, 2023 in Little Rock, Arkansas.
Deadly tornadoes rip through the US. At least 69 tornadoes touched down across eight states on Saturday, leaving at least 32 people dead <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Qkg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfcdb19d6>. In one harrowing incident, a roof collapsed at an Illinois theater where people were attending a heavy metal concert, killing one attendee. As it headed east, the dangerous storm system knocked out power to hundreds of thousands of people, and when it reached NYC, lightning lit up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Qkk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3f9fa0cc> One World Trade Center. (Here’s <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Qko_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C18350549> why the US experiences so many weather catastrophes.)

Elon Musk escalates vendetta against the New York Times. Twitter removed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Qks_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc77007b2> the NYT’s blue check mark on Sunday as the platform started phasing out legacy verifications in favor of a subscription model. But the move against the Times seems to be personal for Musk. He pushed for the defrocking after learning that the NYT was refusing to pay the fee required for verification, per the Washington Post. Twitter also intended to preserve badges for the 10,000 most followed accounts even if they didn’t pay up, according to the Times. The NYT, with 55 million followers, is the 24th most-followed account on Twitter.

LSU downs Iowa for women’s basketball title. In the highest-scoring championship game ever, The Tigers’ electric offense overpowered Iowa <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Qkw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C17753b01> 102–85, ending Caitlin Clark’s historic tournament run (the Iowa star scored the most points in a single NCAA tournament, men’s or women’s). The men’s tournament will wrap up tonight with UConn taking on San Diego State, which won in an epic buzzer-beater on Saturday.

 

TOGETHER WITH FACET

Procrastination is costing you money <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ejI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0NzgxJmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1121f5e9> Facet <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ejI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0NzgxJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C99610aa6>

Their memberships include an expert financial planner and top-notch support from specialists across investments, taxes, and benefits. Oh, and there’s a limited-time $500 *kick-start offered to new annual members . 

Here are two easy ways to get started: 

Take their free 5-minute Financial Wellness quiz <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ejQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0NzgxJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5833f776> to unlock insights about your financial health.

GEOPOLITICS

Calls mount to #BringEvanHome <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Qk0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dedf163cd> Evan Gershkovich smiling <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Qk0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Eedf163cd> Dimitar Dilkoff/Getty Images
Just five months after the US brought home Brittney Griner from Russian detention, it’s facing another prisoner’s dilemma following the brazen arrest <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Qk4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cea82376d> of American journalist Evan Gershkovich on espionage charges last week.

Outrage at Russia’s action grew over the weekend. In a rare phone call, Secretary of State Antony Blinken told Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov that Gershkovich’s detention was unacceptable <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Qk8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6b7182f5> and demanded Russia release him and another detained American, Paul Whelan.

Top editors at 38 news outlets (including the Wall Street Journal, where Gershkovich works) called for Gershkovich to be immediately released <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QlA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4c5de2e0> and accused Russia of “sending the message that journalism within your borders is criminalized.” The WSJ vehemently denies the allegations against its reporter.

Griner and her wife, Cherelle, also spoke up. In an Instagram post, they urged <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QlE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C714d093f> the White House “to use every tool possible to bring Evan and all wrongfully detained Americans home.”

Who is Gershkovich? A 31-year-old son of Soviet émigrés, he developed a deep interest in Russia and has been working there as a journalist since 2017. Gershkovich was also a talented soccer player: At his alma mater, Bowdoin College, he netted a penalty kick <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QlI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4d38511c> to win an NCAA tournament game.

Looking ahead…WSJ Editor-in-Chief Emma Tucker said on Face the Nation that she’s “optimistic” about making contact with Gershkovich this week.

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QlM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce0af17c1>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Q2U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C85fcba2e>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QlU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C421f47f1>  

CALENDAR

The week ahead Donald Trump in a closing elevator Dominick Reuter/AFP via Getty Images
Trump arraignment: Following his indictment last week, former President Trump is expected to turn himself in to authorities on Tuesday in lower Manhattan. He’ll be fingerprinted and have his mug shot taken, but he isn’t expected to be handcuffed or led on a “perp walk.” We’ll also learn the specific charges filed against him, which for now remain under seal.

Wisconsin Supreme Court election: On Tuesday, cheeseheads will vote <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QlY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1fc90842> in what’s by far the most expensive judicial election in history (more than $37 million has been spent). At stake are abortion rights and legislative maps that could shape the 2024 presidential election. Also in the Midwest tomorrow, Chicago will hold its runoff mayoral election.

Spring holidays: Kitchens all over the world are going to smell really good this week because Passover starts Wednesday night, and Easter is on Sunday. The stock market will be closed for Good Friday.

Everything else…

McDonald’s is temporarily closing its offices <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Qlc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6dd8b061> this week ahead of expected corporate layoffs, the WSJ reports.

Today, NASA will reveal the four astronauts selected to take a trip around the moon for the Artemis 2 mission. It’s slated for November 2024 at the earliest.

The Masters tees off in Augusta, GA, on Thursday. Tiger Woods will be competing.

The March jobs report will be released on Friday.

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators USA, Deep South, Tennessee, Nashville, Broadway. Prisma By Dukas/Getty Images
Stat: The city of hot chicken and Kid Rock’s Big Ass Honky Tonk & Rock ‘n’ Roll Steakhouse is also the nation’s hottest job market. Nashville <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Qlg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbe11699d> topped the list of the WSJ’s annual ranking of job markets, and it was followed by fellow Southern metros Austin, TX, and Jacksonville, FL. So, what’s driving the hiring boom in these cities? Tourism. The surging hospitality economy also helped cities like Las Vegas, Orlando, and New Orleans shoot up the rankings from the previous year.

Quote: “I’m still alive.”

Pope Francis, who will forever be known as the Drippy Pope <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Qlk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C56cb24b3>, shared the good news after being released <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Qlo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc5c6e08d> from the hospital for a pulmonary infection. Rest up, Your Holiness—you’ve got a big week ahead of you.

NEWS

What else is brewing
A prominent pro-war Russian military blogger <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QzA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C703af2fa>, Vladlen Tatarsky, was killed in an explosion at a cafe in St. Petersburg. No one has claimed responsibility, but Russian nationalists are blaming Ukraine.

Tesla’s <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QzE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb97d162b> price cuts helped it deliver a record 422,875 cars in the first quarter, topping projections.

UBS <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QzI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C192b2fe1> may cut its workforce by 20%–30% (as many as 36,000 employees) following its emergency takeover of Credit Suisse, SonntagsZeitung reported. Swiss prosecutors <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QzM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3b4de3bc> are also investigating the deal for potential criminal offenses.

Ryuichi Sakamoto <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31041265.2944781/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QzQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTA0MTI2NS4yOTQ0Nzgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb6dd9bbe>, a Japanese composer, producer, and electronic music pioneer, died at 71.

Name change trivia

We’ll give you the name that a famous person was given at birth, and you have to identify who we better know them as now. We’ll also give you a clue as to why they’re famous.

Example: Peter Gene Hernandez → Bruno Mars.

Jorge Mario Bergoglio (very public figure)

 TOGETHER WITH

WHOOP <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80eVE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9b8eba6e> 
Good morning and Happy April Fools’ Day. If you’re having trouble thinking of a simple prank today, just go with the classic: Fake your own death and swap lives with the twin sister you just discovered who is royalty.

—Sam Klebanov, Jamie Wilde, Matty Merritt, Abby Rubenstein, Neal Freyman

Markets: Stocks climbed higher yesterday to end the quarter with a bang after the Fed’s favorite inflation gauge <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QU4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cda7a758e> came in lower than expected.

Stock spotlight: It’s too soon to say what impact the indictment of Donald Trump will have on his campaign, but it has already given a boost to Digital World Acquisition Corp., the SPAC that plans to merge with Trump’s Truth Social. Its shares popped after Trump used Truth Social to respond to the big news.

 

FINANCE

If you invested in tech stocks last quarter, congrats <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QU8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dd74746ff> Stock lines on a chart banking and tech going different directions <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QU8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ed74746ff> Francis Scialabba
With the first quarter of 2023 behind us, we now know that if you’d visited a good Tarot card reader on New Year’s Day, they would’ve told you to park your cash in tech stocks and avoid bank shares.

Despite wild fluctuation due to continuous rate hikes from the Fed and an unexpected bank panic, stocks and bonds managed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QVA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce8ee8bbe> to turn in a pretty, pretty, pretty good performance for the quarter. The S&P 500 gained 7% and the Dow Jones Industrial Average gained 0.4%.

But tech is indisputably the honors students.

Top of the class

Wall Street rewarded tech companies’ layoffs and other cost cutting measures, giving tech stocks a resurgence. And as ChatGPT becomes a household name, investors clearly have their money on generative AI being the next big bet.

The tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite index rose a whopping 18% since January 1, its largest quarterly gain in two years.

Stocks of the tech giants leading the charge in AI-powered search, Microsoft and Alphabet, are up 20% and 16%, respectively.

And in an I-told-you-so triumph for your crypto-obsessed cousin, Bitcoin has surged 72%.

Meanwhile, the second- and third-largest bank collapses in US history happening within 48 hours hurt *drumroll please*…banks.

The remedial bunch

Bank stocks were a delight for short sellers, who made $2 billion betting against the sector in the past three months.

Smaller institutions were most badly injured by the bank panic: The SPRD S&P Regional Banking ETF, which consists of non-behemoth banks, had more than a quarter of its value wiped out in Q1.

Large banks are feeling the pinch of rising interest rates: Global merger and acquisition deals suffered the biggest first-quarter decline since 2001, according to the Financial Times and Refinitiv.

Looking ahead: While Q1 proved just about anything can happen, it’s safe to bet that the market’s future performance largely hinges on what Jerome Powell and his central bankers decide what to do next.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QVE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2d79127c>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QVI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C231a86aa>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QVM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3814a7d0>   

TOGETHER WITH WHOOP

Tell us how you really feel <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80eVE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9dd6ff9c> WHOOP <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80eVE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7fcf8691>
Obvious statement alert: Stress is a part of life. But being able to identify those everyday stressors makes them much easier to manage.

Get 24/7 stress monitoring with the all-new Stress Monitor <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80eVI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccfc56cff> feature from WHOOP. Stress Monitor gives you a real-time stress score between 0 and 3 by measuring your heart rate and HRV and comparing that to your baseline. You can then choose a science-backed breathwork session to help you better manage those stressful moments.

Oh, and you won’t need to be hooked up to a bunch of wires for it to work. The slim, stylish WHOOP wearable <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80eVM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6f7507c4> slips onto your wrist and immediately begins measuring your heart rate variability, sleep, recovery, daily activity, and now stress levels.

Commit to your best, less-stressed self <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80eVQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3JmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3872540a>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines Donald Trump Shane Bevel/Getty Images
Your Trump indictment update: The criminal indictment against former President Donald Trump remains under wraps, but information about the unprecedented situation keeps trickling out. So, here’s what we know: Trump is expected to plead not guilty <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QnI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca830cb4c> Tuesday afternoon in New York. He’s said to be facing more than 30 counts <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QnM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C23e3b2b1> related to the alleged payment of hush money to porn actress Stormy Daniels. Many prominent Republicans have decried the case against the ex-commander-in-chief, but one statement struck some as a little lackluster: Ivanka Trump’s Insta said “I love my father, and I love my country. Today, I am pained for both.”

Dominion gets an edge in its $1.6b case against Fox. The judge overseeing the defamation suit over claims the 2020 election was stolen ruled <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QnE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb74471a1> yesterday that the case should proceed to trial on April 17. He also handed Dominion an advantage going into that trial, finding that the evidence showed it was “CRYSTAL clear” that none of the statements made on air by Fox News personalities about the company's equipment were true and that the company’s reputation was damaged. To win, Dominion will still need to prove that Fox knew the statements were false or recklessly disregarded the truth.

New rules will make many EVs ineligible for tax breaks. If you were counting on a tax credit to push an electric car into your price range, you might want to hit the Tesla dealership before April 18. That’s when new Treasury Department rules <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QVQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8ddde12d> aimed at getting EV-makers to source critical minerals and battery components from the US and its allies (rather than China) will take effect. Because most do currently rely on supplies from China, very few EVs will remain eligible for the full credit.

TECH

Italy gives ChatGPT the boot <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D98cdef84> A cancel symbol in the Italian flag's colors over the OpenAI logo <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E98cdef84> Francis Scialabba
Yesterday, Italy’s data protection authority temporarily banned <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QVY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccc3c15b0> ChatGPT—and not because the AI chatbot may have told one user he could slather his pasta <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QVc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbcf85e19> in Flamin’ Hot Cheetos salsa.

The regulator is primarily concerned that ChatGPT collects and stores Italian users’ personal data without their permission. It also called out the chatbot’s lack of age verification.

AI chatbots *do* have a lot of data in their trunk

The ban stems from a recent accidental leak of user conversations with ChatGPT. But things could get even thornier if the regulator decides to also delve into the other kind of data the system stores. AI systems like ChatGPT make huge sweeps of the internet and feed all that info into their underlying algorithms. Sorting out what data out of that info glut belongs to Italian citizens if necessary would be…complicated.

And other regulatory authorities may soon secondo similar demands:

The EU and UK are working on plans to regulate AI.

US regulators were urged <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QVg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfc45b8ef> this week to investigate ChatGPT’s creator, OpenAI, by an advocacy group.

Also this week, more than 1,000 tech leaders and AI experts signed a controversial open letter calling <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QVk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B9450dd26> for a six-month pause on all AI projects.

Looking ahead…OpenAI has already pulled ChatGPT out of Italy and has 20 days to present a plan for a fix—or it could face a fine of 20 million euros, or about $22 million.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QVo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C421dd17a>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QS0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc9058329>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QV8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbf8275b9>    

TOGETHER WITH THE MOTLEY FOOL

The Motley Fool <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUlM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9fb61820>
Play the long game. Time travel may not be an option (yet). But The Motley Fool has the next best thing: 5 market pullback stocks that have hit some low prices but still show solid potential signs for future success. Sign up for Stock Advisor <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUlM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C795ba530> to get the deets on these stocks.



SOCIAL MEDIA

Twitter says no more free rides <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QjA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dd5a1249e> Hand cutting twitter verification badge in half. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QjA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ed5a1249e> Illustration: Hannah Minn
RIP to your free blue check mark and all the perks that came with it (i.e., more reply guys). Today Twitter will start phasing out <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QjE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C41f5b932> the verification badge for anyone not willing to pay $8 a month for Twitter Blue.

And that monthly fee is a relative bargain: Larger institutions will have to pay at least $1,000 a month for verification. Twitter CEO Elon Musk also tweeted that as of April 15, your For You feed will only recommend content from paid accounts and people you follow.

There is an exception for the site’s top 500 advertisers and 10,000 most followed organizations (including YouTube, NASA, CNN, ESPN, and the New York Times), which will get to keep their checkmarks without paying up.

Other big accounts are out: Notable figures and outlets, from LeBron James to the White House, have said they won't be paying for verification, which should make for an interesting feed: One researcher found <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QjI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B4d81f525> that roughly half of the 220,000 Twitter Blue subscribers have less than 1,000 followers.

But Musk needs a win. And Twitter needs cash: The company’s value has been halved from the $44 billion since he bought it in October.—MM

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Three graves, each smaller than the last with an arrow pointing down Francis Scialabba
Stat: Living in the US has many benefits, including access to stunning national parks and pizza with cheese baked into the crust, but a long and healthy life isn’t one of them. A Financial Times data journalist crunched the numbers <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QjY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3f86ba11> and found that the average American now has the same “healthy life expectancy” (the measure of years lived in good health) as someone born in Blackpool—a depressed seaside town with England’s lowest life expectancy. Eschewing British understatement, he also noted that it’s a particularly bad look for the US, since the UK doesn’t even have the best life expectancy in Europe.

Quote: “I gave my whole salary to water.org because we were down.”

Matt Damon has finally revealed why he ended up in that Crypto.com commercial. In the movie star’s telling, it was for the good of humanity: Damon took the gig <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Qjc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C49e3323c> to get money to hand over to his water microfinance charity. And here we were thinking he just really believed that fortune favors the brave.

What else is brewing
Dangerous tornadoes <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QnQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc6a07e9f> impacted at least 3 million people yesterday as they tore through Arkansas and other parts of the South and Midwest.

Virgin Orbit <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Qjk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C22f4c75c>, Richard Branson’s satellite company, has failed to secure a deal to save itself and will cease operations and cut most of its staff.

Rust assistant director David Halls <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QmE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc4b1c107> pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor gun charge in the on-set death of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins and was sentenced to six months probation.

Oscar Pistorius <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QmI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc180b542>, the former Paralympian who was convicted of murdering his girlfriend, was denied parole in South Africa.

A Miami aquarium <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QmM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca8b50d1c> plans to release Lolita, an orca whale who has lived there for 50 years, back into the wild.

INSIDE JOBS

The only career where your hand might be more precious than a hand model’s Jim from the Office doing jazz hands The Office/NBC via Giphy
​​Inside Jobs, our series on unconventional careers, is back.

Michelle Marquis is a professional calligrapher. That’s right, she not only still remembers how to write in cursive, but she gets paid to do it with style—full time. Marquis majored in science, but shortly after graduating took a calligraphy class and started writing as a hobby. It didn’t take long for people to ask her to take on projects, and she turned it into her career.

Now, her most popular service is engraving wine bottles <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Qm8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb8499a5e> for special occasions, but she also creates wedding invitations and even performs calligraphy in person for customers at luxury boutiques like Guerlain. We asked her all about her loopy career.

Check it out here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80QnA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E6ed1c80d>.
