Impact.com <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80dmo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAxJmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0dcb675a>

Markets: Stocks kept the positive vibes going <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d2E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4b2ac007> on the penultimate day of March, led once again by rising tech shares. The retailer, which desperately needs cash to avoid bankruptcy, crashed again yesterday after it tore up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d2I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca8bb3e52> a fundraising deal in favor of a plan to sell as much as $300 million in stock. Its market cap is now just above $70 million.

LEGAL

It happened: Trump indicted on criminal charges <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d2M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D15459a1e> Former President Trump <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d2M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E15459a1e> Anna Moneymaker/Getty Images
Well, we’re back to living in unprecedented times. In a first for a former US president, Donald Trump was indicted <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d2Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4dc964d0> on criminal charges by a New York grand jury yesterday, his lawyers and prosecutors said.

To call this explosive doesn’t do justice to TNT—it will become the defining plotline of the 2024 presidential race, which Trump has already entered in his bid to reclaim the White House.

So, what are the charges?

No one actually knows yet. Charges are sometimes kept under wraps until the defendant makes their first appearance in court (known as an arraignment). Trump is expected to be arraigned in New York City next Tuesday, according to CNN.

But we do know what the investigation centered on: $130,000 in hush money sent to porn star Stormy Daniels by Trump’s former lawyer, Michael Cohen. Daniels claims to have had an affair with Trump—which he denies, along with the allegations that he was involved in paying her to keep quiet. Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg, a Democrat, is accusing Trump and his company of falsifying business records to hide this payment.

An indictment is just the beginning of the process for the government to make a criminal case—and an eventual conviction is no slam dunk <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d2U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C02208d39>. It relies on a “novel legal theory” that “has never been tested in court,” according to the National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers.

To prove Trump committed a felony, prosecutors will have to demonstrate that he falsified these records to cover up or commit a seperate crime.

Everyone chimed in

Following the indictment, both political parties staked out their positions.

Democrats said the charges show that the US justice system works as designed to hold the powerful to account and that no one, not even a former president, is above the law.

Republicans, echoing Trump’s rebuttal, claimed it was a political hit job by Dems to weaken his 2024 prospects against President Biden. Trump will likely lean into this “witch hunt” theme on the campaign trail, he's already called the indictment “Political Persecution and Election Interference at the highest level in history.”

What happens next: When Trump arrives in New York next week for his arraignment, he’ll be fingerprinted and have a mug shot taken (which will easily become the most viral picture of all time if made public).

This could also be the first of several indictments to come through the pipeline for Trump. He’s being investigated in three other criminal probes, including one over his alleged mishandling of classified documents.—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d2Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc2a4cf21>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d2c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7a718a8d>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d2g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce8b977df>   

TOGETHER WITH IMPACT.COM

Power up your partnerships, pronto <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80dmo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAxJmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3380af3a> Impact.com <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80dmo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAxJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C79dadff7>
When beauty retailer Sephora—perhaps you’ve heard of ’em—wanted more effective time management and partner recruitment methods, they realized their bag of tools was shy of a few essential components.

Luckily, after migrating to impact.com <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80dm0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAxJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca03e5271>, Sephora stocked up on the right tech, tools, and skills to streamline their workflows and build a more diversified partner mix.

With this new foundation, Sephora was able to achieve $7.4m in revenue from 293 partners, a 101% increase in partner growth <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80dm0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAxJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4702a6bc>, and 3x revenue growth after partnering with impact.com. Talk about a glow-up!

To get the deets on Sephora’s journey to success, take a look at their case study <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80dm0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAxJmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C18adefb3>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines Evan Gershkovich smiling Dimitar Dilkoff/Getty Images
Russia arrests American journalist for alleged espionage. A reporter for the Wall Street Journal, Evan Gershkovich, was arrested Wednesday <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80dlo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf974e367> in the city of Yekaterinburg for allegedly investigating Russian military secrets for the US. It’s the first time an American journalist has been detained on espionage charges in Russia since the Cold War and a sign of escalating tensions between the rival countries as Russia’s war in Ukraine continues. The WSJ said it “vehemently denies the allegations,” and the White House also condemned <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80di0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cea83d738> Russia’s “targeting of American citizens.”

A court nixed an Obamacare preventative care mandate. Yesterday, a federal judge in Texas blocked <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d2k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C84f12602> the Affordable Care Act’s mandate that required insurers to cover PrEP, an HIV preventative medication, and preventative screenings for some cancers. The ruling could affect nearly 100 million Americans who use one or more of these ACA-covered services. The ruling came in a lawsuit that argued the mandate forces religious employers to cover drugs that “encourage homosexual behavior, prostitution, sexual promiscuity, and intravenous drug use.” The Biden administration is expected to appeal, and insurers are still likely to offer this coverage for now. Wall Street bonuses slashed. If your I-banking friend is summering in Havasu instead of the Hamptons this year, it may be because the average Wall Street bonus plunged by 26% <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d2o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbd6bb25d> in 2022 to $176,700. This drop, which is the biggest since 2008, is a consequence of both a slowdown in dealmaking and cost-cutting efforts by banks. There were only 71 Wall Street-led IPOs last year that raised a total of $7.7 billion—a tiny fraction of the $142 billion raised by IPOs in 2021. Wall Street bonuses typically account for more than 75% of total comp for NYC-based bankers and traders, per the Financial Times.

POP CULTURE

She’s Gwynocent <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80dzI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D3af351a6> Gwyneth Paltrow in court. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80dzI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E3af351a6> Rick Bowmer/Getty Images
Just hours after the world learned that Trump had been indicted, another headline-grabbing legal battle reached its conclusion: A jury found Gwyneth Paltrow not at fault <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d2s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd793cc8c> for a 2016 ski collision in Utah that injured retired optometrist Terry Sanderson, who sued her for $300,000.

Paltrow not only won the $1 she requested in her countersuit against Sanderson, but she also won the internet. The eight-day trial inspired an avalanche of TikToks and memes that framed Paltrow, an actor and business mogul, as a heroic figure in this drama.

Why was the trial so viral? Mainly because it produced so many soundbites that seemed like they were lifted from a White Lotus episode skewering the wealthy and aloof.

After being asked how the crash inconvenienced her, Paltrow told the courtroom, “Well, I lost half a day of skiing.”

Paltrow was questioned about “intimate” gifts she had given to Taylor Swift.

Sanderson’s witnesses said that following the crash, he was unable to enjoy wine tastings.

Big picture: Having built her Goop empire on outrageously expensive candles and scientifically murky wellness advice, Paltrow has been preparing for the role of out-of-touch rich woman in court for a long time.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80dzU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb208926c>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80dzY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C44ad5acd>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80dzc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C858dd236>

BUSINESS

Disney pulls a fast one on DeSantis <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80dlQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dd6e294e8> Mickey Mouse tipping his hat <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80dlQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ed6e294e8> Disney via Giphy
It looks like Disney has added a new character to the Magic Kingdom: the troll.

The company quietly entered agreements <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80dlU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdc62044b> that rendered the board Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis hand-picked to govern the special tax district surrounding Disney World nearly powerless.

Bewildered board members only learned about these agreements this week, and one said they planned to “correct” Disney’s behind-the-scenes sleight of hand. Disney, though, asserts it was all kosher.

How did we get here? For 55 years, the state allowed Disney to make its own rules for developing the land where its theme parks sit. But after the company criticized the so-called “Don’t Say Gay” bill, DeSantis installed his own board to run the district.

With the new board in place, it looked like DeSantis had won…until Disney pulled a Mulan-like switcheroo. When the board was still Disney-controlled, it entered into restrictive covenants for the land that:

Bar the new board from using the Disney name or any of the company’s IP, including Mickey Mouse.

Give Disney the right to review any proposed changes to properties in the district.

And, fittingly for a company synonymous with princesses, Disney made the agreements valid until “21 years after the death of the last survivor of the descendants of King Charles III, king of England.”—AR

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80dlY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfbcbc014>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80dlc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf7eded92>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80dlg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8c84c606>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators College basketball player Caitlin Clark on Iowa C. Morgan Engel/Getty Images
Stat: The women’s Final Four basketball games will be played tonight, with a record number of TV viewers tuning in to the tournament. In fact, the Iowa–Louisville Elite Eight game last Sunday drew more viewers (nearly 2.5 million) than any NBA game on ESPN this season. The marquee matchup—Caitlin Clark’s Iowa vs. Aliyah Boston’s South Carolina—is at 9pm ET.

Quote: “I was wrong to say sell.”

Investor Michael Burry threw egg on his own face by acknowledging that his advice to sell stocks on Jan. 31 was a bad call <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d2w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2e589f79>, given the the market’s resilience since then. Why do people care what Burry has to say? He’s the guy portrayed by Christian Bale in The Big Short who correctly called the housing implosion in 2008. After issuing his mea culpa on Twitter, Burry congratulated traders who’ve been buying the dip.

Friday puzzle

Today’s puzzle is a classic known as “Seven Bridges of Königsberg.” This old Prussian town has seven bridges (shown in red), and your task is to devise a route that crosses each of those bridges once and only once.

Can you do it?

ANSWER

Apologies if you spent a lot of time on this, but the answer is…no path crosses each bridge only once. Here’s the explanation <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d0I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce27e384e>, first put forth by the famous mathematician Leonard Euler in 1735.

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zSj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMxMDE2MzY1LjI5NDU5MDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbdeed03f>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zSz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMxMDE2MzY1LjI5NDU5MDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2fc928b8>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zTD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMxMDE2MzY1LjI5NDU5MDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C32a3dd92>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zTT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMxMDE2MzY1LjI5NDU5MDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C36cf9b56>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OXo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C68b97b3c>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zTz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMxMDE2MzY1LjI5NDU5MDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca34ff594>

 TOGETHER WITH

vin social <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cWg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ceda56ca0> 
Good morning. If you’re looking to spice up your email signoffs, ChatGPT has a few ideas. Shaun Usher, a self-styled “professional letter nerd,” asked the chatbot to come up with unique signoffs <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cVE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccb18aa63> for letters in various categories. Here are a few that might inspire…

“Happy”: Toasting to our correspondence, Shaun

“Angry”: From the end of my rope, Shaun

“Congratulatory”: In the glow of your achievement, Shaun

“Hot”: Yearning for your taste, Shaun

“Holidaying”: Embracing the culture, Shaun

“Corporate”: Yours in enterprise, Shaun

—From our screens to your heart, Jamie Wilde, Matty Merritt, Abby Rubenstein, Neal Freyman

Markets: Tech stocks were the stars of yesterday’s market rodeo, pushing the Nasdaq into a new bull market <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cVI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C60bc9636>. The tech-focused index ended the day up more than 20% from its low at the end of December, boosted by big rallies from Apple, Microsoft, and Amazon. Investors also seemed less nervous about the banking industry as lawmakers grilled regulators for the second day in a row.

TECH

Musk and 1k others ask for a pause on AI projects <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cVM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D2dafadf6> A pause symbol in green pixels <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cVM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E2dafadf6> Hannah Minn
Elon Musk and other tech leaders signed an open letter <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cVQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfad60a4a> calling on developers to “pause giant AI experiments.” The petition, which more than 1,000 folks have signed, warns that artificial intelligence poses “profound risks to society and humanity” and asks AI researchers to put their projects on ice for at least six months.

That’s asking a lot: OpenAI launched the latest version of its artificially intelligent chatbot, ChatGPT 4, this month; Google started rolling out its AI chatbot called Bard last week; and Microsoft added AI capabilities to its Bing search engine in February. Goldman Sachs even shared a report <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca5b13033> on Monday that said AI could boost worker productivity so much that annual world GDP would jump by 7%.

So, why stop the progress now?

For Frankensteinian reasons: Per the letter, developers are “locked in an out-of-control race to develop and deploy ever more powerful digital minds that no one—not even their creators—can understand, predict, or reliably control.”

The letter calls out AI systems’ tendency toward confidently pumping out misinformation and escalates quickly to discuss AI’s potential to automate jobs and “outsmart” and “replace us” to the point that we “risk loss of control of our civilization.” *Sips coffee.*

It was penned by the Future of Life Institute, a nonprofit organization focused on mitigating existential threats <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cVY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb71c1d29> to humanity, particularly AI. Notable signatories besides Musk include Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak, Skype co-founder Jaan Tallinn, and politician Andrew Yang.

To ensure AI ends up being more Wall-E than Skynet, the letter asks AI labs to use what it calls an “AI summer” break to create and implement safety protocols that ramp up oversight on the development of artificially intelligent systems. If not, it asks governments to step in and force the pause.

Yeah, but…other experts, including Bing’s AI chatbot <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cVc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cef694eb0> (!), say that even if the tech has issues, a pause isn’t the right solution. Critics say the letter contributes to “AI hype” and overfocuses on the threat to knowledge workers above other concerns.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cVg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3cec5a63>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cVk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1f0ddc8f>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cVo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce1fca14c>   

TOGETHER WITH VIN SOCIAL

Sippin’ on success <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cWg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C745acf37> vin social <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cWg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbda509c5>

WORLD

Tour de headlines A bottle of Narcan Justin Sullivan/Getty Images
The FDA approved over-the-counter sales of an opioid overdose drug. The agency decided that Narcan <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cS0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5e035ce9> can be sold without a prescription, paving the way for the lifesaving nasal spray that reverses opioid overdoses to become more widely available. The move follows the deaths of more than 100,000 Americans due to drug overdoses last year. The company that makes Narcan, which has been available with a prescription since 2015, said it expects to be selling it in stores and online by late summer.

Adidas decides not to object to a BLM stripe design after all. Adidas withdrew <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cV8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce50f85c0> its objection to a Black Lives Matter group’s application for a US trademark featuring three parallel stripes—48 hours after filing it. The company didn’t explain its decision to yank its complaint, which stated that the design was too similar to its logo, but Reuters reported it was because the concern could be misconstrued as opposition to BLM’s goals. The sportswear brand is likely looking to avoid that kind of attention after parting ways with Kanye West over his racist and antisemitic statements.

Marvel chief out at Disney. Disney fired <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cjA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7aa1cac7> Ike Perlmutter, who sold Marvel to Disney for ~$4 billion in 2009. Disney described the termination as part of its recent decision to lay off 7,000 employees (it also cut the entire Marvel Entertainment unit he ran, which is distinct from the Marvel Studios unit that makes all those blockbusters). But Perlmutter wasn’t just any Disney employee, and he’d recently butted heads with CEO Bob Iger by backing activist investor Nelson Peltz’s bid to get a seat on the company’s board.

LABOR

Bernie had some questions for Starbucks’s Schultz <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cjE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dfa62e1ab> Howard Schultz and Bernie Sanders staring at each other with coffee cup in center <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cjE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Efa62e1ab> Illustration: Francis Scialabba, Photos: Getty Images
Interim Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz appeared <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cjI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf7897c29> at a Senate hearing yesterday about the company’s role in the wave of unionization hitting its coffee shops—something he only agreed to after Sen. Bernie Sanders threatened to subpoena him into the hot seat. And Sanders was not interested in a light roast: He accused the coffee company of “the most aggressive and illegal union-busting campaign in the modern history of our country.”

In yesterday’s hearing, Schultz responded to the accusations, saying, “Starbucks coffee company, unequivocally…has not broken the law.”

But it’s no secret that Starbucks has fought unionization efforts. Since fall 2021, 290 Starbucks stores have voted to unionize. In that time, Starbucks Workers United has filed 500+ charges of unfair labor practices against the company, and judges have ruled that Starbucks broke federal labor law 130 times.

Bernie’s not the only outsider getting involved:

Republican lawmakers have voiced support for Starbucks, and a Republican-led committee subpoenaed the National Labor Relations Board for records. They believe the federal agency improperly handled a union election in Kansas City.

Plus, Starbucks investors voted last week on whether to have a third-party group look into the company’s alleged union busting, but have not released the vote counts publicly.

Looking ahead…Starbucks has yet to agree to any union contracts, and even with a new CEO, the coffee chain is unlikely to reverse course and accept the union any time soon.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cjM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C05fd9aae>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cjQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B9719c073>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cjU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9913287e>   

TOGETHER WITH VEEAM

Veeam <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cWo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc71861b9>
Call for backup. Happy (early) World Backup Day! This video from Veeam <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cWo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf8259e0f> shows you what life could be like when you *don’t* back up your data. Real friends don’t let friends go without a backup. SPORTS

The king of Queens <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cjY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D90870457> Steve Cohen <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cjY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E90870457> Newsday LLC/Getty Images
It’s Opening Day for Major League Baseball, and the main storylines we’re watching are a) all the rule changes <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cjc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C06a96012> intended to speed up the game and b) the stunning transformation <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cjg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5851188d> of the NY Mets from a hapless franchise laced with self-pity to the biggest spender the league has ever seen.

That makeover is the work of Steve Cohen, a hedge fund billionaire who bought the Mets for $2.4 billion in 2020. This offseason, Cohen maxed out his AmEx Black Card on free agents to bring the team’s projected 2023 payroll to ~$370 million, shattering the MLB record.

For comparison, the team with the second-biggest payroll is the Yankees, who are spending about $210 million on players this year.

We should mention the Mets are also expected to owe a record luxury tax of ~$100 million.

What’s Cohen’s deal? If you’ve seen the show Billions, the investor Bobby Axelrod is loosely based on him. In 2013, Cohen’s hedge fund, SAC Capital, pleaded guilty to insider trading, resulting in Cohen paying $1.8 billion in fines and getting temporarily banned from managing money for clients.

Zoom out: MLB Commissioner Rob Manfred said this week that Cohen’s unheard-of spending spree has “real benefits for the game,” but also widens the gap between the small- and large-market teams. Others say Cohen isn’t the problem—other ultrawealthy owners should be required to open up their wallets just like he has.—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cjk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ceaa96042>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cmE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc054422b>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cmI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3dcc145b>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators A diploma on top of stacks of money Francis Scialabba
Stat: Getting into an Ivy League school is hard, but paying for it may be even harder. The cost of attending classes in a Gothic building while living in a dorm with cinderblock walls is approaching $90,000 per year <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cmM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccff49fb9>, according to Bloomberg. While ~50% of students at these institutions receive financial aid (enough that one economist said the price of attendance has actually gone down for students from households making less than $125k), it still puts the sticker price for becoming someone people roll their eyes at when you name-drop your school above the annual income of many US families.

Quote: “It is something we can leverage to convey that idea of unapologetic enjoyment once again.”

Pepsi is getting a new look: Just in time for its 125th birthday, the second-most iconic American soda brand has gotten a logo <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cmQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc2cefbb0> redesign that execs think will spark joy. The updated logo puts the Pepsi name in the center of the circle (where everyone always thought it was anyway) and incorporates the color black to help highlight the black-canned Pepsi Zero Sugar line that the brand expects to help keep Gen Z drinking pop.

Read: The real story behind “Rosie the Riveter”—it’s not the myth you know. (JSTOR Daily <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cmU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbb1bfb21>)

NEWS

What else is brewing
UBS <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cmY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1e0c423d> is putting its ex-CEO Sergio Ermotti back at the helm to help it manage the absorption of rival Credit Suisse. He’ll have his work cut out for him: A whistleblower claims <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cmc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C09828313> Credit Suisse has been helping wealthy Americans evade taxes.

Pope Francis <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cmg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8ff397f1> has been hospitalized for a respiratory infection.

China <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cmk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C18b34973> threatened to retaliate if the president of Taiwan and House Speaker Kevin McCarthy go through with their planned meeting in Los Angeles next week.

 TOGETHER WITH

Starbucks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bjY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEzJmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C07c3d820> 
Good morning. According to the New York Times, there is apparently a monthly Ryan Meetup for Ryans at Ryan Maguire’s Bar & Restaurant in Manhattan—no non-Ryans allowed.

This Ryan congress builds on a rich tradition of people gathering for no apparent reason other than they share the first name on their birth certificate.

In the past two years, Joshes have convened in Nebraska for the annual “Josh Fight” to raise money for charity.

But our favorite same-name meetup happened at a UK pub in 2019, where 433 Nigels got together to “celebrate Nigelness” before the name goes extinct. No one in the country named their baby Nigel in 2020.

—Matty Merritt, Sam Klebanov, Neal Freyman, Abby Rubenstein

Shares in the Chinese e-commerce giant popped after it announced the most extreme restructuring in its history: It’s going to split up into six business units (“mini Alibabas <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bkM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7ef2f381>,” the FT writes) that could IPO separately.

FINANCE

Apple is getting into buy now, pay later <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80blI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dde74974a> Apple pay later screen. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80blI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ede74974a> Apple
It has never been easier to trick yourself into paying $250 for a pair of jeans, because Apple rolled out <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80blM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C821cff80> its buy now, pay later (BNPL) service yesterday. The feature, Apple Pay Later, was introduced to randomly selected Apple Pay users and will become available to more customers over the next few months.

How it works: When using Apple Pay to buy something, users can pay for $50–$1,000 purchases in four payments over six weeks with no interest or fees.

It’s a weird time to get into BNPL

Rewind to peak Covid, when digital layaway companies were hotter than matching sweatsuits. In 2021, Swedish BNPL company Klarna was Europe’s most valuable fintech startup at a valuation of $45.6 billion. The same year, Block (formerly Square) bought the Australian BNPL company Afterpay for a staggering $30 billion.

But eye-popping valuations didn’t stick around for long. By mid-2022, rising interest rates strained BNPL companies’ business models, and regulators started cracking down on potentially predatory lending practices. Plus, the BNPL field has gotten more crowded than an Old Navy during the 2010 $1 flip-flop sale as established companies like Walmart and PayPal tried to cash in on the gold rush.

But now, the state of BNPL looks more like…an Old Navy the day after the $1 flip-flop sale. Klarna’s valuation plummeted 85% to just $6.7 billion in a July 2022 funding round. And when the short seller Hindenburg accused <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80blQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4de07c9f> Block of being ultra-sketchy in a scathing report last week, it said that acquiring Afterpay was actually a very bad idea, btw, because the company was “designed in a way that avoided responsible lending rules.”

Apple sees opportunity among the ruins

While unprofitable BNPL startups watch their VC drips dry up, the tech behemoth is cool with losing money on its Apple Pay Later feature for a while. It’s got iPhone money. And Apple has been playing the long game in its ultimate goal of replacing your leather wallet completely. In October 2014, when Apple Pay was first introduced, 3% of retailers in the US used its contactless payment service. Now, over 85% of retailers accept Apple Pay.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80blU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9862f6e0>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80blY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccb882cb2>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80blc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C515c572f>  

WORLD

Tour de headlines Robin Wolfenden prays at a makeshift memorial for victims outside the Covenant School building at the Covenant Presbyterian Church following a shooting, in Nashville, Tennessee, Brendan Smialowski/AFP via Getty Images
Nashville shooting update: The suspect who fatally shot six people, including three children, at The Covenant School on Monday had bought seven firearms legally <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bnA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0f16d7c7> in recent years that they hid from their parents, and was in treatment for an unspecified emotional disorder, police said. Between 1966 and 2019, 77% of mass shooters bought at least one of the guns they used in their attacks legally, according to the National Institute of Justice. You can read about the lives of the victims of the Nashville school shooting here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bnE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C03975151>.

An appeals court reinstated the conviction of Serial’s Adnan Syed. Yesterday, a Maryland appeals court reinstated <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bnI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C531251e7> Syed’s conviction for the murder of his former high school girlfriend, ruling that the victim’s family should have been given more notice before the hearing on the state’s motion to vacate his conviction. Syed, whose efforts to overturn his conviction gained national prominence via the massively popular podcast Serial, spent 23 years in prison while maintaining his innocence. The court’s decision will not necessarily send Syed back there, as it gives the parties 60 days to decide how to move forward.

Sam Bankman-Fried charged with bribing Chinese officials. US prosecutors added another indictment <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bnM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc6028123> to SBF’s already extensive list of criminal counts, accusing the FTX founder of bribing Chinese government officials with ~$40 million worth of crypto payments. Prosecutors claim that SBF directed employees to send payments to at least one Chinese official in exchange for China freeing up frozen accounts connected to his hedge fund, Alameda Research. The US says those accounts contained more than $1 billion in crypto.



TOGETHER WITH STARBUCKS

Your favorite Frappuccino coffee, now mini <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bjY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEzJmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C39b76851> Starbucks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bjY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEzJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C64a7848f>
Want to add a spark of joy to your day? What better time to put some pep in your step than your daily coffee-break ritual? But finding the perfect, on-the-go coffee? That can be tricky.

Until now. Enter mini cans of Starbucks Frappuccino coffee <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bjY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEzJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8500e79f>. You read that correctly—the just-right Frappuccino coffee drink you know and love, now in a just-right-sized can. These minis are perfect for adding a quick, flavorful pick-me-up to your day.

Rest assured: This mini-size coffee packs the same big flavor as the Frappuccino coffee drinks you’ve enjoyed from our iconic glass bottles, in delicious creamy Caramel and smooth White Chocolate Mocha <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bjY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEzJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C364dc499>.

Make your day a little sweeter <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bjY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEzJmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C699def87>.



AI

ChatGPT is coming for workers who type a lot <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80blo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D47f3d51d> South Park gif about automation <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80blo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E47f3d51d> Southpark via Giphy
Accountants, survey researchers, and interpreters could see a sizable chunk of their day-to-day work get outsourced to ChatGPT, according to a study <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bi0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C09f4056d> published by researchers from the University of Pennsylvania and OpenAI, the company behind ChatGPT.

If you’re not eager to compete with a language model for a job, you might want to consider physical labor. The study found that for tire repairers, meatpackers, and athletes, ChatGPT was about as impactful as a degree in metaverse real estate management.

Ultimately, the study found the most GPT-able jobs to be those performed by knowledge workers, particularly ones who spend their days coding and writing .

The paper stopped short of predicting how quickly typing prompts into AI tools could become part of the workflow of various jobs. But it’s already happening at some workplaces: One digital artist went viral recently by lamenting <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bl8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C44da36ea> how their job went from creating original art to entering prompts into the text-to-image AI app Midjourney and editing its output in a matter of weeks.

Looking ahead…almost 1 in 5 US employees could have at least half of their work tasks disrupted by ChatGPT, per the study. And Goldman Sachs estimates that AI chatbots might affect 300 million full-time workers across the major economies.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bzA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C39401b80>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bzg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1cfd74ac>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bzI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfe89a1d1>  

FOOD

Cloudy with a chance of mammoth meatballs <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bnY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D79dd9dff> Mammoth meatballs <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bnY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E79dd9dff> Vow
The Australian food company Vow said yesterday that it’s made a meatball <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bnc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C387ee1af> from the extinct woolly mammoth.

This wasn’t the result of a freezer cleanup 10,000 years overdue. Vow “grows” unconventional meat in a lab to offer a protein alternative to slaughtered animals and reduce the environmental impact of animal agriculture.

To make the mammoth meatball, Vow took the DNA sequence of a mammoth’s muscle protein, added a splash of elephant DNA, and then inserted that completed gene into a sheep muscle cell, where it was grown (along with many more sheep genes) into 400 grams of meat. Add salt to taste.

So, why mammoth? The animal probably wasn’t chosen because it’s particularly tender or goes well with marinara—unfortunately, Neanderthal Guy Fieri didn’t leave a review.

Instead, the mammoth was selected to generate marketing buzz around Vow’s mission. The idea was the brainchild of creative agency Wunderman Thompson, whose global chief creative officer,​​ Bas Korsten, told the Guardian that mammoth meatballs were intended to “start a conversation” about the harmful environmental impact of meat consumption.

Looking ahead…the mammoth meatball won’t be coming to an Ikea near you anytime soon. But Vow is hoping to get its first cultivated meat product, Japanese quail, sold in restaurants in Singapore this year.—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bnk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdac4b00b>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bno_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4dfcd1c7>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C953fe48c>

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Marshall Islands soccer ball Francis Scialabba
Stat: The Marshall Islands is the only UN-recognized country without a national soccer team <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bnQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C48aa02c9>, according to ESPN. Yes, even Vatican City (which is one-seventh the size of Central Park) has a national soccer team. But some Marshall Islands soccer boosters are aiming to establish a team and one day upset Brazil at the World Cup. Okay, maybe their ambitions don’t extend that far, but they do want to use soccer to raise awareness about climate change’s impacts on this cluster of islands in the Pacific Ocean. Projections show that 40% of the capital island of Majuro will be underwater by 2030.

Quote: “SVB’s failure is a textbook case of mismanagement.”

Michael Barr, the Fed’s vice chair for supervision, and other financial regulators testified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bzM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd4aecd82> on Capitol Hill yesterday about the two biggest bank blowups since the financial crisis. Lawmakers were keen to blame both Silicon Valley Bank’s executives, who made risky bets that collapsed in value, and regulators, who may have been asleep at the wheel. No consensus was reached on how to prevent the next bank from imploding.

Read: The impossible job of being a Premier League referee. (The Guardian <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bnU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca343488d>)

NEWS

What else is brewing
JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bzc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C25ed775e> agreed to testify under oath over the bank’s ties to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

AMC <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bzY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C380118cb> stock popped 13% after a report from The Intersect claimed Amazon was considering buying the theater chain.

Lucid <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bzU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf9d35925>, the EV startup, is laying off ~18% of its workforce, or around 1,300 employees.

Disney <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bk4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C633cdc60> has cut its metaverse division as part of 7,000 layoffs, according to the WSJ.

McKinsey <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bk8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C29a4a3cd>, the consulting firm that usually recommends layoffs at other companies, is cutting about 1,400 roles from its own roster.

Substack <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80blA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb5624343> is allowing writers on its platform to buy shares in the company for as little as $100. Substack has already raised $82 million in venture capital.

Final Four trivia

Teams from eight universities are competing in the men’s and women’s Final Four games this weekend: LSU, Iowa, South Carolina, Virginia Tech, UConn, Florida Atlantic, San Diego State, and Miami.

Two of these schools are located in their state’s capital. Can you name them?

 TOGETHER WITH

Revela <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Z08_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5NzkwJmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5c493c0a> 
Good morning. Yesterday, at a school in Nashville, three children and three adults were killed in the US’ 129th mass shooting of the year, which is defined by the Gun Violence Archive as an episode of gun violence where four or more people are shot at a time. That’s equivalent to ~10 mass shootings per week in 2023, or almost two per day.—Sam Klebanov, Neal Freyman, Jamie Wilde, Abby Rubenstein

Markets: Stocks were a mixed bag <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80aVk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1ca2a5cf> yesterday, but both the S&P 500 and the Dow gained as investors seemed ready to put the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank in the rearview mirror, giving regional banks a boost. Investors might have also been in the mood for a nosh, because snack-makers Hershey and Mondelez both traded at all-time highs.

WORLD

Tour de headlines Police outside Nashville, Tennessee's Convent School @MNPDNashville/Twitter
Shooting at Nashville elementary school leaves six dead. Three children and three adults were killed yesterday in a shooting <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80aVo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2e294c8c> at The Covenant School, a private Presbyterian elementary school in Nashville, Tennessee.The six victims have been identified as Evelyn Dieckhaus, Hallie Scruggs, and William Kinney, who were nine years old, and Cynthia Peak, Mike Hill, and Katherine Koonce, adults in their early sixties. Koonce is believed to have been the head of the school.

The shooter was also killed while exchanging fire with police. The suspected attacker was identified by police as a 28 year-old former student of the school. According to police <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80anM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce1d9769e>, the shooter, who entered the school with at least two assault-style rifles and a handgun, had written a manifesto and drawn detailed maps of the school before the attacks. In the aftermath of the attack, there was confusion regarding the assailant’s gender because police originally said the alleged shooter was a woman before saying the shooter was transgender and used male pronouns in recent LinkedIn postings.

Israel postpones controversial judicial overhaul. Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said yesterday that “to avoid civil war,” he would delay <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80aV8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C963ba1bf> his plan to revamp the country’s judiciary to bring it more under the ruling party’s power until after it could be debated during the next parliamentary session in April. The decision came after strikes and mass protests brought the country to a standstill. After the announcement, the leader of Israel’s largest trade union said it would call off the general strike by its 800,000 members.

ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE

Stylin’ Pope Francis is regrettably fake <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ajA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D6773ab19> The pope in a stylish coat <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ajA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E6773ab19>
“Pope Francis? More like Pope fashionista ” was everyone’s reaction this weekend to a viral photo of the pontiff sporting a stylish puffer jacket looking like he marched straight out of Milan fashion week. However, to the disappointment of the Very Online of all creeds, the image turned out to be an AI-generated deepfake.

But before its authenticity was debunked, millions of people (including half of our editorial team) took the realistic-looking image at face value and subsequently felt mildly embarrassed at being so easily duped.

Where it came from: “Balenciaga Pope” was brought to us by Midjourney, an artificial intelligence app that generates images from text prompts. It was created and posted to Reddit by a user who was apparently just trying to have a laugh while tripping on magic mushrooms <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ajE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C550a2355>, per BuzzFeed.

What gives it away: Upon closer inspection, the picture does offer some clues that it isn’t actually a candid shot snapped by a paparazzi on the streets of Vatican City. Some tell-tale signs:

The Pope’s glasses look like they're melting onto his face.

The crucifix appears somewhat deformed.

Why people are still unnerved

Midjourney’s ability to have us marveling at the Pope’s chic ’fit got people thinking about what rapid advances in hyperrealistic AI art mean for our post-truth world. Web culture journalist Ryan Broderick dubbed the papal hoax the first “mass-level AI misinformation case.”

Another recent, viral, AI-made image showed it could be used to spread false narratives for more politically polarizing topics than the pope's fashion choices. Investigative journalist Eliot Higgins used Midjourney to churn out a series of images depicting former President Donald Trump getting arrested after an on-foot police chase, amid talk of his impending indictment (Higgins later got banned from Midjourney for doing so).

Looking ahead… AI expert Henry Ajder told Business Insider he’s urging AI companies to embed safeguards—like watermarks for manipulated images and disclaimers for videos—into the technology to prevent it from being weaponized for fake news.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ajI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C36316b92>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ajM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C987e726d>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ajQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccc7dbf8d>   

TOGETHER WITH REVELA

Hair growth tech science <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Z08_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5NzkwJmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1ad6ae3a> Revela <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Z08_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5NzkwJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb341272e>
Advances in science and tech have opened doors to all kinds of change and opportunities—and that now includes more luxurious locks.

Thanks to an AI-discovered molecule called ProCelinyl™, Revela has created game-changing formulas <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Z08_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5NzkwJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccc9b61d2> that tackle hair loss and hair thinning. In clinical trials, 97% of users saw thicker, fuller, or stronger hair after just 6 weeks.

Their Hair Revival Serum <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Z08_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5NzkwJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C407d7318> is the dermatologist-recommended solution for better hair in Harper’s Bazaar. But it doesn’t end there: Revela has a full array of products, including an eyebrow serum to help you thicken your brow game.

Carpe a great hair diem. Get 15% off your Revela <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Z08_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5NzkwJmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca9f8bb64> order now.



CRYPTO

Next up on regulators’ crypto takedown: Binance <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ajU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D58b28421> Binance CEO <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ajU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E58b28421> Antonio Masiello/Getty Images
Yesterday, the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) sued Binance <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ajY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C78bfa870>, the world’s largest crypto exchange, along with its co-founder Changpeng Zhao and its former Chief Compliance Officer Samuel Lim—for allegedly evading US regulations.

The CFTC alleges that Binance…

Didn’t have an effective program in place to prevent money laundering.

Encouraged customers to access Binance via virtual private networks (VPNs), allowing them to make unpermitted trades from the US.

Built a base of high-net-worth “VIP” customers and gave them a heads-up when law enforcement looked into their assets.

The agency claims Binance’s money laundering reporting officer once told Lim, “We see the bad, but we close 2 eyes.”

Big picture: US regulators are bringing down <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ajc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C17d315a5> the hammer on crypto companies…even though they’re already thoroughly smooshed following the collapse of crypto exchange FTX and, more recently, of crypto banks Silvergate Capital and Signature Bank.

Last Wednesday alone, another major financial regulatory body, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) *takes deep breath* sued the Tron blockchain network, as well as Lindsay Lohan, Soulja Boy, and six other crypto-promoting celebrities, and it issued <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ajg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cebc9056f> a warning to the crypto exchange, Coinbase, that enforcement actions are on the way. The crypto crackdown is here.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ajk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cde3337dd>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80amE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd0c77ca9>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80amI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C384101d0>  

REAL ESTATE

East coast, beast coast (for housing prices) <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80aVE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Db1360373> Illustration of a map of the US with homes dotted on it <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80aVE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Eb1360373> Morning Brew
The East Coast–West Coast rivalry is typically associated with rappers or sports teams, but now the divisions are extending to…the housing market.

Just like the sun, home prices are dropping in the West while rising in the East, according to the Wall Street Journal <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80aVI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2653694d>. This stark geographical split is extremely unusual, and highlights Covid’s role in shuffling people around the country in weird ways. The key stats:

West of Texas (but including Austin), home prices in the 12 major housing markets fell in January on an annual basis, data from Black Knight showed.

But home prices increased in the 37 largest metros east of Colorado (excluding Austin).

What’s going on? Western “Zoom Towns” that welcomed an influx of residents during the pandemic (think Boise) saw their bubbly home prices start to pop as mortgage rates spiked. Plus, the tech hubs that were so dang unaffordable even before Covid (SF, San Jose) have taken a hit from the recent downturn in the sector.

Meanwhile, on the East Coast, consistent job growth <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80anI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4becbc8f>, tight housing inventory, and the fact that many cities there didn’t see a ludicrous price boom during Covid are helping push prices higher.

Big picture: Nationally, the median home price dropped annually <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80aVM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce9485996> in February for the first time in more than a decade, and experts predict more year over year declines in many markets.—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80aVQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9802b4a9>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80aVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3944ead2>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80aVY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C88e6dacc>   

TOGETHER WITH BABBEL

GRAB BAGE

Key Performance Indicators Keanu Reeves at the John Wick premiere Axelle/Bauer-Griffin/Getty Images
Stat: John Wick is a man of focus, commitment, and sheer will—but very few words. The puppy-loving hitman played by Keanu Reeves says just 380 words <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80amM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7016adad> in John Wick: Chapter 4, despite the film’s nearly three-hour run time, according to the WSJ. Reeves himself hacked the dialogue down, the film’s director said, and 27% of the 103 lines spoken by Wick in the final cut are a single word. If reports that the actor was paid $15 million to reprise the role are accurate, that’s $39,473 per word.

Quote: “I’ve been here for 15 years giving my & witty thoughts all for bupkis. Now you’re telling me that I have to pay for something you gave me for free?”

Celebrities are not amused by Elon Musk’s decision to remove all blue verification check marks from Twitter except ones that are paid for on April 1 (a date we’re sure will not inspire any pranksters). William Shatner called out <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80amQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb907188d> the chief twit by name in a tweet asking about the upcoming change, but Musk was unmoved by the star’s Earl Grey hot take. He responded that it was about equality and that “there shouldn’t be a different standard for celebrities.” Yesterday, Musk said the paid for check would be required to be featured in the For You feed and vote in polls as of April 15.

Read: The wild story behind a smear campaign and the hackers that exposed it to its target. (The New Yorker <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80amU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7bbe2a95>)

WORLD

What else is brewing
Lyft’s founders <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80amY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C382e8333> will step down from their CEO and president roles and the day-to-day running of the company as the rideshare company struggles to keep up with rival Uber.

Disney <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80amc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1d4d5a1b> will begin its first round of layoffs this week as it looks to cut 7,000 jobs to bring costs down, CEO Bob Iger told employees.

California’s ski resorts <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80amg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C351737fd> have gotten so much snow that they’re planning to stay open through June.

Prince Harry and Elton John <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80amk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cca17d8dd> went to court in London yesterday to watch proceedings in a case they and other high-profile Brits brought against tabloids for allegedly invading their privacy. Stateside, the trial over Gwyneth Paltrow’s ski accident <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80amo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C538ceac1> continued.

Cinema trivia

Earlier we wrote about the minimal dialogue Keanue Reeves has as John Wick. Here’s a question about another actor with a limited presence in a movie:

In 1992, an actor won the Academy Award for best actor despite appearing in the movie for just 16 minutes total. Who was the actor and what was the movie? (Hint: The movie also won best picture that year.)

 TOGETHER WITH

Masterworks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80YU4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C58f8ccd1> 
Good morning. Heads up—a rare alignment of five planets will be visible in the night sky this week, but Tuesday evening will be your best bet. Just head outside right after sunset, look west, and you’ll see Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Uranus appear to line up in an arc shape below the crescent moon. Anyone on Earth should be able to see it, even if you’re living in a city with light pollution.

—Neal Freyman
