Here's what these numbers mean. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zMT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwOTY0NDU2LjMzNDM4NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4f2e68b7>

Markets: Investors are entering the last week of March as directionless as Ben Braddock in The Graduate. With the banking sector skittish, the Fed winding down its interest rate hikes, and inflation still soaring…the outlook for the economy has rarely been this cloudy. Still, all three major indexes posted gains last week.

 

INTERNATIONAL

Israel crisis grows after Bibi fires defense minister <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZWc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dcdd63098> An aerial view of the streets as Israelis continue protests against the Israeli government's plan to introduce judicial changes <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZWc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ecdd63098> Gitai Palti/Anadolu Agency via Getty Images
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin “Bibi” Netanyahu sacked his defense minister yesterday, sparking large-scale protests and escalating a crisis <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZWg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccabac66f> that’s now freezing much of its economy.

The country’s largest trade union group, which represents almost 800,000 workers across a range of industries, announced a strike, halting departures at Ben Gurion Airport and leaving some hospitals with reduced staff. The country’s research universities are also suspending classes indefinitely beginning today.

How we got here

Israelis have been staging mass protests for months against the hard-right coalition government’s plan to overhaul a judiciary that it claims has become too interventionist. Critics say this proposal, which gives the coalition government the final word over judicial appointments, would weaken Israel’s checks and balances and erode its democracy.

And there are a lot of critics—including military reservists in elite units who said they wouldn’t show up for duty. That prompted so much alarm in military circles that on Saturday, Defense Minister Yoav Gallant, a senior member of Netanyahu’s political party, publicly called <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZWk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C13859afa> on the government to delay its overhaul.

The plan presents “a clear and immediate and tangible danger to the security of the state—I shall not be a party to this,” Gallant said. Netanyahu fired him the next day.

Political crisis is not good for business

You typically don’t see corporate elites hitting the streets to demonstrate, but that’s been happening in Israel as the business community warns that the judiciary reforms would severely damage the country’s economy <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZWo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C32ec54f4>—specifically its vaunted high-tech sector.

Israel has prided itself as the “startup nation” thanks to its world-famous tech ecosystem that churns out unicorns. But many business leaders—from major bank CEOs to startup founders—argue that the government’s judiciary plans would weaken Israel’s legal institutions, potentially lead to a credit rating downgrade, and dry up the foreign investment upon which these startups depend. An estimated 90% of the high-tech sector is funded <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZWs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce752f828> by investors outside of Israel, per The Guardian.

The plan has even attracted critics in the US. More than 50 leading economists at American universities wrote a letter <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZWw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C08546483> to Netanyahu stressing how an independent judiciary is critical to economic growth. They said his overhaul is “detrimental” to the economic cause.

Looking ahead…all eyes are on Netanyahu’s next move.

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZW0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C72f139d8>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZVk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb9934234>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZW8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccae08f48>   

TOGETHER WITH MASTERWORKS

$500k+ portfolio investors beat “bank-run bust” here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80YU4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C47908a7c> Masterworks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80YU4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2a38619c>
Banks are falling like dominos, wiping out $465 billion in value from the stock market in just 2 days. Savvy investors are racing to diversify from cash and stocks.

And they’re increasing their exposure to the one asset class that outpaced the S&P 500 by 131% over the last 26 years: blue-chip art.

Masterworks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80YU4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc5981a3f> has created an exclusive platform allowing select members to discover this resilient, low-correlation asset.

Even better, Masterworks has delivered 11 straight successful exits, realizing returns of 32%, 39%, 36%, 27%, 9%, 33%, 21%, 18%, 14%, 35%, and 10%, respectively.

Offerings can sell out in minutes, but Morning Brew readers can skip the waitlist with this exclusive link <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80YU4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cee867c43>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines piles of debris remain where homes once stood before Friday's EF-4 tornado on March 26, 2023 in Rolling Fork, Mississippi. Scott Olson/Getty Images
Deadly tornado strikes Mississippi. At least 26 people were killed when a powerful tornado <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZXA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7cb3c14f> tore through parts of Alabama and west-central Mississippi on Friday night, leveling the town of Rolling Fork and causing widespread damage along its 59-mile path. President Biden declared a major disaster and made federal funding available for rebuilding efforts in one of the country’s poorest regions. To get a sense of how harrowing this Mississippi twister was, watch one meteorologist say a prayer <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZXE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce2cd09aa> on air as he tracked the tornado on Friday. Here’s how you can help <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZXI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4f74d05e> with the recovery.

SVB was finally sold. Well, at least a large chunk of it. First Citizens BancShares, a Raleigh-based regional bank, is scooping up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZVo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8e05fd61> SVB’s deposits, loans, and 17 branches that will reopen today under new ownership. About $90 billion of SVB’s assets will remain with the FDIC, which took control of SVB following its epic collapse over two weeks ago. The sale is meant to “instill confidence in the banking system,” the CEO of First Citizens said, and it seems to be working for now: Regional lenders like First Republic Bank are surging premarket.

The Final Four no one predicted. Florida Atlantic University, UConn, San Diego State, and Miami punched their ticket to Houston this weekend, setting up an underdog-heavy battle for the men’s college basketball championship. On the women’s side, the Final Four will be solidified tonight, but one legendary team won’t be in the mix: UConn got bounced and won’t be in the Final Four for the first time since 2007.

TECH

TikTokers rally around their zaddy <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZXU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D2625cfb7> TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew arrives after a break in a House Energy and Commerce Committee hearing to testify on Capitol Hill <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZXU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E2625cfb7> Jabin Botsford/The Washington Post via Getty Images
TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew has emerged as a Hero of the People after he tangled with infuriated lawmakers on Capitol Hill last week.

On Wall Street, the verdict was damning: One tech analyst called the hearing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZXY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce2579536>, in which lawmakers berated Chew for about five hours, a “disaster” for TikTok that will only accelerate a ban in the US or a forced sale by Chinese parent company ByteDance.

But TikTok users watching the hearing saw something completely different: a sympathetic figure being unfairly singled out by tech-illiterate, disrespectful politicians.

Almost immediately after the hearing, videos making fun of lawmakers and hailing Chew’s “I’m him <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZXc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C74eb16b6>” performance went viral on TikTok. Most of the tributes have been thirst traps commenting on Chew’s looks—“TikTok Zaddy fighting for us,” one user wrote, and another commented, “Yall fr simping for the CEO of TikTok,” Business Insider reported <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZXg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C13c90131>.

Why it matters: The backlash to lawmakers’ treatment of Chew could make a ban even more politically toxic. TikTok reported that 150 million Americans use the app monthly, equivalent to 45% of the US population. And those who do use TikTok are far less likely to support a ban than non-TikTok users. According to a Washington Post survey <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZXk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C48fc04b7>, 54% of daily TikTok users oppose a ban, while 54% of respondents who hadn’t used TikTok in the past month support a ban.

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZVQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7419f4bf>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbed25f69>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZVY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C31792bb5>   

TOGETHER WITH STARBUCKS

Starbucks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80YU8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd0bc777f>

CALENDAR

The week ahead Opening Day at Fenway Park in 2022 Maddie Meyer/Getty Images
Trump indictment possible: Former President Trump’s prediction that he would be arrested last Tuesday did not come to pass. But the threat isn’t over—the grand jury investigating Trump over hush-money payments will reconvene on Monday and potentially vote to indict him this week.

Inflation data coming in hot: The Fed’s preferred measure of inflation, the personal consumption expenditures price index, will be released on Friday, and it’s expected to show that prices continued to rise <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZUM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca8e122bf> at a brisk pace last month.

Sports! The women’s Final Four begins on Friday, the men tip off on Saturday, and baseball is back—MLB’s Opening Day is on Thursday.

Everything else…

The House Financial Services Committee will hold a hearing on the collapse of SVB and Signature Bank on Tuesday.

April Fool’s Day is Saturday.

Twitter will remove all “legacy” blue checkmarks on Saturday to encourage users to pay for Twitter Blue. For my checkmark’s sake, hopefully that’s just a prank.

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Flag of Lebanon at the Crusader Castle in Byblos Getty Images
Stat: If you thought changing the clocks for daylight saving time was annoying, try living in a country with two competing time zones <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZUQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1717eb25>. People in Lebanon woke up to that reality on Sunday after caretaker Prime Minister Najib Mikati delayed a clock change until the end of Ramadan. However, private institutions like TV stations and businesses are not abiding by it. So, some folks in Lebanon are living in this Twilight Zone where they’ve got two meetings one hour apart that actually take place at the same time.

Quote: “I am thrilled to be back in China.”

Apple CEO Tim Cook was all smiles <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZUU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd183d980> in Beijing, where he spoke at an economic summit about his company’s symbiotic relationship with China. You can’t help but contrast Cook’s warm welcome in China (customers even gave him a round of applause when he entered an Apple store) with the harsh reception US lawmakers gave TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew last week. ByteDance, TikTok’s parent company, is based in Beijing.

Watch: Learn about the crime that created the modern internet. (Morning Brew’s YouTube <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZUY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccfc84f70>)

NEWS

What else is brewing
Elon Musk <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZVc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6437187f> is reportedly handing out stock awards to Twitter employees at a valuation of ~$20 billion. He bought the company for $44 billion last year.

Meanwhile <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZVg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc5588fd1>, Twitter disclosed that parts of its source code had been leaked online.

At least four people <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZUc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C011fd023> died in an explosion at a chocolate factory in West Reading, PA.

John Wick: Chapter Four <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZUg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Caf861af2> brought in a dazzling $73.5 million at the domestic box office this past weekend. It’s the best debut for any movie in the franchise.

Creed III star Jonathan Majors <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZUo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cba5a6f37> was arrested in New York after police were called over a domestic dispute.

How GPT-4 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZUs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C19541ebc> saved a dog’s life.

   Money & Career:  Money Scoop <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zWj9lbWFpbD1zb29zZnJhbm9AZ21haWwuY29tJm1pZD03Y2QzZDdlZmNiMmI1ZDFhNmNiZTBiZjA5MzFmNGIyZiZjaWQ9MzA5NjQ0NTYuMzM0Mzg1NQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C43766e33>     Money With Katie <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zLT9lbWFpbD1zb29zZnJhbm9AZ21haWwuY29tJm1pZD03Y2QzZDdlZmNiMmI1ZDFhNmNiZTBiZjA5MzFmNGIyZiZjaWQ9MzA5NjQ0NTYuMzM0Mzg1NQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce712aea4>     Raise <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydmY_ZW1haWw9c29vc2ZyYW5vQGdtYWlsLmNvbSZtaWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwOTY0NDU2LjMzNDM4NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc264814d>

  TOGETHER WITH

SmartAsset <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NDE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3ed3fe62>  
Good morning. Wanna retire young? Be more like Ash Ketchum. The beloved Pokémon trainer is retiring from the Japanese anime series today at the sprightly age of 10—the same age that he was in the pilot episode 25 years ago.

Ash is one of the best-known examples of the “Not Allowed to Grow Up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OWs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc710ece5>” TV trope, which originated in early sitcoms to preserve the comedic dynamics of the nuclear family. Of course, it’s a little easier to pull off with an animated character.

Jamie’s thought experiment: Which characters across TV have stayed the same age the longest? (Besides the Simpsons family.)

—Neal Freyman, Jamie Wilde, Matty Merritt

Markets: Stocks were extra jumpy <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OEw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4e1f0436> as investors chewed over the implications of the Fed’s latest interest rate hike, but still closed higher. Accenture, the professional services giant, popped after it said it was cutting 19,000 jobs, or about 2.5% of its workforce, in the next 18 months to trim costs.

 

TECH

TikTok CEO gets no likes in Congress <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OE0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D058ed762> TikTok CEO on Capitol Hill <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OE0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E058ed762> Tasos Katopodis/Getty Images
At a spicy hearing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OE4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C353f988c> on Capitol Hill yesterday, TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew fought for the app’s survival in the US.

With calls to ban TikTok gaining momentum, the company dispatched its head honcho—a Harvard Business School grad—to alleviate concerns that the Chinese-owned social media app could be used as a spying tool far more potent than any balloon.

He didn’t make much progress

The first lawmaker to speak, House Energy and Commerce Committee Chair Cathy McMorris Rodgers, fired up the grill by calling for a ban on TikTok: “ByteDance is beholden to the CCP, and ByteDance and TikTok are one and the same,” she said, referring to the Chinese Communist Party’s ability to force ByteDance (TikTok’s parent company) to give it information.

In his testimony, Chew didn’t exactly instill confidence that TikTok had a firewall against China. For instance, he couldn’t unequivocally deny that Chinese ByteDance employees can access US user data. “I think quite frankly your testimony has raised more questions for me than answers,” Democratic Rep. Lisa Blunt Rochester said.

But lawmakers didn’t just focus on TikTok’s ties to China. They attacked the app over problems like misinformation, addiction, and dangerous viral trends—issues that Chew pointed out <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OE8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce0f80525> plague US social media companies as well.

TikTok has launched a full-court press to defend itself

Not only in the halls of Congress, but also in the court of public opinion.

This week, TikTok sent an army of influencers to Washington, DC, to make the case that the app was a net positive for society and allowed them and other creators to make a living.

Chew also noted that TikTok now has 150 million monthly users in the US, equivalent to 45% of the population. His not-so-subtle message: Do you really think you can take away something nearly half of Americans love and still expect to be reelected?

Still, analysts watching the hearing gave Chew’s performance two thumbs down. Wedbush’s Dan Ives called it a “disaster <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OFA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C48d1fce5>” that only accelerates a TikTok ban or a sale.

Where things stand: The Biden administration has demanded that ByteDance sell its stake in TikTok or get booted from the US. China has responded that it will “firmly oppose” a forced sale.—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OXM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce38d1530>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OXQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C25c44e28>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OXU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8b425311>    

TOGETHER WITH SMARTASSET

Channeling that retirement energy <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NDE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C059b6591> SmartAsset <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NDE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9af1cb8d>
Life should be a balance of adventure and relaxation—without spending too much time worrying about finances. Which is why SmartAsset raised $161m to help people plan for retirement.

Their no-cost tool makes it easy to find vetted financial advisors <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NDE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C94d3036a> who serve your area. And it may be worth your while, since research suggests people who work with a financial advisor could end up with 15% more money to spend in retirement.¹

SmartAsset can help you kick-start your retirement plans today. Try their free quiz <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NDM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf890bc6a> to get matched with up to 3 financial advisors serving your area, each legally bound to work in your best interest.

It’s never too late to work toward financial freedom <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NDM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0JmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4de83a5b>.

 

WORLD

Tour de headlines Tour de headlines Character.AI
Character.AI lands $1 billion valuation. A chatbot startup even younger than Ash Ketchum just became a unicorn <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OWw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2e4c4e27> after scoring a $150 million funding round led by Andreessen Horowitz. Founded 16 months ago by ex-Googlers, Character.AI made a chatbot <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OW0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C62333dd4> that lets you message with AI-generated versions of real people (dead or alive) or made-up characters. If it wasn’t apparent already, VCs are ready to plow all kinds of $$$ into startups working on generative AI.

Crypto fugitive arrested and charged with fraud. Do Kwon, the co-founder of Terraform Labs who oversaw a $40 billion cryptocurrency wipeout last May, was arrested <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OW4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C43177158> and charged with fraud by US prosecutors. An international search had been underway for months, and when authorities finally caught him and Terraform’s CFO, the scene was straight out of a movie: They were in Montenegro, attempting to fly to Dubai under fake Costa Rican traveling documents, and also had South Korean and (falsified) Belgian travel docs with them.

Apple’s investing in waaaayyy bigger screens. Apple plans to spend $1 billion per year to produce movies <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OFY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4a04eb3d> that will be released in theaters, Bloomberg reported yesterday. The tech company is answering Nicole Kidman’s call in order to win over Hollywood’s best talent (who still care about Oscar noms) and snag buzzier projects. Plus, theatergoers might be tempted to sign up for Apple TV+ after they clean the butter off their fingers. Apple’s CODA won the Academy Award for best picture in 2022, but the film brought in less than $2 million at the box office.

FINTECH

Hindenburg goes after Dorsey <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OFc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D7c4b25af> Jack Dorsey <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OFc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E7c4b25af> Marco Bello/Getty Images
Hindenburg Research sank its teeth into its next victim: Block, a fintech giant led by former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey. The short seller, known for digging up corporate dirt, released a report yesterday alleging that Block is letting fraud flourish <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OFg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2a6d88bd> on its mobile payment service Cash App to pad its growth data.

Block’s stock crumpled nearly 15% after Hindenburg released its two-year investigation. The biggest allegations:

According to Hindenburg, former Cash App employees estimate that 40%–75% of accounts on the app were either fake or fraudulent and could be traced back to one person.

It also claimed Cash App played host to numerous scams conducted by users involving Covid stimulus and unemployment payments.

Hindenburg pointed to rappers bragging about paying for drugs—and in one case, potentially murder—via Cash App in their songs.

Block called the report “inaccurate and misleading” and threatened potential legal action.

Big picture: You might remember Hindenburg for exposing sketchy behavior at EV startup Nikola, which ultimately led to former CEO Trevor Milton getting convicted of fraud. But its most damning accusation <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OFk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce9d7da54> was lobbed at Indian conglomerate Adani Group in January for “pulling the largest con in corporate history.” Adani denied the claims, but the report still caused a $100+ billion wipeout in market value.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OFo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf1395620>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OC0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd4151aa6>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OF8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb9d9e3e6>   

TOGETHER WITH MICROSOFT

Microsoft <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NDQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9e613794>

Join Microsoft’s Viva Summit on April 20 to learn from Microsoft leaders about how smart tech empowers <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NDQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C71599d29> modern workplaces. MEDIA

Is ChatGPT the next Aaron Sorkin? <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OTA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Def1dbf88> The Hollywood sign in cyber-looking font <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OTA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Eef1dbf88> Francis Scialabba
This week the Writers Guild of America, a labor union that reps film and TV writers, proposed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OTE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce82bf4e0> that AI be allowed to help write scripts.

The idea arose during routine negotiations between the WGA and the Alliance of Motion Picture and Television Producers, which reps studios, over writers’ pay <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OTI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C78902636>. And while letting ChatGPT in the writers room sounds like a job threat, the details of the WGA’s proposal could ensure we won’t see a robot giving an Oscars speech anytime soon.

AI could do some of the work but get none of the credit

The union tweeted <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OTM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd2996610> that it considers AI to be merely “research material,” noting that “AI software does not create anything. It generates a regurgitation of what it’s fed.”

Therefore, the WGA proposes that AI could be used to help write scripts. But the writer who turns AI-generated text into a show or movie would get all the credit—and compensation.

Zoom out: Creative industries everywhere are discussing what guardrails should be established around using AI to produce content. While the WGA’s proposal could set a precedent for materials created with AI, some are wondering…what happens when AI gets good enough to write a screenplay without a human co-writer?—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OTQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C29833079>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OTU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6d54d0fc>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OTY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C30595825>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Jennifer Coolidge in White Lotus The White Lotus/HBO
Stat: If you film it, they will come. In a survey <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OTc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc896d085> from American Express, 70% of Gen Z and millennials said they were inspired to travel to a destination after seeing it in a TV show, movie, or news source. HBO incepting your next vacation is best showcased by The White Lotus, the hit series set in posh hotels in Maui and Sicily. The Four Seasons Maui’s website saw a 425% annual increase in traffic during season one, and good luck finding a place to stay in Taormina this summer.

Quote: “The current development, where billionaire sheiks and oligarchs take over clubs and control them as their personal playgrounds, is not a healthy trend.”

To reverse this trend in soccer, Finnish entrepreneur Thomas Zilliacus said he wants to go halfsies <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OTg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C107ee487> with fans on a bid to purchase Manchester United—his company would buy 50% of the club, while MUFC fans would grab the rest. Zilliacus calculated that if all fans participated, the cost would amount to less than $3 per supporter. The only other known bidders for Manchester United are British billionaire Jim Ratcliffe and Qatar’s Sheikh Jassim.

Read: Thirty of the best short films and novels. (The Guardian <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OTk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca8b65974>)

What else is brewing
Utah Gov. Spencer Cox <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OXA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf7563403> signed two measures to restrict teens’ access to social media platforms. Utah is the first state to enact this kind of legislation.

Beyoncé <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OXE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4c13d233> and Adidas have mutually agreed to end their creative partnership, per The Hollywood Reporter.

Ford <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OWM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdac990ae> expects to lose $3 billion on its electric vehicle business this year. It’s the first time the automaker has released financials by business unit instead of by region.

The Bank of England <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OWQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C779c04bf> followed up the Fed by raising interest rates a quarter-percentage point.

ANSWER

Jacob Alan Keegan Edwards. The initials of the names in Group A spell a common short form of the first name in each entry.

tastytrade <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80M1o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDAmbHA9bG9nbw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C359a2d89> 
Good morning. It’s a big day: TikTok’s CEO is testifying on Capitol Hill, the men’s NCAA tournament resumes with the Sweet 16, and we’re celebrating Near Miss Day—the 34th anniversary of an asteroid a half-mile wide coming within 500,000 miles of Earth.

Hurtling through space at 46,000 miles per hour, it would have struck the planet with the force of 20 billion tons of TNT, probably canceling March Madness that year.

—Neal Freyman, Matty Merritt, Jamie Wilde, Abby Rubenstein

Markets: Stocks went up briefly yesterday after the Fed announced its decision to raise interest rates, before plunging <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NFA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb9799cde> once investors had a chance to consider everything Jerome Powell said (more on that in a second). One company whose star kept climbing despite it all was antifungal drugmaker Scynexis: Its shares surged 74% in the two days since the CDC raised the alarm that deadly and drug-resistant Candida auris is spreading rapidly in the US.

ECONOMY

Fed keeps hiking, but summit seems close <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NFE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D1b36b486> Jerome Powell <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NFE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E1b36b486>
Like Ted Lasso and Succession, the Federal Reserve’s interest rate hikes have apparently entered their final season.

While the Fed increased interest rates <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NFI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C19f85970> by another 25 basis points yesterday (its ninth straight rate increase), it also signaled that troubles in the banking sector could lead it to wrap up the rate hikes soonish.

The key words: In its statement after February’s meeting, the Fed said it expected to enact “ongoing increases” in rates to combat inflation. But yesterday, it swapped that language out for “some additional policy firming may be appropriate.” Yes, we’re getting into the fine print, but when it comes to Fed statements, small tweaks make a big difference. This change is a sign that rate hikes could be winding down.

The banking chaos is a big reason why

Fed Chair Jerome Powell said that “serious difficulties at a small number of banks” have emerged, which is a reference to the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank and its ripple effects across the sector.

While it sounds bizarre, the banking turmoil seems to have done some of the Fed’s work for it <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NFM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C87e7f7e1>. Here’s how:

The Fed had been hiking interest rates to curb borrowing and, in turn, slow down the economy and inflation.

SVB’s implosion seems to have done precisely that. As banks hunker down during the storm, it’s “likely to result in tighter credit conditions for households and businesses and to weigh on economic activity, hiring, and inflation,” the Fed wrote.

All of that is not good for the economy, of course, but it could help lower price growth when inflation is still ripping at 6%.

Big picture: Powell has other things besides interest rates to worry about—specifically, job security. He’s been taking heat from lawmakers across the political spectrum over the blowup of several banks on his watch. Politicians as diametrically opposed as conservative Sen. Rick Scott and progressive Sen. Elizabeth Warren have laid the blame for the banking failures at Powell’s feet, arguing that he failed to properly regulate banks in the lead-up to their collapse.

In response to criticism, Powell went full Bart Simpson on a chalkboard yesterday, saying that the Fed is “committed to learning the lessons from this episode, and to work to prevent episodes from events like this from happening again.”—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NFQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce85e87e7>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NFU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdf570055>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NFY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C34a9abce>

WORLD

Tour de headlines
🩻 The organ transplant system is getting overhauled. The Biden administration unveiled a plan <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NFc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cde8bece8> yesterday to revamp the problem-ridden system for organ transplants. One nonprofit, United Network for Organ Sharing, has had a monopoly on running the system for nearly four decades, but the government’s proposal includes potentially bringing more organizations in, as well as upping funding and modernizing the computer systems involved. There are ~104,000 people currently waiting for an organ transplant, and 17 people die per day while waiting.

TikTok’s CEO will tell Congress the app’s no agent of China. Shou Zi Chew will face Congress <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NFg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C99e5e23f> today and is likely to be grilled by lawmakers while arguing that the US should not ban or force a sale of Chinese-owned TikTok, which currently boasts 150 million monthly US users. In prepared testimony released ahead of time, Chew maintained that a ban will hurt American businesses and that TikTok has “never shared, or received a request to share, US user data with the Chinese government.” Influencers have also been pleading TikTok’s case on Capitol Hill.

TRADEMARK

Jack Daniel’s takes a poop joke to SCOTUS <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NFk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D26dd3d11> Jack Daniels Bottle and Bad Spaniels bottle on opposite sides of the Supreme Court building. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NFk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E26dd3d11> Francis Scialabba
Thesaurus.com was probably the star of yesterdays Supreme Court oral arguments, in which attorneys for Jack Daniel’s had to use every synonym for “dog poop” they could find. The whiskey brand argued <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NFo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C62fa2f21> that the dog toy company VIP Products violated its trademark with a crude squeaky toy that mimicked its iconic product.

The VIP “Bad Spaniels” dog toy at the center of the case is modeled after the recognizable whiskey bottle but, instead of saying “Old No. 7 Tennessee Sour Mash Whiskey,” it features “Old No. 2 on your Tennessee carpet” in an almost identical font. Jack Daniel’s claims that the toy’s similarity to the real product confuses customers and associates “fine whiskey with dog poop.” VIP says its toy is a parody protected as creative expression.

A district court sided with the whiskey-maker, but an appeals court said that, because the toy was a parody, extra care had to be taken to make sure that enforcing the trademark didn’t run afoul of the First Amendment. The appeals court then found VIP could keep making the toy.

Bottom line: Whether the high court sides with the toymaker or says the company really stepped in it, the decision could redefine how far federal trademark protections reach when humor is involved.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NC0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C786419ef>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NF8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc181bc8f>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NTA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C03540198>   

TOGETHER WITH CYTONICS

Cytonics <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80M18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDAmbHA9aW1hZ2U/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0d5199c3>
The company aiming to “solve” osteoarthritis. That’s a big deal, considering 600m people suffer from this debilitating joint disease, and available solutions offer only temporary, symptomatic relief. Cytonics <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80M18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDAmbHA9dGV4dDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C613a440c> has leveraged the industry expertise of their team to identify the root cause of osteoarthritis and develop a genetically engineered protein therapy to eradicate it. The best part? You can invest in Cytonics before the opportunity ends on March 30 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80M18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDAmbHA9dGV4dDI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca3818325>.



MARKETING

No one the new ‘We NYC’ logo <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NTE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dcceb50b3> The new NYC logo in a broken heart <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NTE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ecceb50b3> New York State Department of Economic Development Photo Illustration: Hannah Minn
NY’s governor and NYC’s mayor have clearly never heard the phrase “If it ain’t broke, don’t fix it,” because, along with an alliance of businesses, they revealed a revamped version of the iconic “I NY” logo on Monday—and people hate it <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NTI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb843474b>.

I NY is now “We NYC,” a direct riff on NY’s beloved original drawn by Milton Glaser on a scrap of paper in the back of a taxi in 1975. The simple slogan was dreamt up by an advertising firm to encourage tourism to a then-crime-ridden and nearly bankrupt NYC. Glaser gave his design to New York for free—and it now generates millions in merch sales every year.

The v2 is also part of an ad campaign, this time to “cut through divisiveness and negativity” stemming from the pandemic, the CEO of the Partnership for New York City said. The redesigned logo by Graham Clifford aims to “give it more of a modern twist” by sans-ing the serif, shading the heart, changing the “I” to “We,” and adding a C.

The new logo did bring New Yorkers together…in distaste:

“It looks and feels wild lopsided?” Bronx-native entertainer The Kid Mero told the NYT <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NTM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8628bf97>.

“I wouldn’t wish this on Jersey :/,” tweeted <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NTQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb7efe27b> Rolling Stone senior visuals editor Joe Rodriguez.

Zoom out: Glaser updated his logo once, after 9/11, and while that one was popular, no remix is likely to stay popular as long as the original.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NTU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbc9d226b>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NTY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C254b51db>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NTc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C715d3f58>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Taylor Swift performing on her Eras Tour John Shearer/Getty Images
Stat: Taylor Swift may see herself as an on-the-bleachers type, but she’s got the endurance of an athlete. A podcaster estimated <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NTg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0e9dde99> that if you tracked Swift’s movements during her Eras Tour shows like a soccer player during the World Cup, she covers as much as two miles per show. And she does it all in custom Louboutin heels. But with Swift’s 44-song set list clocking in at about three hours, many fans are opting for sneakers and strategically planning out trips to the restroom. Some are trying to match Swift’s stamina, though: One told the WSJ, “If Taylor doesn’t need a bathroom break, neither do I.”

Quote: “The city that rhymes with fun.”

The company tasked with drumming up tourism for the Canadian city of Regina—pronounced like Carolina, not Regina George—has apologized <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NTk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8424395d> after its racy-adjacent new slogans, including “Show us your Regina,” didn’t go over well with many in the city.

Read: I went on a package trip for lonely millennials. It was exhausting. (New York Times <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NWE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce7b19efa>)

The US government was getting it for $15–$26 per dose.

Starbucks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NWU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C02bc92f9> olive oil-infused coffee will be available at some US cafes starting today after debuting in Italy last month.

In case you plan to not-so-quietly quit: A list of the 100 best large employers <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NWk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf0becad0> in the US.

Three headlines and a lie

 TOGETHER WITH

Intuit Mailchimp <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zWVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C39009ee0> 
Good morning and Ramadan Mubarak to readers observing the Muslim holy month, which begins tonight for most communities. Interesting fact: Because Ramadan is linked to a lunar calendar, it begins 10–12 days earlier each year—so the next time it will start around this date won’t be until 2056. And the year 2030 will have two Ramadan observances, one beginning on Jan. 5 and the next on Dec. 25.

—Neal Freyman, Matty Merritt, Sam Klebanov, Abby Rubenstein

Markets: Stocks rose for the second straight day <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MUg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C191ac36f> as maybe those butterflies around a banking crisis are beginning to flutter away. And GameStop kept up the good vibes after the market closed when it revealed its first quarterly profit in two years. Wonder if that’ll sneak its way into the upcoming meme stock movie <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Mm4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4baa27e5> starring Seth Rogen, Paul Dano, and Pete Davidson…

Dramatic Fed meeting: Chair Jerome Powell is in the hot seat today as he makes an interest-rate decision with global ramifications. The Fed will need to decide whether to continue raising interest rates to combat still-soaring inflation or hit the brakes to ease the pressure building on banks. Powell’s decision will influence how central bankers worldwide approach monetary policy in this dicey moment.

 

TECH

Google unleashes the Bard <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MUk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dff971db6> Google logo with chatbot messages floating around it <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MUk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Eff971db6> Francis Scialabba
In the high-stakes race to release advanced AI tech, Google has been the tortoise to Microsoft’s hare. But even a tortoise takes a few steps forward now and again.

Yesterday, Google began rolling out <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MUo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca4f97ac6> its chatbot, Bard, to select US and UK users and plans to open it up to more people going forward (you can get on the waitlist here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MUs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3bf63891>).

Like its AI competitor ChatGPT, Bard can answer your questions in a humanlike, conversational tone. But Google, which has rolled out its AI tech more methodically than rival Microsoft, is stressing that Bard is still an “early experiment” and wants users to play around with it so the company can learn what needs to be fixed.

One thing users will definitely encounter is blatantly wrong information. So to cover its butt, Google has included a warning in the main text box: “Bard may display inaccurate or offensive information that doesn’t represent Google’s views.” In fact, the entire Bard experience has more disclaimers than a white-water rafting trip, highlighting Google’s “use at your own risk” approach.

Big picture: Google is pitching Bard as a complement to its search business—not a replacement. As the dominant leader in search, Google must be careful with how it deploys AI: It can’t cannibalize search’s business model, but it also can’t allow the competition to disrupt search, either.

What else is happening in the world of AI?

Seems like every day in 2023, there’s a new AI development to delight or terrify you. Here’s a rundown of the latest…

Misinformation is a major concern. GPT-4, OpenAI’s latest large language model, spreads even more false information <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MU0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca931e32e> than its predecessor, GPT-3.5, according to a new report from NewsGuard. OpenAI’s CEO Sam Altman himself acknowledged that he was “particularly worried that these models could be used for large-scale disinformation” in a recent ABC interview. Meanwhile, people have already been using generative AI tools to make deepfake photos <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MU4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3ccefab2> of former President Trump getting arrested (which has not happened).

AI-generated images gain steam. Creating an image from a text input has been one of AI’s most popular use cases, and companies are rushing to release these features to the public. Microsoft said yesterday it’s integrating OpenAI’s DALL-E tech into its Bing search engine, while Adobe released a suite of AI tools called Firefly <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MVA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccf42c4dd>.

ChatGPT fools human reviewers. A paper published in an education journal this month highlighted how AI tools could threaten academic integrity and boost plagiarism. Well, the threat seems pretty real, because the paper was written by ChatGPT <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MVE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd1529680> and was peer-reviewed by four academics who did not realize a chatbot authored it. The researchers who submitted the article did it to prove their point—and they succeeded.

Further reading: On his blog <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MVI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca91f6fe0>, Bill Gates argues “artificial intelligence is as revolutionary as mobile phones and the internet.”—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MVM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C144f5b99>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MVQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf8545c28>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce8e96af2>   

TOGETHER WITH INTUIT MAILCHIMP

Right on target <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zWVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C908566f6> Intuit Mailchimp <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zWVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd836f968>
Aiming to step up your marketing personalization? Hit the bull’s-eye with Mailchimp’s powerful segmentation tools <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zWVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C444aab68>.

Mailchimp helps you target the right audience with tools that scale alongside your business. With data from over 300 tool integrations, you can engage customers based on their interests and buying behaviors (and keep your emails relevant, too!).

The best part? Mailchimp’s email platform predicts which customers are more likely to purchase again and spend more over time, helping businesses see up to 88% more revenue <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zWVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2b5511e1>.* 

And when your segmentation starts scoring high, you can sharpen your strategy with **predicted customer lifetime value and demographics.

Ready to reach your revenue goals? Reach the right audience today <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zWVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3JmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6059cd31>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines Los Angeles school staff strike for higher wages Robyn Beck/AFP via Getty Images
🪧 LA schools shut down as support staff strike. The union representing the Los Angeles Unified School District’s 30,000 support workers began a three-day strike <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MVY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C90b7d2d6> yesterday, giving more than 500,000 K-12 students the LA equivalent of a snow day. The union is seeking a 30% pay bump for its members, whose average salary is $25,000 a year, and a $2/hour raise for the lowest-paid workers over the next four years. So far, the district has offered a 23% recurring raise and a 3% cash-in-hand bonus. The 35,000 teachers in the district—the country’s second-largest—also walked off the job in solidarity.

Home prices fell for the first time in over a decade. Deflation has finally come for the housing market: For the first time in 131 months, the median price of a home in the US fell <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MVc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6b78b188> on an annual basis. The median price for an existing home in February dropped 0.2% to $363,000, according to the National Association of Realtors, with the West and the Northeast experiencing the biggest price cuts. Home sales also surged 14.5% from January to February, snapping a yearlong decline and increasing the most since July 2020.

The US will backstop more deposits if it needs to. Speaking to a room full of jittery bankers, US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MVg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C217fe3f8> the decision to backstop depositors in Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank when the institutions collapsed was necessary to safeguard the banking ecosystem, and that “similar actions could be warranted” if other smaller banks face comparable bank runs. Her remarks come as a debate rages over whether all deposits, including those above the current $250k limit for FDIC insurance, should be protected from now on.

FOOD & BEV

White Claw comes for Tito’s <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MVk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D0e4da0aa> New White claw vodkas <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MVk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E0e4da0aa> White Claw
White Claw is releasing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MVo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C808d9ea4> another black cherry-flavored option to leave in the bottom of the cooler. But it’s not quite the same—the popular hard seltzer brand is releasing a straight vodka, flavored vodkas, and canned vodka sodas.

The lake day drink’s parent company Mark Anthony Group, which is also the booze visionary behind Mike’s Hard Lemonade, is venturing into the vodka world to find growth outside of the oversaturated seltzer market. That means it’s about to take on one of the alcohol industry’s heaviest hitters. Tito’s Vodka, originally crafted in its founder’s backyard <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MS0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7f80b970>, unseated big-name rivals to become the best-selling vodka in the US in 2019 and it now accounts for 25% of vodka sales in retail stores.

Ironically, a change in a law helped extend the claw. In 2020, the Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau updated its definition of vodka, allowing the spirit to have a little bit of sugar and still be considered true vodka.

Big picture: With its new products, White Claw is entering two separate markets at very different stages of maturity. The vodka industry’s sales remained flat last year at $7.2 billion, while ready-to-drink cocktails were the fastest-growing spirit category in 2021, posting 35.8% revenue growth over 2020.—MM

TOGETHER WITH KIMPTON HOTELS

Kimpton Hotels <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zWVY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0f01ffc9>

SCIENCE

What happens when ‘Nature’ wades into politics? <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MjI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Da2c8de9a> Biden looking bemused <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MjI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ea2c8de9a> Drew Angerer/Getty Images
Nature’s endorsement of Joe Biden for president in 2020 probably hurt Nature <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Mmw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C997ffd5f> and barely helped Biden, according to new research.

In the lead-up to the election, the prestigious scientific journal accused former President Trump of neglecting science in his handling of Covid and climate change and threw its support behind Biden. But a study published this week concluded that the move could have undermined public trust in Nature and science more broadly.

The nuts and bolts: Stanford political economist Floyd Jiuyun Zhang surveyed 4,260 people (mostly supporters of Biden or Trump) in the summer of 2021 to better understand how scientists taking a partisan stance might affect their credibility with the public. Half of the participants were shown Nature’s statement endorsing Biden, while the other half was asked to read an announcement from the journal that had nothing to do with politics.

What we learned: Reading Nature’s endorsement of Biden was unlikely to turn someone into a supporter of him, but it did make some Trump fans skeptical of Nature and more distrustful of scientists in general.

Nature stood by its campaign advocacy. It claims the scientific community has an obligation to take a stand against politicians who “threaten a retreat from reason.”—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MjM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C277f50ca>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MnA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf7b17c98>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MjU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2e72c4b2>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Shohei Ohtani #16 of Team Japan reacts after the final out of the World Baseball Classic Championship defeating Team USA Eric Espada/Getty Images
Stat: Japan’s dramatic victory over Team USA in last night’s World Baseball Classic championship could very well have been the most-viewed baseball game in history. The thrilling tournament has highlighted the global reach of a sport that began in Cooperstown, NY: More than 62 million viewers <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MjY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C91fce8d5> in Japan watched its pool play victory over Korea, which a) is a bigger audience than the most-viewed World Series game, and b) means almost half of all Japanese households were watching, according to Front Office Sports.

Quote: “Most squirrel bites originate at the front, or ‘bitey end,’ of the squirrel.”

Always appreciate it when the National Park Service gives snarky wildlife advice <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Mjc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C10b2821a> on Twitter.

Dodge <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Mjk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7e26e9fd> announced the 2023 Challenger SRT Demon 170—its last gas-powered muscle car. The car boasts 1,025 horsepower and has optional parachute attachments.

Gwyneth Paltrow <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MmE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C212f7035> went to court over a ski accident in Utah in 2016. She’s being sued for $300,000 in damages by a man who claims she severely injured him on the slopes.

Party like it’s 1999

 TOGETHER WITH

Monogram <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zVG0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5ce544f8> 
Good morning. This day could go down in history. Former President Donald Trump said that he expects to be arrested over an investigation into a hush-money payment today. And yesterday afternoon, the NYPD began installing steel barricades around Manhattan’s Criminal Court.

It’s still not a sure thing, but if Trump is indicted and arrested, he’d be the first former president to face criminal charges. His lawyers have said that if it happens, he’ll follow standard arrest procedures, including getting fingerprinted and having a mugshot taken. Should be an interesting day.

—Sam Klebanov, Jamie Wilde, Neal Freyman, Abby Rubenstein
