Markets: Regulators in Switzerland seem to have given US markets a boost by calming investors’ fears of a banking crisis (at least for now). Stocks closed higher <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV3I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb607769d> yesterday, and regional US banks started gaining again, with PacWest jumping up the most. But not all regional banks—First Republic’s shares plummeted once more, and Jamie Dimon is reportedly trying to engineer another fix for the struggling lender.

 

GOVERNMENT

You never forget your first…veto <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dce1e21b2> Biden <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ece1e21b2> Anna Moneymaker/Getty Images
Biden checked-‘n’-balanced Congress yesterday with the first veto of his presidency. The president nixed a bill that would’ve overturned a Labor Department rule allowing retirement fund managers to consider environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in their investment choices.

Why pick this fight?

ESG investments take social and social and environmental impacts: Investment choices are based on considerations like companies’ carbon emissions and executive pay, in addition to potential returns.

Opposing ESG investing has become as much of a cultural marker for Republicans as listening to All Things Considered is for Democrats. The anti-ESG bill was introduced by Republicans in the House.

GOP lawmakers want investment fund managers to focus exclusively on growing clients’ retirement savings by maximizing returns rather than advancing what they see as “woke” goals. House Speaker Kevin McCarthy accused Biden promoting ESG to “fund a far-left political agenda.”

Democrats say it’s important that fund managers have the option to focus on ESG. They argue that the dichotomy between social goals and investment returns is often false since the former can influence a company’s economic prospects over the long haul.

How did we get here?

During the Trump administration, the Labor Department moved to substantially limit ESG practices for 401(k) funds, but the Biden administration reversed course and made a rule to explicitly allow fund managers to incorporate ESG principles into their investment strategy. Republican lawmakers in both chambers supported the bill to reverse this policy, and Democrats overwhelmingly opposed it (aside from Senators Joe Manchin and Jon Tester and Rep. Jared Golden, who crossed party lines to vote “yea”).

Biden’s veto did not come as a surprise (he threatened to do it before the bill passed), but Republicans hope that passing the bill through Congress lays the foundation for a court battle that can get the rule thrown out.

Zoom out: So far, Biden has kept the presidential flexing to a minimum, compared to his predecessor’s 10 vetoes over four years and FDR’s record 372 vetoes in…12 years.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV3Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2d9bc5df>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zWDE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb5f64a44>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV3Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cab9d024f>   

TOGETHER WITH MONOGRAM

The joint replacement technology we kneed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zVG0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf30d895c> Monogram <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zVG0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbce7dbdd>
That pun was bad, but our news is good: Failing joint replacements will hopefully soon be a thing of the past, thanks to Monogram <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zVG0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C68cbe968>.

Their combination of 3D-printed joint implants and precision surgical robots is helping solve the many issues facing the $19.4b joint replacement market <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zVG0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfc79b378>, including:

100,000 knee replacements that fail each year

20% of patients experiencing chronic pain after a surgery

human error that comes with using a bone saw to operate

Sounds promising? You’re not alone—Monogram has already raised $38m to help them get going.

What’s this all mean? Two words: investment opportunity. Click here to learn more about Monogram ahead of their planned Nasdaq listing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zVG0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4JmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8e0aa7a6>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines An Amazon office. Artur Widak/NurPhoto via Getty Images
Amazon will lay off another 9,000 staffers. The e-commerce giant recently finished letting go of 18,000 employees, but it’s already announcing another round of job cuts <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV3g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cca194adf> to reduce spending. The layoffs will take place over the next few weeks and will include workers in its cloud computing, Twitch, advertising, and human resources divisions. The reductions come after Amazon’s ranks swelled to help the company meet surging demand when nobody could go to stores during the pandemic.

Xi Jinping is visiting “dear friend” Vladimir Putin. China’s leader began a three-day visit <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV3c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C990a92a0> to Russia yesterday, meeting with Putin even as the West tries to keep Russia isolated because of its invasion of Ukraine. China has called the trip a “journey of friendship, cooperation, and peace,” while the US has derided it as “diplomatic cover” for alleged Russian war crimes. The US is concerned China may try to sell weapons to Russia or push a peace deal that leaves Russian troops in Ukraine.

CDC issues warning on fungus. In a possible inspiration for future seasons of The Last of Us, the CDC said yesterday that a fungal threat <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zWDA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf7b86860> to human health is growing at “an alarming rate” in health facilities across the US. Candida auris, a drug-resistant and sometimes deadly fungus that grows as a yeast, has now been detected in more than half of all states after first being found in the US in 2016. The fungus can cause infections and is especially dangerous for older people and people with weakened immune systems.

FINANCE

Credit Suisse bondholders learning their $17b went poof <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV3k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D409d9384> Parks & Rec scene where a character is smashing a phone with a hammer <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV3k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E409d9384> Parks and Recreation/NBC via Giphy
UBS’s emergency takeover <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV3o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cab0bd7f2> of Credit Suisse may have been necessary to avert a financial crisis, but at least one group is Yosemite Sam-level angry over how the deal shook out.

Investors holding $17 billion worth of Credit Suisse’s additional tier-one bonds were shocked to discover that their $17 billion was now worth a grand total of…$0. The value of those bonds had been completely wiped out in the deal.

Quick background: Additional tier-one bonds, or AT1 bonds for short, were established after the 2008 financial crisis to reduce the likelihood that taxpayers would have to bail out a failed bank. AT1s are considered riskier assets, but with that risk comes higher potential returns.

So, if these bondholders knew they were taking on risk, why are they so upset? Mainly because, in this unusual deal, they got wiped out while shareholders didn’t. That’s not how the order of operations usually works:

When a write-down happens, shareholders traditionally suffer losses before bondholders get hit.

This deal flipped the food chain, and livid AT1 bondholders are now huddling up with lawyers about potential legal action.

Big picture: The Swiss government’s arrangement of the UBS–Credit Suisse deal has been bashed not only by AT1 bondholders, but also by lawmakers <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV0E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C801217a4> in Switzerland’s two biggest political parties and financial regulators from around the globe.—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV0I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C68daa3fd>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV0M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2fd029a0>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV0Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5bc91ebe>   

TOGETHER WITH HOKA

HOKA <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zN3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8ba1133c>

ENVIRONMENT

New UN climate report says the window to reduce CO2 is closing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV0U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D8435955f> A thermometer steaming <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV0U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E8435955f> Francis Scialabba
If humanity wants to avoid a Mad Max-like future, the world needs to act now to rein in climate change, a new UN-backed report stressed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV0Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfc47bc4f>. “The climate time-bomb is ticking,” said United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres. “Humanity is on thin ice—and that ice is melting fast,” he added for dramatic effect.

Hundreds of scientists from around the world worked together to create the report. One finding the panel has “very high confidence” in? “There is a rapidly closing window of opportunity to secure a livable and sustainable future for all.” Cue Lloyd Christmas saying, “So you’re telling me there’s a chance?”

It’ll take some elbow grease—err, biofuel—to claw back climate change

Greenhouse gases need to be reduced by 50% by 2030 to keep climate change within 1.5 degrees Celsius of pre-industrial levels—and so far, the world’s on track to miss this target. By the early 2050s, we’d need to reach net zero CO2 emissions to stick to the goal.

Some key tools in the world’s “survival guide,” per the report, which…are all somewhat “duh”:

Increase solar and wind power

Make cities more bikeable and walkable

Cut back on agricultural pollution and limit food waste

Looking ahead…Guterres is putting the onus on high-income nations (ahem, US) to use their resources to limit their CO2 emissions by 2040—ten years before <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV0c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd1d7f2c2> the rest of the world.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV0g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cca905f3d>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV0k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbc9d52d7>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV0o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf359b21b>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Finland wearing a crown and a sash covered in happy faces. Hannah Minn
Stat: For the sixth year in a row, Finland clinched the title of the world’s happiest country <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV0s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2bba23d3>, according to the annual World Happiness Report. Despite spending half the year in darkness, Nordic countries made up the top three, with Denmark in second place and Iceland in third. But even those of us who don’t live in a country where saunas <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV0w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C287c9a9c> are commonplace (the US came in as the No. 15 happy place) have found things to smile about: The report found that global averages for happiness didn’t drop during the pandemic.

Quote: “We haven’t asked for spring break in our city. We don’t want spring break in our city.”

Miami Beach’s mayor is not joining your chants of “spring break forever.” Instead, the city wants to curb its position <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV00_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C301b00eb> as the ultimate destination for sand, sun, and too many margaritas after two fatal gun violence incidents involving out-of-towners occurred there over the weekend. To try to contain unruly crowds, Miami Beach implemented a curfew on Sunday, marking the fourth year in a row it’s had to do so during spring break, and restricted certain alcohol sales.

Twitter trivia

On this day in 2006, Jack Dorsey sent out the first-ever tweet: “just setting up my twtter.”

To celebrate that anniversary, let’s do some Twitter trivia. We’ll give you a tweet that’s among the top 30 most-liked tweets ever, and you have to identify who tweeted it.

“Next I’m buying Coca-Cola to put the cocaine back in”

“This is what happens when you don’t recycle your pizza boxes”

“We did it, @JoeBiden”

“Hey guys, wanna feel old? I’m 40. You’re welcome.”

“Love U”

  TOGETHER WITH

The Ridge <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUk8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf2b234c1>  
Good morning. Today is the vernal equinox, which is a fancy way of saying it’s the first day of spring.

Signs of spring are already here: The cherry blossoms are out in full force, commercials for the Masters are running alongside college basketball upsets, and, you know what, Chipotle was right about “burrito season”—I’m craving one.

P.S.: The deadline for our Financial Forecasting course is 12pm ET today. Don’t miss out <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zVDg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc2490386>.

—Neal Freyman

Markets: The stock market has entered its Harvey Dent era. On the one hand, surging tech stocks pushed the Nasdaq to its best week <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUlU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C38eb5722> since January last week. On the other, global banks have shed $459 billion in market value this month alone, the Financial Times calculates, as the sector faces a growing crisis of confidence.

 

BANKING

The Swiss call time on Credit Suisse <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D5a57eab3> Credit Suisse headquarters <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E5a57eab3> Arnd Wiegmann/Getty Images
Another weekend, another mad scramble to prevent a banking crisis.

Just one week after US officials raced to backstop Silicon Valley Bank depositors, Swiss authorities sprinted to engineer a takeover of spiraling Credit Suisse before the markets opened on Monday.

They got it done: Swiss banking giant UBS will buy its rival Credit Suisse <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca989a81c> for more than $3 billion in a historic tie-up of the country’s storied banks. It’s one of the most significant banking events in years, marking the first merger between systemically important global banks since the 2008 financial crisis.

How we got here: Credit Suisse had experienced massive outflows last week (up to $10 billion per day, according to the WSJ) and was teetering on collapse. An uncontrolled implosion of Credit Suisse would have had “incalculable consequences for the country and the international financial system,” Swiss President Alain Berset said. In other words, if Credit Suisse came crashing down, it would have brought many others with it.

UBS didn’t exactly volunteer as tribute

Understanding the market calamity that would’ve occurred otherwise, Swiss regulators essentially forced UBS to go through with this purchase and offered the bank $108.8 billion in liquidity as a way of saying “thanks for preventing a global financial crisis .”

For Credit Suisse, it’s an inglorious end. The iconic financial institution had been badly mismanaged for years, and its measly sale price reflects its fall from grace. Valued at ~$8.5 billion at market close on Friday, Credit Suisse sold for significantly less than half of that.

To put the price tag in perspective, Crocs is worth more than twice as much as what Credit Suisse was bought for.

No disrespect to Crocs, but Credit Suisse has been around for 166 years and had $574 billion in total assets at the end of 2022. This is a stunning collapse of a once-revered bank.

So, what’s it all mean? Just like US authorities did last weekend, Swiss regulators moved rapidly to nip a spiraling crisis in the bud, employing a “let’s do what needs to be done and worry about the consequences later” approach. It’s unclear whether these last-ditch government efforts will shore up confidence in a sector that’s had its world turned upside down in less than two weeks.

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C679f9486>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zVDk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd0bf75b2>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6699c33d>    

TOGETHER WITH THE RIDGE

Ahh, the butt bulge <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUk8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2777f39c> The Ridge <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUk8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6d3aaa3d>
It’s that bulbous bump beckoning from your backside where your overstuffed, unorganized wallet is not-so-successfully hiding.

So the efficient, organization-minded people at The Ridge <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUk8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca679f9f5> decided to banish the bulge. How? By creating a wallet that’s 60% slimmer and designed to fit in your front pocket.

Ten years ago, they changed money holding forever with their lifetime-lasting, RFID-blocking wallets made from premium materials like titanium and carbon fiber. And to celebrate their 10th anniversary, The Ridge is having a sitewide sale with up to 40% off <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUk8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5bacecbd>.

Now, when you effortlessly take out your Ridge wallet, people won’t shudder at its girth.

Bon voyage, butt bulge.

Gear up for another decade with free shipping and a 99-day free trial <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUk8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1JmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C42e80b1c>.

 

WORLD

Tour de headlines former President Trump Saul Loeb/AFP via Getty Images
Trump claims he’s going to be arrested. In a post on Truth Social, former President Donald Trump wrote (in all caps) that he expects to be arrested <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C084c809d> on Tuesday. His prediction was an apparent reference to the New York investigation into alleged hush money payments made to porn star Stormy Daniels, and all signs point to an indictment shortly. But Trump had no direct knowledge of the timing of an arrest, a spokesperson for the former president said. Trump ended his post by urging his supporters to protest and “take our nation back!” in an echo of his rhetoric ahead of the attack on the Capitol.

Could the insured deposit cap get a lift? At least four US lawmakers—two from each side of the aisle—said they would support raising the cap <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C65471945> on FDIC-insured deposits in order to reassure frazzled bank customers that their deposits are safe. The current cap is $250,000 (up from $100k pre-financial crisis), but Democratic Sen. Elizabeth Warren said bumping it up “is a good move.” Opponents of raising the cap say it would only increase risk-taking and bad behavior by banks. Some even argue we should lower it <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfebf7698>.

Taylor Swift kicked off her tour. The pop star began her Eras Tour <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8829b79e> in Arizona on Friday night, and if the first show is any indication, the hype is real. Swift performed 44 songs from her deep catalog across 3 hours and 15 minutes, delighting fans who she acknowledged went through “considerable effort” to be there (likely a swipe at Ticketmaster). USA Today wrote: “Not since the most vigorous days of Bruce Springsteen and his legendary live concerts has a mainstream artist packed so much music into one show.”

ENVIRONMENT

An enormous seaweed blob heads for Florida <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D3b55bcc4> Beachgoers walk past seaweed that washed ashore on March 16, 2023 in Fort Lauderdale, Florida. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E3b55bcc4> Joe Raedle/Getty Images
Seems like everyone is moving to Florida these days—including a gigantic blob of seaweed almost twice the width of the contiguous US.

The blob, comprised of 10 tons of sargassum algae, is trekking across the Caribbean toward Florida and is already washing up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce2f74d66> in places like Key West. Local communities across the Gulf of Mexico are worried the seaweed will force them to close popular tourism sites during the peak summer months.

That’s because when the seaweed piles up on a beach, it becomes a huge headache—literally.

Out of the water, sargassum rots and releases chemicals that smell like rotten eggs. Those chemicals also present a risk for people with respiratory issues.

And then there’s the sheer volume of seaweed. Sargassum is piling up five- to six feet deep <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C25c08db1> on Caribbean beaches, and Barbados needs to employ 1,600 dump trucks a day to haul it away, Brian Lapointe, an oceanographer at Florida Atlantic University, told CNN.

Big picture: Sargassum blooms are not new, and they provide an important habitat for marine life as they move across the ocean. But, due to a variety of factors scientists haven’t fully grasped yet, the blobs have gotten much bigger since 2011. This year’s blob could break records.

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU00_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd9e6ca07>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU04_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2dda1911>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU08_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca16ff0e0>

CALENDAR

The week ahead Jerome Powell Francis Scialabba
A high-stakes Fed meeting: While many Fed meetings are ho-hum, the one on Wednesday will pack the drama of a prime-time Oprah interview. The central bank’s plan to continue raising interest rates has been upended by the banking turmoil, and experts now say there’s a chance the Fed will pause its rate hikes to shield the banking sector from further chaos.

TikTok CEO on Capitol Hill. TikTok boss Shou Zi Chew will testify before the House Energy and Commerce Committee on Thursday, where he’ll try to make the case that a sale won’t alleviate US lawmakers’ privacy concerns. The US has recently demanded Chinese-owned ByteDance sell its stake in TikTok or else it would ban the app.

Xi ​​Putin. Chinese President Xi Jinping will travel to Moscow today for a three-day meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin. China has tried to play it neutral around the war in Ukraine, but Xi’s visit to Russia symbolizes the close ties between the two US adversaries.

Everything else…

March Madness rolls on (it’s living up to its name this year).

Islam’s holiest month, Ramadan, begins at sundown on Wednesday.

On Friday, Keanu Reeves returns as John Wick for the fourth installment of the hitman franchise.

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Scene from Step Brothers in their bedroom Step Brothers/Columbia Pictures
Stat: There’s so much less room for activities. The average apartment size in the US had its biggest drop <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU1A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C554ef8f5> on record last year, falling to 887 square feet from 917 in 2021, according to a RentCafe.com report. The average US apartment size is now down a full 54 square feet from 10 years ago. What’s behind the shrinkage? Primarily the historically large share of studio and one-bedroom apartments entering the market, RentCafe says.

Quote: “Your boss will soon be able to ask their Copilot to create a summary of who does the least work on average and have their termination letter already drafted in Outlook.”

Economist Samuel Hammond speculated <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU1E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ced67e52c> on Twitter about how Microsoft’s workplace AI tools will change performance reviews forever.

FROM THE CREW

ANSWER

They were all built to interact with the sun on astronomically momentous dates like today (equinoxes, solstices). At the pyramid at Chichén Itzá, for example, the spring equinox sunset creates the visual effect <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zVDc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca709cbb0> of a snake slithering down the steps.

  Classifieds <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUVI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc4f06217> Classifieds banner image <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUVI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dc4f06217> The wackiest headlines from the week as they would appear in a Classifieds section...

Careers

MUST BE PROFICIENT IN GPT: A Japanese startup is testing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUVM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1ffb9e56> potential new hires on whether they know how to use artificial intelligence software like ChatGPT. So, if you’ve spent any time trying to get the new Bing chatbot to admit it was sentient, you should probably add that to your resume.

NEW REMOTE WORK DESTINATION: Joseph Dituri, who goes by the nickname Dr. Deep Sea, is living underwater <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUVQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C04824a7d> for 100 days until June 9. Dituri is researching the effects of a high-pressure environment on the human body, which from our experience in high school theater, isn’t great.

Personal

SEEKING FLAT-EARTHER GF: A dating site for conspiracy theorists <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C61c10e28> has snapped up 1,500 users after its release last month in Germany. In addition to mentioning you enjoy long walks on the beach, Schwurbeltreff.de asks you to list which conspiracy theories you think are real. If you thought men lied about their height on Bumble…

ISO ANT-MAN LEAK: Disney subpoenaed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUVY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd09542e0> Google and Reddit for info on who might’ve leaked the script for Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania before the movie was released. The leaked script was posted to a Reddit forum via a Google Doc and quickly had 7,000 anonymous narwhals floating around it.

For sale

METAL RECORDS: Heavy metal band Metallica is the proud new owner of a vinyl factory <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUVc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca560ed10> in Virginia that has been pressing their records for the last 15 years. Metallica is seizing the means of production in order to satisfy surging demand for records—last year, vinyl records outsold CDs for the first time since 1987.

WET TECH: A UK tech firm set up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUVg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1545ddce> a data center underneath a public swimming pool, which it says is a more sustainable way to heat the water. Some pools in the UK have had to close in the last year due to rising energy costs…definitely not because of the spike in unclaimed Band-Aids floating in them.

A KINDA REAL LIGHTSABER: Chair of Walt Disney Parks and Resorts Josh D’Amaro demoed a working lightsaber <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUVk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce872382d> at SXSW this year. Twitter users surfaced a patent filed by Disney that’s likely for the product, but it’s not for sale yet. The lightsaber won’t cut through a human body like in the movies, though, which is sort of a bummer.—MM

FROM THE CREW

AI in clinical trials
The Crew <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUjA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2616daf8>
Drug costs are unsustainably high in the US, but using AI in the recruitment phase of clinical trials could play a hand in lowering them. While it might seem like something out of The Matrix, Healthcare Brew <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUjA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbf9576c1> reports that by using AI tools to identify qualified patients, researchers can drastically reduce how long it takes for a new drug or device to hit the market.

Check out their full report here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUjA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccb4b3673>.


  SNAPSHOTS

  Photo of the week An aerial view of a remaining pool at the edge of a hillside landslide brought on by heavy rains Mario Tama/Getty Images This backyard pool was unwittingly transformed into a quasi-infinity pool when a mudslide <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUjE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0044ca7d> took out a part of a bluff in the coastal city of San Clemente, CA. The 11th atmospheric river of the season hit the already-drenched state this week, causing all sorts of damage but also alleviating drought conditions across much of California.

  SCIENCE

  Dept. of Progress Hey Arnold saying Hey Arnold!/Paramount Global Here are some illuminating scientific discoveries from the week to help you live better and maybe even justify all those six-dollar cold brews.

Two men and a baby. For the first time ever, scientists have successfully created baby mice with two biologically male parents <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUjI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5148be2d> by turning male stem cells into female ones. After using the cells to make eggs, they were able to fertilize them, implant them in females, and see some healthy babies be born and grow into fertile adults. The breakthrough raises the possibility of using the same techniques for human babies, but scientists cautioned that’s still a long way away.

Your morning brew may be good for you. Drinking three cups of coffee a day might make you type really fast and really loud, but a new study found it could also improve your health. The research <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUjM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfc0b2581> linked high levels of caffeine in your blood with lower body fat and a reduced risk of Type 2 diabetes. But before you zoom off to Latte Larry’s, know that the study had some limitations—it mostly involved people with European ancestry and didn’t actually test whether drinking caffeinated beverages causes the health benefits.

Can a newsletter writer’s vacation move markets? We’re asking for a friend…specifically, Bloomberg Opinion’s Matt Levine, whose PTO has been interrupted by financial news bombshells so many times that people started joking his scheduled vacations presaged market volatility. Ivy League grad students investigated <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUjQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cff69c358> whether this was true—and found it wasn’t. Turns out Matt can knock back drinks served in coconuts without putting the financial system at risk: His time off (usually taken during popular vacation times) actually corresponds to calmer moments for the market.—AR

  NEWS ANALYSIS

  The easy-money era may be over for startups <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUjU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D3c12a66d> Jared in Silicon Valley looking out of a window <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUjU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E3c12a66d>Silicon Valley/HBO via Giphy Silicon Valley Bank’s collapse is dragging down <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUjY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1d8f92f0> startups’ futures with it, like the Scar to their Mufasa. And when the founders of young companies catch their breath from the initial chaos, they’ll be confronted with a harsh reality: The days of easily securing bank loans while looking out over the Pride Lands are over.

The gist: The version of Silicon Valley Bank that now exists after regulators stepped in can give startups their money back, but not the services they’ve come to rely on.

SVB was rooted deep into the startup ecosystem

SVB was relatively small—it had 40,000 customers compared to JPMorgan Chase’s 66 million—but it claimed to bank nearly half of all US tech and life sciences startups last year, including household names like Etsy, Roblox, and Roku. The cultural cachet of having a relationship with SVB as a venture-backed startup was like sporting a New Yorker tote at Whole Foods.

But the reason its loss will leave such a gaping hole in the startup community isn’t that it was cool to name-drop at a networking event. Because the bank was created in 1983 specifically to cater to venture-backed startups, it helped them in ways that most banks can’t—or won’t.

SVB was known for super-chill loans: SVB would offer loans to startups more readily <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUjc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6f2b5327> than large banks, basing the loans on a company’s ability to raise venture capital funds, not to turn a profit. SVB was also known for being flexible—even if startups breached their loan terms.

“They were the easiest money for an unprofitable, early stage to midstage tech company,” Irving Investors founder Jeremy Abelson told The Information.

Plus, it had a personalized touch: Even small startups received hand-holding services, such as guidance on how to set up their financial infrastructure. Its bankers personally called startups when they secured their first rounds of funding, according to The Information.

Now, startups might have to deal with big league banks

Several founders who previously banked with SVB told Bloomberg that they’re moving their money <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUjg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc422b329> to Chase and Bank of America, banks considered “too big to fail.”

Startups’ experience at big banks won’t be like their time at SVB. Not only is Jamie Dimon unlikely to call a startup to congratulate them on their Series A, but big banks are also expected to be more tight-fisted with their loans. The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, a regulator that oversees large US banks, disapproves <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUjk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C51087269> of loans to companies that are further out than one year from profitability, according to Crunchbase.

The loss of SVB is therefore expected to have a chilling effect on loans to venture-backed startups, aka “venture debt,” which SVB handed out more of than any other bank.

Zoom out: While on the surface, less money flowing to startups = bad, some think SVB’s collapse could be a net-positive reckoning for the startup community. Loans from SVB may have been too easy to procure, leading to reckless spending. “I think we all would be better off burning a lot less cash,” Chris Herndon, founder of SVB-banked startup The Guild, told The Information.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUmE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca0caeff9>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUmI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca5449239>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUmM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfed01816>

  DESTINATIONS

  Place to be: the Washington, DC, Cherry Blossom Festival Cherry blossoms in D.C. Getty Images It’s a big world out there. In this section, we’ll teleport you to an interesting location—and hopefully give you travel ideas in the process.

We’re nearing the end of March, and other than on your couch watching college basketball, the only other “place to be” is in Washington, DC, for the Cherry Blossom Festival <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUm0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfa6925af>.

The festivities began yesterday, a few days earlier than intended. DC is coming off of a historically warm winter, and the blossoms will be their fluffiest selves (aka “peak bloom”) March 22–25.

How did DC get cherry blossoms?

We have Eliza Ruhamah Scidmore to thank. In 1885, the American travel writer returned from a visit to Japan, where she had become infatuated with the country’s flowering cherry trees, known as “Sakura.” For the next 24 years, she lobbied the US government to bring Japanese cherry trees to the nation’s capital. Ignored time and time again, she finally found a powerful ally in Dept. of Agriculture official David Fairchild, who was also an admirer of Japanese cherry trees.

The two convinced the first lady at the time, Helen Herron Taft, to join their crusade, and after a few more hiccups along the way, a donation of more 3,000 trees arrived in DC as a gesture of goodwill from the mayor of Tokyo.

You can see the blossoming of Scidmore’s dream along the Tidal Basin over the next five weekends.—NF

  COMMUNITY

  Crowd work Last week we asked: If you could elect any fictional character as US president, who would it be?

Here are some of our favorite responses:

* “Kramer from Seinfeld. I’m pretty sure it’s self-explanatory.”—Trystan from Tacoma, WA

* “Mikey from The Goonies. Not modern-day Sean Astin, but the kid who rallied his friends, brother, and high school girls underground to find treasure. If he can convince them of that, imagine what he could get Congress to do.”—Matt from Sunnyside, NY

* “The Equalizer (Queen Latifah). Fights for good, takes no back talk, and always wins.”—Wayne from Michigan

* “The Dude from The Big Lebowski (if only for the more relaxed dress code).”—Dan from Duluth, MN

* “Future Trunks from Dragon Ball Z, this guy GETS THINGS DONE.”—Yousuf

* “Buffy, from the series Buffy the Vampire Slayer!”—Carolyn from Little Rock, AR

This week’s question

What would be the easiest way for an alien species to win over humanity and make us their allies?

Matty’s answer to get the juices flowing: Breakfast in bed, for everyone in the entire world.

Markets: Wall Street’s $30 billion infusion into First Republic didn’t manage to calm investors’ jitters about how banks are holding up. The regional bank’s stock tanked <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUlU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9650efb5> again yesterday, dragging the rest of the market down with it. Big Tech stocks got a boost from investors looking to park their cash in non-bank companies, though, pushing Microsoft to its best week in almost eight years.

 

FOOD

Lunchables are coming to school cafeteria menus <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUlY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D922f17eb> Deconstructed ham and cheese Lunchable <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUlY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E922f17eb> Alyssa Nasser
Little discs of cardboardy dough smothered with unnervingly sweet pizza sauce via a tiny red stick, sprinkled with what is called “cheese”: Lunchables’s Extra Cheesy Pizza—as well as its Turkey and Cheese variety—will be on the menu at K-8 cafeterias across the US come fall as part of Kraft-Heinz’s new deal <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUlc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7219392d> with the National School Lunch Program (NSLP), a program that provides free or low-cost lunches to nearly 30 million children.

’90s kids may already be salivating, but they should know that Kraft-Heinz had to tweak its original recipes to hit some nutritional targets required for school meals—such as lower levels of fat and sodium and increased amounts of protein and whole grains.

Child nutrition experts aren’t satisfied with the new formulations

They argue that the reengineered Lunchables are a red flag that the US’s standards for school lunches are simply too low…and that they may be that way in part because schools are too underfunded <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUlg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C76d07888> to raise them.

K-12 cafeterias’ budgets are being tightened by high food costs, supply chain snags, and labor shortages.

One of Lunchables’ main selling points to the NSLP was that it’s refrigerated, not frozen, which costs less to ship and store.

“School nutrition programs need to be reimbursed at a rate that they can scratch-cook delicious, healthy meals and not just provide the students a Lunchable because they don’t have equipment or labor,” Donna Martin, the director of a school nutrition program, told the Washington Post.

Others are concerned that selling a healthier version in schools than in stores could confuse customers into thinking the for-school versions and the grocery originals are equally healthy. But Kellogg’s Pop-Tarts, General Mills cereals, and even Domino’s pizza already have health-ified versions available at school cafeterias.

Speaking of marketing…getting in front of Gen Alpha (yeah, that’s what comes after Gen Z) is a Super Bowl-level win for Kraft-Heinz. Lunchables accounted for 8.6% of the grocery-dominating food company’s sales last year.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUlk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C081367b4>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUlo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C51e8e59d>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUi0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C124d8c35>   

TOGETHER WITH AURA HEALTH

Brothers solve $100b problem…for their mother <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT04_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2db2a574> Aura Health <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT04_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf4167321>
After seeing their mother struggle with depression, Forbes “30 Under 30” brothers Steve and Daniel Lee founded Aura <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT04_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2e98e636> to reinvent the $100b mental wellness industry.

The all-in-one mental wellness marketplace helps users find peace and has quickly grown to 7m users and 100k+ paying subscribers <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT04_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C79e8eb78>.

They’ve attracted investments from well-known Silicon Valley investors like Cowboy Ventures and Berkeley SkyDeck, plus executives from the biggest tech giants in the industry. And they’re just getting started.

For the first time, you can invest in Aura alongside these legendary investors and build the future of mental wellness together.

WORLD

Tour de headlines
Arrest warrant issued for Putin. The International Criminal Court issued a warrant <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUl8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdd1676c0> yesterday for Russian President Vladimir Putin for alleged war crimes due to his involvement in the forced relocation of thousands of children from Ukraine to Russia. But you’re unlikely to see a Putin perp walk any time soon—the ICC can only arrest and try Putin if Russia hands him over (it won’t) or if it can nab him outside the country. Russia has long denied committing war crimes and does not recognize the court’s authority.

Weekend banking crisis update. SVB’s parent company filed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUzA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce08eef11> for Chapter 11 bankruptcy yesterday, buying it time in paying off creditors and making it easier to sell off its assets (but the bank itself, currently in the hands of the FDIC isn’t part of the filing). Meanwhile, President Biden called on Congress to make it easier to punish <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUzE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce2117624> bank executives if their mismanagement causes a bank to collapse, including allowing regulators to claw back their pay.

It’s time to learn what a raccoon dog is. We still don’t definitively know where Covid came from, but team “it was an animal” got a new piece of evidence for its side when scientists analyzed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUzI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd197c4b5> genetic material collected from the Wuhan market in the pandemic’s early days and found raccoon dog DNA comingled with the virus. Raccoon dogs, an animal known to have been sold at the market, aren’t raccoons, and while they’re part of the dog family, they’re most closely related to foxes. The analysis has not yet been peer reviewed, and the debate over Covid’s origins rages on.

CRYPTO

Bitcoin is having a moment after SVB’s collapse <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUzM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D5f57a175> Chest of Bitcoin in front of up arrow. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUzM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E5f57a175> Illustration: Hannah Minn
Like the two Christmases you get after your parents divorce, sometimes an institution collapsing can result in an abundance of spoils. Bitcoin prices climbed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUzQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4855a767> as high as $27,293 yesterday, wrapping up the cryptocurrency’s best week since January 2021. And it has Silicon Valley Bank and friends to thank for it.

Why is crypto getting a boost? Crypto diehards claim bitcoin's gains are the result of people losing faith in traditional banking after the unholy trinity of SVB, Signature, and Silvergate  imploded in the last week.

But there’s another possibility: After the second- and third-biggest bank failures in history, economists started second-guessing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUzU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B04379b80> the Fed’s plan to hike interest rates again to protect the rest of the very fragile banking industry. The crypto market, which slid into the dreaded Crypto Winter in the first half of last year because of macroeconomic factors like the Fed’s rate hikes, might finally be approaching spring.

Looking ahead…The Fed’s decision next week will likely serve as crypto’s Groundhog Day. And despite the banking industry hoping Jerome Powell pauses the interest rate hikes, February’s inflation numbers showed that the Fed needs to stick to its original plan to keep inflation in check.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUzY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8be09257>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUzc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ceb00c1de>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUzg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C130781dd>   

TOGETHER WITH WANDER

Wander <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT08_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4a857ded>
First-of-its-kind vacation rental REIT: Wander.com just announced the launch of the first Vacation Rental REIT <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT08_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C65a3d638>. GOVERNMENT

Citizens can be rude in public meetings, Mass. high court rules <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUzk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Daa532088> Gif of Full House character saying <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUzk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Eaa532088> Full House/Giphy
Some wicked news for Massholes: Bay Staters’ right to be as insolent at town assemblies as they are behind the wheel was upheld <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU2E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C44ae8e3f> by the Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court. The state’s high court unanimously ruled that towns cannot require residents to act civilly in public meetings.

Politeness vs. freedom of assembly

The main plaintiff in the case was 71-year-old Louise Barron, of Southborough, MA. Barron sued after her brash behavior got her threatened with removal from a town meeting under rules requiring civility. She was uncivil: In a heated argument, Barron accused the town’s Select Board of spending taxpayer funds “like drunken sailors” and told one member “to stop being a Hitler.”

The court opined that local governments should encourage polite discourse but deemed Southborough’s public meeting civility rules a violation of citizens’ contitutional right to criticize public servants.

Mixed opinions: While some critics worry it’ll embolden cantankerous constituents, freedom of speech advocates welcomed the decision. Bellicose exchanges in town meetings are as much a Massachusetts tradition as sipping on a Dunks medium iced while plowing snow after a mighty nor’easter.

Zoom out: Discussions in public meetings have reportedly become more combative nationwide, as passions ran high over Covid policies and other contentious issues.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU2I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7e5fcde9>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU2M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C373f8ea0>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU2Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C689fad1e>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators A broken piggy bank covered in NYC stickers Hannah Minn
Stat: We know you can’t actually measure your money in vibes, but a recent analysis <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU2U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C81f932e8> found that a $100,000 salary in New York City feels like just $36,000. And it’s not just a feeling—that’s really how much buying power your paycheck has there, once you factor in soaring rents, steep taxes, and the sky-high price of buying salsa from the local bodega at 3am,SmartAsset determined. Of the 76 US cities the financial information provider examined, New York was the one where making six figures made you least baller.

Quote: “It’s a hard job. If I said it was easy, I’d be lying to you—and I don’t think that’s what we want, right?”

George Santos, the New York congressman who seems to have made up his entire personal history, told <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU2Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cee2318a2> the Associated Press that despite pressure from members of his own party, he’s got no intention of stepping down and might even run for reelection. That’s bold, but not as bold as the fact that he kept a straight face when he told the reporter, “I think truth still matters very much.”

Read: Why med school grads can’t get jobs despite a doctor shortage. (Vox <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU2c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C39c11354>)

NEWS

What else is brewing
Ticketmaster <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU2g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd51bd983> has agreed to lower fees and provide small refunds to fans that bought tickets to see The Cure after the band’s frontman publicly expressed frustration over high fees.

Ford <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30877082.2947019/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU2k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3NzA4Mi4yOTQ3MDE5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Bbf3fbfcb> has recalled 1.5 million vehicles to fix their brake hoses and windshield wiper arms.

 TOGETHER WITH

Masterworks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zTW8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTcmbHA9bG9nbw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9ec7aed7> 
Good morning and Happy Saint Patrick’s Day. What is the top US city for St. Paddy’s celebrations? It’s a highly contentious topic, but WalletHub joined the debate by analyzing city celebrations across various metrics. Their rankings <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zTzI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd2e12d8f>:

Boston

Philly

Chicago

Pittsburgh

New York

That checks out with our rule of thumb: A city will have great Saint Paddy’s Day parties if residents spent the past four months being miserably cold and seeing no sunlight.

—Matty Merritt, Neal Freyman, Sam Klebanov, Abby Rubenstein
