Markets: The S&P 500 posted its best day <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zTzM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc3f204c0> in almost two months after 11 banking giants helped out their li’l cousin First Republic Bank to show their confidence “in banks of all sizes.” To give you a sense of how jumpy bank stocks have been recently, First Republic was down 36% at one point yesterday but closed up 10%.

 

INTERNATIONAL

France in a frenzy over retirement age bump <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zTzQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Da7a1d51e> A protester climbs on a traffic light during a demonstration on Place de la Concorde, as the Eiffel tower is seen in the background, after the French government pushed a pensions reform through parliament without a vote <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zTzQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ea7a1d51e> Alain Jocard/AFP/AFP via Getty Images
Emily may have to keep posting about luxury products in her fancy Paris office for longer than she anticipated. French President Emmanuel Macron and his supporters used executive power to bypass Parliament and raise <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zTzU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7766f54b> France’s official retirement age from 62 to 64 yesterday, despite massive pushback from much of the country.

Macron, who’s 10 months into his second five-year term, campaigned on the promise of raising the official retirement age to help keep France’s shrinking pension fund flush with cash. He and his supporters have noted that French people are living on average three years longer compared to a few decades ago, and the retirement age needs to reflect that.

This is about as popular as your sister’s new boyfriend

About three-quarters of the French public is against raising the retirement age. Over the last few months, trade unions have launched eight coordinated protests across the country, and millions of citizens have marched in the streets, stymying public services.

Workers’ strikes have disrupted transportation services, including trains and planes.

More than 7,000 tons of garbage have piled up in Paris after sanitation workers walked off the job in protest.

What comes next? French lawmakers who oppose the change are preparing a no-confidence vote that if successful would essentially gut Macron’s ability to do anything going forward and reverse the retirement age bump. The likelihood of that passing? Not high. So far during Macron’s tenure, several previous no-confidence votes have failed. But unions have vowed to continue protests and “take things up a gear <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zTzY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb4651530>” following Macron’s move.

Big picture: France isn’t the only country that wants to make citizens send emails for more of their lives. The UK and China have both floated the idea of raising retirement ages as their elderly populations eclipse working-age citizens. In the US, the idea of bumping the retirement age has also been proposed as a fix for Social Security reserves expected to run dry in 2034.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zTzc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C71e38352>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zTzg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd9d37bb4>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zTzk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9724ed6c>   

TOGETHER WITH MASTERWORKS

Want to “crash-proof” your investment portfolio? <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zTW8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTcmbHA9dGl0bGU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0f4cee42> Masterworks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zTW8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTcmbHA9aW1hZ2U/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce2dc12cb>
“Inverted yield curve”…? “Bear trap”…? “Dead cat bounce”…? Hey, Wall Street, what the heck is going on?

Forget about the confusing jargon. Join over 30,000 Morning Brew readers investing outside the stock market—and seeing eye-popping results—with Masterworks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zTW8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTcmbHA9dGV4dDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca79af678>.

In just 604 days, a $10,000 investment in a fractionalized painting from Masterworks would have secured a $4,900 profit, beating 94% of S&P 500 stocks.

In fact, their 11 art sales to date have returned $30 million+ to investors <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zTW8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTcmbHA9dGV4dDI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C60048aae>, with the last three seeing 13.9%, 35% and 10.4% net returns, all while financial markets cratered.

Offerings can sell out in minutes, but Morning Brew readers can skip the waitlist <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zTW8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTcmbHA9dGV4dDM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8111beda> now.



WORLD

Tour de headlines Superman, Wonder Woman, and Aquaman flying Super Friends/Hanna-Barbera, DC Comics via Giphy
Wall Street to the rescue. The largest banks in the US gave a $30 billion infusion <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT2E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C59e89773> to First Republic Bank, the struggling regional lender that found itself in the blast radius of SVB. JPMorgan, Bank of America, and other financial giants each poured in at least $2.5 billion to shore up confidence in the US banking system during this precarious time. If you needed more proof these are precarious times: US banks borrowed $152.85 billion from a Fed lending program in the past week, topping the previous weekly high from the 2008 financial crisis.

Inflation hits YouTube TV: Google raised the price <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT2I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca861bc20> of its YouTube TV subscription from $65 per month to $73—a 12% bump. The service, intended as a cable replacement, hasn’t experienced a price hike since June 2020. But, according to Google, “content costs have risen” since then. It didn’t specify what content costs more now, but YouTube TV did recently pony up a reported $2 billion for the rights to the NFL’s Sunday Ticket package. Other streaming services from Apple, Disney, and HBO have raised prices recently.

Microsoft vs. Google locked in workplace AI battle. Microsoft wants to make its Office suite great again by infusing it <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT2M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C08e8423d> with the hottest tech around: the GPT-4 large language model. The company said it will include AI-powered assistants (“Copilots <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT2Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7cef5ff6>”) in apps such as Excel and PowerPoint to take busywork off your hands. That ai-nnouncement comes days after Google revealed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT2U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc79920e6> it would bring generative AI features to Google Docs, Google Sheets, and Gmail.

SCIENCE

World’s 1st octopus farm proposal sparks outcry <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT2Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2De878cb1c> Octopus <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT2Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ee878cb1c> Nikos Stavrinidis/Getty Images
A proposal to kill farmed octopuses with extremely cold water has landed a Spanish company in hot water with animal welfare advocates. Seafood producer Nueva Pescanova aims to open an octopus farm <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT2c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc5fd3a52> in the Canary Islands, the world’s first, where it reportedly would slaughter the mollusks for food by placing them in -3 degree Celsius slush, according to leaked documents obtained by Eurogroup for Animals.

Scientists point to studies on fish to argue that the slaughter method would distress the highly intelligent animals and cause them to die slowly. Animal rights supporters note that the plan to house the octopuses in lit-up communal tanks doesn’t adequately replicate their natural habitat—the animals are territorial and thrive in darkness.

Nueva Pescanova rejects accusations of animal cruelty.

Why are humans rallying around octopuses?

Though wild-caught octopuses are a delicacy in global coastal cuisines (and one award-winning thriller <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT2g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5fbb14fa>), their cognitive prowess makes them a more ethically contentious culinary delight than most other seafood.

One Dartmouth University cognitive neuroscientist believes they’re “as intelligent as cats,” and UK law recently recognized them as sentient beings since they can feel pain and pleasure.

A brain in each of the eight arms (and one in the head) allow octopuses to use tools, recognize humans, and even open jars <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT2k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1c8185ac>.

In the US…lawmakers in Washington state are weighing a ban on the nascent octopus farming industry, inspired in part by the Netflix documentary <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT2o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb9ce9b0c> My Octopus Teacher.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT2s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cce7927bf>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT2w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C25615be6>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT20_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf4be1f39>

ENTERTAINMENT

No Cure for high concert prices <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT24_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D5264e60f> The Cure lead singer Robert Smith against a torn Ticketmaster ticket <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT24_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E5264e60f> Illustration: Alyssa Nasser Photo: Jim Dyson/Getty Images
What do fans of The Cure have in common with Swifties? Both admire performers whose eyeliner is always on point and both are miffed at Ticketmaster.

What’d Ticketmaster do this time? When The Cure announced its latest tour, the band promised to keep ticket prices affordable. To which Ticketmaster, the behemoth that handles ticket sales for just about every live concert, responded “hold my $23 beer” and appeared to drive prices to the moon by tacking on <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT28_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2e3557d3> lots of fees.

Angry Cureheads vented about the extra charges on social media. One fan tweeted a screenshot showing they bought four tickets for $80—but the fees amounted to another $92.10.

The Cure’s frontman, Robert Smith, sympathized with his fans. He tweeted, “I AM AS SICKENED AS YOU ALL ARE BY TODAY’S TICKETMASTER ‘FEES’ DEBACLE” and lamented that artists have no way to counter Ticketmaster. He also noted that the band had used Ticketmaster to try to avoid scalping while opting out of the company’s dynamic pricing model and Platinum ticket tier because they’re “a bit of a scam.”

Big picture: Ticketmaster and its parent company Live Nation have already been catching heat from US lawmakers over their market dominance in live events after botching the rollout of tickets for Swift’s Eras Tour. This latest controversy could add fuel to that fire.—AR

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT3A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb2231262>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT3E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C84008222>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT3I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C31ee5f00>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Sopranos characters golfing The Sopranos/HBO
Stat: The Masters doesn’t qualify for itself, and in this era of remote work, more employees are sneaking out for a midafternoon tee time. In August 2022, 278% more people <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8299e060> played golf at 4pm on a Wednesday than three years before, according to a new study from Stanford University and Inrix. Other leisure activities are seeing a lunchtime spike, too: Noon was the most popular time for salon or spa bookings on ClassPass. Remote work researcher Nick Bloom told the NYT <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT3Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C411d2cbd> we’ve turned into a “student economy. You’re in the library in the evenings, and in the afternoon you’re sleeping off your hangover.”

Quote: “Haven’t watched a second of college basketball, but I won’t let that stop me today from Venmo’ing 9 friends $20.”

This tweet <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT3U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5c085b05> from IT Brew reporter Billy Hurley jibes with our experience yesterday.

Princeton <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT3g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca1ce1abc> (15-seed) upset No. 2 seed Arizona in an action-packed first day of the NCAA men’s college basketball tournament. President Biden had picked Arizona to win it all in his bracket...

The rate of maternal deaths <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT3k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C617b3eae> in 2021 hit its highest level in 56 years, spiking 40% from 2020. The US <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT3o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca891ed72> released footage of a Russian jet dumping fuel on and clipping its drone over the Black Sea.

The men’s total prize money for 2022, by comparison, was $440 million.

Cocaine production <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT0I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb205bf3a> reached its highest point ever following a slump during the pandemic, per the UN.

STARTUPS

How did founders navigate SVB’s collapse?
As SVB collapsed in spectacular fashion, startup founders with uninsured deposits in the bank were scrambling to figure out how to pay employees and understand the legal liability they might face if they didn’t.

While SVB’s depositors were eventually made whole, scarred founders are reevaluating their business relationships to be prepared for another debacle. “This is a huge wake-up call,” Michael Lotito, co-chair of law firm Littler Mendelson’s Workplace Policy Institute, told Morning Brew.

Read how it went down here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30864054.101657/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zT0g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg2NDA1NC4xMDE2NTc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Caf8b37ef>.

 TOGETHER WITH

AT&T <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zRjE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgwJmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc665b3e2> 
Good morning. As if we haven’t already been through March Madness with the banking chaos, the men’s college basketball tournament tips off this afternoon.

While you watch the games play out, the Morning Brew Daily podcast team created a bracket you can actually participate in. The contest is The Greatest Logo of All Time, and we’re asking readers to help select the very best logo from a talented field of 64 designs.

The first-round matchups are juicy, including Crocs vs. Jaguar, Old Instagram vs. New Instagram, and Hartford Whalers vs. Mighty Ducks.

You can vote on Twitter <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8a3eac69> or Instagram <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSkI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf00cb2c5> starting later today.

—Neal Freyman, Sam Klebanov, Matty Merritt, Abby Rubenstein

Markets: Anyone hoping the storm had passed for the markets was disappointed yesterday after Credit Suisse got investors fearing for the health of the financial sector all over again (more on that in a sec). Bank stocks in Europe and the US took a hit <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSkM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1a9ae220>, including First Republic which reportedly began to mull selling itself to a larger institution after two ratings firms cut its credit rating to "junk."

 

FINANCE

Global banking system on edge…again <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSnI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D14b17e97> A dog saying <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSnI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E14b17e97> Gunshow/Giphy
Just when we thought we could put up our feet and enjoy a stress-free day of watching college basketball, another banking mess emerged.

Yesterday’s mayhem stems not from California, but from Zurich. The Swiss banking giant Credit Suisse cratered <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSnM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C667c22a8> to a record low yesterday after its largest shareholder, the Saudi National Bank, said it couldn’t provide Credit Suisse with any more financial support due to regulations. Investors already rattled by two major bank failures in the US sent bank stocks tumbling, and concerns grew that the fragile financial sector could fracture.

To shore up liquidity, Credit Suisse said last night it will borrow <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSzY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cda621474> up to $54 billion from the Swiss National Bank.

Are Credit Suisse’s problems related to SVB?

No. Credit Suisse has been in the Bad Place for years due to mismanagement and scandals. When many clients yanked their money out of the bank last year, Credit Suisse posted its biggest annual loss since the financial crisis.

And, unlike SVB, which catered to a niche client base of startups, 167-year-old Credit Suisse is a much more influential player <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSnU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca835c25d> with deep ties to financial markets all over the globe. It is considered a “systemically important financial institution” under international banking regulations.

But if you’re a bank, now’s not a time to show any weakness

Though SVB’s implosion did not lead to Credit Suisse’s current crisis, it did expose how banks everywhere are under pressure from rising interest rates. When rates were near zero, banks scooped up safe but low- or even negative-yielding bonds. Now that rates are much higher, the value of those bonds fell, and banks are sitting on loads of unrealized losses.

In other words, SVB’s collapse woke up the mama bear, then Credit Suisse went and poked it.

Zoom out: Some finance leaders think a “slow rolling crisis” is coming for banks. BlackRock CEO Larry Fink, in his widely read annual letter, wrote that rapid rate increases have “exposed cracks in the financial system,” and he predicted “more seizures and shutdowns coming.”—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSnY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4cb71961>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSzU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4a5d4864>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSng_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce1f10f38>   

TOGETHER WITH AT&T

March is mad with potential <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zRjE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgwJmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdbbad8e8> AT&T <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zRjE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgwJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C71b507f1>
The last task before EOD doesn’t always wrap up as quickly as we’d like. But don’t let that block your plans. You can close out work from the road with AT&T Unlimited In-Car Wi-Fi <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zRjE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgwJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C12362c0d>. 

Car connection opens up all kinds of possibilities. Maybe it means you take your last meeting from the passenger seat. Or perhaps your kids will stop asking, “Are we there yet?” Either way, game → changed.

AT&T covers more roads than any other carrier <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zRjE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgwJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccf77efb5>, so the whole can stay connected—and you don’t ever have to worry about missing a tip-off.

Take possession of this potential. See if your car qualifies for a free In-Car Wi-Fi trial <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zRjE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgwJmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3f492ab0>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines Split TikTok logo with Capitol building on either side Grant Thomas
US demands TikTok be sold. The Biden administration has threatened to ban TikTok unless its Chinese owner Byte Dance sells off <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSzc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C29b30cf1> the app. The company had been trying to come to an agreement to merely add new data safeguards to the app to appease the US, but the government’s Committee on Foreign Investment in the US has now rejected those plans and demanded the sale. TikTok said it was “disappointed in the outcome” and weighing its options.

Exiled Chinese billionaire charged with $1b fraud. Guo Wengui was indicted <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSkQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd30c20b8> yesterday for fraud and money laundering. He was reportedly one of the richest people in China before he fled the country and potential prosecution, settled in New York, and became pals with Donald Trump’s former political strategist Steve Bannon. Prosecutors now claim Guo orchestrated a $1 billion scam that tricked his hundreds of thousands of social media followers into investing in cryptocurrencies and other businesses. One of the wildest ways he allegedly spent the money? Two $36,000 mattresses.

Abortion pills got a tense day in court. The Texas judge overseeing a lawsuit brought by anti-abortion groups seeking to revoke the FDA’s two-decade-old approval of mifepristone, part of a popular two-drug protocol for a medication abortion, heard arguments <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSkU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C16b06488> for four hours yesterday as he weighed whether to block the drug while the case proceeds. Those looking for clues in Judge Matthew Kacsmaryk’s  questions noted that heseemed open to the idea that the drug hadn’t been properly vetted. The judge said he would decide whether to issue a preliminary ban “as soon as possible.”

COMMUNICATIONS

Ryan Reynolds can act and sell a wireless company <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSkY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D998d95ff> Ryan Reynolds illustration on phone screen with "sold" sticker <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSkY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E998d95ff> Illustration: Hannah Minn
Ryan Reynolds just proved he’s an entrepreneur first, Blake Lively’s arm candy second. T-Mobile announced <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSkc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf3f00b54> yesterday it is buying Mint Mobile, the mobile carrier partially owned by the actor, for nearly $1.35 billion.

How do you go from Deadpool to owning a wireless provider? In 2019, Reynolds bought a stake in Mint Mobile, which sells budget phone plans for as little as $15 a month. He starred in a series of fun ads for the company—understanding, like any adult trying to monetize the skills they learned from the arts™, that marketing was his best way into the business world.

And marketing agreed with him: He is currently the chief creative officer of an ad tech company that’s made campaigns for projects he’s involved in as well as companies he’s not connected to, like Peloton and Match Group.

This isn’t the only successful sale of a Reynolds-backed business: In 2018 he became a co-owner of Aviation Gin, which he sold to Diageo in 2020 for a reported ~$610 million.

Big picture: Having acquired MetroPCS in 2013 and merged with Sprint in 2020 (the latter despite major pushback from regulators), T-Mobile is betting on Reynolds, who will stay on in a creative role, and his continued charismatic ad strategy will help T-Mobile’s now small army of budget carriers snag more customers.—MM

TECHNOLOGY

GPT-4 is blowing minds and getting that bread <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSks_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D7b91e22d> Pong game animation with code in the background <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSks_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E7b91e22d> Francis Scialabba
No one should be more worried about getting replaced in their job by OpenAI’s GPT-4 than GPT-3.5. It’s been just two days since OpenAI launched the next generation of its famed AI engine, but users are already making the most of its talents.

What can GPT-4 do?

Similar to ChatGPT-3.5, the updated system can write humanlike text and code. But it’s also capable of analyzing images—and OpenAI says this version is more creative. Here’s what we’ve seen it do so far:

It turned a hand-drawn sketch on a napkin into a functional website.

One user had it generate recipes based on a photo of some groceries.

Another said they got it to recreate code for the arcade game Pong in less than a minute.

Several companies have already “hired” the chatbot

GPT-4 will help Duolingo language learners practice their conversation skills.

Payment giant Stripe has it advising developers on technical matters.

Khan Academy was clearly impressed by GPT-4’s potential to get the top score on some AP exams: The education nonprofit is launching a pilot to have the chatbot tutor students and help teachers plan lessons.

Yes, but…despite the updates, GPT-4 is still prone to churning out BS in cases where a reasonable human would respond with a simple “I’m not sure.”—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSkw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7e984dac>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSk0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Bdc1c63e5>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSk4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb06b58f3>

Key performance indicators A French Bulldog puppy on a winner's podium Illustration: Francis Scialabba, Photo: Auscape/Getty Images
Stat: Last year, for the first time in 31 years, the labrador retriever was not America’s most popular dog <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSk8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7930b164>, according to the American Kennel Club. So, what breed scooted in on stubby legs with an adorable smushed-in face to take the top dog spot? The French Bulldog. About one out of every seven dogs registered with the AKC last year was a Frenchie, reflecting a rapid rise in popularity of the breed—which, though guaranteed to pull in likes on social media, can also suffer from serious health problems.

Quote: “It’s your fault. Your contract is too big, so they can’t pay for the wi-fi.”

Playing for the New York Yankees comes with at least a seven-figure salary but apparently no free in-flight wi-fi <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30848879.2966880/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSlA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg0ODg3OS4yOTY2ODgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C15b7cb03>. Per Sports Illustrated, it’s one of just two MLB teams that makes players shell out if they want to be able to play Fortnite in the sky (the other is the Cincinnati Reds). Still, the team’s jet is not entirely without perks: One former pinstripe wearer described it as “a pretty cool custom plane with poker tables and stuff.”

 TOGETHER WITH

The Ascent <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQ3A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYxJmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2db1e3ee> 
Good morning. The Ides of March (today) is infamous for being the date Julius Caesar was killed. But before that happened, it was mostly known as the deadline by which the ancient Romans had to settle their debts. That means today is the only day you can click “Remind” on Venmo without being considered passive-aggressive.

—Neal Freyman, Sam Klebanov, Matty Merritt, Abby Rubenstein

Markets: Banking crisis averted? While many questions remain over the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank, stocks boomed yesterday in a sign Wall Street has moved past the “panic” stage of this drama. Regional banks like First Republic, whose shares got trounced on Monday, rebounded <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR2g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C048a39e1> as the threat of an SVB-like bank run dissipated.

 

TECH

Meta downsizes…again <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR2k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2De06eef2c> Mark Zuckerberg lookin sad <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR2k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ee06eef2c> Illustration: Morning Brew, Photo: Getty
We’re beginning to learn what Meta’s “year of efficiency” means in practice: fewer employees.

Yesterday, CEO Mark Zuckerberg said Meta plans to lay off 10,000 employees, <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR2o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1089e959> just four months after it laid off 11,000 staff members. That round of layoffs, impacting 13% of Meta’s workforce, represented the biggest job cuts in the company’s history.

Not only is Meta laying off 10k employees, but it’s also closing 5,000 open roles. This is not a company that wants to onboard many people right now.

Why is that?

Meta is looking to reduce costs as part of what Mark Zuckerberg calls the “year of efficiency.” Last year was “a humbling wake-up call,” Zuck said, citing economic uncertainty and increased competition (aka TikTok) for denting the company’s ad revenue.

But Meta made plenty of unforced errors, too. And by dubbing 2023 “the year of efficiency,” it’s acknowledging that previously, things were not very efficient.

That starts with hiring. Meta has been criticized for growing its headcount so rapidly that many employees had nothing to do.

In a viral TikTok video <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR2s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ceb5f87dc>, one former Meta employee said, “we were just sitting there” and “you had to fight to find work.”

A report <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR2w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3e81cee5> in Wired argues that Meta’s headcount got bloated due to “ghosts in the machine”—employees who were brought on to launch new products and stayed on the payroll even when those products failed.

Putting the recent layoffs in context: Even after shedding 21,000 jobs, Meta will still have a higher headcount than it did before the pandemic. In the boom times of 2020 and 2021, it hired <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR20_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C36da6fa6> more than 27,000 employees.

Zoom out: While the US labor market remains strong, layoffs have spiked in 2023. Companies announced 180,713 job cuts <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR24_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C447f6b54> in January and February—the most to start any year since 2009, according to Challenger, Gray & Christmas. About one-third of the layoffs took place at tech companies.—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR28_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca3334436>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR3A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7776dbca>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR3E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4975ca04>   

TOGETHER WITH THE ASCENT

Time is money, cardholders <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQ3A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYxJmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C84c987af> The Ascent <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQ3A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYxJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9d4e56ac>
With interest rates these days, many folks are looking to curve APRs for as long as possible. And you’ll be hard-pressed to find a card that gives you as much time as this one <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQ3A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYxJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdf72a5b5>.

It’s got a staggering 21-month 0% intro APR offer <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQ3A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYxJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C667f835b> on qualifying balance transfers, making it one of the longest introductory periods on the market. On top of that, there’s 0% intro APR on purchases for 12 months, and no penalty APR if you’re late on a payment.

Think it stops there? Nope, the deal gets sweeter thanks to no late fees and a $0 annual fee.

Don’t get stuck with a card that’s behind the times. Apply here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQ3A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYxJmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C02c790a6>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines An MQ-9 Reaper takes off August 8, 2007 at Creech Air Force Base in Indian Springs, Nevada Ethan Miller/Getty Images
A Russian fighter jet crashed into a US drone. In the first known physical contact between US and Russian aircraft since the invasion of Ukraine, a Russian fighter jet collided <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR3I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C92602e5d> with a US surveillance drone in international airspace above the Black Sea, damaging a propeller and forcing the US to bring the drone down. At least that’s what the US claims happened: Russia denied that the plane came into contact with the drone. According to one US official, drones have been intercepted in the area before, but this incident was particularly “unsafe and unprofessional.”

​​ChatGPT is old news. OpenAI released its much-hyped GPT-4 AI language model <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSGQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2954d576> yesterday, representing an advancement over the tech that powers ChatGPT. GPT-4 is wowing reviewers with its ability to understand not only text but also images (even complex memes). Plus, it crushes its predecessor GPT-3.5 on academic assessments: On a simulated bar exam, GPT-4 scored around the top 10% of test takers, while GPT-3.5 scored around the bottom 10%.

EPA moves to get “forever chemicals” out of drinking water. The EPA proposed regulations yesterday to limit <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C03d1daeb> the amount of six types of industrial chemicals allowed in drinking water. PFAS, as they are known, cause health problems including cancer. Though many companies have begun phasing out the chemicals, a 2020 study found that 200 million Americans are exposed to PFAS in tap water.

FINANCE

What happened to Signature Bank <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR3Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Da51a441f> Signature logo with downward arrow <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR3Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ea51a441f> Jakub Porzycki/NurPhoto via Getty Images
We’ve written at George R. R. Martin-length about the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank, the second-largest banking collapse in US history. But did you know that the third-biggest bank failure <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSGU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8f41aa90> happened just two days after SVB imploded? The deets are juicy.

On Sunday, regulators seized the assets of NY-based Signature Bank and gave senior management the boot, but they assured its depositors that they could access all of their money. Signature was deemed a threat to the US financial system after panicked customers reportedly withdrew 20% of its total deposits.

But leaders inside the bank say authorities overreacted, led by none other than Barney Frank, the former US representative on Signature’s board. If that name sounds familiar, it’s because Frank crafted key banking regulations in the aftermath of the 2008 financial crisis (the Dodd-Frank Act).

Frank argues that Singature was singled out because of its ties to crypto—it was one of the go-to banks for crypto companies. Frank told Bloomberg <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR3U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce481dcf9> that he believes Signature wasn’t on the verge of collapse, and regulators only shut it down “to send a message to get people away from crypto.”

Authorities have pushed back on the pushback. The New York State Department of Financial Services, which initiated the closure, claims that Signature executives were elusive in sharing data with regulators during the bank panic, causing a “crisis of confidence.”—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR3Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8afffbe1>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSGc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbdb90787>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR3g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfee64815>

FOOD

Boneless wings are going to court <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR3k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D0aeb74ea> Chicken nugget in a sea of boneless wings <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR3k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E0aeb74ea> Illustration: Morning Brew, Photos: Getty
Everyone with a complex about getting wing sauce all over their face has a new hero. Aimen Halim of Chicago filed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR3o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C86561265> a class-action lawsuit against Buffalo Wild Wings that accuses the restaurant chain of falsely advertising its boneless wings when they are allegedly just chicken nuggets.

The lawsuit, filed last Friday, states that Halim believed BWW’s boneless chicken wings were actually deboned wings. If he had known the breast-meat truth, Halim claims he would have ordered something else, and therefore he’s suffered “financial injury.”

This debate has been a hot one. A man went viral in 2020 for giving an impassioned speech <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR0E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce376199f> to the Lincoln, NE, city council about why the term “boneless wings” should be stripped from every menu in the city.

But we’ve been having the conversation even before that. In the early 2000s, boneless wings gained popularity when the price of chicken breast—which is what boneless wings are usually made of—cratered, while wings remained expensive. And wing purists have always pushed back against the bone-free option. The prices of both items have fluctuated in the past few years, but the debate over what, if anything, constitutes a boneless wing has raged on.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR0I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc822ba44>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR0M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7fa1e85f>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR0Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5d40c1bc>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Argentina fans at the last World Cup Hannah Peters—FIFA/FIFA via Getty Images
Stat: Calling it now—summer 2026 will see the lowest worker productivity on record. The World Cup is expanding to 104 games <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR0U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C334c594b>, a considerable increase from the 64 matches played last year in Qatar. That’s the result of more teams in the field (48 vs. 32 previously) and a bigger group stage. The next tournament will be hosted in North America over a span of nearly six weeks.

Quote: “The standard deli sandwich with processed meat and cheese, you’re literally eating a heart bomb.”

An article <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR0Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7ab0c6f9> from the WSJ ruined sandwiches for us, and now we’re ruining them for you, too. Sorry. This quote about the health risks of sandwiches comes from a cardiologist and nutrition professor at Tufts University, who, along with other health experts, is warning about the high levels of sodium, sugar, and saturated fat in Americans’ favorite lunch option. A typical turkey sandwich in the 1980s had ~320 calories; in the 2000s, it had 820, per the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute.

Read: Influencer parents and the kids who had their childhood made into content. (Teen Vogue <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR0c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc8810376>)

NEWS

What else is brewing
Silicon Valley Bank’s <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR0g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1a671ea2> new CEO said that rebuilding has begun and asked customers to return: “We are open for business.” Meanwhile, the DOJ and the SEC have begun investigating <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zSGY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9737b566> the bank’s collapse.

Ohio <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR0k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C17441ba2> sued Norfolk Southern to ensure the railroad pays for damage caused when its train containing hazardous chemicals derailed in East Palestine in early February.

Boeing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR0o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce9df84af> notched a big order for 78 787 Dreamliners from two Saudi airlines.

Argentina’s inflation <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR0s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C003c73e9> topped 100% on an annual basis last month.

Google Health <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30836836.2966161/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zR0w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgzNjgzNi4yOTY2MTYx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1c076cd9> rolled out a bunch of new initiatives—many of them leveraging AI—aimed at improving access to care.

Ides of March trivia

Trivia today is admittedly a little darker than usual. But since it is the Ides of March (when Julius Caesar was assassinated), we’re going to quiz you on famous assassinations throughout history. We’ll give you a historic date, and you have to name the well-known figure who was assassinated on that day.

April 14, 1865

June 28, 1914

December 8, 1980

January 30, 1948

June 30, 1520

March 14, 2023 View Online <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQnY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8b96eadf> | Sign Up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9yWj9raWQ9ZjI2NTRlZjMmbWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dd05c7999> |  Shop 10% Off <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9yXz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwODIzODA4LjI5NzY2NTM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2d3fafa2> 
Morning Brew <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9yWj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwODIzODA4LjI5NzY2NTM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Eebabbbfc>

 TOGETHER WITH

Cytonics <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeng_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUzJmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd9594294> 
Good morning. At an event outside Tokyo in 2006, Akira Haraguchi set an unofficial world record for reciting the most digits of pi: 100,000+ over more than 16 hours. So, how’d he do it? In his mind, he linked each digit with a syllable and created a collection of epic stories from the words those syllables formed.

For Haraguchi, pi is more than just a number—it’s a spiritual calling <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQnc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2f8820d5>. He told The Guardian: “All things in this world, including ourselves, are aggregate sums of atoms, which are made up of rotating electrons. The ultimate history of mankind is moving toward a happy ending for people of all races. The Earth, the galaxy, and the universe all rotate. In other words, I think rotation is the absolute truth. So as long as I’m thinking about pi, I think I can live a life according to truth.”

Happy Pi Day.

—Sam Klebanov, Jamie Wilde, Neal Freyman, Abby Rubenstein

Markets: It was a roller coaster <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQng_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1539f1ff> of a day for stocks yesterday as the market continued to absorb the failure of two banks and the government’s efforts to keep those failures contained. Some stocks were actually buoyed by the notion that the Fed might stop raising interest rates due to the potential for a banking crisis. But bank stocks, especially regional ones, took a big hit, even though several regional banks told news outlets that they weren’t experiencing the big deposit pullouts investors feared.

 

FINANCE

Did the government hand SVB and Signature Bank a bailout? <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQnk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dbde10095> Government extinguishing an SVB cash fire <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQnk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ebde10095> Hannah Minn
You may have heard that the second- and third-largest bank implosions in US history occurred in the past four days. And since financial regulators know that bank runs can be as contagious as measles, they moved fast to keep cash flowing in order to prevent a system-wide epidemic.

Officials announced Sunday that clients of Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) and Signature Bank will get their full deposits back, with the money coming from the Deposit Insurance Fund of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC). The decision prompted comparisons to when Uncle Sam bailed out banking behemoths back in 2008, angering many taxpayers who footed the bill to rescue bank shareholders and executives.

But is it a bailout?

Here’s why it sure looks like a bailout to some: The FDIC guarantees bank deposits only up to $250,000, but most SVB and Signature clients were businesses rather than individuals, with account balances surpassing that mark. The government threw out the $250k compensation limit for the banks’ clients. And the Federal Reserve said it’s got cash ready to loan other banks that might be in trouble.

But officials are adamant that there’s no need to use the b-word <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQzc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca6f82ae9>, pointing out that only the banks’ clients are getting their money back.

So, what’s different this time around?

Unlike in 2008, SVB and Signature investors are taking a loss, and executives at the banks will be fired. “That’s how capitalism works,” President Biden said, referring to the fact that shareholders won’t get a free pass for their financial flops (sorry if you took Jim Cramer’s advice <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cac7a8618>).

The Treasury Department is also stressing that this time the recovery money is not from taxpayers but from an FDIC fund that banks pay into.

However, there’s no free lunch for taxpayers…banks may have to shell out extra cash to the FDIC to make SVB and Signature clients whole, which could ultimately come out of their customers’ pockets.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQkI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4477ccae>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQzg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce3366a66>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQkQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C58998105>   

TOGETHER WITH CYTONICS

600 million cases, 1 unsolvable problem… <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeng_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUzJmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6d45c91c> Cytonics <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeng_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUzJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5f278c86>
Osteoarthritis.

Despite being the most common joint disease in the world—affecting over 600m people—the only available treatments are “band-aids” that offer temporary relief (e.g., painkillers and corticosteroids).

That’s a big issue, and one that Cytonics is about to solve <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeng_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUzJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc6f6e354>.

Founded by an orthopedic surgeon, Cytonics has identified the root cause of osteoarthritis and is developing a biologic agent to attack it. With 22 issued US and international patents, $25m in funding already raised, and 8,000 patients successfully treated <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeng_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUzJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9fe7e650>, Cytonics is well on their way to dominating the $240 billion osteoarthritis treatment market.

The best part? They’re still accepting investments.

Check out Cytonics’ investment opportunity before their round closes on 3/30 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeng_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUzJmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbcb1efdd>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines uber driver Getty
Uber drivers are contractors, California court says. A state appeals court upheld <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQzU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9d539806> Proposition 22, a California ballot measure that classifies Uber and Lyft drivers as independent contractors rather than employees. The decision overturned a lower court’s ruling voiding the law. But the legal battle over the status of hundreds of thousands of gig workers is likely far from over: The Service Employees International Union is expected to appeal the decision to the state’s highest court.

Australia is getting nuclear-powered submarines. The US, UK, and Australia struck a deal yesterday to help the country Down Under go further down under. Australia will buy <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQkU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cae1ed42a> submarines from the US to modernize its aging naval fleet in what Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese called “the biggest single investment in Australia’s defense capability in all of our history.” The agreement is the product of a nuclear partnership among the three nations that kicked off in 2021.

Pfizer bets $43 billion on cancer drugs. Pfizer is shelling out that cash to purchase <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQkY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C82facb9f> Seagen, a biotech company specializing in innovative cancer treatments known as antibody-drug conjugates that can attack cancer while leaving healthy cells intact. The purchase could get attention from antitrust regulators as the government has started looking closely at healthcare deals. However, although Pfizer’s oncology division raked in $12 billion in revenue last year, it doesn’t have the kind of treatments it will get from Seagen.

ECONOMY

The Fed rethinks its playbook <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQkc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D8ab1e00a> a meme about the Fed reversing direction <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQkc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E8ab1e00a> Imgflip/Neal Freyman
Fed Chair Jerome Powell had a plan: He was going to continue hiking interest rates until inflation returned to typical 2% levels. But then Silicon Valley Bank collapsed, and that plan became almost as outdated as Mason jar decor.

Given the current fragility of the banking sector, some economists predict that Powell will change his strategy to put the health of banks above all other considerations.

Goldman Sachs, which previously projected a rate increase of 25 basis points at the Fed’s meeting next week, now expects no rate increase <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQkg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C73280627>, citing “stress in the banking system.”

The Japanese bank Nomura made an even bolder prediction yesterday: a rate cut at next week’s Fed meeting.

Another rate hike next week is still the most popular bet—as of yesterday, traders were pricing in a 70% chance <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQkk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B09240512> of a 25 basis-point increase, according to the CME FedWatch Tool. But the fact that we’re even talking about the Fed potentially pausing rate hikes shows how dramatically the conversation has shifted since last Friday, when the probability of a meaty, 50 basis-point hike was 40% (now it’s 0%).

Zoom out: The Fed already had a tough job trying to bring down historic inflation. But thanks to SVB’s implosion, it now needs to balance its fight against inflation with preventing even more banking chaos.

Looking ahead…the Fed’s path forward could get even murkier when the latest inflation report drops this morning.—NF

We’re covering everything you need to know about SVB on our podcast, Morning Brew Daily. ENVIRONMENT

Controversial oil drilling project in Alaska gets the green light <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQk0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Bea848391> Wild birds in Alaska <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQk0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cea848391> The Washington Post/Getty Images
President Biden approved <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQk4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C73a1b06a> the controversial Willow oil project for the Alaskan Arctic yesterday. That means oil company ConocoPhillips can drill on some of the US’s last unspoiled wilderness, where it’ll extract an estimated 576 million barrels of oil over the next 30 years.

Environmentalists oppose the drilling, calling the approval a severe setback for Biden’s goal of cutting CO2 emissions in half by 2030. And they’ve got support: More than 1 million protest letters have been sent to the White House, a Change.org petition has 3.2 million signatures, and the #StopWillow hashtag on TikTok has over 180 million views.

But Alaska lawmakers, oil industry groups, and some Native groups welcome <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQk8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd5d53942> the Willow oil project for the revenue and jobs it could create.

Biden *tried* to please everyone

The final project scales back ConocoPhillips’s original proposal by about 68,000 acres, only allowing three out of five requested drilling “pads,” or sites where a rig is set up.

Biden also threw in some environmental consolation gifts: He banned all drilling in the Arctic Ocean and added protections for 13 million acres of the National Petroleum Reserve in Alaska. But Jamal Raad, co-founder of the climate group Evergreen Action, called these measures “lipstick on a pig.”

Looking ahead…environmental groups plan to oppose the project in court.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQlA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cec337803>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQlE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbf8eafcc>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQlI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2c49bcb8>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators A 7-11 in Japan SOPA Images/Getty Images
Stat: Pour out a Slurpee for Masatoshi Ito, the Japanese billionaire who took 7-Eleven convenience stores global <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQlM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4f82c0f5> (he died on Friday at age 98). Ito succeeded in making 7-Eleven the place to grab mustard and batteries in the middle of the night, and nowhere is it more popular than in his native country. Despite the chain being headquartered in Dallas, Texas, about a quarter of the world’s 83,000 7-Elevens are located in Japan, with 2,881 in Tokyo alone.

Quote: “We have no relation to Silicon Valley Bank.”

There’s no question that the fallout from the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank could be far-reaching, but it probably wouldn’t have sent customers at an Indian cooperative bank into a panic except for one thing: their similar names <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQlQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd0dfff4f>. Mumbai-based SVC Bank reminded everyone this weekend that it has zero connection to the now notorious SVB and urged its customers to ignore “baseless rumors and mischief-mongering” after fielding repeated questions on social media about whether it was failing.

Read: How to protect your money from a bank failure. (Wall Street Journal <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30823808.2976653/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zQlU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgyMzgwOC4yOTc2NjUz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C532a69d4>)

Pie trivia

The answer to each clue has the word “pie” in it.

A dessert that is named after a city and is not a pie but a cake.

The longest song to reach No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100 until Taylor Swift’s “All Too Well.”

One of Mark Twain’s favorite desserts. (Hint: a character in his books is named after it.)

A bird that was the first non-mammalian species to recognize itself in a mirror.

According to legend, this pie’s name comes from insects flocking to its sweet molasses filling.

 TOGETHER WITH

Facet <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zcko_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQyJmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3e9b42ea> 
Good morning. That was a wild weekend for news, and to think—it all happened with one fewer hour.

Somehow we’ve managed to squeeze it into one newsletter: the scramble to prevent a banking crisis, an Oscars recap, turmoil at the BBC, and a lot more. You might want to grab your coffee before diving in.

—Neal Freyman

Here's what these numbers mean. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zMT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwODEzNzc0LjMzODY3NDI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Caa958e18>

Markets: Investors probably feel like a 5,000-pound weight has been lifted off their shoulders since US regulators announced a plan to make Silicon Valley Bank depositors whole. But danger still lurks: An important inflation report is on tap this week, and the banking sector remains skittish following SVB’s shocking collapse. After another weekly loss last week, the S&P is now barely in the green for the year.

 

BANKING

OK, you can breathe now <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeHM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Db4a96105> Silicon Valley Bank branch <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeHM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Eb4a96105> Justin Sullivan/Getty Images
At the end of an extremely stressful weekend, depositors of collapsed Silicon Valley Bank were told they could have everything everywhere, at all once.

Yesterday evening, the US government informed anxious SVB depositors that they’d have access <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeHQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C423fedd9> to all the money they stashed with the lender today, even if the amount exceeded the $250,000 limit insured by the FDIC. In addition to backstopping depositors, the Fed is offering additional funding to some banks to limit the contagion from spreading across the banking sector.

The Fed’s aggressive actions, the scale of which we haven’t seen since early Covid, show how the implosion of Silicon Valley Bank on Friday could have quickly turned into a full-blown banking crisis when markets opened this morning.

Banking is a confidence game, and if people and businesses felt their uninsured deposits were at risk, they could start pulling money from other banks in a catastrophic bank run.

The government had a hard deadline of 9:30am ET this morning to restore confidence in the banking system, and it beat it. Heck, it even got it done before the Oscars.

However, in their announcement, regulators also noted the closure of a second bank, New York-based Signature Bank, over “systemic risk.” All of Signature’s depositors will be made whole, they said.

What it all means

The government’s propping up of SVB’s depositors means the US startup ecosystem will avoid an “extinction-level event <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeHU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C59b1f0a2>,” as some startup leaders had warned. More than half of US tech and life sciences startups banked with SVB, and many were concerned they wouldn’t have enough money to pay employees this week or keep their companies running.

What will happen to SVB? Its assets will be sold to the highest bidder. The FDIC, which now controls SVB, began an auction for the bank’s assets Saturday night. The cleanest outcome would be a single buyer, but there are only a few banks big enough to realistically scoop it all up, such as JPMorgan, Citigroup, or Bank of America. As of last night, no deal had been reached.

Bottom line: While it appears that we won’t be reliving 2008, expect SVB to remain in the headlines for days and weeks to come. Politically charged debates over the Fed’s decision to backstop depositors, the meaning(lessness) of FDIC insurance, regulation of mid-sized banks, and how to prevent another SVB-like collapse have already begun and will only grow louder.
