TOGETHER WITH FACET

Kick-start your finances <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zcko_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQyJmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8a5d0f0f> Facet <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zcko_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQyJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C09d421e9>
The best way to jump-start your financial freedom? How does a $500 kick start sound? Right now, Facet’s offering $250 into your brokerage account <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zcko_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQyJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C90dba6e1> if you invest $5k within your first 90 days. They’re also waiving the $250 enrollment fee for new annual members.

What else comes with your Facet membership <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zcko_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQyJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9f445465> besides a $500 kick start? Your own CFP® professional and a team of financial experts across investments, taxes, benefits, and more, plus industry-leading technology to manage and organize your financial life in one place.

All this and more for a flat annual membership fee, meaning Facet won’t take a percentage of your investments—so when you make more , you keep more .

WORLD

Tour de headlines A.M.P.A.S. via Getty Images
It’s a multiverse, we’re just living in it. Everything Everywhere All at Once dominated <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeHk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf4357219> the Academy Awards, nabbing best picture, three acting wins, and best director. It was also the first time that two Asian actors—Ke Huy Quan and Michelle Yeoh—won Oscars in the same year, both for their roles in EEAAO. Brendan Fraser took home best actor for portraying a 600-pound professor in The Whale. Overall, it was a huge night for A24, the studio behind all six winners of the top Oscar categories.

More Oscars: In addition to the awards, viewers were treated to performances by Rihanna and an oddly close-up performance by Lady Gaga. However, those two megastars were ultimately upstaged by “Naatu Naatu <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeHo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C59023c69>” from RRR, which became the first song from an Indian film to win best original song. By the time the show concluded (way too late), the newly formed Oscars crisis team had not been called into action, since no shenanigans like last year’s slap occurred during the broadcast.

Saudi Aramco made how much? “This is probably the highest net income ever recorded in the corporate world,” Saudi Aramco’s CEO Amin Nasser said, and he might have a point: The state-owned oil giant brought in an astonishing $161.1 billion in net income <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeEE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf10b45b7> in 2022, up 46.5% from the previous year. Rising oil prices lifted all energy companies last year, but Aramco was on another level, raking in almost triple ExxonMobil’s 2022 profits (which were a record for any Western oil company).

MEDIA

Revolt at the BBC <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeEI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D892fca17> BBC Match of the Day host Gary Lineker looks on during the Emirates FA Cup Quarter Final match between Leicester City and Manchester United <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeEI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E892fca17> Marc Atkins/Getty Images
A scandal has erupted in Britain at the intersection of TV, sports, and politics.

This weekend, the BBC was forced to pull <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeEM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4813464a> much of its sports coverage following a boycott by anchors and commentators in solidarity with Gary Lineker.

Lineker, a former star soccer player and now a hugely popular TV presenter, was suspended <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeEQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cceaaae03> by the BBC on Friday for a tweet that criticized the UK government’s immigration proposal to stop asylum-seekers from coming into the country via boats.

The BBC said that Lineker’s tweet violated its impartiality guidelines and suspended him from his hosting duties at Match of the Day, a beloved soccer program that’s been around since the ’60s (imagine the glory days of NFL PrimeTime, but with 100x the cultural cache).

Chaos ensued. To support Lineker, other BBC on-air talent didn’t show up for work this weekend, causing the network to scramble to fill in programming. It even aired a prerecorded podcast on the radio instead of live soccer coverage.

The political fallout: Lineker’s suspension sparked a debate over the BBC’s independence from the government, with critics accusing it of caving to pressure from conservative lawmakers. Even Prime Minister Rishi Sunak weighed in, defending the government’s immigration proposal and expressing hope that Lineker and the BBC would work things out.

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeEU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6a4ce9a7>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeEY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0677746c>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeEc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C899c7d5b>

CALENDAR

The week ahead Dereck Lively II #1 of the Duke Blue Devils dunks against the Pittsburgh Panthers during the first half of their game Grant Halverson/Getty Images
While SVB headlines will likely dominate the week ahead, plenty of other major events are happening…

March Madness: Let’s go dancing. The brackets <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeEg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C65c22177> are set for the men’s and women’s NCAA college basketball tournaments, which kick off later this week. My Final Four picks for the men’s tourney: Alabama, Houston, Marquette, and UConn.

Inflation data: After getting mixed signals about the economy from Friday’s jobs report, the Fed will take a fine-toothed comb to the consumer price index, which drops tomorrow.

Biggg week for Irish pubs. Not only is March Madness kicking off, but Saint Patrick’s Day is on Friday. It’s basically an unofficial three-day weekend.

Everything else…

Tomorrow is Pi Day. Here’s a song <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeEk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdd23e7ef> that can help you memorize the first 100 digits.

Ted Lasso’s third and final season premieres this week. (Here’s the trailer <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeEo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2a1feda3>.)

Beware: Wednesday is the Ides of March.

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Instant Pot Gregory Rec/Portland Portland Press Herald via Getty Images
Stat: The Instant Pot is almost as washed-up as Kenny Powers. After sales of electronic multicooker devices reached $758 million in 2020, they plummeted by 50% <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeEs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7fd82cdf> last year, according to NPD Group (and Instant Pot accounts for the majority of this category, per the WSJ). It seems as though every household that wanted an Instant Pot already has one or has moved on to other shiny kitchen appliances, like air fryers.

Quote: “YOU SHOULD BE ABSOLUTELY TERRIFIED RIGHT NOW”

Over the weekend, entrepreneur Jason Calacanis and other startup investors raised alarms <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeEw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C60b5ab21> on Twitter (sometimes in all caps) about the potentially disastrous consequences of SVB’s collapse and implored Janet Yellen & Co. to step in to protect depositors. Critics were quick to label these SOS calls to the government hypocritical, reminding everyone of investors’ traditionally libertarian, get-the-government-out-of-my-business views. One thing we know for sure: The reactions to SVB’s collapse only deepened the animosity between tech investors and the media.

Read: Samsung “space zoom” moon shots are fake, and here is the proof. (Reddit <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeE0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6c19ec9e>)

NEWS

What else is brewing
Former VP Mike Pence <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeE4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce9ce4a31> criticized his former boss Donald Trump for his actions on Jan. 6, 2021, saying, “his reckless words endangered my family and everyone at the Capitol that day, and I know that history will hold Donald Trump accountable.”

Eight people <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeE8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3b8f0f46> were killed when two migrant smuggling boats capsized in thick fog off the San Diego coast. It was one of the deadliest disasters ever involving migrants on US shores, authorities said.

As many as 500,000 Israelis <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeFA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce8e66b97> protested the government’s planned judicial changes on Saturday night in what the Haaretz newspaper called the biggest demonstration in the country’s history.

American skier Mikaela Shiffrin <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeFE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C49aa9d79> broke the record for the most World Cup victories with her 87th.

Newark, NJ, <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30813774.3386742/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeFI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgxMzc3NC4zMzg2NzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1d005568> unveiled a statue of abolitionist Harriet Tubman to replace a now-removed statue of Christopher Columbus.

  BROWSING

  Classifieds banner image <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdWs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1088e772> The wackiest headlines from the week as they would appear in a Classifieds section...

Careers

BOY NEEDS CAMPAIGN MANAGER: Ben Savage, famous for playing the guy who was nervous around Topanga in Boy Meets World, is running <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdWw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6369f7de> to be a congressional representative for California. This isn’t his first venture into politics—last year, he ran for WeHo City Council…but only snagged 6% of the vote.

ENGINEERS THAT CAN THINK SMALL: After doubling its headcount in the last decade, Lego is hiring <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdW0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C543804e6> to keep up with demand for its foot-wrecking blocks. The company is leaving its toymaker rivals in the dust, bringing in almost double the revenue of Mattel.

Personal

SEEKING BACTERIA WITH A PAST: Scientists named a bacterial compound that kills fungus after Keanu Reeves <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdW4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C195ae3d0> because it reminded them of the way Reeves’s character John Wick obliterates bad guys. The compounds, named “keanumycins,” form holes in the fungi’s surface and essentially make them bleed to death.

TESLA WORKERS NEEDED TO FILL TOWN: Elon Musk is planning to build his own town <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdGQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf8b21403>outside Austin, TX, according to the WSJ. Thousands of acres of pasture and farmland have already been purchased to support the project, which Musk has envisioned as a “Texas utopia.”

For sale

VEGAN REESE’S CUP: Hershey is sending its first totally vegan <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdW8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C492792f2> chocolate to shelves this year. It’s finally making a Reese’s peanut butter cup that dads will refuse to eat.

XXXXXS CROWNS: Three-year-old Archie and two-year-old Lilibet, the children of Harry and Meghan, are now officially using their royal titles <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdXA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce2ca6ee4> of prince and princess. They’re now sixth and seventh in line for the throne, respectively. Neither released a statement on their future plans for the British monarchy because they can’t write yet.—MM

  SNAPSHOTS

  Photo of the week Skijoring competition in Leadville, Colorado Jason Connolly/AFP via Getty Images What exactly is going on in this picture? Thanks for asking. It shows competitors in the annual Leadville Ski Joring event <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdXQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cec65a2ae>. Every winter since 1949, this Colorado town has hosted a skijoring tournament wherein a skier is towed by a horse and rider down historic Harrison Avenue. It’s not exactly for pizza-style skiers—these daredevils must hit jumps, collect rings on their batons, and squeeze between gates while hurtling toward the finish line.

Fun fact: At 10,200 feet above sea level, Leadville is the highest incorporated city in North America.

  SCIENCE

  Dept. of Progress Dexter from Dexter's lab saying Dexter’s Laboratory/Warner Bros. Domestic Television via Giphy Here are some illuminating scientific discoveries from the week to help you live better but maybe also kill your buzz.

Sobering science. Researchers at UT Southwestern may have found a way to sober you up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdXU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf6afda74> fast. At the very least, they’ve figured out what to do with mice that might be slugging IPAs while living in your walls. They found that injecting the liver-produced hormone FGF21 into mice that were passed out from booze brought the critters back to consciousness in half the time it otherwise takes to sleep it off. If it works for humans, the research could lead to lifesaving treatments for alcohol poisoning.

Super superconductor news. Scientists reported a breakthrough in the journal Nature that could improve any technology that uses electric power, from car batteries to maglev trains to fusion reactors. The researchers claim to have discovered a superconducting material <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdXY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C19bb07d7> that, unlike the ones we’ve got now, can work at around room temperature and low enough pressure levels to be commercially viable. One caveat: The team behind the new superconductor had a similar paper retracted by the same journal in 2020, leaving some experts skeptical of their work this time around.

What causes coulrophobia? That SAT word means fear of clowns, and scientists recently set out to determine why we’re all so freaked out <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdXc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C772ff737> by Bozos: Unsurprisingly, it’s the way they look. Though negative pop culture portrayals play a role, the researchers concluded that most people get spooked around clowns because we’re uncomfortable that we can’t suss out their true facial expressions behind their makeup. Of the 53.5% of people surveyed who admitted to being afraid of the circus workers, very few reported having actually had a close encounter with a Pennywise type.—AR



 

FROM THE CREW

The Crew <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zckk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODExJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca1db4a91>
Trend alert: cybersecurity edition. One thing’s for sure in 2023: Cybersecurity <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zckk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODExJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce970b2eb> will continue to be a high-impact sector. Nearly every company has some need for tech, and hacks of all kinds are increasing. Check out our predictions <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zckk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODExJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc5707b41> about the 3 biggest cybersecurity trends of ’23.


  HEALTH

  Covid lab leak theory reignites debate over research safety <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdXg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D811f8d50> Person working with hazardous lab materials <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdXg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E811f8d50>Sebastian Condrea/Getty Images The one thing we know about where Covid-19 came from is…that we just don’t know.

With little hard evidence to draw from, some experts believe that the virus leaked from a lab, specifically the Wuhan Institute of Virology (WIV), while others maintain it transferred from animals to humans. US government agencies are divided, and a congressional subcommittee has embarked on a quest this week to get closer to the truth by holding the first hearing on Covid’s origins. But many experts aren’t waiting for a definitive verdict on the lab leak theory <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdXk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1ad912e1> to jump into a heated discussion about whether the current safety regulations around the globe for research involving high-risk viruses are sufficient.

Even the idea that a virus that killed almost 7 million people may have started from a sleep-deprived intern had us wondering just how many other labs like WIV are out there and what they’re up to—so let’s dive in. 

What kind of labs are these?

Labs like WIV are designated Biosafety Level 4 by the CDC, which means they work with dangerous and highly transmissible diseases for which there are no vaccines or treatments. A pair of gloves and a lab coat won’t cut it at Level 4 facilities: They’re usually housed in buildings with controlled airflow and state-of-the-art equipment, where staff are often swagged out in PPE on steroids <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdXo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3c162d19>.

The number of Level 4 labs has grown in recent years.

* There are 52 of them operating around the world, including four in the US. And 17 more are due to open in the future.

* Locations range from Boston, MA, to Minsk, Belarus. A group of researchers conveniently created a map <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdUE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfb9b8b41> so you can find the one nearest to you.

Though most Level 4 labs are operated by governments, some are privately run. The international standards meant to govern safety are difficult to enforce, and many experts argue that the regulations that are in place are too lax—even in the US.

So, what’s up with US labs?

Every member of the National Science Advisory Board for Biosecurity agrees that there needs to be a serious overhaul of how the US government handles oversight of dangerous pathogens. The board recommended that officials direct more scrutiny at research funded with private money and lower the threshold for what is considered a high-risk pathogen.

Biosecurity experts Gregory D. Koblentz and Rocco Casagrande say <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdUI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9cda4b5e> that the US “has taken a reactive and haphazard approach to preventing lab accidents.” They think there should be an independent government agency to regulate the research.

Meanwhile, former CDC Director Dr. Robert Redfield has called for an outright ban on research that involves engineering viruses to make them stronger. An early proponent of the lab leak hypothesis, Redfield says such research is too risky to be worth it. But infectious disease expert Dr. Paul Auwaerter disagrees: He warns that halting the research in the US won’t stop it from happening elsewhere.

Viruses don’t recognize borders…which is why many experts are calling for international cooperation in crafting research standards that will hopefully prevent the next pandemic, or at least preclude the need to argue about where it came from.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdUM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc4a182f2>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdUQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7ae0c549>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdUU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C45c1c943>

  DESTINATIONS

  Place to be: Nagi, Japan A child gets white powder on their face in Nagi Japan Nagi Town on YouTube <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g_dj0ya0dfLXNFZ2JmTQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce4e231fc> It’s a big world out there. In this section, we’ll teleport you to an interesting location—and hopefully give you travel ideas in the process.

There’s something remarkable happening in the small, remote Japanese town of Nagi: It has a lot of babies <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdU8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D7c2e8982>.

Why is that remarkable? Because Japan’s population is shrinking fast, and an advisor to the prime minister recently warned <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdVA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc5a7b2e7> that “the country will disappear” if Japan doesn’t turn things around in the stork-delivery department. About 2x as many people died as were born in Japan last year.

But Nagi is an exception to the rule <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdU8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E7c2e8982>, the WSJ reported. Women on average there have more than two children, compared to the national average of closer to one. Experts credit the town’s financial support for childcare as a factor encouraging more births— daycare costs a maximum of $420/month for a parent’s first child and the cost goes down to $0 for the third.

Previously, Nagi was only known for inspiring a village of ninjas in the manga series Naruto. But now, thanks to its fecundity (big word alert), it’s become somewhat of a travel destination—“baby tourism,” we’ll call it. Delegations from other parts of Japan and even South Korea have been visiting to understand its baby-making sauce.—NF

  COMMUNITY

  Crowd work Last week we asked you: What lore in your town should be turned into a Hollywood movie?

Here are some of our favorite responses:

* “In Salt Lake City, there is a grave for Lilly E. Gray, which prominently reads: ‘Victim of the Beast 666.’ Quite mysterious and great horror movie fodder.”—Kate from Utah

* “My hometown of Cut and Shoot, TX, supposedly got its name because in the early 1900s a preacher with a radical doctrine wanted to use the new town hall to preach a sermon. Half the town was vehemently against this. So those in favor nearly fought a battle against the pro faction. After that, it was known as where all the cutting and shooting [almost] happened.”—Jason from Cut and Shoot, Texas

* “The mall in Fredericksburg, VA, had a wig shop that stayed there for 30 years. The storefront never changed and the inventory was never updated, but somehow it survived. The wig store was the one constant among an ever-rotating cast of Chess Kings and Spencer’s. Was it the little engine that could, or a mob front? I need a movie about this place!”—Tom from Fredericksburg, Virginia

This week’s question

As we mentioned earlier, Boy Meets World star Ben Savage is running for a US House seat in California. He’s not running as Cory Matthews…but he might be more successful if he were.

So, we’re wondering: If you could elect any fictional character as US president, who would it be?

Here’s Matty’s answer to get the juices flowing: Dalton, Patrick Swayze’s character in Road House. If he can turn the Double Deuce around, he can turn anything around.

Share your response here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30798758.3368811/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdVE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc5ODc1OC4zMzY4ODEx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C39c1e8c2>.

Good morning. Unfortunately, today’s Saturday Sketch will be the last. Our full-time writer/part-time illustrator Max Knoblauch is moving on to a new opportunity, and none of us can quite can draw “Godzilla working from home” like he can (you’ll see).

We’ll miss Max’s deadpan humor, TikTok cameos, and cartoon animals, but we wish him the best of luck on his next adventure. And remember: This isn’t goodbye, it’s…um, well yeah, suppose it is goodbye.

—Sam Klebanov, Jamie Wilde, Matty Merritt, Abby Rubenstein, Max Knoblauch

Markets: Unsurprisingly, stocks did not react well yesterday to the biggest bank failure since the 2008 crisis (more on that in just a sec). The Dow suffered its worst week <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30802367.2974113/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zd1A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgwMjM2Ny4yOTc0MTEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2d045e8f> since June, and trading in several bank stocks, including First Republic, was halted at points throughout the day as Silicon Valley Bank’s collapse prompted a wider sell-off. But major banks JPMorgan, Wells Fargo, and Citigroup all ended the day higher.

FINANCE

So long, Silicon Valley Bank <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30802367.2974113/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zd1E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgwMjM2Ny4yOTc0MTEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D7b2303b8> Brinks truck in front of Silicon Valley Bank <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30802367.2974113/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zd1E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgwMjM2Ny4yOTc0MTEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E7b2303b8> Justin Sullivan/Getty Images
Silicon Valley Bank is no more. The tech industry’s go-to lender imploded in the second largest bank failure in US history. After investor concerns about Silicon Valley Bank’s (SVB) solvency prompted a bank run, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) took control of customers’ deposits yesterday.

The collapse happened fast:

SVB said Wednesday that it sold some of its assets at an almost $2 billion loss, sending investors and depositors into full freak out mode.

Its stock tanked over 60% the next day and several prominent VC funds advised their portfolio companies to pull their deposits.

By Friday, the 40-year-old bank was toast.

Why did things go south?

SVB counted nearly half of all venture-backed US companies among its customers. That client list was a blessing when interest rates were low so startups were swimming in cash from VCs. Its deposits more than tripled between 2018 and 2021.

But when interest rates began to climb last year, deposits shrank and so did the value of the bonds it bought with depositors’ cash. Short sellers have been sounding alarm bells about risks to smaller banks for some time now. But SVB was particularly vulnerable as it parked an unusually high share of customers’ funds in bonds and mortgage-backed securities.

What this means for SVB depositors

So when, if ever, will all those startups see their $175 billion in deposits? Each customer is guaranteed to receive up to $250,000 per account from the FDIC, but they’ll have to wait for the sale of SVB’s remaining assets to see if they can get any more money back (and most will have to make payroll before then).

Some are getting creative: The toy store Camp is offering a 40% discount with promo code “bankrun” to help it stay afloat as it waits for its cash to be returned.

Zoom out: SVB’s downfall sent shockwaves through the banking sector. But banks’ finances are in better shape now than they were in 2008, leaving experts optimistic that a full system meltdown is not on the horizon.—SK

WORLD

Tour de headlines Now hiring sign Francis Scialabba
The labor market is still hot. The US added 311,000 jobs <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30802367.2974113/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeGs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgwMjM2Ny4yOTc0MTEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3ddb055e> last month, the Department of Labor said yesterday. It was more than expected, signaling a strong labor market despite months of interest rate hikes aimed at slowing growth to tame inflation. Still, it was a smaller increase in jobs than the US saw in January, and wage growth slowed slightly too—so it’s still anyone’s guess what the Fed’s next move will be.

Iran and Saudi Arabia agreed to bury their beef. After seven years on the outs, the Middle Eastern rivals announced yesterday that they had agreed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30802367.2974113/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeGw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgwMjM2Ny4yOTc0MTEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd8be584d> to restore diplomatic relations and reopen embassies within two months. The two powers, largely at odds due to religious differences, have not only shunned each other but also fueled conflicts around the region, including in Yemen. The deal to make nice was brokered with China’s help, a sign of its growing influence.

California is getting dangerously drenched. President Biden declared <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30802367.2974113/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeG0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgwMjM2Ny4yOTc0MTEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce26c5862> a state of emergency in California yesterday as yet another atmospheric river hit the state. The National Weather Service warned <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30802367.2974113/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeG4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgwMjM2Ny4yOTc0MTEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C434bdc80> that the usually golden state will experience a “burst of heavy precipitation” this weekend and added that “areas that normally do not experience flash flooding will flood.” California is still recovering from a deadly storm in January and a blizzard last month.

SOCIAL MEDIA

TikTok’s ‘Bold Glamour’ filter pushes AI-enhanced cheekbones to the limit <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30802367.2974113/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeGQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgwMjM2Ny4yOTc0MTEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D82e8cbd4> Side by side of a user with and without the filter <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30802367.2974113/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeGQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgwMjM2Ny4yOTc0MTEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E82e8cbd4> @msxannie/TikTok
Long gone are the days of puking rainbow filters. A TikTok filter called “Bold Glamour”—which contours users’ cheekbones, plumps their lips, and gives them Cara Delevingne brows—has been used in 18.5 million videos, most of which were posted in the last week.

The filter is being lauded for how convincing it looks…but also bashed for how morphing people’s facial features could impact their self-esteem.

How it works: Many speculate the filter uses new AI capabilities that TikTok rolled out <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30802367.2974113/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeGU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgwMjM2Ny4yOTc0MTEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C851efd47> last month (but TikTok hasn’t confirmed). While old-school filters map your 2D face onto a 3D model, resulting in glitches when you try to dab or whatever, the new generation of AI filters is built to stay flush with your skin. Videos featuring “Bold Glamour” show users rubbing their hands across their faces in shock and awe.

Not everyone hearts it: Psychologists warn that it could set people up for disappointment and dysmorphia <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30802367.2974113/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeGY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgwMjM2Ny4yOTc0MTEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cab8fa475>. “When a person uses filters on most pictures, their authentic self tends to become subpar in their eyes,” psychologist Carolyn Rubenstein (who is not related to the Brew’s Abby Rubenstein)  told Yahoo Life.—JW

P.S. Not to brag, but the Morning Brew Daily Show’s Toby Howell tried the filter <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30802367.2974113/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeGc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgwMjM2Ny4yOTc0MTEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb4603ec8> before it was cool.

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30802367.2974113/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeGg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgwMjM2Ny4yOTc0MTEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb59c4df0>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30802367.2974113/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeGk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgwMjM2Ny4yOTc0MTEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C327ebaf9>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30802367.2974113/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeGo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgwMjM2Ny4yOTc0MTEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cff3f20ae>   

FROM THE CREW

The Crew <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30802367.2974113/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdGs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgwMjM2Ny4yOTc0MTEzJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf28bcf84>
Incorporating ESG into a corporate investment strategy can take years, and may require consulting multiple teams and stakeholders. In this report <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30802367.2974113/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdGs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgwMjM2Ny4yOTc0MTEzJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd08dae12>, CFO Brew breaks down how finance teams at companies like BlackRock, GM, and more have started to align their capital allocation and management with their sustainable commitments. ENTERTAINMENT

The Oscars want your attention <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30802367.2974113/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zd1U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgwMjM2Ny4yOTc0MTEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dc15dd7fa> Oscars statue in front of red curtains. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30802367.2974113/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zd1U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgwMjM2Ny4yOTc0MTEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ec15dd7fa> Stefani Reynolds/Getty Images
Like a trendy taco place on Melrose Avenue, the Academy Awards are looking to do things a little differently tomorrow night.

Here’s what to expect while your Oscar party is sipping their Tártinis:

The pre-show red carpet will not be red for the first time in 60 years. It’ll be “champagne,” and celebs will stand on it in a covered space. Organizers want it to feel like it’s happening at night, not at 3pm.

Rihanna is performing her Oscar-nominated song.

All 23 categories will be broadcast live, so buckle in for an even longer show than last year, when eight categories weren’t shown.

Acceptance speeches from the most popular six categories will be almost instantly uploaded to TikTok, but all speeches will be shared on Twitter so we can all quote tweet them and say “so powerful *This is sponsored advertising content.

Open House

Welcome to Open House, the only newsletter section that never gets seasick. We’ll give you a few facts about a listing and you try to guess the price.

House boat in Key West, FloridaZillowToday’s houseboat <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30802367.2974113/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zeDk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDgwMjM2Ny4yOTc0MTEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbc9285dc> is on the adorably named Shrimp Road in Key West, Florida. It doesn’t have an engine, but who needs to go anywhere with a view like that? Amenities include:

1 bed, 1 bath

Marble (looking) shower

“Six approved life jackets” (By whom? We have no idea)

How much to float forever?

 TOGETHER WITH

RAD Diversified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zcG0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkwJmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6a8a76b0> 
Good morning. Today has been dubbed Mario Day, and you wanna know why? Because it’s March 10, and if squish that to Mar10, it looks a lot like “Mario.”

Mario Day had us thinking of other “holidays” that could be established based on combining months + numbers that resemble letters. A couple ideas:

Jan15—a celebration of Janis Joplin.

Nov31—make that 3 into an “e” and you’ve got yourself Novel Day.

If you’re bored today, try out some combinations and let us know what new holidays you’ve created.

—Jamie Wilde, Max Knoblauch, Matty Merritt, Neal Freyman

Markets: Stocks fell <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc3o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5189f047> across the board in the lead-up to the pivotal jobs report out this morning. In this bizarre economic environment, investors are concerned that the US will have added too many jobs last month, because a larger-than-expected jobs number could encourage the Fed to ramp up interest rate hikes. And there’s reason to think it will come in hot: Jobs growth has topped estimates for the last 10 months <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc0E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6dd981fd>, per Bloomberg.

GOVERNMENT

What’s on Biden’s wish list? <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc0I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D85e8e013> President Biden speaking <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc0I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E85e8e013> Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images
President Biden laid out his ideal 2024 budget plan yesterday. Maybe we should say ideal-istic, because it’s the White House’s version of asking that no one gift wine at a white elephant. While the proposals are unlikely to be approved <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc0M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C03cfc2b8> by the split Congress, they give a sneak peek of Biden’s policy priorities heading into the next election cycle.

The proposed budget rings in at $6.9 trillion (nice). Here are a few key items in the plan…

Healthcare: The proposal would cap the price of insulin at $35 per month and empower Medicare to negotiate more drug prices. It would also make tax credits for health insurance premiums permanent.

Childcare: The child tax credit would increase from $2,000 to $3,600 per child and families could receive it even if they don’t owe taxes.

Going to the moon: NASA’s moon-bound Artemis program would get a budgetary boost <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc0Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C22efa435> of $500 million.

His other big goal? Reducing deficit spending by $3 trillion in the next decade to rein in the national debt.

Who’s paying for this?

Biden hopes to raise $4.7 trillion over 10 years by hiking taxes on the kind of folks whose couches aren’t against a wall.

Higher taxes for the wealthy: The budget request would reverse Trump-era tax cuts on Americans making more than $400,000 and add a new 25% minimum tax on billionaires. For people making at least $1 million, the proposal would also double the tax rate on capital gains, or the profit made by selling assets like stocks, houses, and Pokémon cards.

Higher taxes for corporations: Under the new plan, the corporate tax rate would jump to 28%, multinationals’ earnings abroad would be taxed at double the current rate, and the tax on stock buybacks would quadruple from its existing 1% rate.

Looking ahead…the GOP likes tax hikes as much as New Yorkers like a Los Angeles bagel, and the Republican-led House is already planning to reject Biden’s budget as proposed. But consider the budget an icebreaker—or more like throwing the ice into an inferno—to get conversations going.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc0Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2cdb283e>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc0c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8c17ffe6>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc0g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cade82dc4>   

TOGETHER WITH RAD DIVERSIFIED

Stocks are down—this is up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zcG0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkwJmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C92fd6606> RAD Diversified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zcG0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkwJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ceba6aa01>
We don’t blame you if the stock market is tying your stomach in knots. It’s been a long year of ups and downs (mostly downs, TBH).

But there’s another way to invest: RAD Diversified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zcG0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkwJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9a041463>.

RADD is a nontraded public REIT, which means shares of RADD aren’t stuck yo-yoing with the rest of the market. RADD’s share price has increased every year since its founding in 2019, jumping an eye-popping 122.22% in total.

That’s not even the best part. RADD’s expertly managed $100m real estate portfolio keeps growing and generating revenue, which RADD passes on to investors like you through a ~cash dividend~.

Want to join the fun? Learn how you can invest today <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zcG0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkwJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cebda2e4a>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines South Park character saying South Park/Paramount Global via Giphy
Bank stocks get routed. The US banking sector had its worst trading day in almost three years after trouble at Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) sent chills through the industry. Shares of SVB’s parent company tanked <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc0k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4ed47616> a record 60% yesterday after it launched an effort to raise more than $2 billion in capital to mitigate declining deposits. SVB works with almost half of US venture-backed tech- and life sciences companies, and some VCs have begun to tell their founders to yank their money <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc0o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C014488fc> from the bank, Semafor reported.

Visa, Mastercard, others pause plan to track gun shop purchases. Major payment networks halted their plan <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc0s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C58b022bb> to implement a new merchant category code for sales at gun stores, citing legal uncertainty. Gun control advocates had hoped that by categorizing gun store purchases, payment giants would help authorities spot suspicious activity. But GOP lawmakers pushed back, arguing it would infringe on consumer protections. And several bills have been introduced in state legislatures that would ban this type of tracking if passed.

Allbirds stepped in some doo-doo. The crunchy sneaker brand reported a brutal fourth-quarter <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdGU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdd1654df>, posting a 13% annual drop in revenue, and announced a broad strategy shakeup that includes hitting pause on opening retail stores. What went wrong? Once the comfy footwear of choice for tech bros in Silicon Valley offices, Allbirds began trying to attract elite athletes with high-performance running sneakers. But customers weren’t “ready for us to serve them in that area,” co-CEO Joey Zwillinger told CNBC.

ENVIRONMENT

Senators grill Norfolk Southern CEO over derailments <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc0w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dd7af7e61> Norfolk Southern CEO Alan H. Shaw <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc0w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ed7af7e61> Anna Moneymaker/Getty Images
In testimony before Congress yesterday, Norfolk Southern CEO Alan H. Shaw said <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc00_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccb09ad14> he was “deeply sorry” for the company’s early February train derailment in East Palestine, Ohio, that spilled hazardous chemicals into the surrounding soil and killed nearly 45,000 animals. In front of an antagonistic Senate Environment and Public Works Committee, Shaw outlined the company’s efforts to restore the area.

According to Shaw, Norfolk Southern has committed more than $21 million to East Palestine and provided financial support to 4,400 families. However, Shaw notably didn’t promise to pay for long-term medical costs of residents or economic damage to the area.

Senators also chided Shaw for declining to endorse bipartisan rail safety legislation introduced last week by Ohio Senators Sherrod Brown and JD Vance.

Bad timing: Another Norfolk Southern train derailed in Alabama hours before the hearing. About 30 train cars derailed, according to a county news release, but no injuries or hazardous spills were reported. It marks the third major derailment since early February for Norfolk Southern.

Looking ahead…the National Transportation Safety Board said earlier this week that it opened a special investigation into safety practices at Norfolk Southern. The company’s accident rate jumped 81% between 2013 and 2022, according to Politico.—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc04_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfc833bae>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc08_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd6cfc77c>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc1A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf225c340>    

TOGETHER WITH SMARTASSET

SmartAsset <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zcHA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkwJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cde3cf2fa>
Feel good financially. Life should be a balance of adventure and relaxation, not finances. Enter: working with a financial advisor <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zcHA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkwJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C70e9c085>. But choosing the wrong advisor could potentially wreak havoc on your retirement. Avoid these 7 common mistakes <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zcHE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkwJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc4bd188b> when hiring one so you can embrace more peace of mind in your golden years.

 

STREAMING

Spotify wants some scroll capital <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc1E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D392fe3df> New Spotify app layout with Vertical video format. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc1E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E392fe3df> Spotify
When you open Spotify today to blast Miley Cyrus’s new album of breakup bops and future karaoke picks, the app might look a little different. The audio streamer has redesigned <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc1I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce71cc422> its mobile app and—surprise—it kind of looks like TikTok.

The most drastic changes include vertical, TikTok-like discovery feeds for music, podcasts, and audiobooks that let you scroll through previews of each type of content.

Spotify also introduced a “Smart Shuffle” mode for premium subscribers that enables its algorithm to recommend putting new songs in your queue if you are listening to a playlist.

Once you finish a podcast episode, similar podcasts will autoplay.

Spotify's TikTokification joins the ranks of Reddit, Netflix, Instagram, and YouTube which have all doubled down on people’s desire to only see shortened versions of everything while using their phones. Some of the new features started rolling out Wednesday, and the company announced more will come online soon.

Big picture: Spotify said these tweaks amount to the app’s biggest revamp ever, and are intended to help users discover new music and let artists showcase their work in front of potential fans. The glow-up also comes less than a month after Spotify added the AI DJ <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc1M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5e5bf2f7> feature to its app.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc1Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C48c93521>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc1U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4c96a4d0>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc1Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C07576693>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators A Batman meme about Bing and google
Stat: The frequently mocked search engine Bing has cleared 100 million daily active users <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc1c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cba596773>, Microsoft’s head of consumer marketing wrote in a blog post. The search engine got a “little bit of a boost” after launching its AI-powered Bing Chat feature a month ago, but it’s also benefited from Microsoft pushing it hard on users via its Edge browser. We’re still far from everyone saying “Bing it,” though—Google has more than 1 billion daily active users.

Quote: “We have decided to turn over those who were directly involved and responsible in the events.”

The Mexican drug cartel blamed for the kidnapping of four American tourists and the killing of two of them has seemingly apologized <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc1g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5f604529>. In a letter claiming to be written by the Scorpions faction of the Gulf cartel, the authors regretted the violence and said they handed over the perpetrators to authorities. Cartels have been known to turn on the PR machine whenever they sense a threat to their business operations, according to the AP, which obtained the letter.

Read: Why a Vanderpump Rules breakup is the Red Wedding of reality TV. (Polygon <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc1k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C50cf2093>)

QUIZ

NEWS

What else is brewing
Yeti <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zcy0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbec2b35a> recalled 1.9 million coolers and gear cases because their magnets can fall off and get dangerously stuck in the digestive system if swallowed.

Back-to-back “atmospheric rivers” <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zc18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B5d0bba74> began hitting California yesterday, threatening to bring more flooding to a region that’s been drenched by rain and snow in recent weeks.

Three people <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdDA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9ad5eded> in Japan were arrested in connection with “sushi terrorism”—a viral prank where perpetrators put saliva on food at conveyor-belt sushi restaurants.

GM <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdDE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C07e98b86> is offering buyouts to the majority of its salaried workforce, CEO Mary Barra wrote. It’s part of an effort to shed $2 billion in structural costs in the next two years.

Apple <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdDI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbba47a2b> is launching a classical music app on March 28. Bach hive rise up.

Friday puzzle

Here’s a clever word puzzle from NPR <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30788859.3375890/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zdGE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc4ODg1OS4zMzc1ODkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C52ef231c>:

Name a branch of scientific study. Drop the last letter. Then rearrange the remaining letters to name two subjects of that study. What branch of science is it?

 TOGETHER WITH

Revela <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaWs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1a58a02d> 
Good morning. In yesterday’s most “What could possibly go wrong?” news, WWE is reportedly in talks with regulators in Colorado and Michigan to legalize gambling <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zblQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C98cc2702> on its high-profile matches. But don’t call it sports betting—those match results are arranged in advance, so it’d be similar to wagering on an event occurring in a scripted TV show.

If this were around 10 years ago, the bets on the eventual King of Westeros would’ve totaled in the trillions.

—Matty Merritt, Jamie Wilde, Max Knoblauch, Abby Rubenstein, Neal Freyman

Markets: Stocks ended up mixed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zblU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbcc7ccec> after Jerome Powell testified before Congress for the second day in a row and insisted that no decision has been made yet about the Fed’s next move on interest rates. Tesla had its worst day in a month in the wake of Elon Musk’s viral tweets mocking a laid off Twitter employee with a disability who reached out on the platform to ask if he still had a job (Musk later apologized).

 

RETAIL

How would you get rid of $1.3b worth of sneakers? <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zblY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Da8798a47> Very ugly red Yeezys. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zblY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ea8798a47> Jeremy Moeller/Getty Images
Like everyone with a Deathly Hallows tattoo, Adidas is stuck <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zblc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce4234f5d> with a very expensive reminder that a lot has changed in the last few years. The athletic brand is sitting on roughly $1.3 billion worth of Yeezy gear after cutting ties with Ye, formerly known as Kanye West, for his antisemitic comments. But the brand is not sure how to get rid of it.

Not everything ages like fine wine

During an earnings call yesterday, the new Adidas CEO Bjørn Gulden made it clear that ditching its unwanted Yeezy stock is a top priority. But the company is sort of stuck between a rock and an antisemitic sneaker:

Burning or trashing the gear would be unsustainable.

Donating the shoes could create a boom in the resale market.

Even if Adidas rebrands the items and sells them, Ye is still promised a cut of the profits.

The most likely option? Sell the kicks and donate the proceeds to charity. Gulden vaguely upvoted this solution in yesterday’s call saying, “If we sell it, I promise that the people who have been hurt by this will also get something good out of this.”

Big picture: Figuring out how to offload warehouses full of taboo merch isn’t the only headache Gulden is dealing with following the company’s breakup with Ye. Adidas reported roughly $630 million in lost sales in Q4 of 2022 thanks to the split. Gulden cautioned investors not to have high hopes for 2023, calling it a “transition year.” The company is also cutting dividends as it figures out a way to replace its $1.5 billion Ye collab.

Even bigger picture: The company is expecting an operating loss of over $730 million this year. The last time Adidas reported an annual loss, George H. W. Bush was president and Wayne'’s World was still a “new movie” (31 years ago).—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zblg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdd84fa5c>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zblk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cee414e62>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zblo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca263f594>   

TOGETHER WITH REVELA

Not your mom’s retinol <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaWs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb7b706a1> Revela <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaWs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C25fc83ea>
One of the biggest skin concerns as we age is the volume loss that leads to sagging skin and wrinkles.

Meet your skincare routine game changer: Revela’s Fibroquin™ Essence <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaWs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd63ad453>. This lightweight cream gives the results you expect from retinol sans the harsh side effects.

The secret to its success? Fibroquin™, an AI-discovered molecule that helps your skin keep up its collagen and elastin production.

Designed for maximum efficacy, this anti-aging formula is clinically proven to be 2x more effective than .5% retinol at increasing skin elasticity and bounciness, without the peeling or purging that comes with retinol. That’s why it was featured in PopSugar + Marie Claire and sold out just 2 weeks after launch.

Shop now + get 15% off <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaWs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C460a6c22>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines The Silvergate logo surrounded by coins Jakub Porzycki/NurPhoto via Getty Images
The latest crypto giant to fall is Silvergate Capital. The crypto company announced <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbi0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4ac21e53> yesterday that it’s winding down operations and liquidating Silvergate Bank, which has about $11 billion in assets. Silvergate has been on the struggle bus throughout crypto’s downturn—especially after the collapse of FTX, one of its biggest customers. Last quarter, Silvergate fired 40% of its workforce, reported a $1 billion loss, and took out billions in loans…but it wasn’t enough.

Louisville Police routinely violated civil rights, according to a Department of Justice probe launched in response to Breonna Taylor’s death. After a two-year investigation <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbl8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9b8e3165>, the DOJ concluded that Louisville Police officers illegally arrested people, used excessive force, and entered homes without announcing themselves. The people on the receiving end of these behaviors were disproportionately Black. Additionally, the DOJ said yesterday it would launch an investigation into the Memphis Police Department sparked by the fatal beating of Tyre Nichols in January.

JPMorgan sues former exec over Epstein relationship. The bank sued <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zb3Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf9997645> its former executive Jes Staley, who largely managed its business with financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The suit is a legal move aimed at putting Staley on the hook financially if the bank loses lawsuits lodged against it by Epstein’s victims and by the US Virgin Islands over its ties to Epstein, a JPMorgan customer for 15 years. Staley, who served a stint as the CEO of Barclays after leaving JPMorgan, has said that he was unaware of Epstein’s misdeeds.

ECONOMY

The bond market is flashing a recession warning light <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbzA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dbbbe5299> A dashboard with a check economy light flashing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbzA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ebbbe5299> Hannah Minn
At this point, it feels like economists have been predicting an imminent recession for so long that they’re starting to sound like that guy who insisted on spending December 31, 1999,  in a remote cabin because of Y2K. Still, one big recession warning signal reared its head this week.

What happened? When Jerome Powell told lawmakers Tuesday that recent strong economic data meant interest rates would likely climb higher than previously expected, it sent the markets into a tizzy, pushing the US Treasury yield curve to its deepest inversion <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbzE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C75815fe0> since 1981.

And that means…the yield for 2-year Treasury bonds exceeded the yield for 10-year ones—by a lot. It’s considered an inversion whenever the short-term yield eclipses the long-term yield. It signifies that investors expect interest rates to rise in the near term but that those hikes will ultimately damage the economy, forcing rates back down over time.

What does it have to do with a recession? A yield curve inversion has happened before every recession since the 1960s, so it’s definitely a more reliable prognosticator than your friend who has “a system” for their March Madness bracket.

Yeah, but…predicting the future is hard. Right now investors are freaked out by the Fed, but Powell is still trying to stick the (soft) landing—even if this makes it look less likely.—AR

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbzI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2d4c259a>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbzM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B7fa07a62>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbzQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8f449bfd>

WEALTH

Mom was 100% wrong—money for sure buys happiness <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbzU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Db2b6086a> Mom was % wrong—money for sure buys happiness <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbzU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Eb2b6086a> Paramount Pictures
Forget being rich in friendships, folks, it’s time to 10x that salary and start a side hustle dropshipping iPhone cases. A new study <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbzY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C46886d60> found that happiness rises with income level—even accelerating at levels beyond $100,000 per year up to $500,000 per year.

Millionaires and billionaires might be even happier: The study’s authors just didn’t have conclusive data for salaries beyond that range (those folks are probably too happy to take surveys). This new information upends an oft-cited 2010 study that found happiness plateaued near a salary of $75,000, or ~$103k today, after inflation.

In the new study, published in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, two prominent researchers (including Daniel Kahneman, the Nobel Prize winner who wrote that 2010 paper) surveyed 33,391 US adults between the ages of 18 and 65 with household incomes of at least $10,000. Participants logged their happiness level when prompted at random times throughout the day via an app.

A caveat: While more money does lead to more happiness for most people, it’s not the only factor, and its emotional effect is small compared to other considerations, like time off from work. “An approximately four-fold difference in income is about equal to the effect of a weekend,” the study said.—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbzc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cacacb4ef>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbzg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1aa06d3b>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbzk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C79a10372>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Packages on a doorstep in the snow Onfokus/Getty Images
Stat: Bad weather used to mean a drop in retail sales, but now shoppers stuck inside can order banana corers and mop slippers from their couch. US shoppers are expected <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zb2E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf2028207> to spend an additional $13.5 billion when the weather outside is frightful this year, according to an Adobe report released yesterday. Rain is expected to boost sales the most by $8.7 billion, wind by $4.4 billion, and snow will add a small uptick—especially in New York and Seattle.

Quote: “1,160 toilets and urinals. Three times the NBA average! We do not want people waiting in line. We want people to get back to their damn seats.”

Eat all the stadium nachos and hot dogs you want, because the new LA Clippers  stadium has no shortage of toilets, according to team owner Steve Ballmer. He hyped up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zb2I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C16171f5c> the still-under-construction Intuit Dome during a sneak peek of its facilities—especially, erm, the facilities. He previously said he’d “become a real obsessive about” those toilets. The stadium is slated to open during the 2024–2025 season.

INSIDE JOBS

What’s it like to make music for Pikachu and friends? Pikachu waving The Pokémon Company
Inside Jobs, our series on unconventional careers, is back.

In his early days pursuing music, Ed Goldfarb spent a good chunk of his life taking on side gigs—from playing organs in church to performing country tunes for famous NASCAR drivers in a luxury penthouse. But these days, he spends most of his time in his Novato, California, home composing music for film and TV—including the Pokémon franchise.

We chatted with Goldfarb about blowing past Malcolm Gladwell’s 10,000-hour rule, watching movies without music, and why you have to let the universe figure out your dream job for you sometimes.

Check it out here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zb20_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc3NTI1My4yOTY0ODQ2/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0f6ae64c>.
