ANSWER

We made up the one about Notre Dame.

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zSj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwNzc1MjUzLjI5NjQ4NDY/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4483bbd9>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zSz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwNzc1MjUzLjI5NjQ4NDY/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6b4affdd>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zTD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwNzc1MjUzLjI5NjQ4NDY/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C03dd020f>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zTT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwNzc1MjUzLjI5NjQ4NDY/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C17e19ee9>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zTj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwNzc1MjUzLjI5NjQ4NDY/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdb0ef1ce>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30775253.2964846/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zTz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwNzc1MjUzLjI5NjQ4NDY/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C094fbd6f>

Good morning. Happy Holi, Happy International Women’s Day, and Happy (belated) Purim. So whoever you run into today, just give them a thumbs up and a smile—odds are they’re celebrating something.

Markets: Fed Chair Jerome Powell rattled markets when in testimony on Capitol Hill yesterday he said that interest rates were probably going to go “higher than previously anticipated <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbDM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb3a56f82>” in light of stronger economic data. After those comments, stocks sold off and the 2-year Treasury yield spiked to above 5% for the first time since 2007.

 

TRAVEL

The DOJ is aiming to split up JetBlue’s Spirit takeover <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbDQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D6a9f0c2c> A combination Spirit and JetBlue plane <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbDQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E6a9f0c2c> Photo Illustration: Dianna “Mick” McDougall, Source: Getty Images
The Biden administration is continuing its full-court press strategy against airline consolidation. Yesterday, the Justice Department sued <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C87a30ade> to block JetBlue’s planned $3.8 billion takeover of Spirit Airlines, claiming that the  acquisition would raise fares for consumers and decrease options in an industry already known for only having pretzels or peanuts.

Spirit, with its no snacks, 28 inches of legroom, and no-recline seats, isn’t exactly anyone’s top choice for travel, but it is the nation’s largest ultra-low-cost airline. And, according to the DOJ, Spirit getting scooped up would eliminate about half of all ultra-low-cost seats in the industry, sending ticket prices (which are already skyrocketing) up even further.

For the Biden administration’s DOJ, with its hardline attitude against mergers it considers to be anti-competitive, that’s unacceptable.

Why would prices go up?

According to internal company documents that the DOJ cites in its complaint, when Spirit starts flying a given route, average fares fall by 17%. Meanwhile, JetBlue estimates that when Spirit stops flying a route, average fares shoot up by 30%.

JetBlue has claimed that by increasing its size with the purchase of Spirit, it could better compete with the “big four” airlines: United, Delta, American, and Southwest. But according to the DOJ, JetBlue isn’t the disruptive force it once was, and has instead evolved into an “ally of the big four.”

In response to the lawsuit, JetBlue CEO Robin Hayes argued that the merger was not like Pepsi buying Coke, and instead would make his company a “distant fifth-largest airline”—a Dr Pepper, you might say.

Zoom out: The last big merger in the airline industry happened in 2016 when Alaska Airlines acquired Virgin America. According to airlines.org, there have been 21 completed US airline mergers since 2001. That consolidation has made it hard for new competition to enter: Between 2007 and 2021, not a single new airline startup was formed in the country.—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbDY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1eca71b9>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbDc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Be4325fdb>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbDg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3995a956>   

TOGETHER WITH SMARTASSET

Kick back and retire <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaWc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcxJmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C306421ce>
Life should be a balance of adventure and relaxation—without spending too much time worrying about finances. Which is why SmartAsset raised $161m to help people plan for retirement.

Their no-cost tool makes it easy to find vetted financial advisors <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaWc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcxJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb193382f> who serve your area. And it may be worth your while, since research suggests people who work with a financial advisor could end up with 15% more money to spend in retirement.¹

SmartAsset can help you kick-start your retirement plans today. Try their free quiz <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaWg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcxJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C79ed2320> to get matched with up to 3 financial advisors serving your area, each legally bound to work in your best interest.

It’s never too late to work toward financial freedom <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaWc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcxJmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ceb73c2a2>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines National Guard and military vehicles take part in an operation to transfer two of the four US citizens kidnapped in Mexico's crime-ridden northeast
Two Americans found dead in Mexico kidnapping. Of the four Americans who had been kidnapped in Mexico last week, two were found dead <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbDk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C744b191d> and two were found alive, Mexican officials said. The Americans had traveled to Mexico because one of them was getting cosmetic surgery, but while driving in the city of Matamoros on Friday they were fired upon by gunmen and loaded into a pickup trick. US investigators suspect that a Mexican cartel mistook the Americans for drug smugglers, according to CNN.

GOP senators slam Tucker Carlson segment. Republican Senate leaders, including Minority Leader Mitch McConnell, criticized <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbGE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1e739643> the Fox News host for characterizing the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol as “mostly peaceful chaos.” On Monday night, Carlson aired footage from that day after House Speaker Kevin McCarthy gave him access to 40,000+ hours of internal security footage. McConnell and others said that Fox News’s depiction of the riot was misleading and at odds with the Capitol Police chief’s assessment.

New nuclear reactor turns on. For the first time since 2016, a new nuclear reactor in the US has reached the stage where it’s begun splitting atoms <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbGI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf59779b5>. The Vogtle Unit 3 reactor in Georgia hit the milestone on Monday, which puts it on track to become fully operational this summer. Including the Vogtle reactor, there are currently 93 nuclear reactors operating in the US that together generate 20% of the nation’s electricity, per CNBC. New nuclear projects have slowed down dramatically since the accident at Pennsylvania’s Three Mile Island in 1979.

AI

Live look at AI typing your next Slack message <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbGM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D8c173432> Robotic arm with foam head on it rolling on keyboard. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbGM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E8c173432> Simone Giertz
Productivity win: Slack has finally found a way to automate a unique, personal birthday message to your coworker. The Salesforce-owned messaging app said <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbGQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C88b65983> yesterday it’s introducing AI tools based on ChatGPT that will help you draft replies, find answers to questions, and summarize long threads or channels. There’s currently a waitlist to pilot the program.

How it works: In a world with an AI Slack assist, a five-part question from your boss at 4:59pm could become a piece of cake to tackle. The app would create a reply in seconds that you could then edit and send.

Salesforce touts the app’s potential to make workers more productive, but just how productive is up for debate as the AI-generated messages may take longer to edit and fact check than just writing them yourself. Plus, tools like Google’s AI chatbot have made headlines for giving users incorrect information <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yMmg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6b90dcaf>.

Big picture: Slack’s new toy joins a flood of other AI apps and assistants that companies such as Microsoft, Meta, and Google are unleashing on the American workforce. ChatGPT generating an unhinged poem was funny, but to commercialize the tech in a meaningful way, companies will need to make it useful for the average marketing associate to do their job.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbGU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C71d94b58>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbGY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0b30c186>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbGc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3168a9de>

HEALTH

Study finds a popular sugar substitute might be bad for your heart <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbGg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D3a00bc30> Sugar substitute gravestone <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbGg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E3a00bc30> Francis Scialabba
A recent study <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbGk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0dbbd7fe> published in Nature Medicine found that the sugar alternative erythritol is associated with an increased risk of heart issues and strokes.

Our bodies produce small amounts of the compound naturally, but it’s also increasingly found in many processed foods, especially “sugar-free” products and even some toothpaste.

What did the study find?

Scientists explored the link between levels of different chemicals in the blood and the risk of heart disease.

Patients with more erythritol in their system had a higher chance of having a stroke, suffering a heart attack, or dying within three years.

It was also tied to an increased risk of blood clots in mice and human blood samples.

While erythritol is linked to health issues, it is not necessarily a cause. It’s also unclear how worried folks without medical conditions should be, as the study mostly followed a population that was already prone to heart disease (due to conditions like diabetes or high blood pressure).

Zoom out: The researchers are recommending further investigation so we can better understand whether erythritol ought to be proclaimed unsafe. In the meantime, one of the study’s authors, Dr. Stanley Hazen, is telling his patients to skip the sweetener and opt for a couple of drops of honey or a pinch of sugar instead.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbGo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C776546a2>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbGs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C94af75f7>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbGw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf1ba2f70>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Liam Neeson saying I will have my revenge Clash of Clans via Giphy
Stat: Americans who’ve had a bad experience with a product or service are increasingly airing their grievances <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbG0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca5f3d79c> just like Frank Costanza. According to the National Customer Rage Survey, 9% of consumers who had a bone to pick with a company took “revenge” by shaming them in public (on social media or IRL). That’s up from 3% in 2020, but significantly lower than the 17% average during the revenge-seeking golden age of 2003–2017.

Quote: “We love Florida, we’re growing in Florida left and right.”

According to Jamie Dimon, the Financial District is no longer in Lower Manhattan—it’s in the Lower United States. In an interview with Bloomberg TV this week, the JPMorgan CEO hyped <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbG4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C67afd2eb> both Florida and Texas as major growth regions for the finance industry because those states “like business, they want you to come.” Dimon revealed that JPMorgan now has more employees in Texas than in New York: “It shouldn’t have been that way but Texas loves you being there,” he said.

Read: Why the recession is always six months away. (Wall Street Journal <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zbG8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C334fd578>)

FROM THE CREW

Sharpen your predictive skills Back to the Future scene where the kid is yelling Back to the Future/Universal Pictures via Giphy
Y2K scare: never materialized

Tarot readings: too vague

March Madness brackets: always end in heartbreak

It’s time to give false predictions the boot. That’s why the brainiacs at Morning Brew Learning created the Financial Forecasting course, a one-week sprint that gives you the tools to transform qualitative business goals into actionable metrics. Learn how to create an annual business budget that delivers, beginning on March 20.

Reserve your seat now <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30763746.2968171/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ySUI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc2Mzc0Ni4yOTY4MTcx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8dca0051>.

Monogram <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZ2Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfff60c02> 
Good morning. If you had to guess, which state would you expect to have the best tippers? What about the stingiest?

We’ve got the goods. According to Toast’s Q4 2022 Restaurant Trends Report…

Delaware is the most generous state for tipping, with an average tip of 21.8% on the Toast platform.

The least generous is California. People there leave an average tip of 17.5%.

Any theories for the wide gap?

—Jamie Wilde, Sam Klebanov, Max Knoblauch, Neal Freyman

Markets: On the first day of “hell week” for Wall Street, stocks held up reasonably well <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZ08_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5c41a18f>, and the Dow extended its winning streak to four days. TRANSPORTATION

E-bike batteries are exploding and setting buildings on fire <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZ1U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D5840dc0f> Two people on e-bikes in the street <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZ1U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E5840dc0f> Spencer Platt/Getty Images
Everyone and their neighbor seemingly got an e-bike during the pandemic, but their surge in popularity has come with a nasty side effect: exploding batteries <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZ1Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd68fdc4b> that spark deadly fires. The problem is especially evident in New York City, where on Sunday an e-bike battery sparked <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZ1c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb4acda81> an hourslong blaze at a Bronx grocery store that injured seven.

It’s the latest in a string of fires started by the lithium-ion batteries in electric bikes and scooters. They’ve caused at least 30 fires, 40 injuries, and two deaths in NYC this year, as of Feb. 27, according to the New York Fire Department.

Last year, they ignited 216 fires—double the amount of the year before—resulting in 147 injuries and six deaths.

Lithium-ion batteries were the fourth leading cause of fire deaths in NYC last year, per the FDNY.

The number of blazes has been rising in tandem with the number of e-bikes sold: The US imported over 1 million last year, a gear shift up from 880,000 in 2021 and 450,000 in 2020, according to the Light Electric Vehicle Association.

What’s so dangerous about an e-bike battery?

It’s about the batteries. Lithium-ion batteries are a Nobel-prize-winning invention that power everything from phones to computers to electric vehicles. These batteries are safe unless they’re faulty or damaged <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZ1g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8e1df9d4>, and e-bikes and e-scooters are subject to a lot of hard use hauling commuters and delivery workers up and over NYC’s bridges.

The batteries are also expensive (about $300 each), so low-quality and secondhand alternatives, which are more likely to be defective, have flooded the market.

It’s unlikely an e-bike will spontaneously combust midride beneath your butt. Instead, they become a hazard while in storage or when they’ve been left unattended on a charger (where they overheat).

The fires they cause are nightmarish: Lithium-ion battery fires can engulf a room in about 15 seconds, per the UL Fire Safety Research Institute. In addition, the toxic gases they release make them especially difficult to put out.

There’s a solution in the works

The New York City Council approved several bills last week that 1) add new safety and certification standards for micromobility vehicles 2) launch educational campaigns on safe usage and 3) restrict the use and sale of secondhand batteries.

It’s the city’s alternative to an outright ban, which London enacted for e-scooters in 2021 after it faced its own battery fire problem.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZ1k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C60411862>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZ1o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6f5dedbe>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZy0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2f7d48b0>  

WORLD

Tour de headlines Governor Gavin Newsom speaks at a press conference on Wednesday, Feb. 9, 2022 Aric Crabb/MediaNews Group/East Bay Times via Getty Images
California is “done” with Walgreens. CA Gov. Gavin Newsom tweeted that the state will stop doing business <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZ1E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccf881c00> with Walgreens over the pharmacy chain’s decision not to sell abortion pills in 20 GOP-led states. Walgreens and CVS have been threatened with legal action by Republican attorneys general if they distribute abortion medication in those states. But Newsom is not impressed, writing that Walgreens’s move “cowers to the extremists and puts women’s lives at risk.”

US to go full Gandalf with proposed airline merger. That’s a “You shall not pass!” reference, btw. The Department of Justice and Department of Transportation are expected to launch an attempt to block <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZ1M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd543dfcc> a proposed $3.8 billion merger between JetBlue and Spirit as soon as today. The DOJ will sue on antitrust grounds, arguing that a tie-up would harm flyers by raising prices and decreasing options. And in a highly unusual move, the DOT is expected to try and block the transfer of Spirit’s airline operating certificate.

Toblerone loses its Swissness. The brand is ditching <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZ1I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6c0f7f00> the iconic Matterhorn mountain image and Swiss flag from its packaging because of the most European reason possible: It’s breaking Swiss government rules about what can be promoted as a Swiss product. The Swissness Act of 2017 put guardrails around how companies can use certain Swiss symbols in their marketing, but Toblerone will no longer meet the Swissness criteria as it shifts some production to Slovakia.



TOGETHER WITH MONOGRAM

A robot we kneed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZ2Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce79e9b8a> Monogram <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZ2Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd3255a1b>
With over 93k knee replacements yearly, knee reconstruction surgery is one of the most significant orthopedic issues. Which means doctors must have perfected the procedure by now, right?

Wrong. 20% of all patients experience chronic pain after surgery, and there are over 100k revision surgeries a year. That’s why Monogram’s attempting to change the status quo <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZ2Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6c5bde77>.

Their 2-pronged approach has the potential to eventually rework conventional knee surgery completely, thanks to:

3D-printed joints custom made <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZ2Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7ae8c12e> for each patient

precision surgical robots that minimize invasive techniques and human error

What’s this all mean? Two words: investment opportunity. You can invest in Monogram <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZ2Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4JmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C02643b50> to get in on this game-changing new technology before their planned Nasdaq listing.



TRAVEL

Turbulent times for air travel <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZ18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D586ec7d7> Airplane affected by turbulence <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZ18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E586ec7d7> Hannah Minn
We regret to inform you that there are shakes on the plane.

A series of extreme turbulence incidents in early 2023 has air travelers wondering why the seatbelt sign has been left on so much lately. Last week alone, turbulence was responsible for: at least seven injuries aboard a transatlantic Lufthansa red-eye <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaDA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf33a20cb>, the aborted landing of a North Carolina-bound Southwest flight <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaDE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4d9a9d5e>, and a passenger death <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaDI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce0d9ca5c> on a business jet traveling between New Hampshire and Virginia.

Are the skies becoming more treacherous?

Research shows that the chances of having a turbulent flight are increasing and that a changing climate might be the culprit.

Climate change makes atmospheric air currents more unstable and winds faster, causing rockier skies.

It’s also elevating the risk of clear-air turbulence, which appears out of the blue and gives pilots little time to order passengers to buckle up.

But in general, you should still be more concerned about the prospect of a canceled flight than a shaky one.

Extreme turbulence is still very rare and not usually dangerous. Only 146 people were seriously injured by severe turbulence between 2009 and 2021, per the Federal Aviation Administration—and most were not wearing their seatbelts. Airplanes are designed to withstand intense shaking, while pilots are trained to safely navigate intense wind…even if your plane meatloaf sticks to the aircraft ceiling.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaDM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9fad5f92>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaDQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2d5f187e>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdbacd4e7>

GOVERNMENT

Snowplow puns could be your ticket to glory <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaDY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D38ff9374> An image of a snowplow wearing a name tag labeled Saltimus Prime <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaDY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E38ff9374> Francis Scialabba
A storm drain? Who cares. But a storm drain officially named Stormy Drainels? That’s something to cherish.

Municipalities across the US know this, so they’re increasingly holding <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaDc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf3ef9d24> online naming contests to christen fixtures like snowplows, sewer grates, and garbage trucks in a bid to increase public awareness of the services available and the workers who perform them, the WSJ reports.

The Madison, Wisconsin, snowplow naming contest results came in late last month, resulting in five newly deputized plows: Saltimus Prime, Snowbi Wan Kenobi, Seymour Pavement, and Dolly Plowton.

Madison isn’t the only city with named plows. Some highlights from around the US include:

Fuhgeddaplowdit (New Paltz, NY)

Plowy McPlowFace (St. Paul, MN)

Steve (North Hero, VT)

Other pieces of equipment around the country have also gotten the pun treatment. A storm drain in Minnesota is named Drain “The Block” Johnson, a street sweeper in Virginia has been dubbed “MF BROOM,” and a garbage truck in Indiana now goes by “Bin Diesel.”

Where’d this come from? The idea of naming municipal equipment seems to have been spawned in Scotland, where a 2006 primary school contest to name gritters (snowplows) caught on in a big way. All 240 plows operated by Transport Scotland now have names.—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaDg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4769dfb3>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaDk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce89a5f0c>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaGE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C56cabb1a>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Brownstones in Brooklyn
Stat: The real estate development industry is overwhelmingly white. And by overwhelmingly, we mean that about 111,000 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaGI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C32f5de95> of the roughly 112,000 real estate development firms in the US are white-owned. That was the finding of a new study by the Initiative for a Competitive Inner City and Grove Impact, which attributed the lack of minority representation in the industry to a lack of access to capital.

Quote: “This is the biggest innovation in our industry today.”

WW (formerly WeightWatchers) has been watching the explosion of diabetes and obesity drugs such as Ozempic, and CEO Sima Sistani doesn’t want to be left out. To gain a foothold in the space, WW said it’s buying Sequence <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaGM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2a3e881f>, a digital health company that connects its subscribers with doctors who prescribe drugs like Ozempic and Wegovy. WW intends to promote Sequence’s service to its members, the WSJ reported.

Read: Meet the guy who’s lived (mostly) barefoot for two decades. (New York Times <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaGQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9d663038>)

NEWS

What else is brewing
Tesla <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaGU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4b0ce077>, for the second time this year, cut prices on its Model X and Model S vehicles in the US. They’re now 4%–9% cheaper than they were in January.

In other Elon Musk news <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaGY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8cdcea91>, Twitter suffered its second outage in less than a week.

Altria <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaGc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0a926588>, the maker of Marlboro cigarettes, is buying e-cig startup NJOY for $2.75 billion. At the same time, it’s ditching Juul after losing more than $12 billion on its investment in the vaping company.

The World Baseball Classic <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zaGg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDc0OTM1Ni4yOTY4MTY4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccddddb83> kicks off today for the first time in six years.

  Get smarter in just 5 minutes

   Money & Career:  Money Scoop <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zWj9lbWFpbD1zb29zZnJhbm9AZ21haWwuY29tJm1pZD03Y2QzZDdlZmNiMmI1ZDFhNmNiZTBiZjA5MzFmNGIyZiZjaWQ9MzA3NDkzNTYuMjk2ODE2OA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cee09315d>     Money With Katie <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zLT9lbWFpbD1zb29zZnJhbm9AZ21haWwuY29tJm1pZD03Y2QzZDdlZmNiMmI1ZDFhNmNiZTBiZjA5MzFmNGIyZiZjaWQ9MzA3NDkzNTYuMjk2ODE2OA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C767fe389>     Raise <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30749356.2968168/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydmY_ZW1haWw9c29vc2ZyYW5vQGdtYWlsLmNvbSZtaWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwNzQ5MzU2LjI5NjgxNjg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C361fe580>

 TOGETHER WITH

TaxAct <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYWM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkwJmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C92ac59b6>

Markets: Stocks broke out of their slump last week, but investors are still facing black-diamond-level conditions in this jittery market. As usual, the Fed is playing the boogeyman: In recent comments, officials have begun to signal that they plan to raise rates higher and for longer to tame stubborn inflation.

Stock spotlight: Formula One shares reached a record high as the racing season began in Bahrain yesterday. Max Verstappen shares are also at a record high.

 

BUSINESS

More companies are selling a ‘first-class’ experience <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY1g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D376303af> How I met your mother GIF <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY1g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E376303af> How I Met Your Mother/CBS via Giphy
To begin this story, I want to jog your memory: Have you recently bought a higher-quality product even though it costs more? Hulu without ads? Fancy jeans? A Le Creuset instead of a regular ol’ Dutch oven?

Companies are hyperfocused on attracting that particular kind of customer right now. According to the NYT, they’re going all-in on “premiumization <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY1k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf6437bb6>,” which is a strategy to entice customers to pay more for what is perceived as a better-quality product or service.

Premiumization isn’t new. Starbucks famously did it with coffee in the 1990s, and airlines have been dangling a luxurious first-class experience for decades. Premiumization has been especially popular in the consumer goods space <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY1o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C16f98ac8>.

But what’s new is the breadth of companies that are trying to extract more $$$ from their wealthiest customers. Execs referenced the premiumization concept in close to 60 earnings calls and investor meetings in the past several weeks, per the New York Times. A few examples:

Krispy Kreme, which offered bargain deals last year, is now aiming to generate “excitement around our premium specialty doughnuts.”

Six Flags has raised prices “in order to elevate the guest experience.”

Even WD-40 is souping up its cans with things like a “smart straw” to get consumers to pay more.

Why is this happening?

Companies facing slowdowns in other areas see growth opportunities in upselling their wealthiest customers, who are sitting on more than $1 trillion in excess savings since the pandemic.

And those customers seem willing to play along. “All around the world, people are spending more <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zYy0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C155c6872> on better products,” L’Oréal’s CEO Nicolas Hieronimus recently said. “The pandemic has generated this desire to pamper yourself.”

Big picture: The urge to focus on premium products could result in fewer options for lower-income Americans, who spend a greater share of their income on essentials like housing and food, the NYT notes.

The auto market is already out of reach for many Americans. At the end of 2022, only 10 car models were priced below $25,000, compared to 36 at the end of 2017.

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0a189ce7>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZDA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5f9a79b1>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZDE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2749c7a0>   

TOGETHER WITH TAXACT

Bag a bigger return <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYWM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkwJmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C64417984> TaxAct <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYWM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkwJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccf409e2b>
It’s tax time, and, well…times are hard! With inflation in full swing (and rising costs that make even your simplest omelet more expensive), we’re all looking for ways to increase our cash flow.

With TaxAct, you can ensure your tax return is filed accurately (with a $100k Accuracy Guarantee) and that you get the maximum refund, guaranteed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYWM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkwJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc904e3b0>. No matter how complex your return, TaxAct’s easy-to-use software and step-by-step guidance help you file quickly and confidently.

Super simple, right?

It gets even better. Through TaxAct’s Xpert Assist, you can get help from live tax experts who can answer any questions you may have.

File with TaxAct today <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYWM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkwJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3912072f>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines A Hawksbill sea turtle is seen swimming Mark Kolbe/Getty Images
UN agrees to protect the seas. In a deal decades in the making, more than 190 countries established a framework <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZDI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdce3d5d9> to protect marine life on the “high seas”—which are the 60% of the world’s oceans that lie outside of national boundaries. Currently, only 1.2% of those areas are protected, but the UN High Seas Treaty hopes to turn 30% of international waters into protected areas by 2030. Almost 10% of global marine species are at risk of extinction, per the International Union for Conservation of Nature.

Proposed Florida laws will push it hard to the right. Ahead of a new legislative session tomorrow, GOP lawmakers have unveiled a suite of bills <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZDM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cea1f9deb> that are delighting conservatives and worrying progressives, free speech groups, and civil rights leaders. The bills include provisions that would ban gender studies majors and minors in higher education, open up media organizations to more libel lawsuits, and create a universal school choice voucher program. Gov. Ron DeSantis, the champion of this conservative agenda, is expected to run for president in 2024.

Another train derailment in Ohio. For the second time in about a month, a Norfolk Southern train derailed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZDQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C918a2369> in Ohio. Unlike the first incident, which spilled toxic chemicals and forced the evacuation of East Palestine, the train that derailed on Saturday was not carrying any hazardous materials, the railroad said. It’s an inauspicious start to an already tense week for Norfolk Southern: CEO Alan Shaw will receive a grilling from senators when he testifies on Capitol Hill on Thursday.

TECH

ChatGPT not a hit on college campuses…yet <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E5a4915b7> Chart showing use of ChatGPT on college campuses <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2F5a4915b7>
Despite a cyclone of headlines and hype, ChatGPT remains almost as unpopular on campus as the overachiever who asks a question when the professor is about to end class.

In a survey of 520 US college students, a Morning Brew/Generation Lab poll <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZDY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbc2c5055> found that 40% have never heard of the chatbot from OpenAI.

Of those who have heard of ChatGPT, 52% have never used it.

And the students who said they do fire up ChatGPT…don’t use it all that much, as 55% of respondents who said they’ve used ChatGPT do so “almost never.”

Of course, ChatGPT was released just a few months ago—so in a sense it is quite remarkable that 60% of college students have heard of it. Still, it hasn’t made major inroads on college campuses yet, even while many instructors warn the new tech could create havoc in the classroom.

Uses for ChatGPT

Among the students who do use ChatGPT…what are they using it for?

For giggles: 71% of students who’ve used ChatGPT said they use it in part for entertainment or just for fun.

As Google: 32% of students who’ve used ChatGPT said they use it in part for quick answers to simple questions, and 31% to understand complex topics.

For…cheating? 17% of students who’ve heard of ChatGPT said they have direct knowledge of friends having used ChatGPT to cheat.

Check out the full write-up here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2G5a4915b7>.



TOGETHER WITH BRILLIANT

CALENDAR

The week ahead Jerome Powell Pool/Getty Images
“Hell week” on Wall Street. As we mentioned at the top, this week features several potential landmines <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZDc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C39880873> for the stock market. One of them is the jobs report on Friday. Employment numbers have been on the rise, and continued strength in the labor market could lead to more interest rate hikes. Another key event this week: Fed Chair Jerome Powell’s testimony on Capitol Hill. He’s expected to field questions on the trajectory of inflation and the looming debt-ceiling crisis.

Daylight saving time begins. This week might be the last time you leave work while it’s still dark out for a while, because we’re “springing forward” on Sunday and getting more daylight in the evening. Some lawmakers are reviving efforts to make DST permanent.

March Madness is almost here. College basketball teams will make their final push to be included in the NCAA tournament ahead of Selection Sunday on March 12.

Everything else…

The Hindu festival of Holi is on Wednesday.

International Women’s Day is on Wednesday.

Pregame the Academy Awards on Sunday by watching Tár and The Banshees of Inisherin.

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Medical examination room Getty Images
Stat: Men will literally go to therapy instead of getting their annual checkups. A Cleveland Clinic survey of men last year found that 55% do not get regular health screenings <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZDg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C564c184f>, which is a far lower share than women. So, why do men avoid the turn-and-cough? Several potential reasons: their belief they might not need to, the concern of receiving bad news, and the taboo nature of talking about health issues with other dudes, the NYT suggests.

Quote: “You know what people say, they say, ‘Words hurt.’ Anybody that say words hurt has never been punched in the face.”

Comedian Chris Rock spoke at length about Will Smith slapping him at the Oscars in his live Netflix standup <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZDk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0b603b9b> special Saturday night. (Spoiler: He wasn’t particularly delighted about getting smacked.) In the special, called Selective Outrage, Rock also touched on topics such as “wokeness”; Americans’ addiction to attention; and celebs including Beyoncé, the Kardashians, and Meghan Markle.

Read: A DNA test revealed the CEO of my company is my half-brother. (Ask a Manager <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZGE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C434ea325>)

NEWS

What else is brewing
China <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZGI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce05a7507> set a modest economic growth target of around 5% this year at the onset of its legislature’s annual gathering. That’s its lowest growth projection in more than 25 years.

Two US senators <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZGM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc42b45a9> plan to release a bill this week that would enable the government to ban foreign technology products—yes, like TikTok.

Judy Heumann <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZGQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca4c6f388>, the activist known as the “mother of the disability rights movement,” died at age 75.

“Gruyere <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZGU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbaf1a4a7>” can be used as a label for cheese even if it was made outside the Gruyère region of Switzerland and France, a US appeals court ruled.

The puzzle section
Turntable: Mary tells me today’s Turntable features the longest pangram (15 letters) that we’ve ever featured in this game. See if you can solve it here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30739367.3376090/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zZGs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDczOTM2Ny4zMzc2MDkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca85f84ee>.

Food geography trivia

Let’s return to the subject of Gruyère for today’s trivia. The cheese was originally developed in the Swiss town of Gruyères, and it’s not the only food product named after its place of origin.

We’ll give you a food product with a place-based name, and you have to identify the country the name originates from.

Black Forest ham

Lima bean

Sriracha sauce

Cheddar cheese

Fig Newton

Habanero pepper

 TOGETHER WITH

Ooni <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zOEg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0MzcmbHA9bG9nbw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce8f135bc> 
Good morning. Cocaine Bear has only been in theaters for one week but a potential sequel has already emerged: Cocaine Hippo. It wouldn’t be about a hippo on cocaine, but instead about the community of hippos that’s flourished in Colombia thanks to Pablo Escobar. In the late 1970s, the cocaine kingpin imported four hippos to his estate, and in the decades since those four have multiplied into a small village of 130.

Now, with hippos considered an invasive species in Colombia, authorities want to capture 70 and send them to sanctuaries abroad. Elizabeth Banks—you have our number.

—Sam Klebanov, Matty Merritt, Max Knoblauch, Abby Rubenstein, Neal Freyman

Markets: Stocks went up and down more than a sailboat caught in a hurricane this week, but they managed to close the week on an upswing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY20_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C77fac896> and break a four-week losing streak yesterday. Meta was one of the stocks that climbed after the Facebook parent announced big price cuts for its VR headsets, including the high-end Meta Quest Pro.

 

BUSINESS

Amazon hits pause on 2nd headquarters <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY24_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Da1967c56> Construction worker looking up at building <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY24_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ea1967c56> The Washington Post/Getty Images
Amazon’s HQ2 is starting to look more like HQ1.5. The e-commerce giant announced yesterday that it’s halting the construction of its much-hyped second headquarters in Arlington, VA.

Construction status update

The first part of the project, Metropolitan Park, is on track for a ribbon cutting this summer.

Breaking ground on the swanky office park known as PenPlace, which would encompass three 22-story towers and a sleek helix-shaped building, has been put off indefinitely.

Met Park can accommodate 14,000 workers, which is more than enough for Amazon’s 8,000 local employees. And headcount is unlikely to skyrocket any time soon: Amazon began laying off 18,000 employees in January (the steepest job cuts in its history).

Plans and promises

Amazon chose the DC area as the site of its HQ2 in 2018, after a cutthroat bidding battle among dozens of cities nationwide that resembled the municipal version of The Bachelor.

The company promised to bring 25,000 jobs to the region and turbocharge the local economy in exchange for $800 million in tax benefits and infrastructure improvements.

It says it does plan to build PenPlace and reach the workforce goal eventually. But for now, it’s not short on office space: Its employees still spend a lot of time working from home, even after a recent companywide mandate to come into the office three days a week.

The company is also reducing its physical footprint elsewhere. It vacated an office tower in its hometown, Seattle, earlier this year.

Zoom out: Amazon’s pause on its Northern Virginia expansion is part of a bigger trend. Big Tech companies like Meta and Twitter have cut down on their real estate footprint to save money. And it’s just one of the many ominous signs for the commercial real estate market since people no longer go into the office every workday.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY28_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Caff3f62a>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY3A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B4f92743c>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY3E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2706e418>   

TOGETHER WITH OONI

Get a slice of this <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zOEg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0MzcmbHA9dGl0bGU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cae9b1dc3> Ooni <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zOEg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0MzcmbHA9aW1hZ2U/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cee9c3ec6>
Take a second. Think about biting into a fresh, delicious, cheesy, piping-hot slice of pizza anytime you’d like. Sounds like a dream, right? Well, we’ve got good news for you.

The pizza-oven pros at Ooni are making those dreams come true with the Ooni Volt 12 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zOEg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0MzcmbHA9dGV4dDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C674e53e4>.

It’s their first electric oven that brings the pizza shop to your kitchen counter or back patio, capable of reaching a fiery 850°F within 20 minutes and baking a pie in just 90 seconds <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zOEg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0MzcmbHA9dGV4dDI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc810a095>.

With a generous 13-inch cooking area and adjustable temperature, time, and balance controls (including automatic shut-off!), this easy-to-use appliance can handle it all, from a Detroit style to an authentic Neapolitan style.

Plug in and make pizza <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zOEg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0MzcmbHA9dGV4dDM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccdeb32fb>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines NYSE trading floor Spencer Platt/Getty Images
Chip designer shuns London to list in NYC. UK-based Arm—a company whose tech is used in almost every smartphone—used to be listed in London before being taken private by Softbank. Yesterday it said it’s planning an IPO in New York <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY3I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6cf8f928>. The British government has been trying to woo the company to relist in London, and Arm said it wasn’t ruling out a future London IPO. But it’s a big loss for London for now, and it heightens concerns that the UK market is not competitive internationally. Investment bankers are pegging the company’s valuation between $30 billion and $70 billion, per Bloomberg.

Alex Murdaugh is going to prison for life. The disgraced ex-lawyer and scion of a powerful South Carolina legal dynasty received two consecutive life sentences <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc8f43883> yesterday after a jury found him guilty of murdering his wife and son following a trial that garnered national attention. Murdaugh maintains his innocence but the judge presiding over the case found his testimony “not believable.” He is thought to have committed the double murder to divert attention from an alleged multimillion-dollar fraud scheme he orchestrated.

Your next iPhone may be from India. Apple’s manufacturing partner, the Taiwanese company Foxconn, has plans to build <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY3Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C802b13a0> a $700 million, 300-acre plant in India. This is one of Foxconn’s biggest investments in the country and is a flashing red signal that China is potentially losing its consumer electronic heavyweight title. The new factory is expected to create 100,000 jobs in the southern Indian state of Karnataka. That’s actually small-ish for Foxconn: The company's iPhone factory in Zhengzhou, China, employs about 200,000 people.

HEALTHCARE

Walgreens won’t carry abortion pills in some states <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY3U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dd4b22622> Pill rolling off Walgreens logo. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY3U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ed4b22622> Photo Illustration: Dianna “Mick” McDougall, Source: Joe Raedle/Getty Images
Walgreens said <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY3Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca5f42208> Thursday that it will not distribute abortion pills in 20 states, including ones where the drugs are legal. The announcement follows a threat from those states’ Republican attorneys general to take legal action against the pharmacy if it sold the drug mifepristone.

Medication abortions account for more than half of all legal abortions in the US, and mifepristone is part of a popular two-drug process. In a bid to expand abortion access after the fall of Roe v. Wade, the FDA decided in January that approved drug stores could carry mifepristone—which had previously only been available at clinics.

Walgreens, the second-largest pharmacy chain in the US, said it would work to become one of those pharmacies, but quickly saw pushback from anti-abortion lawmakers. Now, the company says it won’t sell the pill in those states, either in its stores or by mail, even though the FDA also said mifepristone could be mailed to states with abortion bans.

This isn’t the only battle surrounding mifepristone: A ruling is expected soon in a Texas lawsuit filed by several anti-abortion groups aiming to pull <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY3c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce9f9edfc> the pill off the market nationwide.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY3g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf686ca55>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY3k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C49302e6f>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY3o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca02ce815>    

TOGETHER WITH REVELA

Revela <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zOEo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0MzcmbHA9aW1hZ2U/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2e9b7b85>
Meet your new skin savior: the Fibroquin Essence <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zOEo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0MzcmbHA9dGV4dDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C60077af3>, a revolutionary new formula that tackles challenging issues for aging skin—including the loss of volume, tightness, and elasticity—without any irritation. In a clinical trial, 93% of participants showed a significant improvement in skin elasticity by week 8. Get 15% off <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zOEo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0MzcmbHA9dGV4dDI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb89f445e>.

 

ENTERTAINMENT

Chris Rock goes live (but probably won’t get slapped) <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY0E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D924c3ae7> Chris Rock goes live (but probably won’t get slapped) <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY0E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E924c3ae7>
If you’ve been waiting a year to hear Chris Rock’s hot take on that little incident at the Oscars, tonight’s the night. The comedian’s new stand-up special drops on Netflix at 10pm ET, and in a big change for the streamer, it’ll be live <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY0I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1af46223>.

Live TV events where anything can happen are still drawing eyeballs even as more viewers are binge-watching shows on their own timetable (15 million people were watching when Will Smith attacked Rock as he hosted last year’s awards gala). And now, a week before this year’s Oscars, Netflix is betting that everybody doesn’t hate Chris as it rolls out its first-ever live-streaming event for its 231 million subscribers.

Rock’s special is called Selective Outrage, and it’s expected to be a version of the show he’s been touring with (which, yes, has included jokes about The Slap), but tonight he’ll have 13 cameras on him as he riffs in Baltimore. Netflix has good reason to think Rock’s stand-up can deliver virtual viewers: The shows have been taking in about $700,000 per night from ticket sales, according to the concert trade publication Pollstar.

Zoom out: Rock may be Netflix’s live event guinea pig, but it’s not the only streamer to turn to the old TV staple. Amazon Prime has also gone all in, paying ~$1 billion/year to broadcast Thursday Night Football.—AR

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY0M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C69b2260d>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY0Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca698822c>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY0U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7581825d>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Instant noodles with fire coming out of the cup Illustration: Francis Scialabba, Photo: Chinnasorn Pangcharoen/Getty Images
Stat: Instant noodles can be dangerous for kids, and not just because one serving is packed with several months’ worth of sodium. Researchers at the University of Chicago found that almost one-third of childhood burn injuries <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY0Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cebc4a0b8> can be attributed to the slurpy snack. Between 2010 and 2020, 31% of kids who checked into the university hospital’s burn center with injuries said instant noodles were the cause. To reduce the risk, the researchers suggest having an adult take the noodle cup out of the microwave and then keep it from the kids until it cools down a bit.

Quote: “We do not have any plans to deploy this.”

Ford reassured everyone this week that it has no plans to go full Repo Man after filing a patent for cars that repossess themselves. The company’s patent application <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY0c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccb423138> describes a system where the bank can remotely shut down the air conditioner, the radio, and ultimately the car itself if a lessee fails to keep up with car payments. It even includes self-driving cars that bring themselves to impound lots. But Ford says it routinely files patents and they don’t necessarily mean the products are  coming out.

Read: How a trio of 19th-century widows transformed the champagne industry. (BBC <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY0g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1f45621b>)

A Jurassic-era bug <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30728929.102437/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zY00_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcyODkyOS4xMDI0Mzc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce55e0cd4> was discovered flying around an Arkansas Walmart. The species had been thought to be extinct in eastern North America.

 TOGETHER WITH

HOKA <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30714817.2969871/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zN3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDcxNDgxNy4yOTY5ODcxJmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4d8e78af> 
Good morning. On Wednesday, we asked you to channel Larry David and discuss whether it’s socially acceptable for two people dining together to order the same dish. And after reviewing your responses over the last two days, it’s clear that people are pretty split on this:

Readers against duplicative ordering talked about the delight of sharing food and the need to “cover your bases” when going to a restaurant (especially a new one).

Readers who said it was OK to order the same dish argued it’s unfair to the person who orders second, and, look—eating at a restaurant is supposed to be fun, not a chore…so don’t stress. Order what you want.

And then there’s Regina B.: “My whole group of eight has ordered the same thing.”

—Jamie Wilde, Matty Merritt, Max Knoblauch, Neal Freyman
