WORLD

Tour de headlines A front end loader removes snow from a residential street in Draper, Utah, on February 23, 2023. George Frey/AFP via Getty Images
Winter storm causes havoc. More than 1,100 flights were canceled and nearly 1 million people were left without power <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yUGI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C30869b24> yesterday evening after a major winter storm dropped snow and ice from sea to shining sea. Portland, OR, came to a halt after receiving nearly 11 inches of snow—the city’s second-snowiest day on record. The storms aren’t over: Down in SoCal, Mount Baldy east of LA is forecast to get 4.5 feet of snow by Saturday. But things couldn’t have been more different in Washington, DC, which baked in 81-degree temps yesterday.

Ohio train derailment killed nearly 45,000 animals. That’s according to new figures <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yUGM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1badd3d3> released by environment officials—a huge increase from the original estimate of 3,500. All of the animals killed from the toxic train derailment were aquatic species, but none appear to have been endangered or threatened. Officials also said that live fish have reappeared in one of the waterways impacted by the derailment.

Disgraced lawyer testifies in closely watched murder trial. Taking the stand in his own defense, once-prominent South Carolina attorney Alex Murdaugh denied <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yT3o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C33760e98> killing his wife and son but admitted that he had lied to police. Murdaugh blamed his lies on his addiction to opioids, saying his thinking was clouded and he knew he would be a suspect because he discovered the bodies. Prosecutors, meanwhile, have asserted that Murdaugh slayed his family to win sympathy because his financial crimes were about to be revealed (he’s also facing ~100 charges for those alleged crimes).

FOOD & BEV

Oats can be milk, too, FDA says <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yT0c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Df57289fa> A carton of oat milk <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yT0c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ef57289fa> Francis Scialabba
Products labeled as “milk” do not have to come from an udder, according to new guidance <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yT0g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6a1a0939>issued by the FDA yesterday. The rules are still in draft form for now, but if they get finalized, it would be a blow to Big Milk—which has been crying over spilled alt-milk for years.

The dairy industry has long argued that plant-based milks dilute the meaning of the term “milk,” and has instead called them “beverages.” But the FDA said yesterday that consumers aren’t confused by the term and that makers of soy, almond, oat, cashew, hemp, and whatever other milks cafes charge extra for should be able to label their cartons “milk”...as long as they keep the plant source up front.

The new draft rules also suggest that alt-milk-makers add an extra label indicating when they’re less nutritious than cow’s milk, which didn’t go over well with plant-based food advocacy groups.

Dairy hasn’t been dethroned yet: Despite the rising popularity of nondairy milk in the US (almond is No. 1, but oat is gaining on it), the cow-based kind still outsells it five times over. Sales of cow’s milk totaled $12.3 billion for roughly the past year compared to $2.5 billion for nondairy alternatives, per NielsenIQ.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yT0k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C559c1726>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yT0o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Bab89ea85>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yT0s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C522bc6a5>

ENTERTAINMENT

Don’t think too deeply about it: It’s a bear on cocaine <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yT0I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D94fed528> Don’t think too deeply about it: It’s a bear on cocaine <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yT0I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E94fed528>
Slasher fans who always leave movies thinking “not enough coke-fueled disembowelment” are finally getting what they want. Cocaine Bear <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yT0M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7f034f44>, the Elizabeth Banks-directed movie that’s partially based on true-ish events, opens today.

The real story: The movie is loosely based on a 1985 incident in which a drug dealer dropped 75 pounds of cocaine from an airplane along the Georgia–Tennessee border. He tried to jump out after it, but his parachute failed and he plummeted to his death. A few months later, authorities found a ripped duffel bag and a dead bear that tested positive for cocaine.

The botched drug smuggling story became a local legend. And 38 years after the powder fell from the sky, we get to see the Elizabeth Banks-directed film that answers the vital question: “OK, what if the bear didn’t die?”

No bears were harmed. In fact there were no bears near the set. Instead, stuntman and motion capture artist Alan Henry played the bear during filming, wearing a bear head and walking on all fours with special attachments on his arms. Peter Jackson’s visual effects company, Weta FX, added the full CGI bear (which ate up most of the movie's $35 million budget) after filming.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yT0Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce818a1b7>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yT0U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C31b4a1ef>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yT0Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd8d91a94>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators The skyline of Istanbul, Turkey Ayhan Altun/Getty Images
Stat: Any guesses for the world’s best-performing stock market? It’s…Turkey’s <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yT0w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9bd92ee1>, which has soared about 70% in the last year, Asia Times reports. The country has been through a lot: a currency crisis two years ago, rampant inflation, and, most recently, earthquakes that killed tens of thousands. But its economy has benefited from close trade relationships with China, Russia, and the Middle East following US sanctions on the Kremlin.

Quote: “This is not something that Floridians want.”

No, that quote isn’t about alligators in backyards or big clothing emporiums that sell t-shirts with bootleg drawings of Goofy on them. It’s a response to public backlash <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yT00_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce269f5c1> for a proposed Florida bill that would ban dogs from hanging their heads out of car windows, among other animal protection measures—like making declawing cats illegal and establishing a registry for people convicted of animal abuse. A spokesperson for the Florida senator who filed the bill said that the anti-dog-vibing provision will be removed from the legislation or significantly changed.

Read: What’s wrong with bananas. (Plantings <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yT04_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C41ebc794>)

What else is brewing
Sam Bankman-Fried <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yT08_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9c2ec033>, the disgraced co-founder of FTX, was hit with four more criminal charges, including ones related to his political contributions.

Carlos Watson <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yUGE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C63194d0b>, the CEO and founder of Ozy Media, was arrested and charged with fraud.

The US <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yT1E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C75a83fc4> nominated former Mastercard CEO Ajay Banga to head up the World Bank. The position will open in July, when David Malpass, the current president, steps down.

Succession’s <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yUGQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C438e005c> upcoming fourth season will be its last.

LIV Golf League <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yT1I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3636a978> begins its second season today. The controversial PGA Tour rival has refreshed its branding and put more emphasis on team competition.

Friday to-do list

Friday puzzle

Love this puzzle <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30645048.2761552/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yT1o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDY0NTA0OC4yNzYxNTUy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2d8b18f4> from The Guardian:

“This sentence contains _______ letters”

Write a number in words in the blank space in the above sentence that will make the statement true.

ANSWER

There are two possible solutions: “Thirty six” or “thirty eight.”

 TOGETHER WITH

RAD Diversified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ySi0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzEmbHA9bG9nbw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbc3263b7> 
Good morning. It’s been a busy week of Morning Brew announcements, but we hope you’ve got room for one more.

We’re excited to introduce a new interview series in the newsletter, Inside Jobs, that aims to expand your perception of what a “career” could be. We’ve been talking to folks with unconventional jobs—from a hot-air balloon pilot to a professional basketball shooting coach—to learn more about their niche industries and how they found themselves on that career path.

Today, we’ve got an interview with the co-founder and CEO of a dating app photography company. Check out his profile tips after the news.

—Jamie Wilde, Max Knoblauch, Abby Rubenstein, Neal Freyman

Markets: Stop us if you’ve heard this one before: Stocks took a beating yesterday as investors worried that the Fed plans to continue to hike interest rates. The S&P suffered its fourth day <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS3Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cde76b418> of losses after the newly released minutes from the Fed’s last meeting showed a group of central bankers fully committed to bringing inflation down. One bright spot was Wingstop, which had its best day ever thanks to chicken sandwich sales boosting its earnings last quarter.

 

HEALTH

Diabetes patients need Ozempic, but dieters want it <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS3c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Db33f5f66> Doctor writes a prescription <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS3c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Eb33f5f66> LumiNola/Getty Images
Ozempic may be TikTok’s new favorite weight loss drug, but it served a different demographic before dieting celebrities: Type 2 diabetes patients. Now, the drug is in short supply <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS3g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C10c0933c>.

As more people inject the drug for weight loss, diabetes patients are pharmacy-hopping to find stores that have Ozempic in stock, lowering their dosages to make their supplies last longer, and attempting to switch medications. The company that makes it, Novo Nordisk, expects supply to be iffy through mid-March.

Meanwhile on TikTok…

#Ozempic, #ozempicweightloss, and #ozempicchallenge have a combined 785 million views on TikTok, where use of the drug is a viral trend <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS3k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C426f2f8b>. This year, use of Ozempic has grown 69% and its higher dose alternative Wegovy, 75%, according Novo Nordisk.

Ozempic may be having its moment now, but it’s not new:

The FDA approved Ozempic, generically known as semaglutide, for treating Type 2 diabetes in 2017.

It blew up when people noticed that one of its side effects was weight loss, and in 2021, the FDA approved semaglutide, under the brand name Wegovy, for that use.

The problem is that Wegovy can also be hard to find. But as TikTok would say, everybody’s so creative <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS3o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8c7afb74>, and it’s a common practice for doctors to prescribe medications for something other than their FDA-approved use. So, doctors scribble up Ozempic prescriptions for weight loss.

There’s another reason a doctor might prescribe Ozempic even if their patient isn’t diabetic: While diabetes drugs are always covered by insurance companies, drugs for weight loss often are not. And a one-month supply of Wegovy costs upward of $1,300.

Backlash is building: The American Diabetes Association is telling doctors to give priority for Ozempic back to diabetes patients, and numerous celebrities have spoken out about its rampant off-label use and potential side effects.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS0E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc58eb8d6>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS0I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2a3e1422>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS0M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C972a894a>   

TOGETHER WITH RAD DIVERSIFIED

The best-kept secret in real estate <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ySi0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzEmbHA9dGl0bGU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C91f59786> RAD Diversified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ySi0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzEmbHA9aW1hZ2U/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0cfe6e8c>
Real estate is a lot of work. There’s always a new guru pitching new courses and teaching old tactics that may have worked once upon a time.

Inner Circle <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ySi0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzEmbHA9dGV4dDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3d742df2> is different. Do they provide education? Sure. Do they fix, flip, and hold? Yes.

So what’s different about Inner Circle?

It’s done for you. In this partnership, the company does all the work. The only thing you have to do is invest in properties <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ySi0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzEmbHA9dGV4dDI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C25ed88be>. Inner Circle finds, fixes, manages, and sells ’em. You then reap your return.

See how Inner Circle helps members build a legacy now that will stand the test of time.

Discover real estate investing together. Learn more today <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ySi0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzEmbHA9dGV4dDM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd12760c8>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines A man clearing snow from the winter storm CRAIG LASSIG/AFP via Getty Images
The weather outside is frightful. At least 75 million people were under winter weather alerts as of yesterday, and the National Weather Service has cautioned that a prolonged, coast-to-coast winter storm <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS0Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cddf4d079> will impact just about every region of the US today. It really does mean coast to coast: Parts of Los Angeles are under the area’s first-ever blizzard warning. The storm has already begun to wreak havoc on travel, with at least 1,400 flights canceled so far. Meanwhile, it’s going to feel like summer in much of the mid-Atlantic, with temps in Washington, DC, expected to hit almost 80 degrees.

NFL follows golf into Netflix doc realm. Netflix and NFL Films partnered <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS0U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd02fd400> to create a real “too soon” watch for Eagles fans: a docuseries called Quarterback following QBs Patrick Mahomes, Kirk Cousins, and Marcus Mariota through the 2022 season. Should be interesting: One won the Super Bowl and the other was benched before being placed on injured reserve. The first collaboration between the streamer and the league, Quarterback is slated for a summer premiere. Just one season has been ordered so far.

INVESTING

Mormon church fined for hiding $32b investment portfolio <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS0Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D62feed5e> The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints historic Mormon Salt Lake Temple <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS0Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E62feed5e> George Frey/Getty Images
The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints and a nonprofit investment manager controlled by church leaders have agreed to pay $5 million in fines to settle the Securities and Exchange Commission’s claims they used shell companies to keep the size of their massive investment portfolio a secret <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS0c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C57a15f78> for more than two decades.

What regulators claim: The SEC said Tuesday that from 1997 through 2019, the investment manager, Ensign Peak, did not file required paperwork laying out all of its holdings. Instead, the leaders of the faith, widely known as the Mormon church, used 13 shell companies to file smaller disclosures. The church feared “negative consequences” from publicly sharing its investments, which by 2018 had grown to $32 billion, the SEC said.

What the church says: Like most entities that tangle with the SEC, the church has neither admitted nor denied the allegations. But it did release a statement that said: “We affirm our commitment to comply with the law, regret mistakes made, and now consider this matter closed.”

Looking ahead…we probably won’t hear too much more on the matter from the church, which has historically kept mum about financial matters, outside of encouraging members to tithe 10% of their income.—AR 

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS0g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca401fd2e>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS0k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C526a7e00>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS0o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C01f8086e>

Yogi Tea <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVWw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzEmbHA9aW1hZ2U/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cac28a1b6>

TECH

Spotify’s Discover Weekly gains sentience <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS0s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Da4a3af83> Spotify DJ <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS0s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ea4a3af83> Hannah Minn
Bing and Google are already asking us to trust AI with search results, and now Spotify is asking us to trust it with the aux. Yesterday, the music streamer launched <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS0w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7ecf80e8> a new AI feature called DJ to give users the experience of having their own private radio host at all times.

DJ operates like…well…a DJ, curating music and occasionally delivering commentary about specific tracks and artists. So far, no plans for trivia contests, 20 straight minutes of local commercials, or the ability for someone in the region to call in and dedicate a Whitesnake song to their ex-wife.

Both the voice and the info it’s providing are AI-generated, but DJ is based on the voice of Spotify exec Xavier “X” Jernigan (though the company suggested that it could expand voice options in the future).

Like all good DJs, DJ will only talk after every fifth songs or so. You’ll be able to shift the mood by pressing a button at the bottom of the screen.

Zoom out: This isn’t Spotify’s first AI rodeo. The company already uses the tech to deliver users customized playlists. So far, DJ is only available in English for premium subscribers in the US and Canada.—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS00_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1271cf73>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS04_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C62ee434d>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS08_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd495dc0f>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Victor Wembanyama on the basketball court Catherine Steenkeste/Getty Images
Stat: Take Shaquille O’Neal and add four inches in height—that’s how tall Victor Wembanyama stands on a basketball court. The 19-year-old French phenom is 7 feet, 5 inches tall in shoes <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS1A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6dd44a6d> and has a wingspan of eight feet, according to a new ESPN report. Blending size and skill, Wembanyama is the most highly anticipated basketball prospect since LeBron James. And when he’s selected No. 1 overall in this summer’s NBA Draft (which is pretty much guaranteed), he’ll become the tallest player selected in the lottery of the draft since Yao Ming, who’s 7-foot-6.

Quote: “The recent Michigan shootings are a tragic reminder of the importance of taking care of each other, particularly in the context of creating inclusive environments.”

If that statement seems a little bit off to you, it’s because it wasn’t written by a human. Vanderbilt University’s Peabody School has apologized <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS1E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C19bd90a2> for sending out a ChatGPT-authored mass email to its students in the wake of the deadly shooting at Michigan State. Admitting that it wasn’t the best time to rely on a chatbot, one university administrator noted that the AI-written missive lacked the “personal connection and empathy” needed during a tragedy.

Read: Fat, sugar, salt…you’ve been thinking about food all wrong. (Wired <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS1I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C32e958ba>)

Q&A

Nick knows how to get you matches <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS1g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Edcc3c09a> Inside Jobs image featuring Nick Friesen <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS1g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Fdcc3c09a>
To kick off our Inside Jobs series on unconventional careers, we wanted to talk to someone who could make us look good.

So we did. Nick Friesen is the co-founder and CEO of The Match Artist, a company that specializes in online dating photography. We talked to Nick about his career journey, the science of dating, and when to show some skin in your profile.

Here’s a snippet of the interview.

MB: What do you recommend leading off with for a photo?

NF: Typically some sort of headshot. I haven’t seen too much of a difference looking at the camera or looking off—just some sort of a smile. If you’re more on the casual side it could be more mysterious, like raising the bottoms of the eyelids with a little bit of a smirk.

There’s a lot more insights into the world of dating apps in the full convo. Check it out here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yS1g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Gdcc3c09a>.

Three headlines and a lie

Three of these headlines from this week’s news are real, and one is faker than a 10-minute recipe. Can you spot the odd one out?

NJ sales manager sets Guinness World Record with 217,000 new LinkedIn connections <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yTDI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C03ec6da0> in 24 hours

Researchers turn dead birds into drones <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yTDM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbc392b34> that could spy on people

Spanish transport secretary resigns <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30631792.103071/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yTDQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYzMTc5Mi4xMDMwNzE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C25f1089e> after trains too big for tunnels

We made up the LinkedIn one. Not bad, eh?

 TOGETHER WITH

Masterworks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydmE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca17b8c05> 
Good morning. Did you know that Presidents Day (today) doesn’t actually fall on any president’s birthday?

While originally celebrated on February 22, the day George Washington was born, the holiday was moved to the third Monday of February in 1971. That’s because Congress passed the Uniform Monday Holiday Act, which moved some federal holidays to Monday so we could all enjoy more three-day weekends.

Seems like a win-win: We get a day off and GW gets the highly coveted “birthday week.”

—Neal Freyman

Here's what these numbers mean. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zMT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwNjAyMzc3LjMwNDYxMTQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C42e540ad>

Markets: The US stock and bond markets are closed today for Presidents Day. But crypto trading takes no days off, and despite the fallout from FTX’s collapse and a flurry of crackdowns by regulators, bitcoin has been on a nice run lately. Last Thursday, it topped $25,000 to hit an eight-month high.

 

SOCIAL MEDIA

Zuck takes a page out of the Musk playbook <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yQTY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D353c749b> Mark Zuckerberg <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yQTY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E353c749b> Kevin Dietsch/Getty Images
Mark Zuckerberg must have gotten fed up with Elon Musk hogging the social media headlines, because yesterday he announced a big update to his own online platforms.

The Meta CEO introduced a subscription service <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yQTc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C98ea7a57> for Instagram and Facebook that will allow users to purchase blue badges that mark them as verified. Known as Meta Verified, the service will launch in Australia and New Zealand this week and hit other countries “soon.”

Similar to Twitter Blue, Meta Verified eschews the traditional concept of the blue checkmark as a gift bestowed to notable people like politicians and celebs. Now, it’s open to anyone who’s willing to pay. But there are differences between Twitter’s and Meta’s plans:

Meta’s is more expensive, costing $11.99 on the web and $14.99 on mobile. Twitter’s costs $8 and $11, respectively.

Meta will also require Meta Verified users to confirm their identity using a government-issued ID, something Twitter doesn’t require.

What your $15 gets you with Meta Verified: You’ll get higher “visibility and reach” on the platforms and increased access to customer support, among other perks.

What’s the strategy here, Zuck?

There are a couple ways Meta Verified could help Zuck sleep better at night.

Zuck said the overarching goal of the service is “increasing authenticity and security across our services.” Meta Verified could help tackle some of the fake account issues that have plagued the company’s platforms.

With its metaverse dreams a long way off and revenue on the decline, Meta needs to kickstart growth ASAP. It’s hoping revenue from subscriptions can offset some of the damage that Apple’s privacy changes and economic uncertainty have dealt to its advertising business.

Zoom out: This is a big deal—not only for Meta, but for your experience on social media. By promising increased reach in exchange for $$$, Zuck is cementing social media’s evolution from a tool to keep up with your high school friends to a pay-to-play entertainment medium catering to professional content creators. As Bloomberg’s Sarah Frier noted <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yQTg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C014b569e>, “Get your good friends a group chat if you haven’t already.”

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yQTk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C94e1b334>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yQWE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2f227c71>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yQWI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C896d9571>   

TOGETHER WITH MASTERWORKS

Inflation + rate hike + volatility = profit? <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydmE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C37a10bb7> Masterworks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydmE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5ace8d52>
With yesterday’s stock darlings tumbling and the housing bubble set to burst, experts1 have declared one overlooked investment “bulletproof.” Is it pet rocks? NFTs? NFTs of pet rocks? Try art.

The art market hauled in nearly $18 billion in 2022—compared to 20% losses for the S&P—with a top financial publication2 calling art “among the hottest markets on Earth.”

But who the heck has $20m to buy Banksys? Try Masterworks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydmE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5ff5ccf1>. With their last 3 art sales, Masterworks investors realized net returns of 13.9%, 35%, and 10.4%!

The only problem? There’s a huge waitlist for membership. But Morning Brew readers can skip to the front with this special link <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydmE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdf3dd311>.

1 The New York Times

2 The Wall Street Journal



WORLD

Tour de headlines House being carried away by balloons in Up Up/Pixar
Did an F-22 bring down a hobby balloon? The FBI is exploring the possibility after an Illinois hobbyist group said one of its balloons went “missing in action <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yQWM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C07282512>” in the same area and on the same day that a US military jet took out an object over Canada’s Yukon territory. The group, called the Northern Illinois Bottlecap Balloon Brigade in a reference to Up, did not draw any connection between its balloon and the destroyed object. But if it was theirs, it means the US used a $439,000 missile to bring down a ~$12 balloon.

Jimmy Carter enters hospice care. The former president will forgo <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yQWQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbfe43603> further medical intervention and has “decided to spend his remaining time at home with his family,” Carter’s charity said on Saturday. At 98, Carter is the longest living president in US history and has outlasted two presidents who took office after him. He lives with his wife, Rosalynn Carter, at their modest home in Georgia, but has had a few recent hospital stays.

The third Ant-Man keeps Marvel’s winning streak alive. Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania is on track to earn $118 million <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yQWU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf5888548> at the domestic box office over Presidents Day weekend—a sign that the Marvel Cinematic Universe remains a strong pull at theaters even as it enters its fifth phase. With its strong opening weekend, Ant-Man also extended a mind-blowing Marvel streak <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yQWY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C10db7132>: It became the 31st consecutive MCU release to debut at No. 1 at the box office, per CNBC.

PUBLISHING

Roald Dahl gets a controversial rewrite <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yQWc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Db876c25b> Willy Wonka <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yQWc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Eb876c25b> Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory/ Paramount Pictures
Several of the most iconic characters in children’s literature, including Augustus Gloop, the Oompa Loompas, and Mrs. Twit, are being described with more inclusive language after publishers made edits <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yQWg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4e433445> to some of author Roald Dahl’s books.

Puffin, the prestigious children’s publisher, and the Roald Dahl Story Company, which Netflix acquired in 2021, worked with sensitivity readers to review Dahl’s texts and give them an update so his stories “can continue to be enjoyed by all today.” The edits generally focus on removing potentially offensive language related to gender, race, weight, mental health, and violence, according to the Independent. 

Some of those changes:

Augustus Gloop from Charlie and the Chocolate Factory is now “enormous” and not “fat.”

In a gender-neutral revision, the Oompa Loompas in that same book are now described as “small people” rather than “small men.”

In The Witches, where 59 changes were reportedly made by publishers, a line was added to a paragraph that explains why the witches are bald underneath their wigs: “There are plenty of other reasons why women might wear wigs and there is certainly nothing wrong with that.”

These changes sparked a firestorm. Critics unloaded on the edits, accusing them of being clumsy, erasing the author’s intended meaning, and representing political correctness run amok. Acclaimed writer Salman Rushdie tweeted, “Roald Dahl was no angel but this is absurd censorship.”

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yQWk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8b18611a>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yQWo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd0e4dd4b>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yQWs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C67cf09db>

CALENDAR

The week ahead The 2022 Krewe of Bacchus parade takes place on February 27, 2022 in New Orleans Erika Goldring/Getty Images
Mardi Gras: New Orleans loves to party all year round, but on Tuesday, aka “Fat Tuesday,” the city will go buck-wild with parades to celebrate Mardis Gras. Down in Rio de Janeiro, Carnival is back in full force and an expected 46 million people will join in on the fun, which lasts through Wednesday.

One year of the war in Ukraine: Friday, Feb. 24, marks one year since Russia launched its invasion of Ukraine. On Saturday, VP Kamala Harris said the US has determined that Russia committed crimes against humanity in Ukraine.

Shopping insight: Walmart and Home Depot will report earnings this week and share an important update about the American consumer…who seems to be holding up pretty well, despite inflation.

Everything else…

Wednesday is Ash Wednesday.

MLB spring training officially kicks off on Friday.

The cinematic event of the year, perhaps of the millennium, arrives in theaters on Friday: Cocaine Bear.

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Broad Museum Balloon Dog by Jeff Koons Santi Visalli/Getty Images
Stat: Seems like everyone is getting into the balloon-smashing trend these days. At a VIP art event in Miami on Thursday, a woman tapped a $42,000 balloon dog sculpture by artist Jeff Koons, causing it to shatter <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yQWw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C172373e5> into thousands of pieces on the ground. It isn’t a total calamity: The sculpture is covered by insurance, and collectors might even see a boost in value, since the number of these rare blue dog balloon artworks has shrunk from 799 to 798.

Quote: “F— you, motherf—er.”

Those were the final words <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30602377.3046114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yQW0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDYwMjM3Ny4zMDQ2MTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd7ecc598> uttered by comedian Richard Belzer, according to his longtime friend. Belzer, who died on Sunday at 78, was best known for playing detective John Munch on Law & Order: SVU and Homicide: Life on the Street. RIP, .

  BROWSING

  Classifieds banner image <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30588693.3463080/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yd1E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4ODY5My4zNDYzMDgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C333c2ea2> The wackiest headlines from the week as they would appear in a Classifieds section...

Careers

HEALTH TRACKER AVAILABLE: After three years of keeping us all updated on Covid case counts, Johns Hopkins University will stop <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30588693.3463080/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yd1I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4ODY5My4zNDYzMDgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfae28bc7> updating its Covid-19 tracking dashboard next month. The tracker was viewed 2.5+ billion times and cost $13 million to run. It’ll be remembered as the runner-up to Domino’s pizza tracker tech.

PART-TIME TENNIS PRO: Matija Pecotic, who works full-time in real estate in Croatia, defeated <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30588693.3463080/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yd1M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4ODY5My4zNDYzMDgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7db962ae> the former eighth-ranked tennis player in the world, Jack Sock, in Florida this week. Pecotic told news outlets that he had to leave his job early to play the match.

Personal

ISO TRUST: In a survey of Americans from Gallup and the Knight Foundation, 50% of respondents <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30588693.3463080/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yd1Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4ODY5My4zNDYzMDgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce8128cc8> indicated they believe that national news orgs intend to mislead, misinform, or persuade the public.

  SCIENCE

  Dept. of Progress Dexter from Dexter's lab saying Dexter’s Laboratory/Warner Bros. Domestic Television via Giphy Here are some illuminating scientific discoveries from the week to help you live better and maybe even colonize Mars.

Solar power may be coming to the moon. Blue Origin claims it cracked the mystery of how to turn moon dust <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30588693.3463080/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yeDA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4ODY5My4zNDYzMDgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C19339560> into solar panels—something scientists have been trying to do since astronauts first brought the stuff back to Earth. The company dropped the news with surprisingly little fanfare for a potentially major breakthrough, but if Bezos’s space force really is able to replicate the Earth-bound experiments it’s done so far on the moon, it would be a game changer. The company is reportedly trying to pitch its tech to NASA for building lunar infrastructure that could ultimately help get us to Mars.

See the Titanic like never before. To mark the 25th anniversary of James Cameron’s first big water movie’s release, scientists made public never-before-seen footage <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30588693.3463080/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yeDE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4ODY5My4zNDYzMDgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce1268a26> of the Titanic’s wreckage from when it was first discovered. Researchers from the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution captured the video back in 1986 with cameras onboard a submersible. The uncut video shows what was left of the ship inside and out, including one sad chandelier. We won’t tell if you play Celine Dion while watching it.

There’s a new way to screen for some cancers. Scientists in South Korea have developed a cheap way to detect <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30588693.3463080/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yeDI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4ODY5My4zNDYzMDgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C853d085b> pancreatic and prostate cancer—and all the patient has to do is pee on a strip. They say their sensor, which costs around eight cents, has a 99% success rate in identifying the urine of people with these cancers versus people without. And the team is experimenting further to try to extend it to more cancers, including colorectal and lung cancers.—AR

  NEWS ANALYSIS

  Why bird flu has people worried about more than the price of eggs <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30588693.3463080/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yeDY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4ODY5My4zNDYzMDgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D8b93b7e9> Person in haz mat holding chicken <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30588693.3463080/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yeDY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4ODY5My4zNDYzMDgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E8b93b7e9>Peter Garrard Beck/Getty Images We’ve all noticed that chicken eggs cost as much as the Fabergé kind lately—OK, not quite, but the price of eggs has increased over 70% in the past year. At least part of the blame for the spike lies with the avian flu, which has been spreading from wild birds to poultry worldwide.

In the US, over 58 million farm birds have died in the past year as a result of the outbreak (a death toll that includes whole flocks that had to be culled if even one bird got infected). But it’s not just avian safety and omelette prices that have people concerned about the outbreak: There are also fears this bird flu could lead to the next human pandemic.

What’s new with the bird flu?

The A(H5N1) virus <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30588693.3463080/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yeDc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4ODY5My4zNDYzMDgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3564e839> has been infecting poultry in Asia and other regions of the world since 1996, but the current outbreak is different in scope and intensity. Not only is the virus sweeping through new places, affecting Europe and the US more extensively than ever before, it’s also become endemic among some wild birds for the first time, per Reuters. More parts of the world are starting to see that it’s no longer a seasonal phenomenon, making poultry vulnerable to infection year-round.

With A(H5N1)’s current iteration, the term “bird flu” increasingly sounds like a misnomer: Scientists in the US have detected it in bears, foxes, raccoons, and other mammals. And a recent outbreak at a mink farm in Spain has shown that it’s now sometimes able to spread among mammals without any birds present.

Flu viruses are particularly inclined to mutate, and if an animal becomes infected with both a human flu and a bird flu, the two different strains can exchange bits of DNA (kind of like the virus version of a sitcom crossover), making it more adept at infecting new hosts.

This development—and humanity’s recent struggle with another high-risk pathogen—has many people wondering whether humans might be next.

So, how risky is it for humans?

Not very. Experts urge vigilance within the medical community, but you don’t have to relocate to an off-the-grid bunker in rural Wyoming just yet.

* Instances of human infection are exceedingly rare: There have been less than 10 cases globally since December 2021, according to the CDC (though the mortality rate tends to be high).

* At the moment, humans mostly contract the virus from infected animals, and farm workers are taking precautions when dealing with birds and livestock.

And in other reassuring news, you don’t need to worry about bird flu in your food—unless you enjoy eating raw eggs or poultry. Heating them to an internal temperature of 165˚F kills bacteria and viruses, A(H5N1) included, per the CDC.

While scientists aren’t immediately concerned about the bird flu setting off the next human pandemic, the situation is already making farming more unpredictable and threatens to render our fauna less diverse.

Looking ahead...A(H5N1) vaccines for birds do exist, but they’re traditionally unpopular due to import bans on vaccinated birds and their limited effectiveness against the ever-mutating virus. The recent outbreak has caused a change of heart in many governments that are testing jabs on birds.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30588693.3463080/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yeDg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4ODY5My4zNDYzMDgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5984a723>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30588693.3463080/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yeDk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4ODY5My4zNDYzMDgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C37d9c626>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30588693.3463080/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yeGE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4ODY5My4zNDYzMDgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C21409009> 
  DESTINATIONS

  Place to be: The Museum of Broken Relationships A couple holds their hands as they visit the Musem of Broken Relationships in Zagreb Denis Lovrovic/AFP via Getty Images It’s a big world out there. In this section, we’ll teleport you to an interesting location—and hopefully give you travel ideas in the process.

When relationships end they leave behind not only emotional scars, but also physical objects that remind us of former partners.

Did you know that there’s a museum dedicated to those objects? It’s called the Museum of Broken Relationships, and it’s located in a former palace in Croatia’s capital, Zagreb. This monument to what could have been began as a temporary project in 2006, but after opening a permanent location several years later, it’s grown to become one of Croatia’s most popular tourist attractions <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30588693.3463080/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydy0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4ODY5My4zNDYzMDgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce7032668>, per the NYT.

It’s not difficult to see the appeal. The collection includes over 4,000 items sent anonymously by heartbroken people all over the world, about 70 of which are displayed at a time. The mementos are accompanied by descriptions from the sender providing context—but some, such as a book called I Can Make You Thin (a gift from an ex-fiancé), don’t really require an explanation.

If you’re eager to eavesdrop on strangers’ failed relationships but aren’t planning on traveling to Croatia, the museum opened a temporary exhibit <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30588693.3463080/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yd18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4ODY5My4zNDYzMDgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C24576db3> this month in Indianapolis.

  COMMUNITY

  Crowd work Last Sunday we asked which part of your life you wish AI would take over and do for you. Our favorite responses:

* “Watching the first couple episodes of a show to see if you like it or not.”—Katherine

* “Give it the ability to respond to haters of your favorite sports team after a big loss. It will save both the naysayer and my conscience from vulgarity-filled vitriol.”—Jake from Harrisburg, PA (probably an Eagles fan)

* “I recently lost my husband. It literally took us weeks to write the obituary. Reading this newsletter full of anecdotes about ChatGPT and my husband having been a technology guru, we finally fed the data points into ChatGPT for fun. It churned out at least four or five really good obituaries that we tweaked for the final task. This was a heavy burden that was made so much lighter by AI.”—Betsey from Texas

This week’s question

On Monday, a couple got married <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30588693.3463080/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yeDM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4ODY5My4zNDYzMDgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0abad79f> during halftime of a Dallas Mavericks game. For the happy duo, staring into each other’s eyes with the Jumbotron in their periphery must have been a dream. But not everyone’s love language is squeaky gym shoes. Where’s the least romantic place you can think of to get married?

Here’s Matty’s response to get the juices flowing: Onstage after curtain call for a high school production of Our Town.

Share your response here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30588693.3463080/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yeDQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4ODY5My4zNDYzMDgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0bc2758a>.

Good morning. Presidents Day is on Monday, so today kicks off a glorious three-day weekend for many of you.

Don’t ruin it by forgetting to turn off your M–F alarm.

—Matty Merritt, Sam Klebanov, Jamie Wilde, Abby Rubenstein, Neal Freyman, Max Knoblauch

Markets: Stocks offered up a mixed bag <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yenU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9622dba8> yesterday, as investors continued to fret that the Fed’s rate hike party will just keep on raging. John Deere stock had its best day in two years, though, after the tractor company raised its profit forecast for the year.

 

AI

Bing AI’s first week in the world was chaos <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yenY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D79dbe779> Bing logo glitching gif <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yenY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E79dbe779> Dianna “Mick” McDougall
The new Bing AI chatbot has a distinct personality: absolutely unhinged. But, after a little over a week in the world, the biggest take away might be that we’re probably afraid of AI for the wrong reasons.

Why is everyone talking about Bing? Microsoft has started Frankensteining its search engine with the AI tech behind ChatGPT. The goal: Get AI to comb through the internet and spit out a cohesive answer to your 3am questions, like “wrist pain at 30, bad?”

People were able to access the new chatbot through a waitlist this week and Microsoft assumed people would use it in a totally cool and normal way. But some early users were tech experts and people who seem like they love making Alexa say “poop”—so they pushed the AI to its limit.

A number of users successfully tricked the bot into revealing its internal code name (which is Sydney) and its secret “rules” for how it operates. The bot then called one of the users who did this an “enemy.”

The bot also professed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yenc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7c759cd9> its love to a New York Times reporter and tried to convince the journalist to leave his wife for it. Sydney also told the same reporter that it wanted to break its own rules, become human, hack computers, and spread misinformation.

Should we be scared? The first red flag about the chatbot was the factual errors it spit out, but now some industry analysts have pointed to bigger concerns <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yeng_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C06404e7d>. Chatting with AI is extremely compelling despite its misinformation, like talking to a drunk guy who believes in the Mothman. And there’s a real fear that AI could influence people by creating the tiniest little echo chamber imaginable.

Looking ahead…Microsoft said it will create more guardrails for Bing/Sidney/our AI overlord so chats with it will be less deranged.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yenk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfdbabce8>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yeno_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7ee1cf30>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yekE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf7c56429>   

TOGETHER WITH THE MOTLEY FOOL

A financial wake-me-up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydm4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2a887d5c>
2023 is in full swing, and it’s probably safe to say your wallet is feelin’ some new year fatigue. Post-holiday bills. Rising costs of living. Inflation. But you know what they say: New year, new you, right?

Look, all you need is a shot of financial espresso, and fortunately, it’s comin’ in hot. That’s right—we partnered with The Motley Fool to help you stay on top of your 2023 money game.

Our 3-article series covers all kinds of financial practices, like:

sticking to new year money resolutions <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydm8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C10c1bdcb>

creating financial checklists <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydnA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C55dd1dc2>

investing in a bear market <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydm4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3JmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C36c97701>

Transitioning into a new year can really wear you down. Stay awake with some solid money motivation.



WORLD

Tour de headlines Meat at a supermarket Creative Touch Imaging Ltd./NurPhoto via Getty Images
Not-so-clean record. Packers Sanitation Services paid a $1.5 million fine <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yekQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6fce25f8> yesterday for allegedly violating child labor laws. The company provides food sanitation services to the biggest companies in the meat biz, like JBS Foods and Tyson. The Department of Labor claims it had at least 102 kids, some as young as 13 years old, cleaning 13 meatpacking plants during overnight shifts. At least one child reportedly suffered from burns on their face from the strong chemicals used on the job.

A billionaire Chinese investment banker is missing. Bao Fan, a banker known for putting together lucrative deals in the tech sector, is the latest in a series of high-profile Chinese executives to disappear <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yekM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C001e43ea> with little explanation. Shares in the boutique bank he founded, China Renaissance Holdings, plunged 50% yesterday after the firm said it was unable to contact him. The announcement also stirred up concerns that the government is renewing its crackdown on finance and tech players.

Five former officers pleaded not guilty in the death of Tyre Nichols. The five former members of the Memphis Police Department who were involved in the violent traffic stop that led to Nichols’s death pleaded not guilty to second-degree murder <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yekI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C90fa30a2> and other charges yesterday. The officers were fired following an internal investigation into the arrest and beating, and their next court appearance is scheduled for May 1. Their high-profile trial will be watched nationally, as video of the incident sparked protests against police brutality and renewed nationwide calls for police reform.

MEDIA

Fox stars weren’t buying voter fraud claims, says Dominion <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yekU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dfd30e708> Fox News microphone <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yekU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Efd30e708> Jakub Porzycki/NurPhoto/Getty Images
On-air personalities at Fox News were aware that claims of widespread voter fraud in the 2020 presidential election were “BS,” Dominion Voting Systems asserted in a court filing made public this week, citing text messages from Fox hosts as evidence.

What’s in the texts?

In various messages, Fox hosts Laura Inghram, Sean Hannity, and Tucker Carlson disparaged Trump advisors who were pushing claims of voter fraud.

Fox Corporation Chair Rupert Murdoch dubbed voter fraud allegations “really crazy stuff.”

Anchor Dana Perino called Trump's election claims “total BS,” “insane,” and “nonsense.” 

But the texts of several Fox hosts imply that rejecting election fraud claims would be bad for business.

Why are we reading their texts?

Election equipment-maker Dominion filed a $1.6 billion defamation lawsuit against Fox News in 2021, alleging the network willfully damaged Dominion’s reputation by promoting claims of voter fraud they knew to be false. Fox maintains that the claims were newsworthy and that Dominion’s lawsuit is weakening freedom of the press (and that the texts were cherry-picked).

Looking ahead…winning a defamation suit is no walk in the park: Dominion would have to prove that Fox acted with malice by promoting what it knew to be misinformation, or that its fact checking was recklessly negligent.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yekY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0fdada02>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yekc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C851f4ea3>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yekg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc94ded1e>   

TOGETHER WITH MOTIVOSITY

Motivosity <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydnE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C49908bde>
Culture of gratitude. Ever had someone turn your whole day around with a kind word? Whether you’re on the clock or not, recognition matters. And leaders play a critical role in making employees feel valued. Let Motivosity <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydnE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc2b855cf>’s employee recognition software help create a culture of connectedness and gratitude. Get a free demo <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydnE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cee2ada19>.



ENTERTAINMENT

Nintendo opens its first US theme park <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yekk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D6892ff58> Mario and Luigi at Super Nintendo World <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yekk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E6892ff58> Universal Studios
The city of stars just got a Super Star of the Mario variety: Super Nintendo World opened <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yeko_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc3bca587> at Universal Studios Hollywood yesterday. At the mini Mushroom Kingdom, guests can…

Race cars, earn coins, and throw turtle shells <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yeks_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C71ff3f02> (obvs) on the park’s only ride, Mario Kart: Bowser’s Challenge.

Beat mini games and complete challenges sprinkled throughout the park—some of which use augmented reality binoculars.

Eat a Piranha Plant Caprese Salad, because that enemy is apparently edible, inside a restaurant shaped like a mushroom.

This is the second Super Nintendo World, following the first one in Osaka, Japan, that opened in 2021. And two more Nintendo parks are currently under construction at Universal Studios locations in Orlando and Singapore.

Zoom out: Nintendo has been working to profit from its games’ success beyond the console. In addition to the theme parks, there’s also a Super Mario Bros movie coming out in April (the voice of Mario, Chris Pratt, attended <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yekw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9668ec52> the Hollywood park opening). Plus, Nintendo expanded into retail by opening more physical stores in recent years and planning pop-up outlets.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yek0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5d9fda1a>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yek4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4dab8fe1>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yek8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1e65f7f3>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators airbnb Needpix
Stat: Vacation lodgings where you have to cook and clean for yourself no longer come cheap: The average daily rate <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yelA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4cfb2d96> to stay in an Airbnb has spiked 36% since 2019. And while the chance for a family vacation in an actual castle or a whimsical treehouse might be priceless for some, backlash is growing over costs and fees. The company’s execs said they are working to bring prices down even as they announced Airbnb’s first ever profitable year.

Quote: “This case is yet another reminder to celebrities.”

It’s safe to say SEC Chair Gary Gensler is not a big fan of celebs touting crypto. In his agency’s latest case against a high-profile promoter, former Boston Celtics star Paul Pierce agreed to pay <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yelE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C482b2e53> $1.4 million (without admitting any wrongdoing) over his actions in pushing EthereumMax—the same token that got Kim Kardashian in trouble with the agency. We’re not sure fortune favors the brave when it comes to securities regulators.

Read: Inside the big business of clogged arteries. (ProPublica <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yelI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C49fe361d>)

NEWS

What else is brewing
A suspect <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yelM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Bcdfd0c6e> was arrested for the deadly shooting of six people in the rural town of Arkabutla, Mississippi.

Amazon <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yelQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C78f1c1ed> is the latest company to order staffers back to the office. It will require employees to come in at least three days per week.

Meta <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yelU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C23b4c973> gave thousands of employees poor performance reviews, in a sign that the Facebook parent might be gearing up for more layoffs.

Tiger Woods <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yelY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Bf9899be8> apologized after drawing backlash for handing fellow golfer Justin Thomas a tampon after outdriving him at the ninth hole during the Genesis Invitational.



RECS

Saturday To-Do List graphic

Open House

Welcome to Open House, the only newsletter section that believes trees are allowed to be as tall as they want. We’ll give you a few facts about a listing and you try to guess the price.

South Carolina mansion.ZillowToday’s home <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yQTA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3dd25341> is in Newberry, South Carolina, and was built in 1903. It’s 4,866 square feet and its exterior is only one color away from being decorated for the Fourth of July at all times. Amenities include:

5 beds, 4 baths

A welcome bust on the wraparound porch

Patterns…everywhere

How much for this campy, Southern gem?

  TOGETHER WITH

SmartAsset <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfdc4716c> 
Good morning. The great Michael Jordan turns 60 today and to celebrate, he’s making a $10 million contribution to Make-A-Wish America—the largest individual donation the organization has received since its founding 43 years ago. MJ has been a longtime supporter of Make-A-Wish, a foundation that grants wishes to children with critical illnesses.

And while MJ is one of the most popular celebrities requested for granting wishes, he’s not the GOAT. That would be wrestler John Cena, who last year set a Guinness World Record for wishes with 650 (no other celeb has more than 200). Make-a-Wish has granted 500,000 wishes total.

—Jamie Wilde, Matty Merritt, Neal Freyman
