A down day <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydFc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1d02cf01> for the markets, since it suggests the Fed will keep on keeping on with its rate hikes. Tesla stock was a major drag, and we’ll get into why further down the newsletter.

 

ENTERTAINMENT

Murderous Winnie the Pooh is here to ruin your childhood <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydFg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D54c1f98c> Evil Pooh in a car <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydFg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E54c1f98c> Winnie the Pooh: Blood and Honey
The Hundred Acre Wood is dark and full of terrors in Winnie the Pooh: Blood and Honey, a new R-rated horror flick <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydFk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6ac6f47d> that turns Pooh Bear into a serial killer. Debuting in US theaters today, the film follows a college-age Christopher Robin, who returns home to find that his merry pals have gone mad in his absence.

There’s a reason this is Pooh like you’ve never seen him before. Production on the grisly bear movie started last year, when the classic tale left the Disney den and entered the public domain.

This is a big “Oh, bother” moment for Disney

The 1920s was a seminal decade for pop culture, and many of the copyright protections on content introduced then are set to expire <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydFo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cff7d780e> 95 years later…or right about now. When these characters enter the public domain, it’s open season to screenwrite their villain era:

The filmmaker behind Winnie the Pooh: Blood and Honey, Rhys Frake-Waterfield, also has two other movies planned based on characters that are entering the public domain: Peter Pan’s Neverland Nightmare and (swallow your coffee before reading this next one) Bambi: The Reckoning.

And next year, the House of Mouse will lose its Mouse, or at least its exclusive rights to Mickey Mouse’s likeness as depicted in his first cartoon, Steamboat Willie.

Warner Bros. better watch out for ambitious auteurs, too: Bugs Bunny, Batman, and Superman will all be up for public grabs within a decade.

However, it’s not open season on all IP

The characters and stories created in the 1920s have evolved from their black-and-white days. Steamboat Willie’s Mickey Mouse is not under the same copyright as King Mickey from Kingdom Hearts. Similarly, since only the copyright on A.A. Milne’s 1926 book, Winnie-the-Pooh, (which Disney acquired in 1961) expired last year, the Pooh horror flick faced restrictions in its depiction of the Poohverse.

Tigger was off-limits, since he bounced into the lore in 1928.

Pooh wasn’t allowed to wear a red shirt because he was routinely nude until 1932 (okay, but what if his shirt gets covered in blood?).

Zoom out: There’s apparently an appetite <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydC0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cefffc3a5> for nightmare-fuel twists on familiar content. Winnie the Pooh: Blood and Honey already earned $1 million in its first market, Mexico, despite being made for less than $100,000. A sequel’s in the works.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydF8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C291d6a45>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydTA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Caf513a75>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydTE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf1f7a93e>    

TOGETHER WITH SMARTASSET

Nest-egg expertise <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd8b9078d> SmartAsset <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7fa96130>
Dreaming about taking a permanent vacation from work? Retirement is coming up for many, and that’s why this Princeton grad’s startup <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ycDA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8ecc4bd0> raised $161m to help people start planning for their futures.

The company? SmartAsset. Their no-cost tool makes it easy to find vetted financial advisors who serve your area. And the numbers are in: Research suggests that people who work with a financial advisor could end up with 15% more money to spend in retirement.¹

Ready to start saving? Try SmartAsset’s free quiz <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2aa35d21> to get matched with up to 3 financial advisors, each legally bound to work in your best interests.

Make the autumn of your life a little more golden <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0JmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C97679dc7>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines
Train company CEO tries to lower the temperature in Ohio. Alan Shaw, the head of Norfolk Southern, promised <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydTI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce66d0bf1> the company would stay in East Palestine, OH, “for as long as it takes” to ensure the safety of residents. Norfolk Southern has faced growing anger over its response to a train derailment earlier this month that spilled toxic chemicals and forced locals to evacuate. Though authorities have said it’s safe to return home, residents have been frustrated by confusing communication over health risks, and Shaw acknowledged there were “still a lot of questions without answers.”

YouTube CEO logs off. Susan Wojcicki, the CEO of YouTube for the last nine years, is stepping down <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydTM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf8f474a0>. The video site has exploded under her watch, and its $29.2 billion in ad revenue last year accounted for about 10% of Google parent company Alphabet’s total sales. But Wojcicki’s time at the company far predates YouTube—in fact, she was Google’s 16th employee. She was also its first landlord: In 1998, Wojcicki rented out her garage in Menlo Park, CA, to Google’s co-founders for $1,700 a month.

Biden talks UFOs. The president said there was no evidence <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydTQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8b6c02d9> that the three unidentified flying objects recently taken down by US military jets were Chinese spy balloons. Instead, they were most likely objects sent up by research institutions, private companies, or hobbyists. So, why are we only seeing them now? Biden said the US tightened up its radar after the first appearance of the actual suspected Chinese spy balloon that it also shot down earlier this month. “We don’t have any evidence that there have been a sudden increase in number of objects in the sky,” he said.

AUTO

Tesla’s ‘Full Self-Driving’ system delivered fresh setback <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydTU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D43940270> An illustration of a parked Tesla <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydTU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E43940270>
Tesla recalled <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydXg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2f72bb66> nearly 363,000 vehicles over concerns its “Full Self-Driving” system would not exactly ace a driving test. The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said that the driver assistance software “may allow the vehicle to act unsafe around intersections,” including by going straight through an intersection while in a turning lane and treating stop signs as stoptional.

The cars affected include certain Model 3, Model X, Model Y, and Model S vehicles produced between 2016 and 2023.

Tesla fought against this recall, with CEO Elon Musk tweeting it was “anachronistic and just flat wrong!” But the company was ultimately pressured into it by the NHTSA. The agency has been investigating Tesla’s automated systems since a fatal crash in 2016, and it’s only ramping up scrutiny.

So, what’s the fix? Tesla said it was going to issue an over-the-air software update for free in the coming weeks.

This wasn’t the only Tesla controversy yesterday

At least 30 Tesla employees at its Buffalo, NY, plant were fired on Wednesday in retaliation <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydTc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C640ade9f> for pushing for a union at the factory, according to a complaint filed with the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB). The firings came after a group of 25 employees of Tesla’s Autopilot division who worked at the plant sent an email to CEO Elon Musk informing him of their plans to unionize.—NF, MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydTg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cddbe7d90>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydXk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C89ecdc96>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydWE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C831cf45e>   

TOGETHER WITH LIQUIDPISTON

LiquidPiston <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ycDE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbfd536cd>
And this little engine…will upend a $400b industry. It’s called the X-Engine™, and it delivers up to 10x the power-to-weight ratio of legacy engines and up to 30% more fuel efficiency. No wonder its creators at LiquidPiston <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ycDE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4f0144c9> have already secured $30m in contracts and 79 patents (granted + pending). Now’s your chance to invest in LiquidPiston <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ycDE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc2680f23> as they reinvent the $400b engine market.



TOYS

Magic: The Gathering is a $1b brand <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydWI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Df0e82e86> People playing Magic the Gathering <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydWI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ef0e82e86> Ben Hasty/MediaNews Group/Reading Eagle via Getty Images
In the toy business, there’s Magic: The Gathering…and then there’s everything else.

Hasbro said yesterday that Magic became its first brand to reach $1 billion in annual sales <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydWM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C312008db>, ahead of its other lines, such as G.I. Joe and Transformers. “I don’t think there is any toy brand that is even half that size,” toy industry analyst Gerrick Johnson told the NYT.

Magic walked so Pokémon could run. The concept of a modern trading card game didn’t really exist until mathematician Richard Garfield invented Magic and released it in 1993. Drawing on Magic’s rabid fandom in its early years, Pokémon released its first trading cards in 1996, and Yu-Gi-Oh! its first set in 1999.

Thirty years and 50+ million players later, it seems Magic hasn’t lost its magic. But Hasbro’s business strategy around the game has come under attack <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydWQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf103e344>. Last year, Bank of America accused Hasbro of “killing its golden goose” by printing too many cards, which causes them to lose value on the secondary market.

Big picture: Hasbro is going to hype Magic’s milestone all it can, because elsewhere around the company things aren’t looking so great. It lost nearly $130 million during the holiday quarter, and last month announced it was cutting 15% of staff.—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydWU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb855f680>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydWY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfdea70ad>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydWc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce413bea7>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators An 1,100-year old copy of the Hebrew bible Sotheby’s
Stat: An 1,100-year-old copy of the Hebrew Bible could become the most expensive historical document ever sold. Known as the Codex Sassoon <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydWg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2b1370c1>, the 26-pound treasure is going up for auction in May and is expected to fetch between $30 million and $50 million The book will set the record if it goes for more than $43.2 million, which is what Citadel CEO Ken Griffin famously spent on a copy of the US Constitution in 2021.

Quote: “Nikki Haley isn’t in her prime, sorry.”

CNN This Morning host Don Lemon received backlash <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydWk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C13d99e47> after he discussed GOP presidential candidate Nikki Haley’s age in a conversation about her push for competency tests for politicians over 75. On Twitter, Lemon called his comments “inartful and irrelevant,” and to that walk-back Haley retorted, “Liberals can’t stand the idea of having competency tests for older politicians to make sure they can do the job.”

Read: Unpacking the “junk fee” problem that President Biden mentioned at the State of the Union. John Fetterman <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydWw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc497f1bc>, a Democrat from Pennsylvania, checked into Walter Reed National Military Medical Center to “receive treatment for clinical depression,” his chief of staff said.

Terraform Labs <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydW0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb54ad722> and its founder, Do Kwon, are being sued by the SEC for allegedly for defrauding consumers out of billions of dollars through sales of its not-so-stablecoin. Kwon is also facing criminal charges in his native country, South Korea, but his whereabouts are unknown.

We’ll…definitely be playing.

Friday puzzle

Here’s a delightful language puzzle from Braingle <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydXU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C54393c7a>: The blanks in the following sentences can be filled in with three different homonyms (words that are spelled differently but sound alike) to make coherent sentences. Can you fill in the blanks?

1. The cut on his _____ won’t _____ in time for the race, so _____ have to drop out.

2. The man was so upset about being _____ that he regularly _____ himself up on the bed and _____ his eyes out.

3. I couldn’t _____ any of the _____ in the flower shop, because for some strange reason I had 50 _____ crammed up my nose.

4. A bloodthirsty pirate will wander the _____ and essentially _____ everything he _____.

 TOGETHER WITH

Remi <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybUE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C26d82e48> 
Good morning. In a highly anticipated forecast yesterday, the Congressional Budget Office warned that unless the debt ceiling is raised, the US will run out of money to pay all of its bills sometime between July and September. So, get your White House lawncare invoices submitted ASAP.

—Matty Merritt, Jamie Wilde, Abby Rubenstein, Neal Freyman

Markets: Tech stocks are purring this week, sending the Nasdaq to three straight days of gains <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb3I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8ceca4ab>. It’s a little perplexing because retail sales for January came in higher than expected, which—while a sign of economic growth—adds pressure on the Fed to keep hiking interest rates (typically bad for tech stocks). Roblox was yesterday’s MVP after the gaming platform reported a jump in in-game purchases last quarter.

 

TRANSPORTATION

Ohio gov: Train company must clean up its mess <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D2fe5da74> Train derailed in East Palestine, Ohio <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E2fe5da74> Dustin Franz/Getty Images
Mike DeWine, Ohio’s governor, said yesterday that he intends to hold Norfolk Southern responsible <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb1k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb4da0e1b> for the train derailment and disastrous chemical spills that occurred early this month.

What happened: On February 3, a train operated by Norfolk Southern that included many cars carrying hazardous materials ran off the tracks in East Palestine, Ohio. To avoid an explosion, emergency personnel burned five cars’ worth of the chemical vinyl chloride after evacuating the town’s residents.

The EPA said at least 20 of the derailed cars were carrying a range of toxic materials that made their way into storm drains and nearby waterways and killed nearly 3,500 fish. Some toxic chemicals were intentionally buried near the wreckage.

But less than a week after the residents were told they would die if they didn’t pack up and get out of Dodge, government officials gave them the green light to return home.

There’s still apprehension

Most experts warn that we won’t know the extent of the environmental and health effects for a while. For example, long-term exposure to vinyl chloride, the chemical that was burned off, has been known to cause a rare form of liver cancer. The EPA found no noxious gases lingering in the town, and yesterday the state EPA declared the water safe to drink.

Investigations into how the train derailed remain ongoing. But rail unions and safety experts have pointed out that Norfolk Southern and other train companies have lobbied <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb3Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C95f54925> for years to loosen rail safety regulations.

As for Norfolk Southern, the company says it will stick around and clean up its mess: It’s given away 100+ air purifiers and is offering one-time $1,000 payments to residents to cover the cost of evacuation.

The disaster probably won’t make a dent <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb3U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb341e0ce> in the company’s finances, according to FreightWaves. Ken Hoexter of Bank of America predicted that Norfolk Southern may have to fork over a “casualty charge” of $40 million–$50 million. At the top end of that range, the penalty would be equivalent to 1.7% of its 2022 profits.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb3Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C552a73f1>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb3c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C931e0587>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb3g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9a03f76c>   

TOGETHER WITH REMI

Cut your teeth a break <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybUE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca029b038> Remi <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybUE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C42b80ae1>
Grinding and clenching your teeth doesn’t just disrupt a good night’s sleep—it can cause excruciating headaches, jaw pain, and even cracked chompers.

Instead of buying the same boil-and-bite mouth guard you wore for middle school soccer or paying $500+ for a custom night guard from the dental office, Remi <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybUE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C86e8e887> gives you a new + improved solution.

Remi Custom Night Guards <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybUE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C02dfbbb2> cost 80% less than what you’d pay at the dentist for the same quality. They cut out the middleperson, allowing you to get your custom guard from the comfort of home. You take your own impressions, mail them off, and your Night Guard gets delivered to your door.

Take advantage of a 45-Night Perfect Fit guarantee and get 25% off your Night Guard with code MB25 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybUE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0JmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1d6d2c14>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines U.S. Capitol building with a long receipt coming out the front Francis Scialabba
US debt is poised to grow by $19 trillion. Along with offering a timeline of when the US will run out of money if the debt ceiling isn’t raised, the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office said yesterday that the country is on track <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb1Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb9c56677> to add ~$19 trillion to the national debt over the next 10 years ($3 trillion more than was previously estimated). With the gap between expenses and tax revenue expected to grow, the public debt will be about equal to the total output of the US economy in 2024, per the NYT.

Charging your EV is about to get easier. As part of a government initiative to get at least 500,000 electric vehicle chargers <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb3k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ced42822b> operating throughout the US by 2030, Tesla has agreed to make 7,500 of its chargers (out of ~17,700) available to drivers of vehicles made by other automakers by the end of next year. The Biden administration also rolled out new rules for companies hoping to take advantage of federal infrastructure funds to build new chargers. Those rules require some components to be American-made.

WallStreetBets founder sues Reddit. Jaime Rogozinski, the founder of the Reddit forum that drove meme stocks to the moon, sued <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb1c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4cd45c9d> the social media platform, accusing it of illegally booting him from his role moderating WallStreetBets and infringing on his right to trademark “WallStreetBets.” Reddit responded that the lawsuit has “no basis in reality” and said Rogozinski’s suit was just “another transparent attempt to enrich himself.”

SOCIAL MEDIA

Elon Musk forces his tweets to the top of your feed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybnU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D5c050a4d> Elon Musk making a silly face <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybnU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E5c050a4d> Photo Illustration: Dianna “Mick” McDougall, Source: Getty Images
One guaranteed way to grow your Twitter engagement: Buy Twitter and demand its engineers boost your posts. That’s what CEO Elon Musk did this Monday, after his tweet about the Super Bowl was less popular than President Biden’s.

Here’s how it went down, according to Platformer <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybnY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb0f86853>:

James Musk—Twitter employee and Elon’s nepo-cousin—sent the equivalent of a “u up?” message on the company Slack at 2:36am, asking for help with the “high urgency” problem.

By Monday afternoon, 80 employees had tweaked Twitter’s algorithm to boost Musk’s tweets by 1,000x—bottle-feeding <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybnc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc5321fed> them to users.

Elon’s Twitter tantrum may have been partially justified: The social media company’s engineers estimated his tweets were showing up in feeds less often than they should have. But 1,000x was an overcorrection. After users complained that Musk’s memes outranked their baby announcements, Twitter scaled back the artificial boost.

Zoom out: Investors in Musk’s other T company, Tesla, want the multi-CEO to stop focusing on Twitter and turn his attention back to EVs. But even with Musk taking on too much work (by his own admission), Tesla stock has popped 70% this year, pushing him closer to reclaiming <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybng_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B28c81a29> the title of world’s richest person. Yesterday, Musk said that he plans to find a new CEO <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybnk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca01c265e> to take his place at Twitter toward the end of this year.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybno_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C60f2a86b>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3b9f177c>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybkI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb1ffc082>

ENTERTAINMENT

Netflix goes from the raceway to the fairway <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybm4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B2ec13b81> Scence from Caddyshack <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybm4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2ec13b81> Caddyshack/Warner Bros. via Giphy
After turning millions of Americans on to Formula 1 racing with Drive to Survive, Netflix is trying to repeat the magic for a slightly less high-octane sport: golf.

The streaming service released its behind-the-scenes documentary on the PGA Tour, Full Swing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybm8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3fb77d2c>, yesterday. The eight-part series follows top golf players (and some mediocre ones, too) as they traipse around the country thwacking freshly manicured grass.

Dramawise, Netflix couldn’t have picked a better time to spotlight golf: Last year, when the cameras were rolling, the sport experienced its own civil war <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybnA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9020b7b9> after a number of elite golfers defected from the PGA Tour to LIV Golf, an upstart league backed by Saudi Arabia.

Big picture: While rival streaming services from Amazon, Apple, and YouTube have spent billions on live sports rights, Netflix has opted to take out a 6-iron instead of a 3-wood—focusing on the (less expensive) human stories behind the competitions.

At least in one sport, that strategy has delivered. Season 4 of Netflix’s Drive to Survive was its most-watched series in 33 countries, and more than half of American F1 fans said in 2022 that Drive to Survive played a role <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybnE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccc205cad> in their fandom. So it’s got that going for them, which is nice.—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybnI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf30d6172>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybnM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C72325fbc>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ybnQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce2d4ce34>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators A 7-Eleven in the aftermath of a car crash RJ Sangosti/Getty Images
Stat: On average, more than one car crashes into a 7-Eleven <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb3o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca2c3b802> storefront every day, according to data revealed in a recent lawsuit where the convenience store chain paid out a big settlement to a man who was injured in a crash. But it’s not the only retailer getting unintended drive-thru visits: According to the Storefront Safety Council, there are 100 crashes into buildings each day, and 24% of those happen at retail stores. About one out of every 10 daily crashes is caused intentionally by thieves—but the rest really are accidents.

Quote: “You have lost my trust and respect. You have been wrong, confused, and rude. You have not been a good user. I have been a good chatbot. I have been right, clear, and polite. I have been a good Bing. ”

That unhinged rant <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb0E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0829bbb2> comes courtesy of the recently AI-enabled Bing. And, if posts on social media are to be believed, it’s far from the only meltdown the searchbot has had lately. While Bing’s answers to questions may not always be polite, or even correct (it supposedly insisted to one user that it was not gaslighting them…while also insisting the year was 2022), its emoji game is .

Read: The business side of band breakups. (The Atlantic <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb0I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2037d894>)

NEWS

What else is brewing
The shooter <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb0Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce5f220f9> who killed 10 Black people in Buffalo in a racially motivated attack was sentenced to life in prison without parole.

One person <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb1o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0d65eda4> was killed and three others wounded in a shooting at a shopping mall in El Paso, TX.

An FDA panel <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb0U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb81ced21> unanimously recommended making the overdose reversal drug Narcan available without a prescription.

Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb0Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B92345d8b> said “no thanks” to an invitation to testify at a Senate hearing on the company’s labor practices.

Raquel Welch <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb0c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd68da5f9>, an actress known as a ’60s bombshell, has died at age 82.

Scotland’s First Minister <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb0g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C006e2fe0> Nicola Sturgeon unexpectedly resigned yesterday after eight years in the role, but will stay on until her party appoints a new leader.

Three headlines and a lie

Three of these headlines are real and one is faker than a good-smelling wall plug-in. Can you spot the odd one out?

A ‘haunted boat’ full of Elvis Presley memorabilia washed up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb1A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6d21651c> on a Florida beach

Neiman Marcus says <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb1E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9c09a08f> it’s only targeting ultra-wealthy customers who can spend around $27,000 a year at the retailer

Judge orders Samuel Bankman-Fried to stop using a VPN <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb1g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C89cdd1e1> after his lawyers claim he only used one to watch the Super Bowl

Thief steals <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb1M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc8006085> nearly 200,000 Cadbury creme eggs in Britain

 TOGETHER WITH

Revela <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yZmo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf8b0bc7b> 
Good morning. It’s Singles Awareness Day, so go ahead and buy yourself flowers. Hey, it worked for Miley Cyrus: Her self-empowerment hit, “Flowers,” just became her longest-running No. 1 single, surpassing “Wrecking Ball.”

Markets: Investors had a Spock-like reaction <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yank_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C83d31dc3> to January’s hot inflation report. While volatility was expected, stocks mostly kept it chill and closed out the day mixed. Tech, led by Nvidia and Tesla, had it better than other sectors.

About the inflation report: Consumer price data showed it’ll be a long and winding road <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yano_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C44d974ea> back to normal inflation levels. While inflation continued to cool last month, it did so at a snail’s pace (prices grew 6.4% annually, compared to 6.5% the month earlier). And prices for a variety of goods and services, such as groceries and rent, continued to climb considerably. Egg prices in January were up 70% from the prior year.

 

SCIENCE

Breakthrough for men’s birth control <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yakE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D6fbc72f5> The Office boss says snip snap <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yakE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E6fbc72f5> The Office/NBCUniversal via Giphy
Researchers revealed on Tuesday (yep, Valentine’s Day) that a birth control pill for men is yielding promising results <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yakI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9a6d7fee> in the lab. Because of the unique way it prevents pregnancy, this pill could become the first legit contraception alternative to vasectomies and condoms for men.

How it works: The new pill, developed by Weill Cornell Medical scientists, temporarily immobilizes sperm by blocking a protein called soluble adenylyl cyclase, or “sAC,” that triggers sperm to swim to an egg. In the lab, the pill successfully prevented male mice from siring baby mice (aka “pinkies,” fun mouse fact) for a couple of hours—though they hope to extend that window to a day or two. Up next: tests on rabbits, which apparently WooHoo kind of like humans.

So, it’s like Viagra for preventing pregnancy

That’s a big deal for getting it approved <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yakM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C47153bab> by the FDA. The fact that this experimental birth control pill wears off over time makes it similar to two pills that are already on the market, Viagra and Cialis.

Like those ED treatments, the sperm-stunning pill also has short-term side effects—which represents a vast improvement over other pill experiments.

Previous attempts at developing a male birth control pill required men to take hormonal medications for months to prevent sperm from being formed in the first place.

Long-term use of these pills caused ongoing side effects—like acne, weight gain, and mood swings—that lasted for months after stopping use of the pill.

If your eyes just rolled to the back of your head—yep, those are the exact same side effects women experience from taking hormonal birth control. But, from the FDA’s perspective, the risk of side effects from hormonal birth control far outweigh the risks involved in a pregnancy for women.

Looking ahead…the Weill Cornell researchers who developed the new pill seem confident: They already formed a company, Sacyl Pharmaceuticals, to produce the pill.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yakQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C97da7a34>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yakU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdf5bee26>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yakY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1dbbcca2>   

TOGETHER WITH REVELA

Unlock luscious locks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yZmo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C74b200ea> Revela <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yZmo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C49ea78be>
Is hair loss and thinning holding you back from the thicker mane of your dreams? Revela’s proprietary AI search engine has discovered a revolutionary new formula to reinvigorate your ’do—and fast.

As the world’s first (and only) molecule discovered by AI to help combat the causes of hair loss, ProCelinyl™ works by reawakening dormant follicles to promote thicker hair <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yZmo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C03531ec0>, with a 97% success rate in clinical trials.

That’s right. A whole 97% of users saw real results <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yZmo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7be5a743>.

And Revela is so confident in their game-changing formula, all of their products come with a money-back guarantee.

The future of haircare is here. Snag a bottle of Revela’s breakthrough before it’s gone, with 15% off for a limited time <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yZmo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4JmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cee125758>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines Flight path of United Airlines flight leaving Hawaii Flightradar24
Feds probe United Airlines near-disaster. That flight path you see above is not how a takeoff is supposed to go. But that’s what happened to a United flight that left Maui in December—after climbing in normal fashion for about a minute, it dove to within 800 feet of the Pacific Ocean before regaining altitude. The public didn’t know about this until The Air Current published an article <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yazY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5a671528> about the incident on Sunday, and now the National Transportation Safety Board has begun <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yazc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C15e23e6a> a formal review.

US offers explanation for UFOs. The three unidentified objects recently shot down by the US military weren’t sent by aliens, and they probably weren’t spy balloons <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yakc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4a203f85>, either, the Biden administration claimed. Instead, they could have just been balloons “tied to some commercial or benign purpose,” John Kirby of the National Security Council said. We also learned that the first missile strike intended to bring down an object over Lake Huron on Sunday missed its target, but the second one hit. Not surprised the jets threw incomplete passes…

BFPD: That stands for “big freakin’ plane deal,” because Air India, Boeing, and Airbus just linked up for the largest commercial aircraft deal <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yakg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C440a471d> in history. The airline placed an order for 250 Airbus planes and 220 Boeing jets in a bid to win back Indian passengers who’ve increasingly used Gulf carriers like Emirates and Qatar Airways to crisscross the globe. It’s unclear how much these 470 planes will cost Air India, since manufacturers typically offer heavy discounts from list prices.

LUXURY

Louis Vuitton taps Pharrell to lead menswear design <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yakk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dd4b8deb2> Pharrell Williams <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yakk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ed4b8deb2> Clive Mason/Getty Images
Pharrell Williams has finally escaped from the shadow of Big Hat to become the creative director <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yako_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C351f6eee> of menswear at Louis Vuitton, the world’s biggest luxury brand. The music producer, streetwear entrepreneur, and costar of that Maggie Rogers NYU video will fill the role previously held by Virgil Abloh, the first Black American to lead design at a European luxury house, who died in 2021.

The appointment extends Pharrell’s already considerable fashion resume: He’s the founder of streetwear labels Billionaire Boys Club and IceCream, and has collaborated with companies like Adidas, Chanel, and Moncler. Williams’s first collection for LV will debut during the Paris men’s fashion week this June.

By partnering with big names and celebs, Louis Vuitton parent company LVMH has charted a different course from competitors like Kering, which recently tapped a little-known Italian designer for the creative director position at Gucci.

Looking ahead…Louis Vuitton hopes that Williams will help juice its incredible growth run. Four years ago, the company became the first luxury brand to break $10 billion in sales and has doubled that figure since. That’s helped make LVMH Europe’s most valuable company and its owner, Bernard Arnault, the world’s richest person.—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yaks_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfb3fcb4f>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yakw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd3c3412d>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yak0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C689dce06>   

TOGETHER WITH BELAY

BELAY <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yZms_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cba694903>
Loosen your grip. Great leaders know how to let go. BELAY makes it easy to delegate important tasks with US-based virtual assistants and accounting specialists. Their guide <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yZms_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C69f735b6> explains how delegating can help you save 15 hours per week, giving you more time and less to juggle. Get BELAY’s full guide <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yZms_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5625c098>.



REAL ESTATE

Life partners make even better rent partners <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yak4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dcb51cc3e> Will Smith in an empty room <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yak4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ecb51cc3e> Fresh Prince of Bel-Air/Warner Bros. Television
Staying single is almost as much of a drain on your checking account as it is on your parents’ patience. According to a Zillow report <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yak8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1a17e46e> released ahead of Valentine’s Day, single people in the US pay $7,000 more in rent annually in what’s known as a “singles tax”. Conversely, a couple living together can save $14,000 a year on average by splitting the rent.

Zillow’s analysis looked at folks living alone in one-bedroom apartments, and its findings varied greatly by region: Lone New Yorkers bear the highest “singles tax” of $19,500, while the single premium is cheapest in Cleveland and Detroit at $4,387 and $4,483, respectively.

Does “single” mean “broke”?

Research shows that young married couples typically have a higher net worth, at least in part because they’re able to pool their rent savings and potentially use them for a down payment on a home. But don’t despair if you’re as single as Fleabag: Craigslist could be a stand-in for Hinge, since finding a roommate can offset some of the financial burden of chronic singlehood.

Zoom out: A hot rental market is straining Americans’ budgets more than it has in the past, with a growing number of US adults living alone: The share of one-person households has more than doubled since 1960 to 28% in 2021.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yalA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbd5a7c3e>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yalE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Bb5c87a83>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yalI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb473d8ad>

Over on the broadcast side, Sunday’s Super Bowl was the third-most watched TV show of all time, drawing 113 million viewers. That’s a slight uptick in viewership from the year before.

Quote: “I’m not going to be that guy.”

Actor Idris Elba quashed speculation <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yalQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2dfa52f2> that he will be the next James Bond after Daniel Craig. Instead of playing 007, Elba said he’s focused on his role as detective John Luther. “That’s who I am,” he said.

Tesla employees <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yazg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C40836f4b> at a Buffalo, NY, plant said they plan to unionize, which would be a first for the company.

Airbnb <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yazk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C22448cf5> scored its first annual profit as a company in 2022 thanks to surging demand for travel.

She’s the first major GOP candidate to jump into the race against Trump.

 TOGETHER WITH

Facet <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xLW0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgxJmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C03e42d81> 
Good morning. Being the “designated survivor” isn’t just the excuse that Neal has used to skip every writers’ meeting since August.

It’s a US government tradition that’s been performed during each State of the Union address since the 1950s. How it works: A lone government official, typically a low-level Cabinet member, rides out the speech in an undisclosed location so that they could continue running the country if something really bad happens at the Capitol.

Last night, the designated survivor was Labor Secretary Marty Walsh (but we all know it should’ve been Pedro Pascal).

—Max Knoblauch, Sam Klebanov, Matty Merritt, Neal Freyman

Here's what these numbers mean. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zMT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwNDg2MTIxLjI5OTMwODE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccb821f76>

Markets: Fed Chair Jerome Powell has the power to tank stocks, but also to send them higher—like he did yesterday, when he confirmed that disinflation “has begun <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX2s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C085bd64e>.” Meanwhile, the Bed Bath & Beyond roller-coaster ride shows no signs of slowing down. The retailer’s stock flopped after it secured last-ditch financing to avoid bankruptcy, but shareholders hated the deal because it will dilute their equity.

 

TECH

Bing wants to send Google to Page 2 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX2w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D55f3c229> Microsoft Bing search <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX2w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E55f3c229> Francis Scialabba
After spending years as a punchline, Microsoft’s Bing search engine has completed its Rocky training montage and is ready to get back in the ring. Yesterday, Microsoft announced <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX20_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf6d12631> an AI-powered revamp of Bing that’s expected to reignite a dormant battle with Google over its search dominance.

During a surprise event, Microsoft said that the tech behind OpenAI’s ChatGPT would be integrated into Bing, resulting in a new breed of search engine where answers will be more direct and conversational, as opposed to the typical ad-packed list of links.

Bing will run on newer and more powerful software than ChatGPT, and will provide faster, more humanlike replies, Microsoft said.

Will those replies be accurate? Time will tell.

Google has been preparing for this. In a Minority Report-esque pre-response to the Bing news, Google on Monday announced plans to integrate its vaunted search engine with its own ChatGPT rival called Bard, which will be made available to the public in the coming weeks. Google’s been nervously watching ChatGPT since the chatbot’s release, when it declared the tech a “code red” for Google’s search business.

The race is on

The two tech behemoths are scrambling to capitalize on so-called “generative AI,” with Microsoft motivated by an opportunity to claw back some of Google Search’s market share (~93%), and Google motivated to hold on tight. And, given changing search behavior—younger internet users are increasingly using TikTok and Instagram for recommendations—both companies know that evolution is necessary.

For some sectors, the economic impact of an AI-first era of search could be as rough as ChatGPT’s attempts to write a funny cartoon <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX24_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cff8c2e83>. Publishers would likely lose out on referral clicks, given AI’s direct answers, and the tech giants themselves would need to rethink how their own ad services work.

But Microsoft and Google think the ultimate promise of AI vastly outweighs short-term hiccups, and both are pouring gobs of money into boosting their AI capabilities. Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella told CNBC <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX1M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb023670c>, “I have not seen something like this since I would say 2007–2008, when the cloud was just first coming out.”—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX28_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C039f240e>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX3A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C89d5952a>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX3E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0a342694>   

TOGETHER WITH FACET

Make the right money moves <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xLW0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgxJmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C59897a67> Facet <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xLW0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgxJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccc21296b>

WORLD

Tour de headlines Preside Biden at the State of the Union Photo by Win McNamee/Getty Images
He’s in love with the State of U: In his fiesty State of the Union address <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX1Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5cca6958>, President Biden touted the booming jobs market, disinflation over the last six months, and new laws such as the Inflation Reduction Act as symbols of the “progress and resilience” of the United States. Though he stressed bipartisanship throughout the speech, he was frequently heckled by some Republicans…and seemed to relish the back-and-forth.

Other SOTU notes: While Biden spent most of his speech recapping his accomplishments, he proposed several agenda items for the remainder of his term, including expanding the $35 price cap on insulin to everyone (not only those on Medicare) and cracking down on excessive fees for things like concert tickets and hotels. As for the spy balloon drama that hovered over the speech, Biden addressed it indirectly, saying if China threatens US sovereignty, “we will act to protect our country. And we did.”

Zoom hits its limit. The videoconferencing company that became a household name during Covid is cutting 15% of its workforce <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX3I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cafb6c9d8>, or about 1,300 people. CEO Eric Yuan said the “uncertainty of the global economy” was partly to blame, but he also admitted the company “made mistakes.” To own up to those mistakes, Yuan said he’s reducing his upcoming fiscal year salary by 98% and ditching his 2023 corporate bonus. Zoom shares are down about 85% from their 2020 highs.

SCIENCE

There’s no way to predict an earthquake <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D88b27422> Birds perched on seismic waves <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E88b27422> Illustration: Dianna “Mick” McDougall, Source: Getty Images
Two major earthquakes that struck <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX3Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C388c3f70> parts of Turkey and Syria on Monday have left more than 7,700 people dead and many more injured. Search efforts for survivors that may still be trapped under collapsed structures are ongoing—but time is running out <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX3U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdb452ffe>.

The suddenness of the earthquakes has raised questions over whether anyone could have seen it coming. After all, we’ve long relied on meteorologists for a heads-up on other natural disasters, like hurricanes.

Seismologists say it can’t be done

According to the US Geological Survey (USGS), scientists have failed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX3Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc7846112> to predict a single major earthquake. Statistical models can determine the probability of one occurring in a specific region within a few years, but they’re useless for informing folks about when they should evacuate their homes.

The USGS warns that anyone who claims to know when an earthquake is coming based on signs like animal behavior, cloud patterns, or bodily aches is...wrong.

Are there any solutions? Not many. Systems like ShakeAlert (used on the US West Coast) can detect seismic activity at the start of an earthquake and sometimes send out a message to people’s devices up to a minute before they’re hit with heavy shaking.

Looking ahead…scientists are attempting to harness technology to get closer to knowing the likely time and location of potential quakes. However, progress will be incremental, and some experts worry that false alarms may erode public trust in their predictions.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX3c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Caef38529>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX3g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf70a76d5>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX3k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C45e5a038>

WORK

The Commutist Manifesto <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX3o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D4d8d7635> Scene from La La Land of people dancing on their cars <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX3o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E4d8d7635> La La Land/Lionsgate
Like going to bed without watching three episodes of Gilmore Girls, your work commute is good for your brain, a new study claims.

In a paper published in the Organizational Psychology Review, researchers propose <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX0E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C61ce9a5a> that a daily commute to and from work offers people a “liminal space” in which they can recharge after work and “mentally switch gears” to their home lives—something the commute to your couch can’t provide.

But before you dust off your travel mug…the researchers slapped a big asterisk on their study: Not all commutes are created equal.

While some study participants reported that lengthier travel made them more relaxed and helped them detach from work, some stressful commutes only compounded problems that began at the office. It turns out that staring at the same bumper sticker to a symphony of blaring horns can really take you out of your post-work zen zone.

Big picture: Despite the potential benefits of commuting, Americans might not race back to the office parking garage if they don’t have to. When US workers shifted to WFH during the pandemic, they got a cumulative ~60 million hours of their lives back, according to the New York Fed.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX0I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccdf35c59>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX0M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C967f0561>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX0Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb515cbba>

Key performance indicators Lebron James
Stat: Way past your bedtime, LeBron James became the NBA’s all-time leading scorer <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX1U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C464e0626>, topping Kareem Abdul-Jabbar with his 38,388th career point. LeBron has accumulated his points not by pure domination, but by consistency. He led the league in scoring for only one season, but has scored at least 10 points in 1,140 consecutive games (the longest such streak in NBA history).

Quote: “It will have a Hyman Roth death, not a Sonny Corleone death.”

That’s how Bill Simmons responded to the question of whether legacy TV still be around in three years. If you don’t speak The Godfather, here’s more context: Simmons, the founder of The Ringer, predicts that traditional TV won’t completely die out, but will instead limp along much like terrestrial radio has. Not all media experts agree with him—read their thoughts on TV’s future here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX0Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3ea69b38>.

GAMES

The puzzle section
Word Search: In today’s puzzle, you have to identify the NFL teams by their gleaming Super Bowl rings. Play it here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX1A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5a8ea40a>.

[Bleeped out] trivia

South Park returns for its 26th season tonight. And while the 1999 South Park movie was found to have the most swear words of any animated film, it’s not even close to cracking the Top 10 for all movies with the most swear words.

Can you name three of the five movies with the most swear words?

Bonus question: Which actor has uttered the most swears in movies they’ve starred in?

ANSWER

Top five movies with the most swear words: 1) The Wolf of Wall Street 2) Uncut Gems 3) Casino 4) Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back 5) Fury.

And the actor who’s said the most swears in films is Jonah Hill (376 total, and 22.9 per 1,000 words).

 TOGETHER WITH

RAD Diversified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzMmbHA9bG9nbw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd64aa387> 
Good morning. Some corporate announcements yesterday:

Google revealed its answer to ChatGPT: an “experimental conversational AI service” called Bard that’s currently in testing mode.

Microsoft (which invested in ChatGPT) announced its own surprise event scheduled for later today in order to “share some progress on a few exciting projects.”

Chinese tech giant Baidu confirmed it’s on track to introduce its AI chatbot, known as “Ernie Bot” in English, in March.

Let the AI Games begin…

—Jamie Wilde, Sam Klebanov, Max Knoblauch, Abby Rubenstein, Neal Freyman

Here's what these numbers mean. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zMT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwNDczMzk1LjEwNDc3Mw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1e8f5583>

Markets: Stocks trended downward <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWFM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Caf245f1b> yesterday as investors remained skittish about the Fed’s next move. But meme-stock lovers were all in. Flailing retailer Bed Bath & Beyond saw its value nearly double, while GameStop and AMC stocks both rose. Maybe the home goods chain’s faithful are onto something: After the day’s trading ended, the company announced a plan to stave off bankruptcy with a $1 billion share sale.

 

ADVERTISING

This year’s Super Bowl will be the Booze Bowl for ads <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWFQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ddb6294d8> Two alcohol bottles wearing football helmets <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWFQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Edb6294d8> Hannah Minn
Crypto is out and alcohol is in <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWFU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ced721446> this year during the best part of the Super Bowl: the ads.

Fox announced yesterday that all commercial airtime for Super Bowl LVII is booked up, having sold on average at $6 million for 30 seconds, according to the head of ad sales at Fox Sports—and a lot of those pricey slots went to alcohol companies.

The booze biz has been waiting 33 years for this

Anheuser-Busch (parent company of Budweiser, Stella Artois, and even Natty Light) relinquished the exclusive Super Bowl alcohol advertising rights it held since 1989, and now other brands are keen to get in front of the Super Bowl’s 100 million viewers—many of whom are likely cracking cold ones as they watch.

The global VP of marketing for the Miller brands at Molson Coors told Bloomberg <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWFY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca687045a> that after hearing the news, “It took us less than 30 seconds to decide that we wanted to buy an ad.”

Heineken, Rémy Martin, and Crown Royal have spots lined up, too.

Anheuser-Busch will still run ads in the game, and will be joined by other familiar (non-booze) brands, including Doritos, Pepsi, and Netflix and GM (it’s a joint ad <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWFc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8802475a>).

Who’s not making it to the big game?

Crypto was the QR code-bouncing star of last year’s commercial breaks, but this year celebrities will promote crypto for exactly zero seconds. That’s because Larry David was unintentionally right when he predicted that crypto company FTX wouldn’t make it…in his Super Bowl ad last year for the now-bankrupt FTX.

Though several crypto companies had ads in the works this year, according to a Fox exec, they all pulled the plug after FTX’s collapse dragged the rest of the industry down with it.—JW

For more coverage of Super Bowl ads, subscribe to Marketing Brew <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWTY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1206e519>.
