WORLD

Tour de headlines The aftermath of the earthquake in Turkey Anadolu Agency/Getty Images
Death toll climbs to more than 4,000 in Turkish earthquake. Rescuers searched <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVTk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C94515ceb> the rubble in Turkey and Syria for survivors yesterday in the wake of a 7.8 magnitude earthquake, followed by another 7.5 magnitude quake in southern Turkey. Rescue teams have found thousands alive, but the number of victims will also likely increase as their work continues. In addition to the devastating loss of life, ancient sites in the region were damaged, including the Gaziantep Castle in Turkey, which collapsed, and the Aleppo Citadel in Syria.

Two arrested in “racially motivated” power grid plot. Federal authorities announced <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWHo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cccc3b02f> yesterday that they stopped an alleged plan to bring down Baltimore’s power grid using assault weapons. A neo-Nazi leader and a Maryland woman were arrested last week for allegedly conspiring to attack electrical substations in the area—an act that they purportedly believed would “destroy” the city. Assaults on the power grid are on the rise: There were 171 disturbances traced back to people last year, compared to 99 in 2021, Department of Energy stats show.

Past Chinese spy balloons escaped detection at the time. The 200-foot-tall suspected Chinese spy balloon shot down by the US on Saturday is not believed to be the first to enter US territory in recent years, but it now appears to be the first the US knew about while it was there. General Glen VanHerck, the head of NORAD (which, in addition to tracking Santa, monitors and protects North American airspace) said yesterday <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWTc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce45fcff1> that a “domain awareness gap” allowed three others to float on by during the Trump administration that were only discovered by the intelligence community after the fact.



TOGETHER WITH RAD DIVERSIFIED

Tough times call for smarter investments <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzMmbHA9dGl0bGU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0c485991> RAD Diversified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzMmbHA9aW1hZ2U/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc5d9e0e7>
It’s no secret that economic times are a li’l tough right now. What might be a secret, though, is a certain smart investment that’s well-equipped to handle these hard times: REITs (aka real estate investment trusts).

RAD Diversified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzMmbHA9dGV4dDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5dcc6690> is a nontraded, SEC-qualified public REIT that is *unaffected* by the stock market. They invest in residential, commercial, and multifamily properties (and even income-producing farms) all over the US.

That’s how RADD <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzMmbHA9dGV4dDI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C45ccde0c> is ready to handle any economic era. And they’ve got the numbers to prove it: RADD made a 35.35% return in 2021, and RAD Diversified REIT stock value has increased by 122.2% since October 2019.

Start investing smarter here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzMmbHA9dGV4dDM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C590f992c>.



BUSINESS

FTX wants its $93m in political donations back <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWTA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dcd164b67> Sam Bankman-Fried under arrest <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWTA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ecd164b67> Anadolu Agency/Getty Images
FTX is flouting the first rule of gift-giving—no take backs. The bankrupt crypto exchange is telling <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWTE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccb2228dc> recipients of its political donations to return the cash they got from its employees by the end of the month or wait for the judge to order it back.

That’s not a small amount: The company’s ex-CEO, Sam Bankman-Fried, was once the second-largest Democratic campaign donor (though he has said he quietly gave just as much funding to Republicans as well).

Over a third of lawmakers in the current Congress have some FTX-associated donation on their campaign ledgers, including heavyweights like Rep. Nancy Pelosi and House Speaker Kevin McCarthy, according <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWTI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C37a8a9a6> to CoinDesk.

It’s estimated that FTX-related political donations add up to as much as $93 million in total.

Where is the money now?

After FTX was revealed to be allegedly defrauding investors and customers, counting it among one’s donors became more toxic than swimming in a pool of nuclear waste. Many lawmakers chose to wipe their hands by donating the contributions elsewhere. Only five members of Congress had returned the money to FTX as of mid-January, while several others said they were standing by for further instructions.

Looking forward...all of FTX’s donation recipients could eventually be forced to hand back the funds, but courts tend to work much more slowly than election cycles.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWTM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdd7c8960>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWTQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7cd3dd36>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWTU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C91512c7b>

Mascara <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWGI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzMmbHA9dGV4dDI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C284d7a4f> with over 25k five-star reviews

ENTERTAINMENT

AMC introduces the cheap seats <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWEE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dca9a89bd> movie theater <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWEE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Eca9a89bd> Francis Scialabba
AMC already knows you come to their place for magic. Now, you can go there to replicate the energy of shuffling through the Delta first-class cabin with a stale bagel on your way to seat 38E (bathroom adjacent). The theater chain is introducing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWEI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C31d70d74> a tiered ticket-pricing scheme based on your seat location, similar to airlines, sporting events, and concerts.

AMC is hoping that charging a bit extra for the middle seats will help boost revenue in a more consistent way than just waiting for new Avatars to come out. The seating tiers, part of a program called Sightline, will reflect the demand patterns you can observe in any theater:

Value: Generally bad front-row seats (for a discount)

Standard: Common seats (for the traditional ticket price)

Preferred: The good middle seats that fill up first (for a premium price)

While the location of your seat will soon impact your ticket price, what movie you’re seeing won’t. The chain can’t vary prices of individual films because tickets are priced by a contract between studios and theaters. Pricing by demand has also been avoided, since it would require more complex monitoring and cost theaters money.

Looking ahead…AMC plans to roll out Sightline at some locations in New York, Chicago, and Kansas City this Friday, and is aiming to expand nationwide by the end of the year.—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWEM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C374660b2>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWEQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc1a2bd73>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWEU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8172cfe4>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators A Bachelorette contestant saying The Bachelorette/ABC via Giphy
Stat: One in 10 US adults who have paired off romantically met their partner <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWEY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7295f1c9> through a dating site or app, according to Pew Research. But not everyone swiping is looking for The One. Some are just searching for Mr./Ms. Right Now: 44% of app users over the past year said they wanted to meet a long-term partner, while 40% wanted to date casually. No word on what percentage of those lived out the rom-com cliche of finding true love when you least expect it, though.

Quote: “You don’t have a recession when you have 500,000 jobs and the lowest unemployment rate in more than 50 years.”

Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen took to the morning show circuit yesterday to reassure us she sees a path forward <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWEc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C49e33e48> for inflation to come down without stirring up an economic apocalypse. And while Yellen works for the president, she’s not the only one who’s starting to see the possibility of a recession becoming less likely—economists at Goldman Sachs lowered their estimate on the possibility of a recession in the next year from 35% to 25%, thanks to the strong labor market.

Read: How a Vietnamese refugee became America’s first hot sauce billionaire. (Forbes <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWEg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0804ce29>)

NEWS

What else is brewing
The National Enquirer <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWE0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C44509291> will be sold to a joint venture that involves a former MoviePass exec who’s been charged with securities fraud. The tabloid has been seeking a buyer for about four years.

Dell <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWE4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C84b5f7e7> is laying off 6,650 people (about 5% of its staff) after demand for PCs plunged last year.

The Grammys <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWE8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C32bc3c1d> drew in 12.4 million viewers. That’s 30% more than last year and the biggest audience the award show has gotten since 2020.

President Biden <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWFA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0a85c871> will deliver the State of the Union address tonight against the backdrop of his likely bid for reelection, a heated debt ceiling fight, and the drama over the Chinese spy balloon.

Periodic table trivia

To celebrate National Periodic Table Day, here’s a question about everyone’s favorite poster hanging in the science classroom.

There is only one letter in the alphabet that is not found in any symbol on the periodic table. Can you name it?

ANSWER

J. Yes, there is a Q in the abbreviation for the element Ununquadium (“Uuq”). But that is a temporary name, and once this element gets an official name, Q will disappear from the periodic table and be as elusive as J.

Huel <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUzA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C83fcea05>  
Good morning. One small formatting update before we get into the news: In an effort to better organize our recommendations in the “Brew’s Bets” section, we’re going to borrow a page from our Sunday newsletter and call that section the “To-do List” every day of the week. The content isn’t changing a lick—our aim is to add more consistency and clarity for you.

That’s it from me. Have a great day.

—Neal Freyman

GEOPOLITICS

Spy balloon gets popped <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVEU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D4734241a> Chinese spy balloon floating in the air <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVEU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E4734241a> Peter Zay/Anadolu Agency via Getty Images
Nearly a decade into its combat service in the US military, the F-22 Raptor fighter jet finally completed its first air-to-air strike. It took out a balloon.

As excited onlookers watched from Myrtle Beach, the jet climbed to 58,000 feet and downed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVEY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C17c2c5da> a suspected Chinese surveillance balloon over the Atlantic Ocean on Saturday. The balloon’s debris was scattered across seven miles of the sea—but the geopolitical fallout from its doomed voyage is much wider.

Here’s what you need to know about balloongate.

Why wait to shoot it down? The US knew that the balloon had entered its air defense zone on Jan. 28, well before it floated across North America. President Biden wanted to shoot the balloon down last Wednesday, when it was hovering above Montana, but military leaders recommended waiting until no Americans were in harm’s way when its remnants came crashing down.

Biden was attacked by Republicans, who wanted him to destroy the balloon much earlier and called it a “projection of weakness” to allow a Chinese surveillance tool to enjoy unfettered access to our amber waves of grain. But the Pentagon actually thinks the balloon played into the Americans’ hands—they were able to study the balloon as it floated, and an analysis of the debris will teach them even more about Chinese espionage tactics.

What is China’s response? The foreign ministry called the balloon pop a “clear overreaction” and suggested it could retaliate. China never admitted the balloon was intended for spying—claiming instead it was a meteorology research airship that got blown off its course. The US isn’t buying that.

Were there other Chinese spy balloons? Yes, and pretty recently, too. Chinese surveillance balloons entered US airspace at least three times during the Trump administration and once previously while Biden was president, a senior defense official said. And there’s also one currently floating above Latin America, the Pentagon revealed on Saturday.

What happens next? The balloon drama will only deepen the distrust between rivals US and China—it already led Secretary of State Antony Blinken to call off his planned meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping. But China’s relatively muted response to the balloon downing suggests it may let the hot air blow over...just like the US did.

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVEc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C870e3ad6>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVTg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Caebd7f15>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVEk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C734e2ed1>    

TOGETHER WITH HUEL

One less thing on the to-do list <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUzA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C56f8e647> Huel <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUzA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C04760cd6>
Trying to eat healthy without taking too much time out of your day can be a real struggle. Fortunately, Huel <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUzA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C31e3a9a7> found a way to bring convenience and nutrition together in one delicious meal.

Huel Black Edition <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUzA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdd4c89ac> is ready in seconds and packed with 40g of plant-based protein plus 27 essential vitamins and minerals. With just two scoops shaken up with water, you’ll have a nutritious breakfast or lunch in less time than it takes to make a sad sandwich.

WORLD

Tour de headlines A collapsed building in Turkey Volkan Kasik/Anadolu Agency via Getty Images
Major quake hits Turkey. A 7.8 magnitude earthquake and several aftershocks struck southeastern Turkey <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVTk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce2f4dd6a> early today, causing buildings to collapse and sending tremors across other areas of Turkey, Syria, Lebanon, and Israel. The preliminary death toll was at least 195 people, but that number is expected to rise. Compounding the damage: Many of the residential buildings in the region near the epicenter are of low-quality construction, making them susceptible to shaking, per the United States Geological Survey.

Close call at Austin’s airport. A FedEx cargo plane and a Southwest 737 came within 1,000 feet of one another <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVEs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cac2c8fb6> in a scary moment at Austin-Bergstrom International Airport on Saturday morning. Investigators are looking into the incident, which may have been caused by an air traffic controller double-booking a runway (the Southwest plane was taking off right as the FedEx one was landing). This is the second near-collision in as many months—authorities are investigating a close call on a JFK runway that occurred in January.

Kyrie Irving is headed to Dallas. The Brooklyn Nets are shipping <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVEo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc085300d> star Kyrie Irving to the Mark Cuban-owned Dallas Mavericks days after Irving requested a trade. Irving’s four-season ride with the Nets was a bumpy one—he missed 35 home games under NYC’s Covid vaccination policy, and earlier this season was suspended for posting a link to an antisemitic movie on Twitter. Expect a flurry of other moves ahead of the NBA trade deadline on Thursday.

MUSIC

Beyoncé anointed Grammy <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVWE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D84f38d9f> Beyonce on stage at the Grammys <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVWE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E84f38d9f> Christopher Polk/Variety via Getty Images
Beyoncé cemented her reign on the musical throne last night, becoming the most-decorated artist <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVWI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca57a3c37> in Grammy Awards history.

Her four wins, including best dance/electronic album for Renaissance, vaulted her past classical conductor Georg Solti for the most Grammy awards ever. She ended the night with 32.

While Beyoncé was the biggest story of the Grammys, she wasn’t the only story from the award show, which returned to the Crypto.com Arena in Los Angeles after several pandemic-altered broadcasts.

Harry Styles won album of the year. His groovy Harry’s House topped entries from Beyoncé, Adele, and Bad Bunny.

A new EGOT was crowned: Viola Davis became the 18th person <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVWM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc2954ab5> to win an Emmy, Grammy, Oscar, and Tony after she received a Grammy for the audiobook to her memoir, Finding Me.

The best performance: Certainly the Questlove-produced celebration <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVWg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C87da8849> of the 50th anniversary of hip-hop.

Didn’t see this one coming: Dr. Dre won the Dr. Dre Global Impact Award.

Looking ahead…the first tickets for Beyonce’s Renaissance Tour, her first solo tour in seven years, go on sale today <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVWQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6c220c88>. Ticketmaster has changed its process to avoid being attacked by the BeyHive like it was the Swifties.

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVWU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1de35057>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVWY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9779d07a>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVWc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C42c61750>

CALENDAR

The week ahead State Farm Stadium in Arizona is decked out in Super Bowl regalia Christian Petersen/Getty Images
It’s Super Bowl week. Here are a few storylines to get you prepped for Sunday’s game between the Eagles and the Chiefs: Read about the woman who rescued <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVE0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C76bc8a6a> Patrick Mahomes’s season. Two starting Black quarterbacks will face off <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVE4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc02550b4> in the Super Bowl for the first time ever—and so will two brothers <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVE8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce7c9b303>. Here’s a preview of Rihanna <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVFA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca7a105d7> and the other musical acts. Finally, browse the Super Bowl betting guide <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVFE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C90b2cf2a>.

State of the Union address: President Biden will deliver his State of the Union address Tuesday night with a potential reelection campaign looming on the horizon. In something we can definitely relate to, he’ll probably be editing the speech up until deadline to tweak his China section in light of the balloon drama.

Earnings: This week’s busy earnings slate is highlighted <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVFI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C012bede8> by Disney, PepsiCo, Uber, and Chipotle. Investors are setting the bar low given the disappointing Q4 reports companies have posted thus far.

Everything else…

Google could make some big AI announcements <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVFM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C22145bbf> at an event on Wednesday.

LeBron James is just 36 points away from passing Kareem Abdul-Jabbar as the NBA’s all-time leading scorer. He should break the record this week.

It’s National Pizza Day on Thursday (and, frankly, every other day of the year).

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Mount Washington Summit Mount Washington Observatory
Stat: Yes, we all know it was really cold in the Northeast on Friday night. But how cold? So cold that New Hampshire’s Mount Washington found itself in the next layer of the atmosphere. Freezing temps caused the atmosphere to compress <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVFQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb63f6f53>, and the dividing line between the troposphere (which we’re in right now) and the stratosphere sank in altitude to below the summit of the mountain.

Quote: “It’s really an amazing day, an awe-inspiring day and actually a bit of a frightening moment.”

Speaking of Mount Washington, there were actually people up there as the wind chill plunged to a record low of minus 108 degrees Fahrenheit. A team of scientists live on the mountain in order to take weather measurements, and one of them—Francis Tarasiewicz—described <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVFU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce14027cd> to WMUR the thrilling-but-terrifying experience of braving the historic cold this weekend. Tarasiewicz said it was so cold that frostbite would set in after less than a minute.

Read: I hired five people to sit behind me and make me productive for a month. (Simon Berens <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVFY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cec8c2909>)

NEWS

What else is brewing
Tesla <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVFc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5b55aa16> hiked prices on its Model Y by $1,000 after the Biden administration raised the cap on prices for certain EVs eligible for tax credits.

Elon Musk <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVFg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6f1cc39b> said that while the last three months “were extremely tough,” Twitter is trending to break even “if we keep at it.”

Ukraine <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVFk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb469aa1f> is warning of a Russian offensive later this month, around the one-year anniversary of its initial invasion.

An Italian mafia fugitive <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVFo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cba45c7b0> was arrested in a town in France where he had opened his own pizza parlor.

A Colombian judge <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVC0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C32676947> used ChatGPT in a court decision—the first known instance in which the chatbot has been included in a legal ruling, per Vice.

Peak trivia

New Hampshire might have Mount Washington, but not all states can boast such great heights.

There are five US states where the highest point of elevation does not exceed 1,000 feet. Can you name them?

  BROWSING

  Classifieds banner image <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUUE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca234feff> The wackiest headlines from the week as they would appear in a Classifieds section...

Careers

DELI SLICERS WANTED: As part of its turnaround plan, Subway wants to start slicing its meat <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUUI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C36197ee7> in front of customers to give them a “better perception of seeing the nice, fluffy meat,” according to CEO John Chidsey. Those machines are oddly satisfying…

CHELSEA SEEKING HR SPECIALIST: Chelsea FC could use onboarding support after spending a breathtaking amount <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUUM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C18647e13> on new players in January. Under new American ownership, the Premier League club forked over $370+ million for talent last month—that’s more than every team in the top Spanish, German, French, and Italian leagues spent combined.

Real estate

EX-PRESIDENT LOOKING FOR FLORIDA SUBLET: Brazil’s former President Jair Bolsonaro, who’s already been chilling in Florida since late December, applied for a visa to stay six months longer <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUUQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1b4a45f5>. He’s not exactly rushing back to Brazil, where he’s facing multiple investigations.

BRITISH MONARCH SEEKS NEW BANK-NOTE HOME: Australia has decided to replace <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUUU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C951487f8> an illustration of Queen Elizabeth on its A$5 bank note with an indigenous design.

Personal

ISO COMPANION TO PARAMOUNT+ WITH SHOWTIME AND CHILL: Yes, it’s a mouthful, but that’s not our fault. Paramount Global said this week it’s folding Showtime into Paramount+ and rebranding <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUUY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2b4b0437> it to “Paramount+ With Showtime.”

CHESS APP DESPERATELY SEEKING SERVERS: So many people are playing chess <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUUc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8be02253> on Chess.com, its computers can’t keep up. The app recently notched 10 million active users and is currently the No. 2 free gaming app on the App Store.—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUUg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C952d731f>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUUk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc835207e>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUUo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C24563fa3>  

 

TOGETHER WITH APOLLO GLOBAL MANAGEMENT

Raising up retirees
Apollo Global Management <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUXk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cef3f63f5>
We all want our golden years to be…well, golden. That’s why it’s never too early to start thinking about retirement. Fortunately, that’s where Apollo <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUXk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce20d95d3> can help.

Apollo is on a mission to help people retire better by investing in tomorrow, today. 

They offer a wide variety of products that provide an alternative to the traditional public markets. Whether providing guaranteed income products through their retirement services business Athene <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUUs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0d2d2cf8> or tailored portfolio and asset management services to external retirement plans, Apollo and Athene’s offerings can help you sail into retirement with some security.

Expand your opportunities with Apollo <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUXk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0JmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1fd7655e>.


  SNAPSHOTS

  Photo of the week Sky art from the last 747 Flightradar24 There are two ways to announce your retirement: 1) post a video on Instagram or 2) create an epic piece of sky art.

The Boeing 747 chose the latter. The final 747 that will ever be delivered departed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUU8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C73495df7> Everett, WA, for Cincinnati on Wednesday, but took a two-and-a-half hour detour over eastern Washington to craft one final goodbye message.

The image of the crown is an homage to the 747’s nickname: “the queen of the skies.”

  SCIENCE

  Dept. of Progress Hey Arnold saying Hey Arnold!/Paramount Global Here are some illuminating scientific discoveries from the week to help you live better and maybe even channel your inner Mulder and Scully.

Your friends are good for you. Since the days of Freud, we’ve known that talking helps you feel better, but new research shows that even a single conversation <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUUw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb66f84b5> with a friend per day is enough to boost your happiness and lower stress. While the conversation needs to be “quality” to improve your day, that can mean anything from deep discussions to just catching up or joking around. And if you need some motivation to leave the house: The study determined in-person interactions were better for well-being than yakking it up in the TikTok comments.

🫦 Virtual temptation might help your IRL relationship. Here’s a use case for the metaverse even Zuck probably hasn’t thought of yet: A research team in Israel found that flirting with a seductive VR character can help fend off infidelity. The team conducted experiments <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUU0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C08fff5e6> where participants strapped on a VR headset, entered a virtual bar, and chatted up the (simulated) bartender. The researchers observed that a little bit of virtual temptation works like an anti-cheating vaccine, inoculating you against IRL threats to your relationship.

The truth is out there, and AI is looking for it. An international group of scientists has begun to use AI to hunt for aliens <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUU4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C84600b01>—and not by asking ChatGPT “Tell me where aliens are located in the style of Pulp Fiction.” Instead, they’re using machine-learning algorithms to sift through huge quantities of data to detect alien transmitters on distant planets. So far, the tech has helped researchers home in on eight signals with possible extraterrestrial origins (though they disappeared when scientists tried to find them again—those little green creatures are wily).—AR



 

TOGETHER WITH TAXACT

Take the stress out of tax season. With TaxAct’s Xpert Assist, you get unlimited access <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYWM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8e0fcc0c> to tax experts who can answer allll your burning tax questions.   NEWS ANALYSIS

  No more fear and loathing in British Columbia <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D98ce818d> Canadian flags on a building <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E98ce818d>Bloomberg Creative Photos/Getty Images In an attempt to stem its opioid crisis, British Columbia is testing something that may at first seem counterintuitive: decriminalizing those drugs. The Canadian province started a three-year hard drug decriminalization trial run <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUi0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8e740ae5> on Tuesday.

While it will still be unlawful to sell and traffic these drugs, as well as to bring them into airports and schools, possessing small quantities (less than 2.5 grams, or one-tenth of an ounce) for personal use won’t be penalized.

* Adults carrying that amount of opioids like heroin and fentanyl, as well as cocaine, meth, or ecstasy, will no longer run afoul of the law.

* Police will not seize the drugs, and users will be informed about resources for substance abuse recovery.

But as they went into effect this week, the new rules stirred up questions about whether they’ll actually work.

Good intentions, but mixed responses

The law aims to move toward treating drug abuse as a public health issue rather than one that requires handcuffs. BC’s government hopes that the new approach “will help reduce the barriers and stigma that prevent people from accessing life-saving supports and services.”

Many activists welcome the reform, arguing that it’ll relocate drug use to safer spaces and make it easier for users to seek recovery care. Groups like the international HIV advocacy organization UNAIDs have long advocated for decriminalization as a way to reduce the spreading of the disease via needle sharing.

But many drug users and recovery advocates see the BC law as a “half measure”: Various stakeholders (including <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce2ebfe0f> the provincial government itself) believe the 2.5-gram threshold is too low to accommodate heavy drug users and those who buy in bulk. Experts also point to a lack of access to safe drugs and a shortage of spaces in treatment programs, with many provincial officials acknowledging that more needs to be done.

So, how has decriminalization fared before?

British Columbia isn’t the only place to try “decrim,” as the approach is known. Portugal, the Netherlands, and the Czech Republic have all adopted some form of it. It’s even being tried in the US: In 2021, Oregon became the first (and so far the only) state to decriminalize all drugs after the policy passed as a ballot measure.

Portugal is the standard-bearer for decrim success: Instituted in 2001 amid a devastating heroin epidemic, the country has seen drug-related deaths plummet. Though fatal overdoses have since risen, drug death rates remain below <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc528034c> the EU average.

Oregon, meanwhile, has posted mixed results, and the measure remains controversial. Despite its expansion of resources for those with substance abuse disorders, the state experienced a faster-than-nationwide-average rise in overdose deaths for the year 2021, and some observers point to low uptake of treatment programs.

Zoom out: Other Canadian provinces and governments abroad have their notepads out, preparing to watch BC’s experiment closely. But even decrim proponents acknowledge that the strategy can’t work on its own and must be paired with shifting resources toward healthcare and fighting addiction.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc14907d9>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C50cbfd8c>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4899b1a1>

  DESTINATIONS

  Place to be: 10 miles west of Boston a screenshot of The Last of Us depicting a setting 10 miles west of Boston The Last of Us/HBO It’s a big world out there. In this section, we’ll teleport you to an interesting location—and hopefully give you travel ideas in the process.

In last Sunday’s episode of The Last of Us, the HBO drama got Massholes even more riled up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4a177936> than usual by claiming this mountainous landscape was located 10 miles west of Boston. New Englanders called BS by pointing out: a) that is not what eastern Massachusetts looks like and b) the only thing wild about the place is the logos on quarter-zips.

Plus, the show was primarily filmed in rugged Alberta, Canada, which seems much more likely to be the setting for the shot.

So what actually is 10 miles from Boston? Well, it’s Massachusetts, so a cluster of college campuses, including Boston College, Wellesley, Brandeis, Bentley, and Babson. That area is also home to the very lovely and very Massachusetts-sounding suburbs of Waltham, Watertown, and Newton.

Sound like a nice place to live? Sure is, but it’ll cost you: The median sale price for a home in Newton was $1.2 million in December, according to Redfin.—NF

* “New employees can go on raids of celebrity homes to collect items to auction for back taxes.”—Wendy from Knoxville, TN

* “Come work for us and get a 10% employee discount on your income tax!”—Doug from British Columbia

Droplette <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc209bbf4> 
Good morning. On this day 19 years ago, Harvard sophomore Mark Zuckerberg launched The Facebook. The site eventually became just “Facebook” after Sean Parker reportedly told Zuck to drop the “The.” Which got us thinking: What other names could be improved by dropping the “The”? A few ideas…

Markets: Stocks ended the week subdued <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xU1k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cab5853a7> yesterday when a red-hot jobs report once again got investors biting their nails over what the Fed will do next—though the S&P and Nasdaq both eked out positive weeks. The tech stock rally started losing steam after several big companies reported disappointing quarterly results, with Amazon being the one investors cooled on most.

 

ECONOMY

Hiring refuses to slow down <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xU1o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dfebb5e24> Now hiring sign <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xU1o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Efebb5e24> Francis Scialabba
The seemingly endless announcements of mass layoffs notwithstanding, Americans haven’t been this employed in more than fifty years. The Bureau of Labor Statistics said <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUy0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9217f1e5> yesterday that the US added a whopping 517,000 jobs last month and the unemployment rate dropped slightly, to 3.4%—the lowest it’s been since 1969.

The jump in new hires was almost triple what experts predicted and amounts to the biggest monthly gain since July. So, where has “you’re hired!” been exclaimed the most?

The most jobs created were in leisure and hospitality (128,000), professional and business services (82,000), and government (74,000), with the last figure partially due to formerly striking state university employees returning to work.

The news of the January jobs jump comes on the heels of a Department of Labor report that said over 11 million jobs were open at the end of last year. So, while tech giants like Alphabet, Meta, and Amazon have all laid people off, many workers may be getting both severance packages and job offers. The IT industry was still looking to fill 109,000 job openings as of December, and IT folks were wanted <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xU18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc3978768> at companies like PwC and Northrop Grumman.

Why no one saw this coming

On Wednesday, the Federal Reserve raised interest rates for the eighth time since last March as part of its ongoing efforts to combat historic inflation. As any freshman economics textbook will tell you, the Fed’s moves are liable to drive up unemployment and threaten to tip the economy into a recession.

But this round of jobs data suggests that we must be living in a parallel reality, where the laws of economics don’t apply: Job growth just keeps on trucking, while inflation has been slowing.

Looking forward: The rapid job creation dampens hopes that the Fed will stop raising interest rates in the next few months. But a labor market seemingly signaling “can’t nobody hold me down” eases fears of an impending recession.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf53dc827>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B92903c7d>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce7bac0d6>   

TOGETHER WITH DROPLETTE

Fall in love with your skincare routine <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C369c813f> Droplette <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C388400be>
You wouldn’t waste time or money on a bad relationship, so why do that with your skincare? 90% of traditional products never actually absorb into the skin—they’re wiped or sweated off before making a difference.

Droplette’s <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C195fd3ac> breakthrough technology supports your skin by transforming serums into tiny, high-velocity micro-drops that get 20x deeper, where they are most effective.

The result feels like a gentle mist but delivers an injectable alternative without needles or pain. This means ingredients like collagen, often notoriously too large for absorption, can absorb into the skin successfully, leaving it hydrated and plump.

It’s time to break up with disappointing skincare and get into a healthy relationship with Droplette. Brew readers save 50% on Droplette devices with code BREWLOVE <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cff5da99e>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines The news showing frigid temperatures forecast for New England ABC news screenshot
🧊 New England’s being hit with an epic cold snap. (Thanks, Punxsutawney Phil.) This morning, wind chills could plummet to -10°F in New York City, -33°F in Boston, and as low as -60°F in Maine. Warnings about the extreme weather <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B16e5b72b> are in effect throughout New England. Some areas could experience their coldest weather in decades, and New Hampshire may hit an all-time low temp with wind chills dropping to -100°F. Thankfully, the chill’s expected to thaw by Monday.

Elon Musk off the hook for an apparent 420 joke. A jury found the Tesla CEO not liable <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0ed76558> for investors’ losses after his 2018 tweet that he had “funding secured” to take the electric car company private for $420 per share. Investors had been seeking billions of dollars in damages to cover their losses due to a sell-off that took place in the days after the tweet. Musk has long contended that there was nothing wrong with the tweet, even though he settled when the SEC sued him over it.

Battle of the beans: Anyone walking by the corner of Leonard and Church Streets in NYC might be wondering how they ended up in Chicago. A sculpture reminiscent of “the bean” in Chicago’s Millennium Park has just been completed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7f81d44c> in TriBeCa, and the resemblance is not a coincidence: The reflective sculpture was created by the same British artist, Anish Kapoor, as the one in Chicago. NYC media is criticizing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C589bf57c> the new bean for diminishing New York’s original flair, but the real loser here is Boston, the actual Beantown, which is still without a bean.

ESPIONAGE

This is not a party balloon <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ddda6e494> The suspected Chinese spy balloon <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Edda6e494> Chase Doak
Not since Balloon Boy has a balloon flying over the Rocky Mountain region caused such a kerfuffle: Yesterday, the US canceled <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cec98377f> the secretary of state’s planned visit to China after a suspected Chinese spy balloon was spotted over military sites in Montana before drifting eastward.

China claimed the object, which is still floating over the US, is merely a “civilian airship” conducting weather research that got blown off course, and expressed “regrets” for the incident. The Pentagon, however, is giving that as much credence as it would a liposuctioned celebrity paid to hawk weight loss teas.

Why bother with a balloon when China has satellites and TikTok to spy with? The older technology is cheaper to deploy and can be fitted with modern tech like cameras and radar sensors.  Plus, they can linger over a spot longer than satellites can. But experts say the most likely reason China went with a balloon was to make a statement <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVDk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf9a76a75> that it’s ready to take the US on. It likely even wanted to get caught snooping.

Zoom out: This probably isn’t going to help warm up the frosty relations between the US and China. The two countries have  been going at each other lately over issues like chip technology and the status of Taiwan.—AR

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C85acdc96>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1356fc57>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc93e6d31>    

TOGETHER WITH PRIMAL KITCHEN

Primal Kitchen <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdFI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7c71c835>
Extra sauce, plz. How can a turkey + bacon + avocado sandwich go from “pretty good” to “you have to try this”? The secret’s in the sauce: Primal Kitchen Buffalo Mayo <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdFM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0639cec9>. It’s creamy. It’s a li’l spicy. And it’s a great dip for veggies or fries, too. Get saucy and find it in stores or take 25% off your online order <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdFM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf2397e10>.



FOOD

Sushi terrorists post their germy deeds on social media <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dfc027c05> Bitten sushi on a conveyor belt <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Efc027c05> Francis Scialabba
Young adults in Japan are committing crimes against sushi <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C98f07284>—and we don’t mean ordering California rolls. Social media posts of people touching, licking, and otherwise messing with food as it travels by at conveyor belt restaurants have gone viral and caused some to question Japan’s communal values.

What’s going on?

At the end of January, the term “sushi tero” (which means sushi terrorism) was used to caption a video of someone licking the inside of cups and soy sauce bottle caps at the “sushi train” chain, Sushiro. The clip has over 40 million views on Twitter, made the rounds on Japanese broadcast news, and caused the stock of the restaurant’s parent company to drop <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C32795746> 5% on Tuesday.

Before that clip ignited the trend by naming it, videos of other fishy acts—like slathering passing sushi with wasabi—had gone viral throughout the month. These incidents, explains the Japan Times <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1d4bb421>, stem from a wider, yearslong trend.

Zoom out: Conveyor belt restaurants are a 740 billion yen, or $5.7 billion, industry in Japan, per Teikoku Databank. Restaurant chains affected by sushi terrorism are taking legal action, as well as replacing circuitous belts with straight-to-the-customer ones or powering them down entirely. Some worry “trust-based businesses” like these simply don’t work in modern Japan.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6ce30517>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C255b8e6d>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1d3e662e>  

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Milk being poured into a Starbucks coffee drink Giphy
Stat: If you’ve been relying on the Starbucks on the corner to get your heart pumping every morning, you’re paying five dollars to be served weak tea, er, coffee. A Starbucks cappuccino has five times less caffeine <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C14ee1f94> than one from Costa Coffee (66 milligrams vs. 325 milligrams), and the chain’s single espresso shot has about six times less than one from lunchtime staple Pret A Manger (Pret’s has 180 milligrams to the mermaid cup’s 33 milligrams), according to UK consumer group Which.

Quote: “My watch thinks I’m dead.”

You may want to leave your Apple Watch at home if you’re planning a big trip to Gstaad. The devices have been mistakenly calling 911 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5a0b3dea> because their crash-detection feature keeps confusing trips down ski slopes for car wrecks. Could be Apple just doesn’t like fun, since the same feature previously made headlines for being triggered by roller coasters.

Read: Are Wall Street’s short kings heroes or villains? (The Atlantic <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVG0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C738ee4ce>)

Open House

Welcome to Open House, the only newsletter section that’s wondering how many pool parties you’re really going to throw this summer. We’ll give you two different properties and you have to determine which one is more expensive.

Queens, NY home with pool next to Green Bay, WI mansion with much bigger pool.ZillowListing No. 1 (left): This four bed, 3.5 bath <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVHk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9c027517> contemporary colonial in Queens, NY, (Flushing, to be precise) has a massive living room that could double as a fancy dance studio if you’re cool with no furniture. In addition to 2,625 square feet of running-around space, the home features a saltwater pool and a hot tub.

Listing No. 2 (right): The in-ground pool on the second listing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVHo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc4bf552d> could probably double as an outdoor ice rink, because this home is located in Green Bay, WI. Though its swimming season might be shorter, this 8,042 square-foot mansion is much more spacious than the Queens house, and its expansive outdoor area features a fireplace, a gazebo, and a pool house with a kitchenette.

So, which house is more expensive?

ANSWER

The Queens home was sold for $1.48 million last June. The Green Bay home is listed for $2 million.

 TOGETHER WITH

LiquidPiston <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMyJmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbb005f22> 
Good morning. In the words of Jack Black, “Math is a really cool thing.”

Here’s one reason why: The number of minutes in February (in non-leap years) is equivalent to 8 factorial. As Tim Urban calculated <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTnY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2f3b0632>…

February has 28 days (7 x 4)

Each day has 24 hours (8 x 3)

Each hour has 60 minutes (6 x 5 x 2)

So, the number of minutes in February is 8 x 7 x 6 x 5 x 4 x 3 x 2 x 1, aka 8! Neat!

—Neal Freyman, Max Knoblauch, Jamie Wilde, Abby Rubenstein

Here's what these numbers mean. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zMT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwNDQxNTQ4LjM0NTQ2MzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C85b23e50>

Markets: If you hung on to your tech stocks during the rout of 2022, you’ve got to be feeling good right now. After another smashing day, the tech-focused Nasdaq is off to its best start to a year since 1975. Meta played an outsized role—the company’s stock posted its biggest single-day gain in almost 10 years after Mark Zuckerberg dubbed 2023 the “year of efficiency.”

On tap today: the January jobs report. It’ll provide crucial insight into a labor market that’s giving more mixed signals than TJ’s Philly Cheesesteak Bao Buns. On the one hand, jobless claims dropped to a nine-month low last week. On the other, US employers announced more than 100,000 job cuts in January, which amounts to the most monthly layoffs since 2020, according to Challenger, Gray & Christmas.

 

BUSINESS

How to lose $108b in 1 week <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTnc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Da9a14e1a> Gautam Adani <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTnc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ea9a14e1a> Mint/Getty Images
Just one month ago, we thought it would be impossible for someone to lose more money more quickly than FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried did.

Enter Gautam Adani. In the week since the Indian mogul was targeted by a short seller, his businesses have lost a combined $108 billion in value, and his own net worth has plummeted by $52 billion. Because Adani was once the second-richest person in the world, he’s still got plenty left in the bank. But, as Bloomberg notes <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTng_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7cc408d1>, his downfall “defies just about every historical comparison.”

Given Adani’s sprawling business empire and his cozy relationship with India’s leadership class, this crisis has echoed across both markets and politics. Here’s a rundown of what you need to know about the most important story in global business this week.

Who is Adani and how did he get so rich? Adani, who grew up middle-class, dropped out of college to trade diamonds and eventually formed his own business hawking other physical products. During the ’90s his ambitions expanded <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTnk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb13794f8> along with the Indian economy, and he now runs a conglomerate that encompasses energy, transportation infrastructure such as ports and airports, defense manufacturing, and media.

What sparked the collapse? On Jan. 24, a US short seller named Hindenburg Research claimed Adani’s empire pulled “the largest con in corporate history,” accusing it of stock manipulation and accounting fraud in a 100-page report. Adani has denied the allegations, but his pushback hasn’t comforted spooked investors…especially after he scrapped a $2.5 billion share sale on Wednesday. 

How has this infiltrated politics? Adani responded that Hindenburg’s report wasn’t just an attack on him, it amounted to a “calculated attack on India…and the growth story and ambition of India.” Adani’s business ventures have aligned closely with the priorities of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, and Modi’s political opponents are seizing on the fiasco to highlight the relationship between India’s leader and Adani.

What happens next? Adani emphasized that his company’s fundamentals remain “very strong” and its balance sheet “healthy.” Still, experts say the accusations could leave a lasting reputational stain on India’s largest corporations and hamstring their ability to grow.—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTno_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6cbd73a5>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C851e6a2b>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTkI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc20e8392>   

TOGETHER WITH LIQUIDPISTON

Take your portfolio full throttle <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMyJmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7480b36d> LiquidPiston <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMyJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5e19b7ed>
Meet the X-Engine™ from LiquidPiston: a patented, redesigned rotary engine that’s up to 10x lighter <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMyJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0fe90003> than comparable piston engines of the same power.

And guess what? LiquidPiston’s giving you the chance to become a shareholder in the future success of their engine technology.

LiquidPiston <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMyJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3aff8e87> is kicking new markets into top gear, from drones that can fly 2x farther to hybrid-electric cars that can use 80% smaller batteries.

Best of all, the engine is compatible with a variety of fuels, including hydrogen. This could unlock a 100% green energy solution for the combustion engine market.

No wonder they’ve secured $30m in contracts from the US Army, the Air Force, and more.

Invest in LiquidPiston today <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMyJmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb970dff3>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines LeBron James looking up ESPN via Giphy
It’s a bird, it’s a plane, it’s a…Chinese spy balloon? US officials presumably scanning the sky for the green comet saw something else entirely: a surveillance balloon <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xT3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4af25d3f> they’re confident was sent by China. Pentagon authorities said they’ve been tracking the balloon, which was spotted floating high above Montana, but decided not to blow it up out of safety concerns. The discovery of ramped-up Chinese spy operations comes days ahead of an expected meeting between Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Chinese President Xi Jinping in Beijing.

Big Tech earnings were a wet blanket. Despite the euphoria over tech stocks on Wall Street, disappointing Big Tech earnings <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xT3Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb1179c2f> showed that companies are still facing tough economic conditions. Apple posted a rare quarterly sales decline, Alphabet is “meaningfully” slowing down its hiring, and Amazon’s cash cow—AWS—isn’t growing like it had been. We’ll see if these underwhelming reports put the brakes on the Nasdaq’s rally today.

Artificial tears could be causing real infections. The CDC urged the public to stop using EzriCare Artificial Tears, saying the over-the-counter lubricating eye drops may be linked to an outbreak of drug-resistant infections <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xT3U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C65c0c275> that have caused vision loss in at least five people and at least one death. EzriCare said it stopped selling and distributing the drops, which are manufactured in India by a different company, when it learned of the CDC’s investigation. But the company stated it was not aware of testing that “definitively” linked the infections to the product.

SOCIAL MEDIA

New MrBeast video sparks healthcare debate <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTkM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D7df046b0> MrBeast <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTkM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E7df046b0> Dave Kotinsky/Getty Images
YouTuber MrBeast (real name Jimmy Donaldson) has moved on from recreating Squid Game to going creative mode on the US healthcare system. The 24-year-old and world’s most popular YouTuber uploaded a video <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRmw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C88c56be4> over the weekend that revealed he funded cataract surgery for 1,000 people.

The video, titled “1,000 Blind People See For The First Time,” has garnered more than 77 million views on Donaldson’s channel, but sparked debates around the use of philanthropy as a revenue driver and prompted some viewers to express frustration with medical expenses in the country.

The surgery costs about $3,500 per eye, according to MyVision.org, and the participants in MrBeast’s video weren’t able to afford medical insurance.

Criticism of the video focused primarily on the broader implications of an altruistic YouTuber funding surgeries as content, but some are more generally unsettled by the idea that the MrBeast channel—which has featured videos of people being paid to live in a windowless room and stay in a circle in the middle of nowhere for 100 days—is earning revenue off of charitable acts.

To his critics, MrBeast responded:

MrBeast@MrBeast via TwitterZoom out: Donaldson’s main channel has 131 million subscribers and generated about $54 million in revenue in 2021. He gave away more than $3 million in prizes in 2022.—MK

TOGETHER WITH BABBEL

Babbel <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTDA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMyJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce748be11>
