  TOGETHER WITH

Mugsy <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C40c40de6> 
Good morning. Can ChatGPT write a funny comic? Max wanted to know. So he asked the chatbot to provide a topic for his Saturday Sketch, and then faithfully drew up the response.

We’ll let you judge the quality of the joke yourself, but at least from our POV…Max shouldn’t lose sleep over AI taking his job. For now.

—Sam Klebanov, Jamie Wilde, Max Knoblauch, Matty Merritt, Abby Rubenstein, Neal Freyman

Markets: It was a happy Friday <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0944e20c> indeed for the stock market. All three major indexes closed the week in positive territory—and for the Nasdaq, that meant a fourth straight week of gains. After their worst year ever in 2022, Tesla shares have begun 2023 with a Liam Neeson-level vengeance, soaring nearly 65% this month and 31% this week alone.

 

BUSINESS

Goldman Sachs CEO joins the ranks of execs taking pay cuts <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D5828cc6e> CEO looking at smudged hundred dollar bills <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E5828cc6e> Photo Illustration: Dianna “Mick” McDougall, Sources: Getty Images
Goldman Sachs tightened its belt at the expense of its CEO’s wallet. The investment bank announced <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce327bb26> yesterday that CEO David Solomon received a 29% pay cut in 2022. But it’s unlikely that he’ll be staging a walkout, as his new compensation still came in at a not-too-shabby $25 million.

Solomon’s shrinking paycheck reflects the financial struggles that have been plaguing the bank under his leadership:

Goldman Sachs has lost $3 billion since 2020 on its troubled foray into commercial banking, and its profits declined last year amid a slowing economy.

The bank let 3,200 employees go this month, its biggest layoffs since the 2008 financial crisis, according to the New York Times.

But Solomon is not the only CEO to see his pay package get smaller. Rival bank Morgan Stanley, as well as Apple and Alphabet, have all recently cut CEO compensation (in most cases alongside layoffs).

Why are executive pay cuts so hot right now?

Slashing executives’ pay is a cost-cutting measure that doubles as a way to signal that bosses are weathering economic headwinds alongside rank-and-file workers.

A 2021 study from Oxford University showed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C32e0cb70> that companies that prioritize paying employees over managers in difficult times tend to get a better rep with customers. It can also be a way to placate disgruntled shareholders who are not too pleased to sponsor the caviar-filled lifestyles of company leaders as they watch their investments dip into red territory.

Zoom out: CEOs still aren’t exactly hurting. The heads of the biggest US companies made 399 times more than the average worker in 2021, according to the Economic Policy Institute, an almost 20-fold increase in the pay ratio since 1965.—SK

TOGETHER WITH MUGSY

Your thighs have a new best friend… <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8af94d68> Mugsy <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca77dd23c>
Yep, those thighs right there , wrapped handsomely in a pair of Mugsy jeans <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf22201dd>—the most comfortable jeans ever made.

If they could talk, they’d be telling you how Mugsy jeans are the softest, comfiest jeans a set of thighs has ever called home.

And if they could shout, these thighs would be screamin’ about the incredible stretch Mugsy jeans deliver, keeping the fit juuust right—never too baggy and never too tight <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb8b9fd90>.

But thighs can’t talk, so you’ll have to trust the 13,000+ 5-star reviews on Mugsy’s site, like this one: “Just. Buy. Them. Absolute perfection.”

Try these game-changing jeans for yourself and get 10% off your first purchase with code BREW10 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xYkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1JmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc7bbaf70>, plus free shipping + free returns.



WORLD

Tour de headlines
Intel raises alarms for the chip industry. Due to a lack of demand for chips and a slowdown in its data processing center business, the company reported its worst financial results <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C36e96c26> since the dot-com bubble popped at the turn of the century. Though the stock only ended up falling 6.4% by the time the market closed yesterday, Wall Street definitely took notice of the company’s troubles: Twenty-one analysts slashed what they thought it was worth, and many did not hold back in describing the chipmaker’s fall. “No words can portray or explain the historic collapse of Intel,” one said.

Asia’s richest person may not be for long. Billionaire Gautam Adani’s conglomerate has lost $51 billion in value in a sell-off <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7c224213> sparked by a report from US-based short-selling firm Hindenburg Research accusing the Adani Group of “pulling the largest con in corporate history.” Though Adani has denied the report and threatened legal action, the market has responded strongly, with some of his companies falling by 20% yesterday. The timing is particularly bad for Adani, as yesterday marked the beginning of a planned $2.45 billion share sale.

CANNABIS

FDA doesn’t know WTF to do with CBD <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Da630a7ec> Bottles of CBD oil <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ea630a7ec> Leon Neal/Getty Images
The Food and Drug Administration said on Thursday it can’t vouch for the safety of cannabidiol <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdi0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3621215c> (CBD)—a nonpsychoactive compound found in marijuana and hemp plants—and because of that, it can’t regulate it. Instead, it’s calling on lawmakers to help supervise $12 CBD lavender sodas.

Why? The FDA said that CBD doesn’t fit the mold of the dietary supplements and food additives it typically monitors, such as ginseng and caffeine. The agency claims the science is lacking on the safety of long-term CBD use, let alone on any potential perks—like preventing diabetes or aiding sleep.

This game of legal Hacky Sack is a major drag for CBD advocates

Congress legalized hemp four years ago, and most CBD is derived from hemp, not marijuana. As a result, CBD got kicked off the controlled substances list and got lobbed from the Drug Enforcement Administration’s desk to the FDA’s.

Since then, the FDA’s been less active in regulating CBD than a teen in a ’90s anti-marijuana ad. That’s resulted in a chaotic and confusing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdl8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C784f2c52> marketplace, and CBD industry players were hoping the FDA would soon start reining it in.

Looking ahead…while CBD advocates expressed frustration at getting sent back to square one, some members of Congress are optimistic that they can finally sort the issue out.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce581cd62>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc2cd017e>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbac61b29>  

TRANSPORTATION

Your bike can sleep with the fishes (in a good way) <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D3b0c5b37> Underwater bike garage in Amsterdam. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E3b0c5b37> travelism/Getty Images
Oh, to be an Amsterdammer—free from finessing a U-lock onto a frozen street sign. A new $65 million bike parking garage <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb1510da4> opened Wednesday in the largest city in the Netherlands, and it is all underwater.

Going under…the facility is at Amsterdam’s Centraal Station, which sees roughly 200,000 travelers arrive per day—about half by bike. To access the new parking facility, you can bike right up to the moving walkways that take you and your wheels into the depths of what used to be just canal water. The structure took four years to build and can hold 7,000 bikes. Its capacity will increase to 11,000 when a second structure opens in February. (Here’s a pretty sick time lapse <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C37d934f0> of how they drained all that water and built the garage.)

While it cost a lot to build, the parking is cheaper than most bus fares in the US: Parking is free for the first 24 hours and roughly $1.46 per day after that.

Big picture: This new facility is a logical investment for a country in which bicycles outnumber the residents. Dutch people are the most physically active on the planet primarily because biking is such a huge part of their daily lives, according to a 2021 study from global research firm Ipsos.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5458e99f>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfebe645f>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4e6b4f56>   

TOGETHER WITH RAD DIVERSIFIED

RAD Diversified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdXY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb9f6a542>
Do you wanna know a sec(REIT)? Real estate investment trusts (REITs) like RADD <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdXY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf396bd03> own portfolios that can generate income, equity, or both. Their stock is up 122.22% since October 2019 (as of Oct. 26, 2022) while amassing over $100m in properties and offering 13% in distributions back to investors in 2022. Find out how RADD REIT <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdXY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7d4f59a8> can build your wealth into a legacy.



GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators A coin going into a piggy bank Itaú Unibanco via Giphy
Stat: Whether we’ve got a recession coming remains the biggest will they or won’t they story since Aang and Katara, but it looks like more Americans are starting to sock away cash just in case. Data released by the Department of Commerce yesterday puts the savings rate <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C61de83ca> for December at 3.4%—the highest level in seven months and the biggest uptick from the previous month since July 2021 (November’s rate was 2.9%). Could be that everyone’s just saving up in case Taylor Swift adds more tour dates…

Quote: “Up until now, I was a professional tidier, so I did my best to keep my home tidy at all times. I have kind of given up on that in a good way for me.”

Renowned declutterer Marie Kondo has admitted that, like every other parent who is constantly stepping on Legos strewn across the living room floor, she’s let her house become less organized <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd2E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cee8272eb> since giving birth to her third child. This sparks joy for the rest of us slobs.

GAMES

The puzzle section
Brew crossword: Since y’all seem hyped about trying to beat Neal’s time on our crosswords, see if you can solve today’s <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd24_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8d01022d> in less than the 10 minutes, 33 seconds it took him.

Open House

Welcome to Open House, the only newsletter section that can free solo your home’s facade. We’ll give you a few facts about a listing, and you try to guess the price.

DC former ex senator home with garden and pool.Bright MLSToday’s listing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd28_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb2a20b60> is in Washington, DC, and used to be the estate of a former US senator. Which one? Probably one that didn’t support a general wealth tax. This stone mansion is 8,500 square feet and has a separate pool house. Amenities include:

6 beds, 7 baths

Private elevator

Busch Gardens-esque backyard

How much for your political oasis?

 TOGETHER WITH

Facet Wealth <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xcGY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2c3bf410> 
Good morning. TIL there is such a thing as “burrito season.” Chipotle said yesterday it’s hiring 15,000 employees to prep for “burrito season”—the period from March–May that represents its busiest sales stretch on the calendar.

So if we’re getting this right…

March–May: burrito season

June–August: ribs season

September: soup season

October: spooky season

November: Soup Season 2: The Return of the Soup

December–February: cuffing season

—Neal Freyman, Jamie Wilde, Max Knoblauch, Matty Merritt

Markets:  The positive vibes coming out of Tesla’s earnings helped propel <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xczY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf7ad9a8a> the stock market higher yesterday—as did Q4 GDP numbers, which we’ll get to in a bit. All three major indexes are on track to close out the week, and the month of January, in the green. (Side note: How is January almost over?)

 

ECONOMY

How’s the economy doing? <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xczc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D5efcc8d3> Larry David saying <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xczc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E5efcc8d3> Curb Your Enthusiasm/HBO via Giphy
Larry David’s favorite tagline also happens to be an apt description of the economy right now: It’s pretty, pretty good.

US gross domestic product (GDP), the broadest measure of economic activity, grew at a 2.9% annualized pace <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xczg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C91286dd9> in Q4 2022, which topped expectations. And it’s rock-solid proof that the recession we’ve been warned about for months ain’t here yet.

Not only has the US economy regained <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xczk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C840b50c3> all the lost output from the Covid recession, but it’s also returned to its growth trajectory from before the pandemic. Real GDP per capita, which factors in inflation, has reached its highest level ever.

Is this a sign of a “soft landing”? Q4’s strong GDP numbers add fuel to the argument that the Fed could actually pull off the tricky “soft landing”—where it knocks down inflation through interest rate hikes without sending economic growth into reverse. The resilient labor market is cooperating: Despite all the headlines about layoffs, jobless claims fell last week to their lowest point since April 2022.

But don’t write off a recession just yet

Economists combing through the GDP report found a few warning signs that indicate a recession remains a clear and present danger. Here are a few:

Consumers are pulling back. Personal consumption, which represents about 70% of all US output, came in below forecasts, signaling Americans aren’t reaching for their wallets like they had been earlier in the pandemic. Growth in business inventories also suggest a more cautious consumer.

The housing market got pummeled. The sector shrank at a 27% annualized pace last quarter as higher mortgage rates put home-buying and construction on ice.

Companies are slowing down their spending. In Q3, business investment grew 6.2%; in Q4, just 0.7%.

Bottom line: The US economy is in a fluid state right now, being tugged in different directions by large, complex forces. Even the people who study it 50 hours a week only speak in probabilities (e.g., “there’s an X% chance Y will happen”). When execs and economists say the outlook is “uncertain”—they mean it.—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc2E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C88cca600>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc2I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfe1b42d3>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc2M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5631d579>

WORLD

Tour de headlines Monopoly board game Scott Olson/Getty Images
More companies announce layoffs: And it’s not just the high-flying tech firms doing it. The toymaker Hasbro cut about 15% of its global workforce <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc2Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C225addc9> after its holiday-season sales dropped 17% from the prior year. And IBM, Dow, S&P, and 3M all announced significant layoffs <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc2U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C83a8f46e> this week, citing the uncertain economic environment we just discussed.

Ex-Memphis police officers charged with murder. Five former officers of the Memphis Police Department were charged <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc2Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C833e432e> with second-degree murder and other crimes over the killing of Tyre Nichols, a Black man who died three days after a violent traffic stop. Shelby County District Attorney Steve Mulroy said that a video of the traffic stop shows the five ex-police officers, all of whom are Black, severely beating Nichols, and asserted that they were all responsible for his death. That video will be released to the public this evening.

14 reasons why AI should write online content. BuzzFeed CEO Jonah Peretti told employees yesterday that the company will work with OpenAI <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc2c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C84f8e3dc> (ChatGPT’s creator) to help pump out “AI inspired content” such as its patented quizzes. That memo sent BuzzFeed’s battered stock up 120%...all the way to above $2/share. While Peretti and investors are jazzed about incorporating AI into content, BuzzFeed will have to tread carefully: The tech site CNET was recently forced to apologize after people pointed out that its AI-written articles made factual errors and plagiarized humans' work.

EDUCATION

ChatGPT goes to school...and passes <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc2g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D3a66d751> A robot wearing a grad cap <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc2g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E3a66d751> Dianna “Mick” McDougall, Sources: Getty Images, OpenAI
If robots rise up against humanity, it might be because we’re making them take a bunch of tests. ChatGPT, the much-hyped AI text generator from OpenAI, passed medical <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc2k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5eba1665>, business <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaFo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdfd30b4e>, and law <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc2o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce137f79e> exams this month and scored higher than many human students.

ChatGPT recently scored above a passing grade on…

The three-part US Medical Licensing Exam

A Wharton Business School exam—the final test of the MBA program’s Operations Management course

Four University of Minnesota Law School exams in Constitutional Law, Employee Benefits, Taxation, and Torts (not the dessert)

These tests contained a mix of short-answer, essay, and multiple choice questions—and ChatGPT received passing, but not gold-star, grades in all of them. Examiners noted that ChatGPT was much better at writing than math, which…same.

Big picture: SmarterChild 2.0’s success has educators debating AI’s role in the classroom and how to best assess student learning in the new ChatGPT era. While some want to keep AI tools out of class by, say, requiring students to write out work by hand, others say we should embrace the new tech as a support tool, like a tutor or calculator.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc2s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6094926c>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc2w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc7b49a6b>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc20_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8871fa8e>  

TECH

James Dolan defends his walled Garden <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc24_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D3562a816> James Dolan <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc24_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E3562a816> Photo Illustration: Dianna “Mick” McDougall, Source: Getty Images
“If you sue me, I’m not going to let you see Billy Joel live.”

That’s essentially how James Dolan, the CEO of Madison Square Garden Entertainment and billionaire owner of the Knicks, defended <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc28_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce3e4996c> the company’s controversial use of facial recognition at its venues.

In a rare TV interview yesterday, Dolan claimed that “the Garden has to defend itself,” and threatened to halt alcohol sales at Rangers hockey games to generate negative publicity for regulators. “I don’t need the liquor,” he said.

What’s Dolan so riled up about? Remember when an attorney was escorted <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc3A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5324464f> out of Radio City Music Hall while attempting to see the Rockettes with her daughter? It’s about that—and broader backlash over MSG’s alleged practice of using facial recognition tech to identify and ban lawyers employed at firms involved in MSG-related cases from entering its venues.

New York has launched an investigation into MSG’s use of facial recognition tech, which has impacted 90 law firms, according to NY Attorney General Letitia James.

Zoom out: Dolan might want to check his fortifications—they’re a bit porous. To evade the scanners, one lawyer donned a disguise to attend a Jerry Seinfeld show in December.—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc3E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca6ed2ab1>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc3I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Bc820ddbf>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca23adccb>

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators The path of an asteroid passing near Earth NASA/JPL-CALTECH
Stat: An asteroid made one of the closest approaches <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc3Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1fd0117e> to Earth on record last night, skimming the planet’s orbit just 2,200 miles above the Pacific Ocean near Chile (that’s closer than some satellites). The asteroid, named 2023 BU, is roughly the size of a U-Haul truck and poses no threat, according to NASA. “It’s going to zoom past Earth, say hello, and move on,” a NASA engineer said. Sounds like our ex.

Quote: “The word ‘mummy’ is not incorrect, but it is dehumanizing.”

Some museums want you to remember that mummies were once—a really long time ago—people, too. A trio of British museum organizations said they will avoid <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc3U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbd564d7b> using the word “mummy” whenever possible, and swap it out with “mummified remains of” or “mummified person.” Meanwhile, the AP recommended a controversial language update <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc3Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C54f119c0> of its own yesterday.

Watch: Why esports are flailing even as gaming explodes. (Morning Brew <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc3c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc41789f9>)

QUIZ

QuizGPT <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc0g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E3234f81a> Weekly news quiz <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc0g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2F3234f81a>
The feeling of getting a 5/5 on the Brew’s Weekly News Quiz has been compared to remembering you have a new episode of Real Housewives to watch.

WHAT ELSE IS BREWING

The FBI <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc3g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C00a5ce65> announced it disrupted a major hacking group and prevented it from collecting more than $130 million in ransomware payments. “We hacked the hackers,” Deputy US Attorney General Lisa Monaco said.

Southwest Airlines <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc3k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb075c5f8> booked a net loss of $220 million in the fourth quarter due to its late-December meltdown.

Bed Bath & Beyond <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc3o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8c8d1d45> once again warned of bankruptcy after it said it didn’t have sufficient cash to pay down its debt.

DoNotPay <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc0E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdd55bda6> called off its plan to equip a defendant in court with its “robot lawyer,” citing threats of jail time.

Friday puzzle

ANSWER

 TOGETHER WITH

Revela <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xbmg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3JmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8abedb03> 
Good morning. Welp—looks like we were wrong about the prospect of snow accumulation in NYC yesterday (was mostly miserable rain). Probably best to retire as meteorologists and stick to something we’re much better at: running courses that help you get better at your career.

Speaking of, the Business Essentials Accelerator, our eight-week online course on business fundamentals, is kicking off Feb. 6. Think of it as a streamlined Biz 101 course that’s both enjoyable and informative—kind of like this newsletter. Learn more here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xbFA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfd7edae7>.

—Jamie Wilde, Max Knoblauch, Matty Merritt, Abby Rubenstein, Neal Freyman

Markets: Stocks finished out the day mixed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb2k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C20a15c9f> yesterday as investors continued to process that the corporate earnings season so far has also been…mixed. IBM’s stock, for example, dipped even though the company reported its biggest annual sales increase in a decade (but also joined its fellow tech companies in announcing layoffs). 

 

NATION

Mass attacks of violence have a lot in common <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb08_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D37e98444> The crime scene in Half Moon Bay, CA <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb08_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E37e98444> Tayfun Coskun/Anadolu Agency/Getty Images
If it feels like recent US mass attacks have startlingly similar details, it’s because many of them do. A new study <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb1A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc5e8cb06> from the Secret Service’s National Threat Assessment Center examined 173 public attacks occurring from 2016 to 2020 and found patterns that repeated from Uvalde, TX, to the back-to-back shootings in California this past weekend.

Some commonalities:

Who: Almost all attackers acted alone and were men. Though attackers ranged in age from 14 to 87, the average age skewed younger at 34.

What: Nearly 73% of attacks involved firearms, and most of those were fatal. The remaining attacks that didn’t involve firearms were mostly nonfatal.

Why: Nearly all attackers experienced a significant stressor, such as a loved one dying, in the five years prior to the attack, and 77% of them experienced one within a year. Half of the incidents were motivated by “perceived wrongs” in the workplace or at home.

The killing of seven people in Half Moon Bay, California, on Monday was described <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb1E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfcdcf654> by officials as an act of “workplace violence.”

Most attackers had similar red flags

The study says that nearly half of attackers had a history of misogyny and/or domestic violence—and that those behaviors “deserve increased attention” from law enforcement. Violent online posting and chatting can also signal an individual may commit an attack. The Uvalde, TX, shooter, for example, threatened <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb1I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C49ce0464> women online and shared graphically misogynistic content.

Nearly two-thirds of attackers said or did things so “objectively concerning” that the report says they “should have been met with an immediate response.” Many of these were even reported to law enforcement, employers, and others prior to the mass attack.

The report’s big takeaway? Recognizing shared patterns among past mass attacks early could help prevent future incidents.

Zoom out: Over 39 incidents of mass violence have already occurred in the US this year, and two incidents happened in California just this past week. Legislators are debating what laws they can pass <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb1M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cefcd33cf> to slow or stop the momentum.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb1Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4fa1624d>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb1U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1d5979bd>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb1Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce73c6d7e>  

WORLD

Tour de headlines M1 Abrams tanks being shipped David Hecker/Getty Images
Ukraine is getting new tanks. Both the US and Germany agreed yesterday to send tanks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb2o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca50bfcf3> to Ukraine as it fends off Russia’s invasion—something Ukraine has said it needs to win the war. The US will send 31 M1 Abrams tanks, while Germany will provide 14 Leopard 2 A6 models. Though Western allies have been arming Ukraine since the war began nearly a year ago, there was hesitation over whether sending tanks would be considered an escalation. And while President Biden stressed this move was “not an offensive threat to Russia,” Russia has stated that sending tanks will make the possibility of talks to end the war less likely.

Trump can shop on Facebook Marketplace again. Meta said yesterday former President Trump’s accounts on Instagram and Facebook will be reinstated <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb2s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8c8f7566> after the company suspended his accounts following the Jan. 6 attacks. Meta said Trump’s risk to public safety has “sufficiently receded” since then. Before being banned, Trump was the most followed person on Facebook. It’s not the only social network to welcome him back: Trump’s Twitter account was reinstated in November (though he has yet to post there, sticking to his own competitor, Truth Social…for now).

State abortion pill bans get challenged in court. Mifepristone manufacturer GenBioPro filed a federal lawsuit <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb2w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C69cd9f79> yesterday seeking to have West Virginia’s ban on abortion pills deemed unconstitutional on the grounds that the FDA’s approval of the drug should trump state restrictions. More than half of all US abortions are medication abortions, according to the Guttmacher Institute, and questions concerning the legality of these abortions have proliferated since the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade. A separate suit also filed yesterday by a North Carolina doctor challenges that state’s ban, but abortion opponents have their own suit pending in Texas to try to overturn the FDA’s drug approval.



TOGETHER WITH REVELA

Meet your new skin savior <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xbmg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3JmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7998d0a6> Revela <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xbmg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfaaa04d1>
Did you know you start losing skin elasticity (aka the ability to stretch and bounce back into place) as early as your 20s? Thanks to Revela, you can now help restore your skin’s structure.

Kicking off their new skincare line is Fibroquin Essence, a revolutionary new formula featuring Fibroquin™, their proprietary, AI-discovered molecule that tackles one of the most challenging skin issues for aging skin <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xbmg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C15b6209d>: the loss of volume, tightness, and elasticity.

Fibroquin™ rejuvenates skin by supporting its collagen biopathway, enabling skin to remain lifted, toned, and supple without any irritation. In a clinical trial, 93% of participants showed a significant improvement in skin elasticity by week 8.

Get 15% off your first purchase here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xbmg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5f934d97>.



BUSINESS NEWS

Short seller firm targets world’s 4th-richest person <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb20_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D7c85ffd1> The Simpsons Mr. Burns <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb20_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E7c85ffd1> The Simpsons/20th Television Animation via Giphy
A US-based short seller has set its sights on a Goliath-sized target. The firm, Hindenburg Research, released a 100-page report on Tuesday alleging <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb24_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C61fc2f8e> that the Adani Group, led by the world’s fourth richest person—Gautam Adani—was “pulling the largest con in corporate history.”

According to Hindenburg, Adani Group (one of India’s largest business conglomerates that’s seen as “too big to fail,” given Indian taxpayers’ exposure to it) has run a “brazen stock manipulation and accounting fraud scheme” for decades, using shell entities to siphon off taxpayer money. Adani Group companies lost $12 billion in market value after the report’s release—something that, if you own a conglomerate, you don’t want to happen.

Adani himself dropped a whole spot on the world’s richest list, falling below Jeff Bezos and just out of the top three.

In response, Adani Group dismissed the allegations and accused Hindenburg of timing the report’s release in bad faith to undermine an upcoming stock sale.

What's at stake: This report makes Adani Group the largest target of Hindenburg Research, and it’s a test of the firm’s power. Hindenburg was relatively unknown until 2020, when its report on then-hot EV maker Nikola became a pillar in the government’s fraud case against the company’s founder.—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb28_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf6124262>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb3A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4421e5f7>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb3E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2842d96d>  

HOUSING

The viral house afire will live on as YouTube content <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb3I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D748c9a38> Tennessee house photo on fire next to sold sign. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb3I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E748c9a38> Illustration: Francis Scialabba, Photo: Zillow
A $1.5 million Tennessee mansion went viral this week…despite its Zillow listing using a photo of it literally on fire. And in case you were wondering if buying homes is still hard: It’s already under contract <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb60f11d1>.

The hopeful buyer, Mike Thakur, plans to vlog his restoration process, riding the property’s wave of internet virality and milking that charred house for as much content as possible.

The burnt home…sits on almost five acres of land in Franklin, TN, and includes a bunch of grand staircases, an outdoor kitchen, and a detached guesthouse—where Thakur and his family will live while they fix up the main manor. The house had a fire in September that caused significant damage, but in 2020 (pre-fire) it sold for $10 million, according to a press release from Newswires.

We don’t know how much the self-described content creator/serial entrepreneur is paying for the house, but it was only listed last Tuesday and had a lot of interest from potential buyers, according to the realtors.

Big picture: There’s also growing interest in non-burned down homes. Redfin data found that pending house sales in the US rose 3% last month, the first increase since October 2021. After a tumultuous year, housing demand seems to be rising slowly from the ashes.—MM

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Parks and Recreation/NBC via Giphy
Stat: Corporate America may not be fully on board with pay transparency just yet (or maybe there are just a ton of jobs available right now in the $90,000 to $900,000 range), but the newest entrants to the workforce aren’t keen to put on real pants for multiple rounds of interviews only to discover the job pays less than their teenage babysitting gig. According to Adobe's Future Workforce Study, 85% of the 1,000 recent and soon-to-be college grads surveyed said they were less likely <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb3c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4858472c> to apply for a job if the salary range wasn’t in the job posting.

Quote: “Being homosexual isn’t a crime.”

Pope Francis called laws criminalizing homosexuality unjust during a wide-ranging interview <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb3g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8ea68e88> with the Associated Press, and said Catholic bishops who support them need to undergo “a process of conversion.” The pope, who despite previous statements hinting at a greater acceptance of LGBTQ rights has not moved to change church doctrine on the issue, maintained that homosexuality is “a sin,” but noted: “It’s also a sin to lack charity with one another.”

Tesla <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb3o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf4cb8502> reported record profits yesterday and said it would work to try to speed up its car production.

Chevron <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb0E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca26c57a1> will buy back $75 billion of its stock after scoring mega profits last year.

Microsoft <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb0I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd4fdb71e> suffered a global cloud outage that briefly locked users out of multiple Microsoft 365 services, including Teams and Outlook, yesterday morning.

The glitch <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb0M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc706d2de> that wreaked havoc on New York stock trading on Tuesday morning was caused by a “manual error” involving a disaster recovery system that wasn’t reset at the start of the day, the NYSE said.

The SEC <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb0Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5b5e9567> is finally making moves to ban conflicts of interest by entities that create asset-backed securities, a practice that helped cause the 2008 financial crisis.

Three headlines and a lie

Three of these headlines are real and one is faker than your to-do list the week before a vacation. Can you spot the odd one out?

Rare “watermelon” comet is expected to pass <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb0k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0fd6bf65> by Earth this summer, but the colorblind population won’t be able to see it

Swedish government moves <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb0o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca801829f> to get rid of permits needed for dancing

Stolen hot dog statue returned <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb0s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C85f222d2> to West Virginia restaurant owner

 TOGETHER WITH

RAD Diversified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZUU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQyJmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9c12e696> 
Good morning. Today is National Compliment Day, which…isn’t a real holiday, but it is an excuse to say something nice to someone today.

But not all compliments are created equal. While procrastinating writing the newsletter, we discussed the best types of compliments you can get. A few we came up with:

When someone asks for your recipe at the potluck

When a high school friend’s parents remember your name (or pretty close)

“I see you've been flossing!”—your dentist

Of course, this is not an exhaustive list. Reply with the compliments that give you an especially potent dopamine high.

—Max Knoblauch, Sam Klebanov, Abby Rubenstein, Neal Freyman

PODCASTS

The day the podcasts died <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaFQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Da475ef74> Spotify <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaFQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ea475ef74> Hannah Minn
The corporate podcasting boom may be ending, not with a too-long preamble before the guest, but a whimper. Spotify announced <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaFU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce18f8052> yesterday that it will lay off about 600 employees, or 6% of its workforce, in the latest Big Tech recession hedge. The shakeup could signal a pivot in the company’s podcast strategy.

Like most of the other major tech companies making cuts, Spotify cited overly ambitious pandemic growth as the primary cause, and CEO Daniel Ek took “full accountability” for the move. Along with the layoffs, Ek announced a major departure from the audio streamer: Chief Content Officer Dawn Ostroff, who was the driving force behind the company’s $1+ billion podcasting arms race to sign deals with companies like Gimlet and high-profile talent like Barack and Michelle Obama, Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, and Joe Rogan.

Although the layoffs don’t specifically target Spotify’s podcasting staff, the departure of Ostroff is yet another sign that the company is slowing down its full-steam-ahead approach to the space. Earlier this month, Bloomberg reported the company froze its US budget for new podcasts. The company also didn’t re-up its exclusive deal with Brené Brown, and back in October it pulled 11 originals from the platform.

Overzealous for pods

The tech industry megadeals of the pandemic may have been premature—podcasting made up just 7% of total listening on Spotify in Q1 2022, the company said, despite the massive investment in tentpole shows. And the exclusive show model that makes popular shows available only to subscribers of a given streamer hasn’t proven wildly successful—the Gimlet and Parcast unions announced that making certain shows Spotify exclusives reduced their listenership by, in some instances, as much as 75%.

Zoom out: Sirius XM and Amazon Music have also hit the brakes on pods, reducing signing offers and increasing their share of advertising revenue. On the whole, 2022 just wasn’t the best year to talk into a microphone. According to data compiled by Chartr, the number of new shows created last year dropped 80% from 2020. —MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaFY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C58d79cec>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaFc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B96a2e9c0>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaFg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd9cbc5b9>   

TOGETHER WITH RAD DIVERSIFIED

REIT 101: Please take your seat <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZUU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQyJmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C02490307> RAD Diversified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZUU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQyJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8b5ce790>
First, a quick lesson.

Real estate investment trusts (REITs) own real estate properties that generate income, equity, or both. There are public and private REITs, which trade on and off the stock market.

And there are public, non-traded REITs. These aren’t traded on the stock market, but are SEC-qualified and regulated to give investors more transparency.

Introducing RAD Diversified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZUU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQyJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C67fc6f63> and their flagship RADD REIT:

Stock price has grown 122.22% (as of Oct. 26, 2022) since October 2019

Amassed over $100m in properties and offered 13% in distributions back to investors in 2022

The minimum investment is $1,000 and investors can redeem their shares 2x/year. Find out how the RADD REIT <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZUU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQyJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb0f8ea0f> can help build your wealth into a legacy.



WORLD

Tour de headlines Computer code in the shape of Microsoft's logo Francis Scialabba
ChatGPT passes one business school exam, gets billions in investment. Microsoft announced yesterday that it had made a “multiyear, multibillion dollar investment <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaFk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C353e29b6>” in OpenAI, the company behind the ChatGPT chatbot whose latest accomplishment <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaFo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C83389b01> is getting a grade in the B range on a Wharton Business School test. The Windows-maker—which recently laid off 10,000 humans and wants to use the AI to make Bing a real competitor to Google, among other things—didn’t give an exact figure for how much its sinking into the business, but earlier reports said it was looking to invest ~$10 billion on top of the $1 billion it already gave OpenAI in 2019.

Covid shots might get more like flu shots. The FDA released a proposal yesterday to streamline the immunization schedule <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaC0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc64f64bf> for Covid-19 that would treat the jab similarly to your annual flu vaccine. As with the flu, a group of experts would meet yearly to determine which variants should be targeted, and then a once-a-year shot would be made available to the public. The agency is mulling the shift at a moment when only 15% of Americans who are eligible for the most recent Covid booster shot have gotten one. On Thursday an FDA committee will vote on whether to recommend the plan.

CRIME

A murder trial worthy of a true crime series begins <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaF8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D157e0239> Alex Murdaugh on trial <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaF8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E157e0239> WFLA News Channel 8
A murder trial for the true crime podcasts began <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaTA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C173fd5d8> yesterday. Alex Murdaugh, a prominent lawyer and the scion of an important South Carolina legal dynasty, is accused of murdering his wife and son. The trial is happening in Walterboro, SC, a small city located in the jurisdiction where three generations of Murdaughs had served as prosecuting attorneys.

Murdaugh’s alleged crime resume

In 2021 Murdaugh’s wife and son were shot and killed at the family’s hunting property, and a year later prosecutors charged him with the crime. They contend he committed the double murder to win sympathy and divert attention from his shady financial dealings and the legal troubles from a fatal boating accident involving his son. Murdaugh maintains his innocence.

In total, there are more than 100 indictments against Alex Murdaugh. In addition to the alleged murders, he had also been accused of a litany of financial crimes, including:

A multimillion-dollar fraud scheme that siphoned money from his family law firm and its clients

Diverting of funds from the estate of his housekeeper who died at his home from a “trip and fall accident”

Insurance fraud related to an alleged attempt to have his cousin murder him so his older son, Buster, could claim a $10 million life insurance payout

Looking forward: Murdaugh faces life behind bars if convicted of the murder charges.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaTE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce89cc937>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaTI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5a216b53>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaTM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7f49d7a2>  

MARKETING

‘Woke’ firestorm melts M&M’s candy mascots <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaTQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dd1885975> An M&M character standing in front of a retirement sign <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaTQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ed1885975> Illustration: Dianna “Mick” McDougall, Sources: M&M’S, Getty Images
Layoffs are hitting the confectionary industry: M&Ms announced yesterday that it’s sending its colorful cast of candy characters into “indefinite <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaTU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2db69529>” retirement.

In explaining <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaTY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2bdc8add> why it cut its ‘spokescandies,’ brand owner Mars didn’t point to a looming recession or hiring too many candy spokespeople during the pandemic. It appears these characters became too much of a PR headache for the company over criticism that they had lost their sex appeal.

The backstory: Last year, M&M’s began to make changes to its candy spokespeople to be more “representative of the customer” and to keep up with cultural trends—for instance, by replacing the green M&M’s high heels with sneakers.

To some right-wing commentators, these changes reflected the “woke” movement’s hijacking of American culture. Fox News host Tucker Carlson has been the most vocal critic of the M&M’s makeover, saying on his show last January that “M&M’s will not be satisfied until every last cartoon character is deeply unappealing and totally androgynous. Until the moment you wouldn’t want to have a drink with any one of them.”

In its statement, a defeated-sounding M&Ms acknowledged “even a candy’s shoes can be polarizing.” It said it will replace its spokescandies with former SNL star Maya Rudolph.—NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaTc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C40db5721>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaTg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B5b20bfb8>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaTk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd6bd2017>

Key performance indicators Gif of Lizzo dancing in a workout studio with two other women Giphy
Stat: If you’ve been seeing even more spandex-clad people than usual lately, they might actually be going to work out rather than making dubious fashion choices. Fitness studios <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaWE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C488c2370> are seeing 40% more foot traffic this January than last January, according to retail analytics firm Placer.ai. Still, gym traffic remains 3% below pre-pandemic levels in 2019.

Quote: “There is some karma around 420 although I should question if that is good or bad karma at this point.”

Elon Musk insisted in front of a jury yesterday that in his 2018 tweet saying he had funding secured to take Tesla private at $420 a share <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaWI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C507a7ba0>, the number was “not a joke” but instead a 20% premium over the stock price. Testifying as he defends himself against a lawsuit from shareholders who claim the tweet cost them money, the Tesla CEO maintained that any other association was mere coincidence. Still, it wouldn’t be the only time Musk sneaked an apparent marijuana joke into his business dealings: His offer to buy Twitter was for $54.20 per share.
