Markets: The Dow snapped <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fZj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C332ceb35> its four-day winning streak after Goldman Sachs posted its biggest earnings whiff in more than 10 years (Q4 was miserable for dealmaking). Crypto prices, though, continued to tick higher, and bitcoin has now clawed back all of its losses since the implosion of FTX.

 

SOCIAL MEDIA

TikTok is dropping out of college <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fZz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D39689528> Longhorn over phone with x over it. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fZz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E39689528> Illustration: Dianna “Mick” McDougall, Source: Alano Design/Getty Images
The University of Texas at Austin, one of the largest public universities in the nation, banned <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9faD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb8084d01> TikTok from its wi-fi and across its wired networks yesterday—and not because someone made a call-out video of Bevo’s Shein haul.

The university is complying with Texas Gov. Greg Abbott’s recent decision to forbid state employees from having the app on government-issued devices. And it’s just the latest major US campus to confine its students to Instagram Reels: Public universities in at least five states, including Auburn University in Alabama, the University of Montana, and schools in the University System of Georgia, have banned the app.

The backstory: In the last few months, more than half of US states have barred TikTok from government devices, according to CNN. Government officials all the way up to President Biden—who last month signed legislation that included a TikTok ban for federal devices—are on edge about the national security and privacy concerns around the app, which is owned by China’s ByteDance. In the past year, ByteDance has admitted to tracking journalists who cover it, and accessing US TikTok user data from China.

These college bans will mostly be...annoying

When you tell a college student not to do something, they’re probably going to find a way to do it. Tech-savvy undergrads are skirting the bans by using their own data or personal wi-fi to access one of their favorite social media platforms.

Still, the bans are causing uncertainty, and everyone from communications professors to the people running university mascot accounts are wondering how these restrictions will affect their work. Think of the college improv teams trying to Impractical Jokers people, or the sorority rush chairs who use the app to hype recruitment.

But it goes beyond depleting DG’s follower count: Some critics also argue that banning TikTok on university wi-fi hinders <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9faT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C957bbe04> professors’ abilities to better understand the app and how it spreads the misinformation politicians are so concerned about.

Bottom line: It’s unlikely that most students at UT-Austin, Auburn, or any other school that decides to ban TikTok in the future will ditch the app. According to Pew, 67% of 13- to 17-year-olds have used the platform, making it the second most popular app behind YouTube.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9faj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C69302e12>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9faz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8bda63c1>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fbD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf2023133>   

TOGETHER WITH FUNDRISE

Invest smarter, not harder <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9aeT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDgmbHA9dGl0bGU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8f71e2df> Fundrise <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9aeT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDgmbHA9aW1hZ2U/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8a8a8adc>
There are a lotta ways to diversify your portfolio, but not many that are built specifically to protect your investments as much as they are to capture growth. There is one alternative investment manager to put on your radar that stands above the rest.

We know what you’re thinking: In this economy?

That’s right: We’re talking about Fundrise. With a decade-long track record of outperformance through various market environments, they can help you invest smarter by adding real estate private equity to your portfolio. Even better, Fundrise expects 2023 to be one of the most opportune real estate investing environments of the last decade.

Find out how Fundrise’s real estate portfolio <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9aeT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDgmbHA9dGV4dDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0a4444b3> is well positioned for the long haul and join over 350k other investors here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9aeT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDgmbHA9dGV4dDI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccf3bff01>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines Police officers carry Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg out of a crowd of protesters. Hesham Elsherif/Getty Images
Greta Thunberg hauled away by police at German coal mine protest. The climate activist and other demonstrators were detained <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fbT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb724970f> (and later released) by police yesterday while protesting the demolition of a village to allow for the expansion of a coal mine. Protesters had been trying to defend the town, called Lützerath, for years, turning it into a symbol of government hypocrisy on climate change. But the energy crisis spurred by the war in Ukraine and Germany’s desperate search for more energy sources, lent new urgency to the coal mine’s expansion. Last week, hundreds of protesters who had been living in Lützerath were cleared out by police.

Disney’s proxy battle is getting nasty. The Mouse House is not pleased that activist investor Nelson Peltz is trying to gain a spot on its board. Yesterday, the company bashed Peltz <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fbj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbdf6490b> for lacking a “basic understanding” of the media industry (Peltz has a history of pushing for changes at consumer giants like P&G and Unilever). Last week, Peltz launched a proxy battle with the Disney board after accumulating a $900 million stake. He claims that Disney’s acquisition spree has harmed shareholders, and he’s called out the company’s fumbled execution of its CEO succession plan.

🪓 Microsoft prepares the pink slips. The tech giant is following its peers and will reportedly lay off <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fUj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Caf2bec91> a large number of employees today: a rumored 5% of its workforce, equivalent to more than 10,000 people. CEO Satya Nadella recently said that Microsoft wasn’t “immune to the global changes,” and predicted a “challenging” next two years. Still, Microsoft isn’t totally hunkering down. It’s also prepping its largest startup investment ever: $10 billion <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fUz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd395f46c> into ChatGPT creator OpenAI.

WORLD

A shrinking China isn’t good for anyone <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fbz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Df2db37db> Chart showing China's population <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fbz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ef2db37db> Morning Brew
China recorded <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fcD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C904b0b0d> a population drop in 2022—its first in over six decades, government data shared on Tuesday showed. The last time this happened was in 1959–1961, when the abysmal Great Leap Forward economic initiative caused widespread famines.

Though it occurred sooner than demographers predicted, the current decline isn’t shocking—China's birthrate has been dropping for years, reaching a record low in modern history in 2022. Observers blame the high cost of parenthood, strict COVID lockdowns, and decades of the restrictive one-child rule. As a result of the country’s aging population, funerals outnumbered baby showers by about 850,000 last year.

Everyone–not just China–should be worried

An aging population usually creates a noxious economic cocktail of less working-age people available to fill jobs and more retirees requiring costly care. This can slow economic growth (any gains in the daytime television industry notwithstanding), which for various reasons <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fcT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1f0970ad> in China was already at a multi-decade low of just 3% last year.

If things go south for the world’s second-largest economy, the rest of the world would feel it, too. Fewer workers in the exporting powerhouse of China could mean more expensive products for consumers globally, as well as reduced demand for goods and services that the country sources from abroad.

Zoom out: Some experts are staying optimistic about China’s future, pointing to its ongoing embrace of less labor-intensive industries like semiconductors and finance, while manufacturing shifts to countries with more abundant workers.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fcj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5da1a6a7>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fcz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C018ca949>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fdD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb9da1f52>  

FOOD

Tinned fish is the hottest new extremely old trend <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fdT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D38344975> Canned tuna <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fdT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E38344975> Francis Scialabba
Whoever heads up PR for the anchovy lobby deserves a few extra zeroes at the end of their paycheck. After reportedly being killed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fdj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7dffad69> by millennials just four years ago, canned fish—like tuna and sardines—are surging <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fdz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C78a286ad> in popularity, receiving a huge boost over the last year from TikTok and sustainability trends.

Sales of canned seafood shot up by 10% (to $2.7 billion) in the US in 2022, according to Euromonitor International. The primary driver? TikToks in which aesthetic, photogenic tinned fish boards are prepared as part of a romantic date night charcuterie.

While some users claim the trend is “giving Great Depression,” it doesn’t seem to be slowing down. Over the course of last year, users on the app posted their #tinnedfish dinners—some claiming to do this every week—and the hashtag now has more than 26 million views.

Companies are jumping aboard the cannedwagon, utilizing vintage design styles in packaging and developing new strategies, like selling pairing kits, to move fish. Scout Canning, a popular Vancouver-based brand, told the WSJ that its revenues jumped 82% in 2022.

Could be nice for Earth, too: Tinned fish’s long shelf life, lack of refrigeration requirements, and recyclable packaging make for a more climate-friendly protein than many other meats.—MK

TOGETHER WITH REVELA

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators A man swiping right and left using virtual reality headset @tomgalle via Giphy
Stat: Can you put a price on love? Match Group is testing a $500/month subscription <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fQT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2c1664c3> to Tinder, according to Bloomberg. And while that Tinder feature is still in experimental mode, Match is moving ahead with new subscriptions for Hinge, another of its dating apps, rolling out a souped-up version for “highly motivated daters” that costs up to $60/month. We’d totally sign up if it meant never seeing a “Looking for a Jim to my Pam” on a profile again.

Quote: “This song sucks.”

At least one person isn’t impressed by the imitative powers of ChatGPT. On his blog, the singer-songwriter Nick Cave blasted a song that was written by ChatGPT “in the style of Nick Cave,” calling it “a grotesque mockery of what it is to be human.” Cave’s entire post on the AI-written song, in which he reflects on songwriting more broadly, is worth reading <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fQj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C510ff8ce>.

What else is brewing
Apple <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fRD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3953b994> announced new MacBook Pros equipped with its latest and greatest chips.

Restaurant workers <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fRT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce2d3afc0> are paying for lobbying that depresses their wages, a NYT report shows.

Another AI copyright lawsuit dropped <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fRj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cab132ebf>: Getty Images is suing the creator of AI art tool Stable Diffusion for scraping images protected by copyright to train its software.

For the gram

We’re handing over the mic to our copyeditor, Holly, who’s going to give you all a grammar quiz. Can you spot the stylistic/grammatical errors in the following Brew sentences?

(No literary sensibilities were harmed in the making of this puzzle. We caught each error before the fish emoji hit Slack.)

A survey from Resume Builder found that 90% of companies will require a return to the office this year, signaling a shift away from the softly-enforced hybrid policies that became popular during the pandemic.

The world’s richest person and CEO of luxury goods conglomerate LVMH named his daughter Delphine Arnault CEO of the fashion house Dior, setting up a sibling battle for succession of his company.

With a narrow majority in the House, these early days are key for the GOP in organizing and setting the stage for their agenda leading up to the 2024 general election.

NATO crisis diffused. NATO member Poland said that the missile strike that killed two people there on Tuesday was likely launched unintentionally by Ukraine as it tried to defend itself from Russian shelling.

ANSWER

A writing tip you can keep in your pocket (if it’s not already there) is that adverbs ending in -ly should not be hyphenated. Here “softly-enforced” should become “softly enforced.”

If Bernard Arnault had more than one daughter, this sentence would be correct. But he only has one, so “Delphine Arnault” should be offset by commas.

Here is a classic case of a misplaced modifier, as it sounds like the early days won a narrow majority in the House. The fix we went with: “With a narrow majority in the House, the GOP needs to optimize…”

The problem here is homonyms. We meant “defused,” which means to make less tense. “Diffused” means spreading out.

Markets: Markets were closed for MLK Day in the US yesterday, but they were hopping across the pond in Britain and Europe. Stocks closed higher in both France and Germany. And in the UK, the blue-chip FTSE 100 index nearly matched <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XZz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C827ad93d> a record high it clinched in 2018 as investors continue to get hope from signals that global inflation is beginning to ease.

 

WORK

Employers are trying to take back the power on RTO <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XaD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dc043b5f0> A large open floor plan office from a scene in Orson Welles's The Trial. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XaD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ec043b5f0> The Trial/Studio Canal
The ongoing tug of war between remote employees (who are feeling more productive and less burnt out) and their employers (who are feeling bad about paying for an office) could experience a balance shift in 2023. Major companies, aware of fears about a potential recession, are issuing directives <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XaT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C85e847b2> to come into the office for more days, sometimes under the threat of termination.

Last week, Disney CEO Bob Iger told hybrid staff that, starting on March 1, they must return to the office four days a week. Two days later, Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz announced a similar three-day RTO requirement, expressing irritation at internal badge swipe data that revealed employees were not “meeting their minimum promise” regarding hybrid work.

Employees at Vanguard, Paycom, and News Corp have also received recent orders to phase out remote work in the new year. A survey from Resume Builder found that 90% of companies will require a return to the office this year, signaling a shift away from the softly enforced hybrid policies that became popular during the pandemic.

A controversial resolution

That doesn’t mean employees are excited to add commute time or “getting asked about weekend plans” back into their lives: According to a recent Gallup poll, 34% of remote-capable workers want to work from home permanently and just 3% want to work in the office full time. A Monster survey in September found that 40% of workers would quit if they had to come into the office even one day a week.

But there’s an issue with that: Remote work is getting hard to find. Between February and October 2022, remote job listings fell from 20% to 14% of all listings on LinkedIn. Now, even more employers seem empowered to demand <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XTT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C22719f95> in-office time.

Remote hope is not lost: On the flip side, Twitter CEO and vocal remote work critic Elon Musk recently ordered Seattle employees to WFH as a cost-cutting measure.—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Xaj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C82cd18cf>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Xaz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce4aaf8ea>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XbD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc88bab99>   

TOGETHER WITH LIQUIDPISTON

The little, lighter engine that could <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9NUj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5NiZscD10aXRsZQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca5bd72ed> LiquidPiston <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9NUj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5NiZscD1pbWFnZQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C03974cd8>
It’s called the X-Engine™. And even though it’s smaller than other engines, Little X delivers up to 10x the power-to-weight ratio <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9NUj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5NiZscD10ZXh0MQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce79b3206> of legacy engines and 30% more fuel efficiency.

But that’s just the start. When the EV market grows 380% by 2030, there will be a shortage of precious metals like lithium. That’s where X-Engine comes in, enabling hybrid electric cars to use 80% smaller batteries. 

It’s no wonder X-Engine’s creators at LiquidPiston <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9NUj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5NiZscD10ZXh0Mg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3cfe612e> have already secured $30m in contracts to do everything from shrinking generators to flying military drones 2x farther.

Become a LiquidPiston shareholder as they take the tiny-but-mighty X-Engine full throttle.

Don’t just say “I think I can.” Invest in LiquidPiston’s X-Engine today <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9NUj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5NiZscD10ZXh0Mw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0a53b578>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines Mob boss Matteo Messina Denaro after he was arrested In Sicily Carabinieri via Getty Images
Mafia boss nabbed. Italy’s most wanted man, Matteo Messina Denaro, a Mafia boss who had been on the lam for more than 30 years, was arrested <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XbT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C12ef6a80> in Sicily yesterday. Messina Denaro, who once bragged that you could “fill a cemetery” with his victims, is allegedly the head of the Cosa Nostra syndicate. Despite dodging authorities since 1993, he has been convicted in absentia and given life sentences for his role in various crimes, including the murder of two anti-Mafia prosecutors; bombings in Florence, Milan, and Rome that killed 10; and the slaying of the young son of a Mafioso who turned state’s witness.

Ukrainian soccer club pledges $25 million for soldiers. Rinat Akhmetov, Ukraine’s richest man and the owner of the Shakhtar Donetsk football club, announced the donation <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Xbj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cce602086> yesterday after agreeing to trade star player Mykhaylo Mudryk to Chelsea FC in a ~$110 million deal. The cash will go to soldiers and their families to cover a variety of needs, including medical treatment and psychological support. Akhmetov said he is confident Ukraine will win the war against Russia and “we will play a friendly against Chelsea at Donbass Arena in a Ukrainian Donetsk.”

Elon Musk heads to court over Tesla tweet. Elon Musk regularly gets into spats over his tweets—he seems to enjoy it so much that he bought the platform, but he’s probably less enthused about the legal trial <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Xbz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0f3a3102> starting today over one particular tweet from 2018. In it, Musk (who never met a 4/20 reference he didn’t like) said he had secured funding to take Tesla private for $420 per share, and investors are suing Musk and Tesla since the deal never happened. So far, Musk is expected to testify this week, and his odds don’t look great: The judge already determined that the tweet was false and reckless, but now a jury will weigh whether Musk knew it was false and whether it was material to investors.

TECH

Artists sue AI art generators <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XcD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Da1c3e8eb> A corgi eats an avocado in space <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XcD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ea1c3e8eb> Midjourney
Art made by AI has won prizes, been displayed in museums, and taken over Twitter profile pics, but not everyone’s happy with how it turns users into elven princesses.

Three artists are suing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XcT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd1904dd4> Midjourney, Stability AI, and DeviantArt for their use of an AI art-generating tool called Stable Diffusion. The artists—Sarah Andersen, Kelly McKernan, and Karla Ortiz—allege the tool violates millions of artists’ copyrights.

How AI art generators work: Stable Diffusion has been fed billions of images scraped from the web in order to train its AI on how to do things like identify an “avocado.” So when a user types “corgi eats an avocado in space” into an AI art generator that uses Stable Diffusion, it creates new works <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Xcj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca06ef6f9> based on the images it’s analyzed.

But whether it’s derivative or plagiarism is up for debate

The suit claims that Stable Diffusion cobbles together pieces of copyrighted images, but creators of AI art-generating tools argue that their use of existing pictures to train the AI to make new ones is covered by “fair use” doctrine—which allows using copyrighted materials for “transformative” purposes.

Bottom line: This case could set an important precedent on training AI tools that could go way beyond the art world.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Xcz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf9b7ab8b>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XdD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C151ff2a3>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XdT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfe6f7f55>  

SCIENCE

Lasers to lightning: ‘Follow me’ <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Xdj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Df8ce3514> Lightning in the night sky <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Xdj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ef8ce3514> Getty Images/assalve
Watch out, Zeus: Scientists haven’t completely mastered lightning, but they’ve successfully used a laser to divert its direction. A study <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Xdz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce57548a5> published yesterday described an experiment in which a laser was shot at a storm cloud from atop a Swiss mountain to successfully direct lightning toward the ground.

This marks the first time the method worked outside a lab, and that’s a big step forward for public safety.

Lightning causes billions of dollars in damage and claims over 4,000 lives a year.

It would be much worse had Benjamin Franklin not invented the lightning rod, which to this day remains the go-to for protection from lightning. But the man would have turned 317 today, so it’s about time his invention was updated—especially since the Franklin rod is a godsend for your home, but it’s insufficient for bigger places like airports or wind farms.

So, how did we one-up a founding father?

Scientists unleashed a rapid-fire barrage of laser pulses at thunderclouds, creating a path of charged particles that lightning was more likely to follow. Four lightning bolts were steered toward a rod mounted on top of a telecom tower that is a frequent target of lightning strikes.

Looking forward: It’ll be a while before you’ll be able to catch regular laser-lightning shows in the night sky due to an eye-popping price tag: The system used in the experiment costs $2.17 billion.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XeD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C76d12d30>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XeT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C323a745e>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Xej9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9c76f63f>

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Scrooge McDuck Scrooge McDuck/Disney via Giphy
Stat: The world has created $42 trillion in new wealth since 2020—but you probably didn’t see a big chunk of that hit your bank account, because 63% of it is in the hands of the richest 1% of the population, per a report <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XQT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C49b54575> released by Oxfam yesterday. Advocating for steeper taxes on the wealthiest as the world’s most influential people arrived in Davos to ski and try to solve all the world’s problems, the charity noted that for every $1 of that new wealth earned by a person in the bottom 90%, a billionaire managed to snag another by $1.7 million.

Quote: “We love to quote King in and around the holiday…but then we refuse to live King 365 days of the year.”

Speaking at a commemorative service at Ebenezer Baptist Church, where Martin Luther King Jr. preached, the civil rights leader’s youngest daughter, Bernice King, delivered a reminder <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XQj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0686fd76> yesterday that we’ve still got a long way to go as a society to realize her father’s dream. Acknowledging that his challenging words are sometimes flattened into platitudes in today’s political discourse, she sought real action instead, saying, “Dr. King, the inconvenient King, puts some demands on us to change our ways.”

Read: Should we bring back the woolly mammoth? Scientists are getting close. (BBC <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XQz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3c1678d1>)

WHAT ELSE IS BREWING

The White House Counsel’s <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XRD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6dda2241> office said there are no visitor logs for President Biden’s Delaware home (as is typical for presidents’ private homes), in response to a demand from Republican lawmakers to see logs after classified documents were found there.

Ryan Cohen <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XRT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd5d1b5cb>, an investor known as the meme-stock king, has built up a stake in Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba and is pushing it for more stock buybacks, according the WSJ.

China’s <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XTj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3d03c478> population declined in 2022 for the first time since the early 1960s, and India is poised to overtake it as the world’s most populous country soon.

The Belfer family <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XRj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2012b595>, a New York oil dynasty known for its philanthropy that previously invested in Enron and Bernie Madoff, now ranks among FTX’s shareholders, too.

Taliban officials <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30267060.104296/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9XRz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjY3MDYwLjEwNDI5Ng/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2999868f> are buying blue checks on Twitter.

ANSWER

Yes: Disney

Yes: Keurig Dr Pepper

 TOGETHER WITH

Yogi Tea <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9TYT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzAmbHA9bG9nbw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5b0028cb> 
Good morning. Today is Martin Luther King Jr. Day. Not only is it a federal holiday to honor the legacy of Dr. King, but it’s also the only federal holiday to be designated as a National Day of Service. So let this be a nudge to roll up your sleeves and get active in your local community—you can make a positive difference.

—Neal Freyman

*Stock data as of market close, cryptocurrency data as of 11:00pm ET. Here's what these numbers mean. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zMT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C282f7b8f>

Markets: The US stock and bond markets are closed for MLK Day, so we’ll have to wait another day to see if this year-opening rally will extend into a third week. But crypto trades 24/7, and the same hopeful inflation news that’s been lifting stocks has also given life to beaten-down cryptocurrencies. Bitcoin gained for the 11th straight day on Saturday, topping $20,000 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VVz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9ef75cfd> for the first time in more than two months.

 

TECH

How to spot cheating in a ChatGPT world <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VWD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dbb43dc44> A man looking at his hand to cheat on a test. It says <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VWD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ebb43dc44> 5secondfilms via Giphy
As more students realize that ChatGPT can write five-paragraph essays equally as good as—if not significantly better than—what they’re capable of, teachers are scrambling for tools that can detect whether they’re grading the writing of a young human or a young robot.

Several cheating-detection tools have sprung up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VWT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2d3c7817> in the few months since ChatGPT, a conversational language model from OpenAI, arrived on the scene. The most-talked about one is GPTZero <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VWj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cea1ab833>, which was developed by, of all people…a student.

Over winter break, 22-year-old Princeton student Edward Tian created an app that determines the likelihood that a piece of text was written by a human or by ChatGPT. While it probably didn’t make him the most popular dude on campus, the app is getting more than 7 million views as of last week.

Apps like GPTZero are becoming increasingly sought after as older cheating detection tools become obsolete in the ChatGPT era.

Remember Turnitin?

Many of us who’ve been tasked with explaining the green light at the end of The Great Gatsby have had to submit those essays to Turnitin.com to make sure we didn’t copy it from Wikipedia. That was effective…before ChatGPT. But what makes ChatGPT different is that it theoretically creates an original response of text every time you query it. That’s not what Turnitin is designed for: It cross-checks your work against an existing database of writing.

Turnitin, of course, is on the case: It says it’s currently testing a tool that can detect AI-generated text, and plans to open it up to the public later this year.

But as good as these apps get, ChatGPT and its fellow language models will also evolve—and some education experts say teachers will have to also rely on the oldest tool in the book to mitigate cheating: their noggin. Teachers will need to understand the differences (which do exist) between AI and human writing. They’ll also likely need to overhaul their teaching process <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VLT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5273cf40> to minimize cheating opportunities—for instance, by setting clear expectations with students about the role of ChatGPT in classrooms, or by tweaking their assignments to reward skills ChatGPT hasn’t mastered…

Yet.

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VXz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C009affff>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9WMD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2c7c4801>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9WMT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc8003671>   

TOGETHER WITH YOGI TEA

Warm up to well-being <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9TYT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzAmbHA9dGl0bGU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc7a8231f> Yogi Tea <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9TYT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzAmbHA9aW1hZ2U/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C80568d8a>
When you think of well-being, exercises like journaling, yoga, and deep breathing probably come to mind. And while those are wonderful practices, they aren’t the only ways to take care of yourself.

Yogi Tea <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9TYT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzAmbHA9dGV4dDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C356eaf10> recognizes that well-being looks different to everyone and can change on the daily. Today it could mean cooking your favorite meal. Next week, it could mean scream-singing a throwback jam.

With 40+ herbal, green, and black teas <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9TYT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzAmbHA9dGV4dDI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce2ab9870> made with spices and botanicals from around the world, Yogi has a flavor for every mood and expression. Each one brews a mug full of deliciousness + wellness benefits.

Find your flavor of well-being today <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9TYT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzAmbHA9dGV4dDM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfbd57553>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines Rescuers and onlookers gather at the site of a plane crash in Pokhara Krishna Mani Baral/AFP via Getty Images
Dozens killed in Nepal plane crash. At least 68 people were killed when a Yeti Airlines flight crashed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9WMj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C759c9c31> while attempting to land in the resort town of Pokhara on Sunday. A total of 72 people on board the aircraft, a twin engine ATR 72, including 15 foreign nationals. It’s Nepal’s worst plane disaster in 30 years, but plane crashes are not uncommon in this country of towering mountains, treacherous flying conditions, and weak safety standards: Since 1946, Nepal has experienced 42 fatal airplane crashes.

A Ukrainian residential building was destroyed. In the deadliest civilian attack on Ukraine in months, a Russian missile strike on a nine-story apartment block killed 30 people <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9WMz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C24171329> in the city of Dnipro on Saturday. The Ukrainian military said the missile was a supersonic Kh-22  “aircraft carrier killer” that it does not currently have the ability to intercept. As Russia ramps up its attacks after a two-week breather, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky urged Western allies to supply more weapons. Britain recently announced it would send over 14 of its primary battle tanks.

Biden classified docs update: The political chatter around classified documents ramped up over the weekend after the White House said it found <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9WND9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7fd9de41> five more pages of classified documents at President Biden’s home in Wilmington, DE, on top of the previously disclosed two batches of classified docs. Republicans who’ve just assumed power in the House are asking for visitor logs of Biden’s home, while Democrats say they’re waiting on the findings of the recently appointed special counsel before drawing conclusions.

HISTORY

Polarizing MLK monument opens in Boston <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9WNT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Db29258cd> The Embrace- a new monument to MLK and his wife in Boston <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9WNT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Eb29258cd> Lane Turner/The Boston Globe via Getty Images
On Friday, Boston city officials unveiled <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9WNj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd088ab19> the latest monument to Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.—a $10 million bronze sculpture depicting the moment MLK embraced his wife, Coretta Scott King, after Dr. King learned he won the Nobel Peace Prize in 1964. It is called The Embrace.

The completion of the 22-foot-tall statue was highly anticipated: Five years in the works, it is the largest monument to racial equity in the country, and it’s located in the Boston Common, the oldest public park in the US.

Why Boston? That was where MLK met Coretta: He was a doctoral student at BU, while she was studying at the New England Conservatory of Music. Boston Common was also the final destination of a 20,000-person-strong voting rights march Dr. King led from Roxbury in 1955.

But The Embrace hasn’t exactly been embraced <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9WNz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C23e86aaa> from a critical POV. The design of the statue, which shows four arms intertwined, was bashed online for not depicting the couple in full and for potentially giving off inappropriate vibes. Corretta Scott King’s cousin, Seneca Scott, wrote in the online journal Compact, “Ten million dollars were wasted to create a masturbatory metal homage to my legendary family members.”

The artist’s vision: Brooklyn-based sculptor Hank Willis Thomas told the Boston Globe <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9WOD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd5acce8e>, “This work is really about the capacity for each of us to be enveloped in love.”

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9WOT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C487c3c22>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9WYT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B1ef4e27c>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9WYj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8d257a1e>

TOGETHER WITH LIQUIDPISTON

LiquidPiston <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9TYj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzAmbHA9aW1hZ2U/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1f5f8626>

No wonder its creators at LiquidPiston <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30260530.3516230/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9TYj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjYwNTMwLjM1MTYyMzAmbHA9dGV4dDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C552c2d50> have already secured $30m in contracts and 79 patents (granted + pending). ANSWER

Brazil. Wasn’t expecting that, eh? Turns out that French Guiana in South America is a territory of France, and its border with Brazil is longer than mainland France’s border with any European country.

Careers

IN-N-OUT HIRING MIDWEST MANAGER: The iconic California burger joint is expanding <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9QSz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8d62086a> eastward into Tennessee, with its first locations there slated to open in 2026. When a Wawa and an In-N-Out open in the same state, the singularity will arrive.

SENIOR VP OF WAGE THEFT: New research found <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9QTD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce125d069> that quirky job titles like “chief fun officer” and “director of first impressions” are just a mechanism companies use to avoid paying employees overtime by assigning them bogus managerial titles.

FOURTH GRADE ARCHAEOLOGISTS: On Christmas morning, nine-year-old Molly Sampson found a five-inch-long tooth <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9QTT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C657cae1e> belonging to a megalodon, a now-extinct shark that was one of the largest predators in history. This was no chance discovery: Sampson has been collecting shark teeth since before she could walk and has amassed more than 400.

NUMBING NETWORKING OPPORTUNITIES: Conducting business via ice bath <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9QTj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7cc6cc53> is growing in popularity thanks to the supposed benefits of frostbite.

For sale

FEWER LOUVRE TICKETS: The Louvre will start limiting <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9QTz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca94c5304> its daily visitor count to ensure people in the museum have a “more pleasurable” experience when viewing famous works like the “Mona Lisa.”

CANDY FOR LADIES: Mars said it’s flipping <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9FLT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C974df1e9> imagery on M&M packaging to make an “all-female” bag of candy (you know, because M upside down looks like W). Looking forward to seeing their Pride Month plans for Twix.

Personal

SPAC SEEKING SPAC: Money-losing companies that recently went public via SPAC are combining <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9QUD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C34ed3693> with other SPACs to secure more funding and stay afloat. The ultimate goal is one giant SPAC that also has a streaming service.

LOOKING FOR GROCERY STORE FRIENDS: A Dutch supermarket has installed “slow checkout lanes <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9QUT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8aa609e8>” for the elderly and other people who might want to chat a bit more when they purchase their groceries. This should be an option at the Taco Bell Cantina.—MM

TOGETHER WITH FACET WEALTH

New year, new financial outlook

That’s our favorite thing about this time of year: all the fresh starts + new beginnings, like a *new* financial plan that gives you a better handle on your finances.

A Facet membership <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9QSD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzMmbHA9dGV4dDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C604395b5> can help you get a fresh financial start and ensures you have a go-to financial partner to guide you through every stage of life. As a member, you’ll receive access to a dedicated CFP® professional (the highest possible certification) who works with you one-on-one to guide you through every financial decision you face—all for a fixed membership fee.

Get two months free* <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9QSD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzMmbHA9dGV4dDI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9a763e21> when you sign up by 1/31/2023.

  SNAPSHOTS

  Photo of the week Anglers cast lines through holes on a frozen river during the annual ice fishing festival in Hwacheon Anthony Wallace/AFP via Getty Images Any idea what all these people are doing on the ice? If you guessed “fishing for trout,” you get a sticker.

This photo captures the mesmerizing spectacle of the world-famous ice fishing contest in Hwacheon, South Korea, which has historically drawn more than 1 million visitors annually (though it was paused for three years due to the pandemic). The festival is located just 12 miles from the Demilitarized Zone that separates South Korea from its northern neighbor.

  SCIENCE

  Dept. of Progress Jason Sudeikis talking about the periodic table on SNL SNL/NBC via Giphy Here are some illuminating scientific discoveries from the week to help you live better and maybe even find new worlds.

Cancer prevention is working. Overall mortality from cancer <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9QWj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3ec60548> has plunged by a third since 1991, according to a new report by the American Cancer Society. The drop, which the organization estimates has resulted in 3.8 million cancer deaths avoided, reflects improvements to cancer screening and prevention. For instance, cervical cancer rates for women in their early twenties dropped 65% following the introduction of the HPV vaccine. But there’s still more work to do: Rates of prostate cancer, which is the second largest cause of cancer death for US men, have started climbing and cases are frequently being caught in later stages.

A whole new world. NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope proved this week that it can do more than just take gorgeous photos: It discovered its first exoplanet <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9QLT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C08b3966f>, a rocky sphere about 41 light-years away from us that’s roughly the same size as Earth. But this one’s probably not a candidate to be our new digs if Elon Musk’s plans for Mars don’t pan out—the planet, named LHS 475 b, orbits a red dwarf star a whole lot closer than we do the sun, making it at least 200 degrees hotter than Earth. Still, the newbie adds to the list of 5,000+ exoplanets NASA has found so far.

🫧 A startup is sucking carbon from the air. Switzerland-based Climeworks said it has achieved a world first by pulling carbon dioxide out of the air and sticking it underground <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9QXz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8e50ca64>, where it will ultimately transform into rock. The feat has been confirmed by an independent auditor, meaning that hoovering gas out of the air, a long-held goal for several companies and a potentially important way to fight climate change, is now a real possibility.—AR



 

TOGETHER WITH THUMA

Thuma <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9QVj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzMmbHA9aW1hZ2U/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C495c4cd5>
Strong + sturdy, and no squeaks. Yep, we’re talking ’bout a platform bed frame. Specifically The Bed, aka the one perfected by Thuma <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9QVj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzMmbHA9dGV4dDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C902048b8> that’s expertly crafted with solid, upcycled wood.   ANALYSIS

  Why a bunch of VIPs will be at the same ski resort tomorrow <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9RYz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D262bfb06> Davos <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9RYz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E262bfb06>Getty Images What do German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and cellist Yo-Yo Ma have in common? They’ll both speak at the World Economic Forum’s (WEF) annual meeting in Davos this week, as economic and political elites from around the globe gather in the Swiss Alps to drink Glühwein in a ski lodge brainstorm solutions to the world’s most pressing problems.

According to the WEF <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9RZD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C42260562>, these are: climate change, inflation, confrontation between countries, threats from technology, plus the prospect of these issues combining into a “polycrisis” (like wars over scarce natural resources brought about by climate change).

What happens in Davos every year is pretty straightforward: World leaders, billionaires, heads of international NGOs, celebrities, and Nobel laureates rub elbows behind closed doors. Meanwhile, journalists lurk around, hoping to catch them in a talkative mood.

But does the WEF really achieve anything besides organizing a glitzy get-together in Europe’s highest town?

First, what is the WEF?

It’s a not-for-profit foundation that’s been around since 1971. It aims to bring together the world’s most influential people to “shape global, regional, and industry agendas.” Aside from the flagship Davos event, it runs regional summits and publishes thought leadership on economic and social issues.

The WEF’s efforts center on stakeholder capitalism, the idea that corporations should not just be profit-maximizing machines but should also look out for customers, suppliers, and local communities.

Not everyone is a fan of the Alpine ski squad

It shouldn’t come as a surprise that an organization in the business of setting up schmooze fests for the global elite has more than a few critics.

Davos skeptics note that the WEF is funded by basically every major organization under the sun. Its 2022 annual report says over half of the ~$413 million it brought in that year came from its partners, mostly corporations like Nestlé and government-run entities like the Agricultural Bank of China. It’s been accused of engaging in capitalist virtue signaling while making it easier for sponsors to lobby for their interests and advocate for business-friendly policies.

The “Great Reset” initiative, the foundation’s global post-pandemic recovery plan, has been panned as a thinly veiled effort to tip the power balance in solving global issues away from governments and toward the private sector.

Why this all matters to those without a private jet

The WEF shapes the conversation (and policies) in areas like international food security and global vaccine distribution:

* It’s a prominent supplier of narratives to news organizations, with last year’s Davos meeting getting 48,000 media mentions (and it’s already notched at least one this year).

* Its influence transcends legacy media: Popular journalist Johnny Harris was once called out <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9RZT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C972d107f> for partnering with the WEF to promote shareholder capitalism on his YouTube channel.

Big picture: Curiously enough, this year’s Davos attendees nearly showed up to a ski resort without the ability to ski, as an unusually warm winter has left European mountains with little snow. It did snow in Davos at the last minute, but whether the WEF’s efforts can help blunt the impacts of climate change (or solve any other problems) remains to be seen. The WEF’s ability to produce vague proclamations and viral Greta Thunberg moments <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9RZj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf1ac448c>, however, is certainly beyond question.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9RZz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cee70cca6>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9RaD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C69e9ad88>  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9RaT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C14fd2566>

Try the strainer <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9RMD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C454f209f> or whirlpool <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9RMT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C671af413> method.

Streaming binge: The Last of Us <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9RNT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C40517d89>, premiering tonight on HBO Max, has apparently broken the video game adaptation curse.

Playlist: Listen to the artists who are set to play Coachella <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9RNj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5979ad1b> and Bonnaroo <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9RNz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf9a8ad56>.

  DESTINATIONS

  Place to be: Melbourne, Australia Australia Open venue in Melbourne Graham Denholm/Getty Images It’s a big world out there. In this section, we’ll teleport you to an interesting location—and hopefully give you travel ideas in the process.

While it may not be Australia’s largest city, Melbourne is the country’s hub for all things food, culture, arts, and sports—and starting tomorrow it’ll be the center of the tennis universe for the next two weeks when it hosts the Australian Open.

As you watch tennis players rally in the warm sun (it is summer Down Under, after all), you should know that outside the courts, there’s a metropolis of 5+ million people with some unique characteristics, starting with the city’s design. Melbourne’s central business district (CBD) is laid out in a grid, but tucked behind the major thoroughfares are “laneways” that in the Victorian era serviced the businesses on the main roads. It’s on these narrow streets that you can find some of the cafes, boutiques, restaurants, and street art that Melbourne is known for.

Some other fun facts:

* Melbourne is sports-mad. Not only does it host the Australian Open, but also a Formula 1 race and other international events. Melbourne Cricket Ground (capacity: 100,000+) is one of the most famous sports venues in the world. And in 1956 Melbourne became the first city outside of Europe or North America to host the Olympics.

* Vegemite, that foul spread Australians like to eat with bread, is manufactured in Melbourne and the product turns 100 years old this year.

* In the 2010s, Melbourne was declared the most livable city in the world for seven straight years by the Economist Intelligence Unit. —NF

  COMMUNITY

  Crowd Work Last Sunday we asked you to predict what Merriam-Webster will select as its 2023 Word of the Year and why. For reference, this year’s was “gaslighting.”

Our favorite responses:

“In 2023, Merriam-Webster’s Word of the Year will be ‘artificial.’ AI will continue to make us ask questions about content like the ones we’ve been asking about our food: ‘This isn’t butter?’ ‘Yogurt?’ ‘This is meat? IMPOSSIBLE!’ Prince Harry’s Spare will expose the phoniness of the monarchy. Elon Musk will continue to make bots scapegoats. And making daylight saving time permanent will help us all realize how artificial anything can be—even time.”—Luke from Atlanta, GA

“‘Sus,’ because everything is.”—Brandie from Arkansas

“ChatGPT. Why? Because the phrase ‘ChatGPT it’ will replace the phrase ‘Google it’ as the means to obtain unknowns via the internet.”—Heather

“Gaslighting. Because what are you talking about? It was never the 2022 Word of the Year.”—Hanna from San Diego, CA (and a lot more of you jokesters)

This week’s question

Super high-end restaurant Noma announced that it will cease to be a restaurant in 2025. The Copenhagen establishment, ranked among the world’s best, was known to charge $500 for a meal. Design a meal that you would happily pay $500 for.

Here’s Matty’s response to get the creative juices flowing: The theme would be “Midwest Delicacies.” There would be three courses featuring various types of loose beef sandwiches and a fancy strawberry pretzel salad for dessert.

Share your dream $500 meal here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30246160.3484633/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9QVz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjQ2MTYwLjM0ODQ2MzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C67b046fa>.

 TOGETHER WITH

Cariuma <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9QRT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTgmbHA9bG9nbw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2f3cfeb4> 
Good morning and Happy Saturday. Our fantastic design team was out at a summit yesterday, which left the inmates (us) to run the asylum (image selection for the newsletter).

When deciding which images to use for each story, Jamie jokingly floated the idea of using Simpsons GIFs for all of them. At first we laughed, but then thought…why the heck not? So, for no particular reason, we did.

Thank you most of all to Matt Groening for providing an infinite library of timeless scenes to choose from.

— Sam Klebanov, Jamie Wilde, Matty Merritt, Max Knoblauch, Abby Rubenstein, Neal Freyman

Here's what these numbers mean. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zMT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbde886af>

Markets: Stocks ended the week with a bang yesterday, shaking off the start of what’s expected to be a bummer of an earnings season. The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq both clinched their best weeks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VZz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C274a3da7> since November. With investors feeling like inflation is finally letting up, tech stocks like Amazon are creeping back up again. The e-commerce giant had its best week since April 2020.

 

GOVERNMENT

Yellen sounds the alarm on debt ceiling <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VaD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ddcbb74d6> Homer Simpson saying the end is near <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VaD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Edcbb74d6> The Simpsons/20th Television via Giphy
The sky began to slowly descend on Washington as Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen kicked off the fight over the debt ceiling yesterday.

Yellen said that if lawmakers don’t raise the cap on government borrowing, the Treasury will start taking “extraordinary measures,” like pausing contributions to federal workers’ retirement funds, on Thursday.

So, what is all the fuss about? In order for the US to keep borrowing and paying its bills, lawmakers have to agree on a new debt ceiling. Currently the US is $78 billion away from maxing out the current $31.4 trillion limit (similar to your credit card sitch after the holiday season).

This is something Congress needs to do, but lawmakers have come to view the procedure as a bargaining chip. The negotiation is expected to be epic:

Ultraconservative Republicans only handed Rep. Kevin McCarthy the House speakership on the condition that a new borrowing limit gets coupled with deep cuts to government spending and a plan to balance the budget in the next decade. (According to the Washington Post, they’ve already prepared a plan for default.)

The White House insists that the new debt limit must be passed with no strings attached.

While the government can probably scrape by on the cash it has until early June, all the drama has people thinking about what defaulting for real would be like. Well, the reputation of the US as a borrower would start to resemble that of an unemployed uncle with a gambling addiction. Financial markets would likely enter a tailspin and the US economy would tank.

How do we avert the disaster?

Lawmakers have to reach a compromise. It could involve negotiations between top House Republicans and the White House, or the House entering a more protracted procedure that entails convincing moderate Republicans to vote with Democrats.

But if the traditional route doesn’t work, policy nerds have some workarounds (that are not Yellen-approved). One is minting a trillion-dollar platinum coin to meet the Treasury’s financial obligations.

Bottom line: While an unprecedented default on US government debt remains a remote possibility, some parts of the bond market (which holds government debt) are already angsty and preparing for a long congressional fight.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VaT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1a7481e4>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Vaj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Bf4ccf549>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Vaz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4e1ae399>   

TOGETHER WITH CARIUMA

The wait(list) is over <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9QRT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTgmbHA9dGl0bGU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9615fed6> Cariuma <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9QRT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTgmbHA9aW1hZ2U/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C19d4b21c>
When you’re wearing kicks from Cariuma—the cool, sustainable sneaker brand <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9QRT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTgmbHA9dGV4dDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccfb0dea8> loved by celebs, skaters, and surfers—your fit doesn’t just look good. It does good for the planet.

Each pair is handmade with Mother Nature in mind, from ethically sourced rubber to carbon-neutral shipping. And now, you can get your hands on ’em: Our fan-fave OCA Low is finally back in stock <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9QRT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTgmbHA9dGV4dDI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cad9b4b7c> after clearing a 77k waitlist.
