WORLD

Tour de headlines Bart Simpson writing I will not sell my kidney on eBay on the blackboard The Simpsons/20th Television via Giphy
At least it’s looking like a “mild recession.” The four biggest US commercial banks kicked off earnings season <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VbD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C38896370> yesterday with a mixed bag of results. Though bank lending is looking profitable right now thanks to higher interest rates, the institutions said they were socking away more cash than analysts expected to cover loan defaults in preparation for a recession. Both JPMorgan and Bank of America indicated that they anticipate the downturn will be a “mild” one but that they have to prepare for the worst anyway. They’re also probably psyched not to be Goldman Sachs, which hasn’t reported earnings yet but revealed that it lost $3 billion on its attempts to serve consumers since 2020.

Corporate Demogorgon blinks, for now.  Hasbro is retreating for the time being from introducing a new version of the Dungeons & Dragons open game license <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VbT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C333bd340> that had dungeon masters insisting that the company had gone too far in its quest for gold pieces. Hasbro still plans to revamp the 23-year-old license, which allows smaller publishers and creators to make their own riffs on the game, but it’s backing down from some provisions that drove the pushback, including a royalty agreement, and has delayed the release of the new deal.

Leopard lost and found. The Dallas Zoo was closed yesterday after it discovered that a clouded leopard named Nova was not in her enclosure. Luckily, Nova—who despite sounding fearsome was described by officials as only 30 pounds and no threat to humans—was located near the enclosure hours later, and preliminarily found to be unharmed. Though zoo officials had faith she’d be found close to her home, Dallas police opened an investigation into the potential involvement of a cat burglar after determining that the leopard’s enclosure was intentionally cut rather than torn.

AUTO

Tesla’s shifts prices into reverse <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Vbz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D54fcced2> Homer Simpson disappearing into a hedge. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Vbz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E54fcced2> The Simpsons/20th Television via Giphy
For a revolutionary tech company, Tesla is starting to act a lot like your average car manufacturer. After missing year-end delivery goals, the company slashed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VcD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cda25b213> its vehicle prices in the US and Europe Thursday.

The details: Tesla fell short getting cars into garages despite pulling out all the stops to move its vehicles in December, including $7,500 discounts and the promise of free charging. And this week it went even further and announced another round of price cuts, some as high as ~20%, to goose sales. The lower pricing also made more versions of its popular Model Y SUV eligible for Biden’s $7,500 EV tax credit.

What does this mean? The company that once bragged about its long waitlist now has too many vehicles sitting around collecting dust. Which isn’t great when you consider the 65% nosedive Tesla’s stock took last year thanks to supply chain problems, skyrocketing interest rates, the EV market becoming more saturated, and Elon Musk’s chaotic Twitter ordeal.

Bottom line: Investors are getting nervous. Tesla will report its 2022 Q4 earnings January 25.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VcT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8a8c5615>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Vcj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1e27843e>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Vcz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5d2639e9>  

SPACE

UFOs are stunting through our airspace <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VdD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D1512a57b> UFOs are stunting through our airspace <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VdD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E1512a57b> The Simpsons/20th Television via Giphy
National intelligence officials cataloged hundreds of new sightings of unidentified aerial phenomena since last year, according to the unclassified version <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VdT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C80513ad8> of a government report released Thursday. The report is part of a growing effort by the US government to investigate UFOs as a legit scientific and national security matter—not a conspiracy theory.

Some other nuggets from the report:

Over 366 sightings out of 510 total have been added to the government’s list since last year; more than half have been deemed “unremarkable” and “clutter,” and their self-confidence is now shattered. Many were just balloons and drones.

But 171 are special and have “demonstrated unusual flight characteristics or performance capabilities,” like little Tony Hawks of the sky.

Officials have said, repeatedly, that there’s no reason to suspect Kang and Kodos or any other aliens of operating the UFOs—but they also haven’t ruled it out.

Zoom out: Any hostile life-forms that want to invade Earth better do it soon. Last summer, NASA said it would form a team <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Vdj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cee9cb720> to analyze sightings of unidentified aerial phenomena. And last month, Congress passed legislation <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Vdz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc79ba135> that requires the Defense Department to reinvestigate UFO reports dating back to the historic New Mexico sighting of an avocado-shaped UFO in 1945 (witnesses said they saw “little creatures,” get hyped!).—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VeD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2e504d9c>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VeT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca497c514>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Vej9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C85c502b4>

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Homer Simpson saying The Simpsons/20th Television via Giphy
Stat: Another day, another previously human-only activity that ChatGPT proves to be unsettlingly good at: This time the chatbot wrote medical research abstracts <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VQT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1bd4027e> that managed to fool experts. In a recent study, medical researchers were asked to spot the fakes, and they identified 32% of the AI-generated abstracts as real and flagged 14% of the genuine abstracts as phonies. Using computers to fight computers won’t get us out of this mess—an AI output detector guessed wrong slightly more often than the researchers.

Quote: “I don’t know whether SBF is guilty of a crime. I therefore reserve judgment until our legal process arrives at a conclusion.”

Billionaire investor Bill Ackman took to Twitter this week to remind us all that while it sure might look like ex-FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried’s business strategy primarily consisted of playing League of Legends while quietly stealing customer funds, SBF hasn’t actually been convicted <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VQj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9dece08b> of anything yet. Ackman said his commitment to the presumption of innocence was forged by his own experience as the target of investigations by then-New York prosecutor Eliot Spitzer and the SEC, which ultimately found no wrongdoing but still tarnished his rep.

Read: Violent gang or rap label? Prosecutors say Young Thug’s YSL is both. (New York Times <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VQz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C487bf2f9>)

WHAT ELSE IS BREWING

Donald Trump’s company <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VRD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf8a80569>, the Trump Organization, was ordered to pay $1.6 million, the maximum possible penalty under New York state law, for tax fraud.

Apple <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VRT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2d845ef6> is cutting CEO Tim Cook’s pay by 40% this year (to ~$49 million), a move Cook himself requested after shareholders objected to his compensation package.

Adidas <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VRj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3eed0f1a> lost its trademark lawsuit against fashion designer Thom Browne over a four-stripe design.

The NFL <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VRz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8cc31bab> wild-card round kicks off today with the Seahawks up against the 49ers and the Chargers facing the Jaguars.

Open house

Welcome to Open House, the only newsletter section that is hiding all of its secrets in plain sight. We’ll give you a few facts about a listing and you try to guess the price.

Mirrored, reflective house in Joshua Tree.The Invisible HouseToday’s listing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30250159.3068198/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9VTz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjUwMTU5LjMwNjgxOTg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C19215a1b>, called the Invisible House, is very obviously the first piece of an alien Tetris game. The 5,500-square foot rectangular disco ball next to Joshua Tree National Park is perfect for anyone who wants to keep an eye on everyone and everything at all times. Amenities include:

One loooong room, but two toilets

Indoor pool

Bed with 2,500-pound glass base

How much for the shiny log?

 TOGETHER WITH

Revela <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9DUD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTUmbHA9bG9nbw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5542790b> 
Good morning. It’s once again time to revive the quarterly practice of lighting $50 on fire because the lottery jackpot got high enough to make it seem like a smart idea. After 25 whiffs over three months of drawings, the Mega Millions jackpot has risen to $1.35 billion, which is good for the second-largest Mega Millions jackpot in history. The next drawing will be held Friday night.

—Jamie Wilde, Max Knoblauch, Matty Merritt, Abby Rubenstein, Neal Freyman

Markets: Stocks kept the good 2023 vibes going yesterday, rising <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Fcz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C82a697e2> as investors bet that this morning’s release of the consumer price index will show inflation cooling down. But not all the vibes made sense: Bed Bath & Beyond, which is considering bankruptcy and reported dismal quarterly sales earlier this week, led a meme stock rally like it was 2021, with GameStop and AMC also notching gains.

 

TRAVEL

404: Modern air travel tech not found <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9FdD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D69531b5a> A plane chained to an old computer. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9FdD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E69531b5a> Francis Scialabba
The FAA created air travel chaos yesterday that highlights outdated tech in aviation again after a key bit of its software glitched harder than a Grand Theft Auto NPC. The agency grounded all flights in the morning over a problem it believes was caused by a “damaged database file,” renewing concerns that US travel infrastructure desperately needs an update.

This grounding is way bigger than when your parents realized the “cartoons” you rented from Blockbuster were hyperviolent anime: It may be the first time all flights have been ordered to stay on the tarmac since 9/11. Departures resumed at 9am ET, but as of yesterday evening, 10,000+ US flights were delayed and 1,300 were canceled as airlines struggled to sort out the morning mayhem <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9FdT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9eb7c460>.

Delays and cancellations could go on for days…meaning this MLK weekend could give deja vu of late December, when Southwest had to cancel thousands of flights after its software couldn’t handle weather conditions disrupting its itineraries.

What exactly caused this mess?

The FAA system that went down was created over 75 years ago. It's called NOTAMs (formerly “Notice to Airmen,” now “Notice to Air Missions”), and it alerts pilots to any hazards along their route and at their destination—such as flocks of birds and icy runways. It was rebooted <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Fdj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd36a7e25> yesterday morning after some corrupted data was discovered, and it took longer than AOL dial-up to get back online.

The government system has been criticized for *surprise, surprise* not being very modern, and the UN’s aviation body has been pushing to bring NOTAMs into the 21st century. A single briefing produced by the system can consist of up to 200 pages of alerts, and pilots have to review the whole document before takeoff.

Looking ahead…the FAA has preliminarily traced the issue back to a damaged file and said that it does not appear a cyber attack was involved, but, whatever occurred, the outage signals that the system’s outdatedness may run deeper than its HTML. “America’s transportation network desperately needs significant upgrades,” Geoff Freeman, the US Travel Association president, said. He called on <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Fdz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C64dcf877> policymakers to “modernize our vital air travel infrastructure.”—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9FeD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C38f63d82>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9FeT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C57fe7dab>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9Fej9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7e873e5a>   

TOGETHER WITH REVELA

Here’s to a year of (hair) growth <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9DUD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTUmbHA9dGl0bGU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf7ac59a2> Revela <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9DUD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTUmbHA9aW1hZ2U/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C084602a0>
It’s the time of year when “growth” and “change” are the words on everyone’s minds. But we’re here to talk about the type of growth you don’t need to manifest in a bullet journal: hair growth.

Whether you’re dealing with hair loss and thinning or dreaming of a mane that looks like you’ve added extensions, Revela <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9DUD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTUmbHA9dGV4dDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C75743540> can help you get the growth you’re looking for this year.

Their revolutionary new Hair Revival Serum <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9DUD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTUmbHA9dGV4dDI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9e83d928> includes ProCelinyl™, which helps combat hair loss and shedding. It’s designed to reawaken dormant follicles, leading to a 97% success rate in just six weeks.

Revela’s so confident you’ll experience thicker hair that all products come with a money-back guarantee.

Click here for 15% off <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9DUD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTUmbHA9dGV4dDM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C86556e1b>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines Amazon Labor Union president Chris Smalls at a protest Michael M. Santiago/Getty Images
Amazon union’s Staten Island win got certified. A federal labor official certified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9GOD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd2dbdc98> the Amazon Labor Union’s victory in the election at the New York City warehouse, rejecting the e-commerce giant’s objections to the vote. But Amazon plans to continue appealing up the chain to the full National Labor Relations Board in Washington, DC. Nonetheless, the union’s leader, Chris Smalls, called the decision “very historic for workers” and urged the company to begin negotiations with the union.

Disney park lovers’ complaints reached Mickey’s ears. After many of its parks’ biggest fans took umbrage at the rising costs of a visit, Disney has worked some magic to help guests pay less (though mostly without actually lowering entry prices). Disney said <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9FQT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cddf1aa78> it will: stop charging for overnight parking, let Disney World annual passholders come to parks on weekday afternoons without a reservation, and expand the number of days lower cost tickets are available for Disneyland. But theme park backlash isn’t the only headache Disney is dealing with: An activist investor is trying to join the board, Disney revealed yesterday, as it elevated a Nike exec on its board to the chair position.

Uniqlo workers in Japan are getting a big raise. The retail chain’s parent company, Fast Retailing, promised a pay bump of up to 40% yesterday. The announcement <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9FQj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5b776e15> came days after Japan’s prime minister urged the country’s employers to boost wages in the face of soaring inflation and average pay that has barely inched up since the 1990s. It’s likely to put pressure on other companies during their annual spring pay negotiations, even if most won’t offer such a large increase.

WEALTH

‘Succession’ takes a nonfiction turn for Arnault family <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9FQz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dcc5b260e> Succession GIF <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9FQz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ecc5b260e> Succession/HBO
Not satisfied with simply taking Elon Musk’s top spot on the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, Bernard Arnaut is also taking plot lines from HBO. The world’s richest person and CEO of luxury goods conglomerate LVMH named his daughter, Delphine Arnault, CEO of the fashion house Dior, setting up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9FRD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C769625df> a sibling battle for succession of his company.

Analysts see the move as a Logan Roy/George Bluth-eseque attempt to pit sibling against sibling, as Arnault’s son Antoine was named CEO of the holding company that controls the family fortune in December.

Luxury goods seem to be a passion for all of Arnault’s five children, as they all work for the company in various executive positions across its brands. Probably safe to assume there’s a Tom Wambsgans analog eating birds under a cloth in the mix, too.

But, like Succession, we may have to wait a few seasons to see how this all shakes out. LVMH recently changed its bylaws to increase the maximum age for a CEO to 80 (from 75)—an apparent sign that the 73-year-old Arnault patriarch isn’t planning on stepping down soon.

The power of nepotism: A surge in the share price of LVMH—Europe’s most valuable company—helped push the combined value of companies listed in Paris above those listed in London in November.—MK

FOOD

Yolked egg prices might finally get some relief <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9FSD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Db1752177> Six eggs in a carton. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9FSD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Eb1752177> Westend61/Getty Images
Dump your flaxseed and aquafaba: You might be able to afford baking with actual eggs again soon. Egg prices are finally starting to come down after hitting a record-high average of $5.46 per dozen in December.

How did scrambled eggs become the new caviar? Egg prices saw the highest jump <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9FST9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0c831ba7> of all grocery items last year (49%), according to the consumer price index, forcing bored teens to go back to TPing and cyberbullying.

A lot less chickens were crossing the road last year…On top of high inflation all around, more than 43 million egg-laying hens died last year due to the worst avian flu outbreak in US history (leaving ~375 million total). The death toll was so high partly because if one bird in a farmer’s flock gets infected, the FDA requires all remaining birds to be killed, real zombie apocalypse stuff.

Three-egg omelets are on the horizon: Average egg prices fell slightly to $4.63 last week, partly due to less consumer demand post-holiday baking season. While prices are finally <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30223741.3062455/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9FSj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjIzNzQxLjMwNjI0NTU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccb28a7ec> trending down, experts cautioned that we won’t be getting bargain eggs again until the avian flu is fully under control.—MM

Instead, South Korea’s Samsung got the most, while IBM came in at No. 2. But the company was quick to explain that it totally meant to drop off the top of the list after three decades of dominance, having made the decision back in 2020 to focus on collaboration over exclusivity to get the quantum computing industry off the ground.

 TOGETHER WITH

Babbel <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iYWJiZWwuY29tL3Q_> 
Good morning and Happy National Milk Day—the day that celebrates all kinds of milk: whole, skim, 2%, the kind that expired yesterday but still smells OK, the one in the fancy glass bottle from the good store, chocolate, and even melk.

—Matty Merritt, Sam Klebanov, Max Knoblauch, Neal Freyman

Markets: So far, stocks are generally making good on their New Year’s resolution to only go up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY25iYy5jb20vMjAyMy8wMS8wOS9zdG9jay1tYXJrZXQtZnV0dXJlcy1vcGVuLXRvLWNsb3NlLW5ld3MuaHRtbA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd56b84b5>, but they’ll face several AP-level tests in the coming days, including the monthly inflation report release (Thursday) and the start of earnings season (Friday). Over in cryptoland, Coinbase investors applauded the company’s dramatic moves to cut costs—the crypto exchange said it would lay off 20% of its workforce and drop “several” projects.

 

WEATHER

20 trillion gallons of water is too much—and not enough <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.> Flooding in California. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.> George Rose/Getty Images
A deadly barrage of storms has been dumping Olympic-sized pools of rain on California over the past few weeks. On Monday, millions across the state experienced an “atmospheric river” that dropped a month’s worth of rain in one day. And as the downpours continued yesterday, 90% of the state’s population (which equates to 10% of the entire US population) was under flood watch. Forecasters estimate more than 20 trillion gallons <Over%2020%20trillion%20gallons%20of%20water%20are%20expected%20to%20fall%20across%20California%20over%20the%20next%202%20weeks.%20> of water will have fallen on California by mid-January.

Surely all this water will cure the state of the devastating drought that’s parched it over the last few decades, right?

Not quite

In fact, most parts of California are simultaneously under drought and flood emergencies, a bizarre consequence of climate change that will likely stick around—despite more rainstorms projected to hit the state throughout the rest of the month.

Experts say California would need a lot more rain to completely reverse the drought that has put the Southwest in its driest condition in 1,200 years. One scientist told <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cud2FzaGluZ3RvbnBvc3QuY29tL25hdGlvbi8yMDIzLzAxLzA1L2NhbGlmb3JuaWEtZHJvdWdodC1yYWluLXN0b3JtLz91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bWImdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C18ef35f3> the WaPo that these storms are like getting a normal monthly paycheck after several months of not getting paid at all—the influx is welcome, but your bank account will still be depleted.

Another problem: Right now, there’s too much water and nowhere to put it. While California has gargantuan reservoirs to store rainwater and snow melt, most of the state has received rainfall anywhere from 400% to 600% above average since the storms began a few weeks ago. And once reservoirs are full, the water just flows into the ocean.

For instance, Lake Cachuma in Santa Barbara County was hovering around 30% capacity in early December. After rising 34 feet yesterday, it’s expected to start overflowing Friday or Saturday.

Plus, in cities like LA (which has received around three inches so far), rainwater can’t be collected because it’s been contaminated by road runoff.

The current state of the storms: Around 146,000 customers were left without power as of 7pm ET yesterday and the death toll has risen <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY25uLmNvbS8yMDIzLzAxLzEwL3dlYXRoZXIvY2FsaWZvcm5pYS1mbG9vZGluZy1hdG1vc3BoZXJpYy1yaXZlci10dWVzZGF5L2luZGV4Lmh0bWw_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C018290c4> to 17. Mudslides and flooding have forced residents of many areas, including the ritzy neighborhoods of Montecito, to evacuate.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZmFjZWJvb2suY29tL3NoYXJlci5waHA_dT1odHRwczovL21vcm5pbmdicmV3LmNvbS9kYWlseS9zdG9yaWVzL2NhbGlmb3JuaWEtc3Rvcm1zLWxpa2VseS13b24tdC1tYWtlLWEtaHVnZS1kZW50LWluLWRyb3VnaHQmdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1mYWNlYm9va19zaGFyZQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C70bb1313>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cDovL3d3dy5saW5rZWRpbi5jb20vc2hhcmVBcnRpY2xlP3VybD1odHRwczovL21vcm5pbmdicmV3LmNvbS9kYWlseS9zdG9yaWVzL2NhbGlmb3JuaWEtc3Rvcm1zLWxpa2VseS13b24tdC1tYWtlLWEtaHVnZS1kZW50LWluLWRyb3VnaHQmdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1saW5rZWRpbl9zaGFyZQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C420a2b63>   <mailto:?subject=Check%20out%20this%20story%20from%20Morning%20Brew%21&body=20%20trillion%20gallons%20of%20water%20is%20too%20much%E2%80%94and%20not%20enough%3A%20https%3A%2F%2Fmorningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2Fcalifornia-storms-likely-won-t-make-a-huge-dent-in-drought%3Futm_campaign%3Dmb%26utm_medium%3Dnewsletter%26utm_source%3Dmorning_brew%0A%0AWant%20more%20great%20content%3F%20Subscribe%20to%20Daily%20Brew%20%E2%80%94%20Delivering%20the%20latest%20business%20news%20from%20Wall%20St.%20to%20Silicon%20Valley%20daily.%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fr%2F%3Fkid%3Df2654ef3%26utm_source%3Demail_share%0A> 

TOGETHER WITH BABBEL

Mark your calendar: It’s day numero uno. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iYWJiZWwuY29tL3Q_> Babbel <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iYWJiZWwuY29tL3Q_>
Maybe learning a new language has been your goal for a few years now. Maybe it’s an idea that’s recently transpired. Either way, Babbel <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iYWJiZWwuY29tL3Q_>’s language learning platform can help you take it from the goals column to the achievements section.

With just 10 minutes of daily practice with Babbel, you can start having actual conversations in as little as three weeks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iYWJiZWwuY29tL3Q_>. That’s right—if you start today, you could be chattin’ it up in another language by the end of the month.

Here’s another nudge to get you to the starting line: You can save 60% on your Babbel subscription <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5iYWJiZWwuY29tL3Q_> for a limited time only.



WORLD

Tour de headlines <#> Goldman Sachs logo Michael M. Santiago/Getty Images
🪓 “David’s Demolition Day” has arrived. Today, Goldman Sachs will begin laying off <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubnl0aW1lcy5jb20vMjAyMy8wMS8xMC9idXNpbmVzcy9kZWFsYm9vay9nb2xkbWFuLXNhY2hzLWxheW9mZnMuaHRtbD91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bWImdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc7369251> up to 3,200 employees (~6% of its total workforce) as part of its largest cost-cutting efforts since the 2008 financial crisis. The bank has been hit hard by the market downturn and dealmaking drying up, plus its highly anticipated plans to build a consumer business failed to find…any consumers. We’re sure CEO David Solomon will have more to say about his restructuring plan on Goldman’s earnings call next Tuesday.

Biden launches another student debt overhaul. While the Biden administration’s student loan debt wipeout is held up in court, the Education Dept. is moving ahead with another student debt revamp <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubnl0aW1lcy5jb20vMjAyMy8wMS8xMC95b3VyLW1vbmV5L3N0dWRlbnQtbG9hbnMtaW5jb21lLWRyaXZlbi1yZXBheW1lbnQuaHRtbD91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bWImdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C397b5fc7> to lessen the burden for borrowers. This proposal would change the rules of existing income-driven repayment plans to slash the payments millions of borrowers need to make on their loans by more than 50%, allowing them to pay off their debt more quickly. As for the broader student loan cancellation plan, the Supreme Court is expected to hear the case next month.

France could make you work longer, and unions are angry. The French government released plans to gradually raise the age of retirement <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY25uLmNvbS8yMDIzLzAxLzEwL2J1c2luZXNzL2ZyYW5jZS1wZW5zaW9uLXJlZm9ybT91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bWImdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2a36958d> by two years, to 64, in the hopes it’ll boost employment among seniors and put funds back into its strained pension system. But French unions, which staged massive protests the last time this plan was floated, have already made plans to strike on Jan. 19 in opposition to the move, which they call unjustified. Even at 64, the retirement age in France would still be lower than it is in other higher-income countries.

BUSINESS

Microsoft chats up ChatGPT <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vZGFpbHkvc3Rvcmllcy8yMDIzLzAxLzEwL3doeS1vcGVuYWktbWlnaHQtYmUtZ2V0dGluZy11c2QxMGItZnJvbS1taWNyb3NvZnQ_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldyZtaWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmY/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Deccbd6cc> Microsoft chats up ChatGPT <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vZGFpbHkvc3Rvcmllcy8yMDIzLzAxLzEwL3doeS1vcGVuYWktbWlnaHQtYmUtZ2V0dGluZy11c2QxMGItZnJvbS1taWNyb3NvZnQ_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldyZtaWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmY/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Eeccbd6cc> Francis Scialabba
Microsoft is reportedly preparing for its largest startup investment in history: a $10 billion stake <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuc2VtYWZvci5jb20vYXJ0aWNsZS8wMS8wOS8yMDIzL21pY3Jvc29mdC1leWVzLTEwLWJpbGxpb24tYmV0LW9uLWNoYXRncHQ_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbd7aa35b> in OpenAI that could value the research lab at $29 billion.OpenAI is the creator of potentially groundbreaking AI tools like ChatGPT, the multitalented chatbot that can code in Python and help high schoolers cheat on English essays.

What’s in it for Microsoft? The company has already invested $1 billion in OpenAI, but thinks an even tighter relationship would help it better compete with Big Tech rivals like Google (which reportedly declared a “code red <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubnl0aW1lcy5jb20vMjAyMi8xMi8yMS90ZWNobm9sb2d5L2FpLWNoYXRncHQtZ29vZ2xlLXNlYXJjaC5odG1sP3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1tYiZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C28fc1b8f>” over ChatGPT’s threat to its search engine).

But Microsoft’s AI ambitions go beyond just integrating <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubW9ybmluZ2JyZXcuY29tL2RhaWx5L3N0b3JpZXMvbWljcm9zb2Z0LWJpbmctY2hhdGdwdD91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bWImdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3Jm1pZD03Y2QzZDdlZmNiMmI1ZDFhNmNiZTBiZjA5MzFmNGIyZg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb66d055a> ChatGPT know-how into its own search engine, Bing. The company wants to use OpenAI’s tools in its Office suite—and it’s already experimenting with algorithms to help users craft emails in Outlook.

So, what is OpenAI? It was founded in 2015 as a mission-based AI research organization by a roster from Silicon Valley’s A-list, including Elon Musk. Its stated goal is to develop safe AI for the benefit of humanity.

But OpenAI has plenty of critics who have called it out for ethical concerns, a lack of transparency, and abandoning its mission for profits.

Zoom out: A slew of buzzy AI product releases in 2022 has startup investors forgetting they ever heard the word “metaverse.” Languishing in the prolonged crypto winter and facing an uncertain economic future, many venture capitalists see the field as the next big thing to shovel money into.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZmFjZWJvb2suY29tL3NoYXJlci5waHA_dT1odHRwczovL21vcm5pbmdicmV3LmNvbS9kYWlseS9zdG9yaWVzLzIwMjMvMDEvMTAvd2h5LW9wZW5haS1taWdodC1iZS1nZXR0aW5nLXVzZDEwYi1mcm9tLW1pY3Jvc29mdCZ1dG1fc291cmNlPWZhY2Vib29rX3NoYXJl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2b6e2c32>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cDovL3d3dy5saW5rZWRpbi5jb20vc2hhcmVBcnRpY2xlP3VybD1odHRwczovL21vcm5pbmdicmV3LmNvbS9kYWlseS9zdG9yaWVzLzIwMjMvMDEvMTAvd2h5LW9wZW5haS1taWdodC1iZS1nZXR0aW5nLXVzZDEwYi1mcm9tLW1pY3Jvc29mdCZ1dG1fc291cmNlPWxpbmtlZGluX3NoYXJl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C16afdce0>   <mailto:?subject=Check%20out%20this%20story%20from%20Morning%20Brew%21&body=Microsoft%20chats%20up%20ChatGPT%3A%20https%3A%2F%2Fmorningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2023%2F01%2F10%2Fwhy-openai-might-be-getting-usd10b-from-microsoft%3Futm_campaign%3Dmb%26utm_medium%3Dnewsletter%26utm_source%3Dmorning_brew%0A%0AWant%20more%20great%20content%3F%20Subscribe%20to%20Daily%20Brew%20%E2%80%94%20Delivering%20the%20latest%20business%20news%20from%20Wall%20St.%20to%20Silicon%20Valley%20daily.%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fr%2F%3Fkid%3Df2654ef3%26utm_source%3Demail_share%0A>

TECH POLICY

You can now fix your tractor (if you know how) <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vZGFpbHkvc3Rvcmllcy9qb2huLWRlZXJlLXJpZ2h0LXRvLXJlcGFpcj91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bWImdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3Jm1pZD03Y2QzZDdlZmNiMmI1ZDFhNmNiZTBiZjA5MzFmNGIyZg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Bd50e87fc> John Deere <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vZGFpbHkvc3Rvcmllcy9qb2huLWRlZXJlLXJpZ2h0LXRvLXJlcGFpcj91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bWImdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3Jm1pZD03Y2QzZDdlZmNiMmI1ZDFhNmNiZTBiZjA5MzFmNGIyZg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd50e87fc> Photo Illustration: Dianna “Mick” McDougall, Source: Getty Images
As tractors have evolved to include high-tech features like self-driving capabilities, GPS, obstacle detection, and—soon, with any luck—League of Legends compatibility, they’ve become increasingly difficult for farmers or third-party shops to repair. But on Sunday, John Deere committed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cud3NqLmNvbS9hcnRpY2xlcy9kZWVyZS10by1hbGxvdy1mYXJtZXJzLXRvLXJlcGFpci10aGVpci1vd24tZXF1aXBtZW50LTExNjczMjI4NTgwP3V0bV9jb250ZW50PWJ1ZmZlcjE3MjdlJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09c29jaWFsJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9dHdpdHRlci5jb20mdXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPWJ1ZmZlcg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C72d00aa8> to making that easier.

Together with the American Farm Bureau Federation, the company signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) that’s aimed at providing farmers with greater access to tools, diagnostic codes, and manuals. Until now, the company’s high-tech tractors could only be repaired by authorized dealers due to software locks, which farmers claimed raised costs and caused delays (and even led to some farmers hacking <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZW1lcmdpbmd0ZWNoYnJldy5jb20vc3Rvcmllcy8yMDIyLzA5LzIwL2pvaG4tZGVlcmUtcy1kaWdpdGFsLWVtYnJhY2UtcHV0cy1hLXNwb3RsaWdodC1vbi1pdHMtY3liZXJzZWN1cml0eS1wcmFjdGljZXM_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPWV0YiZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXcmbWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJm/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4799e80c> their tractors).

While this represents a victory for the burgeoning right-to-repair movement, advocates are wary of the MOU’s lack of enforcement measures and certain sections in the agreement, including one that gives John Deere (or the AFBF) the ability to withdraw from the deal if any federal or state right-to-repair legislation is enacted.

Zoom out: This isn’t the first time a deal like this has been made in the private sector. In 2018, a similar agreement was reached between a lobbying group representing Deere and the California Farm Bureau, but many of the promises didn’t come to pass.—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZmFjZWJvb2suY29tL3NoYXJlci5waHA_dT1odHRwczovL21vcm5pbmdicmV3LmNvbS9kYWlseS9zdG9yaWVzL2pvaG4tZGVlcmUtcmlnaHQtdG8tcmVwYWlyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9ZmFjZWJvb2tfc2hhcmU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C65f1c5d6>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cDovL3d3dy5saW5rZWRpbi5jb20vc2hhcmVBcnRpY2xlP3VybD1odHRwczovL21vcm5pbmdicmV3LmNvbS9kYWlseS9zdG9yaWVzL2pvaG4tZGVlcmUtcmlnaHQtdG8tcmVwYWlyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bGlua2VkaW5fc2hhcmU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C318d9e5e>   <mailto:?subject=Check%20out%20this%20story%20from%20Morning%20Brew%21&body=You%20can%20now%20fix%20your%20tractor%20%28if%20you%20know%20how%29%3A%20https%3A%2F%2Fmorningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2Fjohn-deere-right-to-repair%3Futm_campaign%3Dmb%26utm_medium%3Dnewsletter%26utm_source%3Dmorning_brew%0A%0AWant%20more%20great%20content%3F%20Subscribe%20to%20Daily%20Brew%20%E2%80%94%20Delivering%20the%20latest%20business%20news%20from%20Wall%20St.%20to%20Silicon%20Valley%20daily.%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fr%2F%3Fkid%3Df2654ef3%26utm_source%3Demail_share%0A>  

TOGETHER WITH THRIVE CAUSEMETICS

You’ll want allll eyes on this. After the busy holiday season, we could all use a makeover on our makeup routine. Combine these clean, bestselling products from Thrive Causemetics for the ultimate eye look and start 2023 with eyes as bright as your future. GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators <#> Skyline of Chicago Interim Archives/Getty Images
Stat: Chicagoans have a lot of time to contemplate what the Bears should do with the No. 1 NFL Draft pick. That’s because Windy City drivers wasted an average of 155 hours sitting in traffic last year, making Chicago the worst US city <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cud2FzaGluZ3RvbnBvc3QuY29tL3RyYW5zcG9ydGF0aW9uLzIwMjMvMDEvMTAvdHJhZmZpYy1jb25nZXN0aW9uLWlucml4LWNvdmlkLz91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bWImdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3216fe67> for congestion, according to INRIX’s global traffic scorecard. Traffic picked up in cities all over the world last year, to match (and in some cases exceed) pre-pandemic levels. London was found to be the most congested city globally.

Quote: “We are not, and will not be, a ‘climate policymaker.’”

In a speech in Stockholm, Fed Chair Jerome Powell said it’s not his job <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly9hcG5ld3MuY29tL2FydGljbGUvYnVzaW5lc3MtamVyb21lLXBvd2VsbC1zd2VkZW4tc3RvY2tob2xtLWNsaW1hdGUtYW5kLWVudmlyb25tZW50LWMzZTU4NzVmNGI2ZDdlZmEwNzljODcwZmRjNzc5ZDc0P3JlZj1iaXp0b2MuY29t/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdae93fb6> to play climate cop for the global financial system. Powell has heard from critics in both directions that the Fed should play a larger (or smaller) role in promoting environmental sustainability in the financial world. Powell also emphasized the need for the Fed to maintain its independence, since political influence could disrupt necessary—but unpopular—interest rate hikes to stamp out inflation.

Read: The gripping obituary of a French man whose forgeries saved thousands of Jews during the Holocaust. (New York Times <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.>)

WHAT ELSE IS BREWING

Republican lawmakers <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY2JzbmV3cy5jb20vbmV3cy9wcmVzaWRlbnQtYmlkZW4tY2xhc3NpZmllZC1kb2N1bWVudHMtdGhpbmstdGFuay1yZXB1YmxpY2Fucy1jcml0aWNpemUtdHJ1bXAtbWFyLWEtbGFnby8_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdd2f25d8> called for investigations into classified documents that were discovered in President Biden’s former office at a Washington, DC, think tank. Biden said he was surprised by the findings and is “cooperating fully.”

All of the winners <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly92YXJpZXR5LmNvbS8yMDIzL2F3YXJkcy9hd2FyZHMvZ29sZGVuLWdsb2Jlcy0yMDIzLXdpbm5lcnMtbGlzdC0xMjM1NDgwMTI1Lz91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bWImdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce0eb829b> from last night’s Golden Globe Awards. And the speech of the ceremony <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly90d2l0dGVyLmNvbS9WYXJpZXR5L3N0YXR1cy8xNjEyOTgzMTMwNjA4MjU5MDc1P3M9MjAmdD1NdVhfUVBtNlpDSk5oSE5uSWViZWVn/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce2dcb302>.

The last eight years <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuYXhpb3MuY29tLzIwMjMvMDEvMTAvY2xpbWF0ZS1jaGFuZ2Utd2FybWVzdC15ZWFyP3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1tYiZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Bdd030410> were the eight warmest ever recorded, per a new report from the EU’s Copernicus Climate Change Service.

Allen Weisselberg <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cucmV1dGVycy5jb20vbGVnYWwvZm9ybWVyLXRydW1wLW9yZ2FuaXphdGlvbi1jZm8tZ2V0cy1maXZlLW1vbnRocy1qYWlsLTIwMjMtMDEtMTAvP3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1tYiZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf1a950ab>, the former CFO of the Trump Organization, was sentenced to five months in NYC’s Rikers Island jail for his role in a tax fraud scheme at the company.

Guinness <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30212721.3059397/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuYmxvb21iZXJnLmNvbS9uZXdzL2FydGljbGVzLzIwMjMtMDEtMTAvZ3Vpbm5lc3MtaXMtcmFpc2luZy1waW50LXByaWNlcy1pbi1pcmVsYW5kP3NybmQ9cHJlbWl1bSZzcmVmPUtrUHpwWnZ6/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cae717345> is raising its prices by 12 euro cents per pint to help meet rising costs. The Irish PM said it would create “financial hardship for many” pubs.

 TOGETHER WITH

LaneAxis <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zMD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODImbHA9bG9nbw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7fcdc9ff> 
Good morning. What can you expect from Super Bowl commercials this year? Less crypto, more Gronk. FanDuel announced yesterday that in an ad during the game, Rob Gronkowski will kick a 25-yard field goal live. If he makes it, anyone who placed a Super Bowl bet of $5 or more on FanDuel will split $10 million in free bets on the platform.

Something tells us this is going to be a very effective way to sign up new users…

—Max Knoblauch, Sam Klebanov, Jamie Wilde, Abby Rubenstein, Neal Freyman

Markets: Stocks ended the day mostly flat <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zMj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc89521d5> yesterday, despite spending the morning looking like they were going to keep Friday’s big rally energy going (investors’ enthusiasm waned after two Fed officials made discouraging noises about interest rates). ENVIRONMENT

Ozone layer’s been looking good lately <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zMz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D192ac170> Ozone layer recovery illustration <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zMz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E192ac170> Hannah Minn
A bit of good news for the Earthlings reading this: The ozone’s layer is set to be fully restored <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zND9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0728e10a> over most of the world within the next two decades, according to a new UN report.

Trends indicate a full ozone layer recovery by 2040 will take place across the planet, excluding the poles: Ozone bounce back (to 1980, precrisis levels) over the Arctic is expected by 2045, and over the Antarctic by 2066. So keep holding, South Pole property owners, good times are just over the horizon.

So, why does it matter?

Science class refresher:

The ozone layer is a thin part of the Earth’s stratosphere, about nine to 18 miles above its surface. This layer shields Earth from harmful ultraviolet rays linked to cancers and crop damage. In 1985, scientists identified a hole in the ozone layer caused by chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs), the ozone-depleting chemicals found in air conditioners, refrigerators, and deodorants.

The loss of the ozone layer was one of the most feared environmental issues through most of the 1980s and ’90s, culminating in a poetic reference in Smash Mouth’s 1999 banger “All Star.” Perhaps due to the easily digestible urgency of the problem (a hole that was getting bigger), an international agreement to phase out CFCs known as the Montreal Protocol was reached quickly in 1987.

And, despite a few hiccups—including a 2018 discovery that factories in China were emitting large amounts of banned chemicals—the Montreal Protocol has proven successful. Yesterday’s report found that the primary ozone-depleting gasses in the stratosphere were on the decline from their peaks:

Chlorine decreased 11.5% from its peak in 1993.

Bromine decreased 14.5% from its peak in 1999.

In a bit of a full circle moment, the defunct Earth Radiation Budget Satellite, which helped confirm the ozone layer’s decline in the ’80s, fell back to Earth on Sunday night.—MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zNT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C339d34f3>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zNj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2644f5ea>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zNz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce4e4f849>   

TOGETHER WITH LANEAXIS

Freight shippers: Stop pulling your hair out! <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zMD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODImbHA9dGl0bGU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5db47b3a> LaneAxis <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zMD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODImbHA9aW1hZ2U/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf9069ed1>
When companies need to ship freight, they call a trucking company, right? Wrong! 

They call a broker to hire a trucking company. These middlemen rake in $200b annually by charging up to 50% commissions, which drives up your product costs and shrinks truck drivers’ revenue. 

Enter LaneAxis <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zMD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODImbHA9dGV4dDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cde17503d>. They’re fixing this $1t industry with the first direct network for the global supply chain <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zMD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODImbHA9dGV4dDI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd18993d0>—and it’s already fully functional.

Their patented software creates unprecedented efficiencies and lowers consumer costs via direct shipper-to-carrier connections, direct contracts, and direct payments.

Target: 1.37m daily loads posted on inefficient freight boards.

Purpose of raise: Gain mass exposure.

Potential: Every 1% reached generates $150m in LaneAxis revenue.

Invest in LaneAxis today <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zMD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODImbHA9dGV4dDM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cef35a085>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines A house and cars partially submerged in flooding in California
Storms keep slamming California. President Biden declared an emergency <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zOT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0adb160e> in California yesterday after a slew of winter storms drenched the state, causing at least 12 deaths, widespread power outages, and flooding. The declaration will allow federal agencies to coordinate relief efforts as atmospheric rivers and cyclones keep pummeling the northern part of the state. As of yesterday, about 34 million Californians, or ~10% of the US population, were under a flood watch, according to CNN, and Montecito was ordered to evacuate.

The DOJ is investigating Biden’s handling of classified docs. The department is looking into ~10 classified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy91aT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C35b6d551> documents from President Biden’s tenure as VP that were found in a private office he used—an official appointed by former President Trump has been tasked with the review. Unlike the documents that were seized from Trump’s Mar-a-Lago club, however, it appears that Biden’s own attorneys found them and alerted the government, returning them the next day. In other political news yesterday, Republican Rep. Kevin McCarthy made it through the first test in his hard-won speakership when the House passed the rules it will operate under, as well as a bill rescinding new funding for the IRS that’s unlikely to succeed in the Democrat-controlled Senate.

Brazil detains 1,500 people after riots. Authorities cracked down <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zOD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C61221cc2> yesterday after supporters of Brazil’s former President Jair Bolsonaro, who don’t believe he lost the last election, stormed its Congress, Supreme Court, and presidential palace on Sunday. Meanwhile, the situation is getting awkward for President Biden, as members of his own party are pressuring him to expel Bolsonaro, who’s been in Florida since days before his successor was sworn in. As for Bolsonaro himself, his wife said yesterday he was in the hospital with abdominal pain.

CULTURE

The most controversial royal tell-all since Princess Diana’s hits the shelves <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zYj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D4a917d0c> The most controversial royal tell-all since Princess Diana’s hits the shelves <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zYj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E4a917d0c> Max Mumby/Indigo/Getty Images
Windsor watchers who have yet to overdose on British monarchy drama are queuing up at their nearest bookstore. Prince Harry’s memoir, Spare, hits shelves <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zYz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd36a024f> today and bombshell pre-release leaks suggest that it’s a juicy one (we already know more than we want to about royal circumcision).

Royalties for royalty

Celebrity narratives are big business: A four-book deal (allegedly) earned Harry and his wife Meghan up to $40 million. And though literary accolades are likely not on the horizon for Prince Harry (or his ghostwriter), Spare already clinched the No. 1 bestseller spot at both Amazon and Barnes & Noble.

Its publisher, Random House, says it printed 2.5 million copies for North America, betting at least that many readers will be willing to shell out $25 to get further details on how Harry lost his virginity in a field, behind a pub.

Zoom out: Harry and Meghan have not shied away from getting paid to publicly air grievances with family members turning themselves into a powerful media brand after walking away from royal duties. Together they launched a Spotify podcast and a Netflix docuseries. It’s no doubt made them bank, but it’s also made Prince Harry less popular—at least in the UK, where his approval ratings plummeted the most with older people who tend to support the monarchy, according to a recent YouGov poll.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zZD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C08313393>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zZT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3efc70b7>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zZj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C95cefb65>  

FINE DINING

This is about to be the hardest resy to get <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zZz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dd3d13d0f> People working at Noma <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zZz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ed3d13d0f> Thibault Savary/AFP/Getty Images
Noma announced <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zaD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C43fa5894> yesterday it’ll serve its last fried duck brain in a mallard head in 2024 (see the famous dish <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zaT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0d52c53f> if you dare). Its creator and head chef, René Redzepi, told the NYT that the way fine dining currently operates is “unsustainable.”

If you couldn’t relate to anyone in The Menu except Margot and wouldn’t shell out $500 for a meal, here’s why this is a BFD:

The Copenhagen-based restaurant has three Michelin stars and has topped the World’s 50 Best Restaurants list so many times (five) that it became ineligible to nab No. 1 again.

Redzepi, who’s been called the greatest chef of his time, co-created “New Nordic” cuisine—which highlights the naturalness of foraged ingredients. If you’ve ever been served an entree on a log, that’s Noma’s influence.

But a lot of unpaid interns had to tweeze fruit leather into the shape of a beetle (seriously <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zaj9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C44cd9237>) to get Noma to the top. Grueling hours, low pay, and a workplace culture that would get zero stars on Glassdoor has become the norm in fine dining restaurants.

Redzepi told the NYT, “Financially and emotionally, as an employer and as a human being, it just doesn’t work.”

Looking ahead…in 2024, Noma will be converted into a culinary lab where Redzepi will pickle and ferment foods we’ve never heard of.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zaz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5bae9b2f>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zbD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C27fa0729>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zbT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfbca4eb6>

Stat: Not to sound like the News at 10, but a common appliance in your kitchen might be making kids sick: A recent study found that about one in eight childhood asthma cases in the US could be traced back to gas stoves <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zcz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1be63658>. Gas ranges, which are used in about 40% of American homes, emit enough harmful pollutants into the air that the government is now considering banning them, per Bloomberg.

Quote: “In a creative business like ours, nothing can replace the ability to connect, observe, and create with peers that comes from being physically together.”

Disney employees may not have been the happiest group on Earth yesterday after the company’s new-old CEO Bob Iger announced that all hybrid <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9zdD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cddebb61d> workers will need to start showing up at the office four days per week as of March. The move puts Disney out of step with many companies that have offered more flexible arrangements (though Mickey’s minions can still work from home on Fridays unlike, say, the folks at Elon Musk’s Twitter).

The investment bank faces an expected 46% drop in profits.

Virgin Orbit’s <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30200055.3066282/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy91aD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjAwMDU1LjMwNjYyODI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C080e710e> satellite launch, which would have made the UK the first European country to get satellites into space from its own soil, ended in failure after its rocket suffered an anomaly that kept it from reaching orbit.

 TOGETHER WITH

Huel <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly9odWVsLmNvbS9wcm9kdWN0cy9odWVsLWJsYWNrLWVkaXRpb24vP3V0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ2JyZXcmdXRtX21lZGl1bT1hZHZlcnRvcmlhbHMmdXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPXVzX25ld3NsZXR0ZXJfbWJfcHJpbWFyeV8xLzkmdXRtX2NvbnRlbnQ9YnBvdyZscD1sb2dv/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C39cdfcdd> 
Good morning. Before we get to the news (and there was a lot of it this weekend), here’s a quick PSA that our Leadership Accelerator is open for applications and begins in just a few weeks on Jan. 23.

The deets: It’s an eight-week online course that helps you become the leader you wish you had, all built to complement your day job. Learn more <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly9sZWFybmluZy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vY291cnNlcy9sZWFkZXJzaGlwL2xlYWRlcnNoaXAtYWNjZWxlcmF0b3I_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPUxBX0MzJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bWItZGFpbHkmdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9jb250ZW50PXRvcGJsdXJiJm1pZD03Y2QzZDdlZmNiMmI1ZDFhNmNiZTBiZjA5MzFmNGIyZg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C68a70927> about this awesome opportunity.
