GOVERNMENT

In Congress, the fiercest battles are only beginning <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.> The US Capitol building <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.> Drew Angerer/Getty Images
Last week’s historic, bare-knuckle brawl to elect Rep. Kevin McCarthy as House speaker was a sign that in this 118th Congress, we’ve ain’t seen nothing yet. Concerns grew over the weekend that the chaos and brinkmanship that characterized the 15-round speaker vote could foreshadow nasty infighting <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cud2FzaGluZ3RvbnBvc3QuY29tL3VzLXBvbGljeS8yMDIzLzAxLzA3L2dvcC1idWRnZXQtZGVidC1saW1pdC1rZXZpbi1tY2NhcnRoeS8_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C78246370> around the biggest legislative issues of the year.

After all, electing a House speaker in just one ballot has been mostly a foregone conclusion since the Civil War. So if you can barely dice the onions, how are you supposed to make the entire chili?

The No. 1 issue: debt ceiling

The biggest challenge for Congress to tackle in 2023 is raising the debt ceiling <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubnl0aW1lcy5jb20vMjAyMy8wMS8wNy91cy9wb2xpdGljcy9zcGVha2VyLWVsZWN0aW9uLWRlYnQtbGltaXQtcmVwdWJsaWNhbnMuaHRtbD91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bWImdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1d75b5cf>.

What is the debt ceiling? It’s a limit on what the US government can borrow to pay its bills. And since the government runs on budget deficits, it regularly needs to borrow more money to avoid a credit default, which would be a disastrous scenario. Should a potential default materialize due to congressional paralysis, it could crater global markets and plunge the US into a recession.

So, what’s the status? In 2021, Congress raised the debt ceiling by $2.5 trillion—but that will only get us to August, when Goldman Sachs predicts that lawmakers will need to raise the roof again to avert a default.

Here’s where the McCarthy vote comes into play: The small faction of hardline Republicans who held up McCarthy’s election as speaker could, in effect, hold the debt ceiling “hostage” by getting their demands—specifically, spending cuts to domestic programs and the military—into any debt limit bill. Given their outsized leverage in the Republican Party’s slim majority in the House, this group could bring debt ceiling negotiations perilously close to the expiration date, which is worrying economists over the downstream effects on markets.

Looking ahead…the concerns about gridlock may become real starting today, when the House will vote on a rules package that determines how the chamber will operate during its term. Some Republicans expressed hesitation <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cudGhlZ3VhcmRpYW4uY29tL3VzLW5ld3MvMjAyMy9qYW4vMDgva2V2aW4tbWNjYXJ0aHktaG91c2Utc3BlYWtlci1uZXh0LWZpZ2h0LXJ1bGVzLXBhY2thZ2U_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cad4ff5ce> this weekend about approving these rules due to the still unknown concessions McCarthy must have granted the hardline faction to secure his speaker seat.

And finally, a palette cleanser: Bad congressional lip-reading <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cudGlrdG9rLmNvbS90L1pUUmdGVzZDSy8_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C32436ada>.

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZmFjZWJvb2suY29tL3NoYXJlci5waHA_dT1odHRwczovL21vcm5pbmdicmV3LmNvbS9kYWlseS9zdG9yaWVzLzIwMjMvMDEvMDgvaW4tY29uZ3Jlc3MtdGhlLWZpZXJjZXN0LWJhdHRsZXMtYXJlLW9ubHktYmVnaW5uaW5nJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9ZmFjZWJvb2tfc2hhcmU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C16163a4f>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cDovL3d3dy5saW5rZWRpbi5jb20vc2hhcmVBcnRpY2xlP3VybD1odHRwczovL21vcm5pbmdicmV3LmNvbS9kYWlseS9zdG9yaWVzLzIwMjMvMDEvMDgvaW4tY29uZ3Jlc3MtdGhlLWZpZXJjZXN0LWJhdHRsZXMtYXJlLW9ubHktYmVnaW5uaW5nJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bGlua2VkaW5fc2hhcmU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5c10db89>   <mailto:?subject=Check%20out%20this%20story%20from%20Morning%20Brew%21&body=In%20Congress%2C%20the%20fiercest%20battles%20are%20only%20beginning%3A%20https%3A%2F%2Fmorningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2023%2F01%2F08%2Fin-congress-the-fiercest-battles-are-only-beginning%3Futm_campaign%3Dmb%26utm_medium%3Dnewsletter%26utm_source%3Dmorning_brew%0A%0AWant%20more%20great%20content%3F%20Subscribe%20to%20Daily%20Brew%20%E2%80%94%20Delivering%20the%20latest%20business%20news%20from%20Wall%20St.%20to%20Silicon%20Valley%20daily.%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fr%2F%3Fkid%3Df2654ef3%26utm_source%3Demail_share%0A> 

TOGETHER WITH HUEL

Make eating healthy easy <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly9odWVsLmNvbS9wcm9kdWN0cy9odWVsLWJsYWNrLWVkaXRpb24vP3V0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ2JyZXcmdXRtX21lZGl1bT1hZHZlcnRvcmlhbHMmdXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPXVzX25ld3NsZXR0ZXJfbWJfcHJpbWFyeV8xLzkmdXRtX2NvbnRlbnQ9YnBvdyZscD10aXRsZQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cebb74eb4> Huel <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly9odWVsLmNvbS9wcm9kdWN0cy9odWVsLWJsYWNrLWVkaXRpb24vP3V0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ2JyZXcmdXRtX21lZGl1bT1hZHZlcnRvcmlhbHMmdXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPXVzX25ld3NsZXR0ZXJfbWJfcHJpbWFyeV8xLzkmdXRtX2NvbnRlbnQ9YnBvdyZscD1pbWFnZQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1709c59a>
Rushing between meetings or running out of time to meal prep in the morning? Getting proper nutrition doesn’t have to be time consuming or expensive. Huel Black Edition <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly9odWVsLmNvbS9wcm9kdWN0cy9odWVsLWJsYWNrLWVkaXRpb24vP3V0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ2JyZXcmdXRtX21lZGl1bT1hZHZlcnRvcmlhbHMmdXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPXVzX25ld3NsZXR0ZXJfbWJfcHJpbWFyeV8xLzkmdXRtX2NvbnRlbnQ9YnBvdyZscD10ZXh0MQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf4e1bd1c> makes eating healthy meals easy and affordable.

With 40g of premium, plant-based protein, 27 essential vitamins and minerals, plus 160 health benefits, Huel Black Edition <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly9odWVsLmNvbS9wcm9kdWN0cy9odWVsLWJsYWNrLWVkaXRpb24vP3V0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ2JyZXcmdXRtX21lZGl1bT1hZHZlcnRvcmlhbHMmdXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPXVzX25ld3NsZXR0ZXJfbWJfcHJpbWFyeV8xLzkmdXRtX2NvbnRlbnQ9YnBvdyZscD10ZXh0Mg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ced177e70> covers all your health goals and helps you stay fueled even on your busiest days.

Ditch that tedious meal prep routine. Just add two scoops of Huel Black Edition to water, shake, and enjoy. It’s that simple.

Start a healthy habit that fits seamlessly into your routine without compromising money, time, or nutrients. Get a free shaker and T-shirt with your first order of Huel Black Edition <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly9odWVsLmNvbS9wcm9kdWN0cy9odWVsLWJsYWNrLWVkaXRpb24vP3V0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ2JyZXcmdXRtX21lZGl1bT1hZHZlcnRvcmlhbHMmdXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPXVzX25ld3NsZXR0ZXJfbWJfcHJpbWFyeV8xLzkmdXRtX2NvbnRlbnQ9YnBvdyZscD10ZXh0Mw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C32d3552e>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines <#> Supporters of Brazilian former President Jair Bolsonaro invade the National Congress in Brasilia on January 8, 2023. Sergio Lima/AFP via Getty Images
Bolsonaro supporters storm government buildings. Thousands of supporters of former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro invaded <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly9hcG5ld3MuY29tL2FydGljbGUvamFpci1ib2xzb25hcm8tYnJhemlsLWdvdmVybm1lbnQtY2FyaWJiZWFuLTBjMDNjMDk4YTVlMmEwOWFjNTM0NDEyYzMwYWU4MzU1P3V0bV9zb3VyY2U9aG9tZXBhZ2UmdXRtX21lZGl1bT1Ub3BOZXdzJnV0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1wb3NpdGlvbl8wMQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C941e4a77> congress, the supreme court, and the presidential palace in Brasilia yesterday in scenes reminiscent of the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol. Many called for the removal of President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, who was sworn in last week, piggybacking on Bolsonaro’s baseless attacks on the legitimacy of October’s election. Leaders across the world, including in the US, condemned the riots as undemocratic. Security forces said they took back control of the buildings.

Biden at the border. President Biden made his first visit <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubmJjbmV3cy5jb20vcG9saXRpY3Mvam9lLWJpZGVuL2JpZGVuLW1ha2VzLWZpcnN0LXRyaXAtcHJlc2lkZW50LXVzLW1leGljby1ib3JkZXItYWRtaW5pc3RyYXRpb24taW1wb3MtcmNuYTY0ODA4P3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1tYiZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce38361c0> to the US–Mexico border while in office yesterday as he toughens up restrictions on the record number of asylum-seekers coming into the country. Biden has been criticized by Republicans for not doing enough to secure the border, while he’s attacked opponents for not passing his own immigration proposal. After his visit to the border in El Paso, TX, Biden left for Mexico City, where he’ll attend a summit with the leaders of Mexico and Canada.

China drops restrictions, sparking travel rush. Nearly three years after it sealed itself off from the world, China scrapped quarantines <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly9hcG5ld3MuY29tL2FydGljbGUvaGVhbHRoLWNoaW5hLWhvbmcta29uZy1iZWlqaW5nLWJ1c2luZXNzLTQ5ZTMxZGVkYjc4ZmQyNGMxMDc3YjM0MGViZGFmYTFmP3V0bV9zb3VyY2U9aG9tZXBhZ2UmdXRtX21lZGl1bT1Ub3BOZXdzJnV0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1wb3NpdGlvbl8wMg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc02ac5a3> for international travelers yesterday to complete the dismantling of its “zero Covid” strategy. Travelers still need to show a negative PCR test taken within 48 hours of entering China, but that’s nothing compared to the up to three weeks of isolation that were imposed on visitors during the pandemic. The tens of thousands of people traveling to and from Hong Kong yesterday cheered the opportunity to see loved ones again.

TECH

Better call SaulBot 3000 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.> Saul Goodman and Walter White on Breaking Bad <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.> Breaking Bad/AMC
Would Walter White have received better counsel from an AI than from Saul Goodman? We might get closer to the answer next month, when a robot will advise a defendant <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.> in US court for the first time in history, New Scientist reports.

The “robot” is actually an artificial intelligence algorithm created by the company DoNotPay. It’ll run on a smartphone located in the defendant’s pocket and, through an earpiece, will advise them on what to say after hearing the arguments presented during the hearing.

DoNotPay is keeping the specifics of its “experiment” mostly under wraps, since what it’s doing violates courtroom protocol, but we do know the hearing involves a speeding charge <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly9naXptb2RvLmNvbS9kb25vdHBheS1zcGVlZGluZy10aWNrZXQtY2hhdGdwdC0xODQ5OTYwMjcyP3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1tYiZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C135ff807>. Interestingly, no one in court other than the defendant will know that an AI lawyer is even involved (DoNotPay will use a hearing accessibility loophole to get the defendant to wear AirPods).

DoNotPay said it’ll cover any fines or fees incurred by the defendant if its AI gets stage fright in court or if they otherwise lose the challenge.

Big picture: Recent breakthroughs in AI have some of us worried about robots taking our jobs—are lawyers on the chopping block? Maybe not yet, but in a test from 2018, a machine-learning AI topped human attorneys when analyzing NDAs for risks.

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZmFjZWJvb2suY29tL3NoYXJlci5waHA_dT1odHRwczovL21vcm5pbmdicmV3LmNvbS9kYWlseS9zdG9yaWVzLzIwMjMvMDEvMDgvYWktd2lsbC1iZS11c2VkLWFzLWxlZ2FsLWFzc2lzdGFudC1pbi1jb3VydC1mb3ItZmlyc3QtdGltZS1ldmVyLWluLWZlYnJ1YXJ5JnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9ZmFjZWJvb2tfc2hhcmU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf919f3e6>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cDovL3d3dy5saW5rZWRpbi5jb20vc2hhcmVBcnRpY2xlP3VybD1odHRwczovL21vcm5pbmdicmV3LmNvbS9kYWlseS9zdG9yaWVzLzIwMjMvMDEvMDgvYWktd2lsbC1iZS11c2VkLWFzLWxlZ2FsLWFzc2lzdGFudC1pbi1jb3VydC1mb3ItZmlyc3QtdGltZS1ldmVyLWluLWZlYnJ1YXJ5JnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bGlua2VkaW5fc2hhcmU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C361a9735>   <mailto:?subject=Check%20out%20this%20story%20from%20Morning%20Brew%21&body=Better%20call%20SaulBot%203000%3A%20https%3A%2F%2Fmorningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2023%2F01%2F08%2Fai-will-be-used-as-legal-assistant-in-court-for-first-time-ever-in-february%3Futm_campaign%3Dmb%26utm_medium%3Dnewsletter%26utm_source%3Dmorning_brew%0A%0AWant%20more%20great%20content%3F%20Subscribe%20to%20Daily%20Brew%20%E2%80%94%20Delivering%20the%20latest%20business%20news%20from%20Wall%20St.%20to%20Silicon%20Valley%20daily.%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fr%2F%3Fkid%3Df2654ef3%26utm_source%3Demail_share%0A>

CALENDAR

The week ahead <#> A poster advertising the launch of Prince Harry's memoir Finnbarr Webster/Getty Images
Prince Harry’s memoir goes on sale. Spare will be released <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuYmJjLmNvbS9uZXdzL3VrLTY0MTc5MTY0P3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1tYiZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8daefcbf> on Tuesday and is certain to dominate book sales (and office small talk) this week. Per leaked copies, Harry mentions a physical altercation with his brother, Prince William, and dispassionately describes how he killed 25 Taliban fighters in Afghanistan.

Companies will report (bad) earnings. In the upcoming earnings season, corporations ailing from interest rate hikes are expected to post their first annual profit decline <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cud3NqLmNvbS9hcnRpY2xlcy93YWxsLXN0cmVldC1zZXRzLWxvdy1iYXItZm9yLWNvcnBvcmF0ZS1lYXJuaW5ncy1zZWFzb24tMTE2NzMxMjM0OTE_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9884fbde> since the Covid recession. Big banks will kick off the fireworks at the end of this week.

Will inflation continue its decline? We’ll find out on Thursday, when the latest consumer price index report drops. Inflation had been on the comedown toward the end of 2022, but some Fed officials warn it’s too soon to declare victory—and that inflation remains far too high above typical levels.

Everything else…

The Mega Millions jackpot has ballooned to $1.1 billion—the third-largest prize in US history—ahead of Tuesday night’s drawing.

The college football championship game between UGA and TCU is tonight.

The troubled Golden Globe Awards return to TV on Tuesday night.



TOGETHER WITH MCKINSEY & COMPANY

McKinsey & Company <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubWNraW5zZXkuY29tL2NhcGFiaWxpdGllcy9xdWFudHVtYmxhY2svb3VyLWluc2lnaHRzL3RoZS1zdGF0ZS1vZi1haS1pbi0yMDIyLWFuZC1hLWhhbGYtZGVjYWRlLWluLXJldmlldz9scD1pbWFnZQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfcae0440>
AI comin’ in…hot? Let’s be honest: Artificial intelligence (AI) is still a little mysterious for most of us. If you’re wondering how businesses use AI, check out McKinsey’s State of AI in 2022 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubWNraW5zZXkuY29tL2NhcGFiaWxpdGllcy9xdWFudHVtYmxhY2svb3VyLWluc2lnaHRzL3RoZS1zdGF0ZS1vZi1haS1pbi0yMDIyLWFuZC1hLWhhbGYtZGVjYWRlLWluLXJldmlldz9scD10ZXh0MQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1036024b>. GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators <#> Man at stack of cash saying SNL/NBC
Stat: As a Netflix software engineer in California, you can expect to make somewhere between $90,000 and…$900,000 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuYmxvb21iZXJnLmNvbS9uZXdzL2FydGljbGVzLzIwMjMtMDEtMDYvY2FsaWZvcm5pYS1wYXktbGF3LWJpZy10ZWNoLXBvc3RzLXdpZGUtc2FsYXJ5LXJhbmdlcz9zcm5kPXByZW1pdW0mc3JlZj1La1B6cFp2eg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9d3ac519>, according to a job posting. As of Jan. 1, CA companies are required to post salary ranges for open positions, but like we saw when NYC enacted a similar law last year, some employers are making somewhat of a joke of it. Still, since CA is home to so many influential tech companies, the law is giving us an unprecedented look <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY29tcHJlaGVuc2l2ZS5pby8_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C35ed3323> at the salaries of people who work for Apple, Tesla, Meta, Google, and more.

Quote: “When you put real love out into the world it comes back to you 3x’s as much.”

Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin posted on Instagram in his first public comments <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubmJjbmV3cy5jb20vbmV3cy9zcG9ydHMvZGFtYXItaGFtbGluLXRoYW5rcy1ldmVyeW9uZS1zdXBwb3J0LWZpcnN0LXB1YmxpYy1jb21tZW50cy1jYXJkaWFjLWFyci1yY25hNjQ3NjY_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca47796a6> since collapsing during a game one week ago. Doctors said Hamlin remained in critical condition on Saturday but that his “neurological function is excellent.” Meanwhile, the final NFL weekend of the regular season went on as planned, featuring many tributes to Hamlin and exciting win-or-go-home games.

WHAT ELSE IS BREWING

A “parade of cyclones” <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cucmV1dGVycy5jb20vd29ybGQvdXMvc3Rvcm0tY2FsaWZvcm5pYS1sZWF2ZXMtb3Zlci0zMzAwMDAtd2l0aG91dC1wb3dlci1tb3JlLXJvdWdoLXdlYXRoZXItYWhlYWQtMjAyMy0wMS0wOC8_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C26b4a64b> is headed toward an already-drenched California over the next several days.

XBB.1.5 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly93YXBvLnN0LzNpbWluUlU_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbfba5213>, a rapidly spreading Omicron subvariant, has been called the “most transmissible variant” yet by the WHO.

Elon Musk <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly9hcG5ld3MuY29tL2FydGljbGUvZWxvbi1tdXNrLXRlY2hub2xvZ3ktYXVzdGluLXNhbi1mcmFuY2lzY28tYnVzaW5lc3MtOTExMTdhNWEyODE5MjdiNGUzNTExZTYyNDRiNzgzNzI_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8f0fe638> asked a judge to move a trial about his tweets out of SF because the local media there has portrayed him negatively and the people are biased against him.

Chinese tech mogul Jack Ma <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30190372.3054878/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubnl0aW1lcy5jb20vMjAyMy8wMS8wNi9idXNpbmVzcy9qYWNrLW1hLWFudC1ncm91cC5odG1sP3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1tYiZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd30a3ee5> will relinquish control of his fintech company, Ant Group, several years after Chinese authorities targeted Ant amid a broader Big Tech crackdown.



BREW'S BETS

Dive back into the week.

I don’t know U

TCU will play against the University of Georgia in tonight’s college football championship game. But do you know what the letters TCU stands for? (The answer is: Texas Christian University.)

In today’s trivia, we’ll give you the popular abbreviation for a US college or university, and you have to figure out its full name.

GMU

RPI

UAB

RISD

CIA

IUPUI

 TOGETHER WITH

The Motley Fool <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZm9vbC5jb20vbW1zL21hcmsvZS1zYS1wdWxsYmFjay1zdG9ja3M_dXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPWNvbnRlbnRtYXJrZXRpbmcmdXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPTUtcHVsbGJhY2tzJmFpZD0xMDcwMSZwYWlkPTEwNzAxJndhaWQ9MTA3MDEmc291cmNlPWVzYW1uYndkZzA1MDAxMzQmcHNvdXJjZT1lc2FtbmJ3ZGcwNTAwMTM0Jndzb3VyY2U9ZXNhbW5id2RnMDUwMDEzNCZscD1sb2dv/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd8513193> 
Good morning. Per a decree from Larry David, the statute of limitations to wish someone a “Happy New Year” ends today. Anyone who gets caught using that greeting from tomorrow on will be punished by having to turn on their group chat notifications…with high volume.

—Sam Klebanov, Matty Merritt, Jamie Wilde, Abby Rubenstein, Max Knoblauch, Neal Freyman

Markets: Stocks had their first big rally <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY25iYy5jb20vMjAyMy8wMS8wNS9zdG9jay1tYXJrZXQtZnV0dXJlcy1vcGVuLXRvLWNsb3NlLW5ld3MuaHRtbA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4eca2e78> of 2023 yesterday, with the Dow and S&P 500 both having their best day since November after new economic data convinced investors that inflation may be slowing so the Fed can finally cool it with the rate hikes. One stock that didn’t join the party: Party City. The retailer’s stock tanked after the WSJ reported that it’s teetering on the edge of bankruptcy.

 

ECONOMY

Why slowing wage growth has economists popping bottles <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.> Briefcase with green leaves growing out of it <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.> Hannah Minn
Most people don’t toast to government data on a Friday night, but a report on the job market that dropped yesterday inspired cautious optimism: There might be a way out of our current inflation hellscape without bringing the economy to the brink of collapse after all.

The big numbers from the Bureau of Labor Statistics report:

The unemployment rate dropped <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuYmxvb21iZXJnLmNvbS9uZXdzL2FydGljbGVzLzIwMjMtMDEtMDYvdXMtaGlyaW5nLXRvcHMtZm9yZWNhc3RzLWpvYmxlc3MtcmF0ZS1mYWxscy1hcy13YWdlLWdhaW5zLXNsb3c_c3JlZj1La1B6cFp2eg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1e3d2005> to 3.5%, the lowest it’s been in 50 years.

The US added 223,000 nonfarm jobs in December. Though job growth slowed from the previous month, the labor market is still going strong.

In 2022, 4.5 million total jobs were added, compared with 6.7 million in 2021.

But the number that really got people talking was the lower-than-expected month over month wage growth, which slowed to .3% in December and 4.6% annually.

While that might not sound like welcome news to anyone who doesn’t live off a fortune inherited from their robber baron granddad, the folks at the Federal Reserve are most certainly pleased. Rapidly growing paychecks are seen as one of the key drivers of inflation, which the Fed has been trying to tame with aggressive interest rate hikes since early last year.

Economists have dubbed the jobs data a “Goldilocks” situation—not too hot, and not too cold. Since the labor shortage and the strident wage growth it drove seem to be abating, the hope is that inflation will continue to decline. At the same time, a strong labor market (fingers crossed) might just allow the economy to avoid a recession caused by the interest rate increases.

Zoom out: Experts expect slowing wage growth to signal to the Fed that it’s time to chill with the aggressive rate hikes. And it’s not just speculation: Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Raphael Bostic said yesterday that he’d lean toward just a 25 basis point increase (as opposed to 50 basis points) for the next interest rate hike if the labor market continues to cool.—SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZmFjZWJvb2suY29tL3NoYXJlci5waHA_dT1odHRwczovL21vcm5pbmdicmV3LmNvbS9kYWlseS9zdG9yaWVzLzIwMjMvMDEvMDYvd2h5LXNsb3dpbmctd2FnZS1ncm93dGgtaGFzLWVjb25vbWlzdHMtcG9wcGluZy1ib3R0bGVzJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9ZmFjZWJvb2tfc2hhcmU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5b655ae4>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cDovL3d3dy5saW5rZWRpbi5jb20vc2hhcmVBcnRpY2xlP3VybD1odHRwczovL21vcm5pbmdicmV3LmNvbS9kYWlseS9zdG9yaWVzLzIwMjMvMDEvMDYvd2h5LXNsb3dpbmctd2FnZS1ncm93dGgtaGFzLWVjb25vbWlzdHMtcG9wcGluZy1ib3R0bGVzJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bGlua2VkaW5fc2hhcmU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1359ab49>   <mailto:?subject=Check%20out%20this%20story%20from%20Morning%20Brew%21&body=Why%20slowing%20wage%20growth%20has%20economists%20popping%20bottles%3A%20https%3A%2F%2Fmorningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2023%2F01%2F06%2Fwhy-slowing-wage-growth-has-economists-popping-bottles%3Futm_campaign%3Dmb%26utm_medium%3Dnewsletter%26utm_source%3Dmorning_brew%0A%0AWant%20more%20great%20content%3F%20Subscribe%20to%20Daily%20Brew%20%E2%80%94%20Delivering%20the%20latest%20business%20news%20from%20Wall%20St.%20to%20Silicon%20Valley%20daily.%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fr%2F%3Fkid%3Df2654ef3%26utm_source%3Demail_share%0A> 

TOGETHER WITH THE MOTLEY FOOL

It pays to wait <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZm9vbC5jb20vbW1zL21hcmsvZS1zYS1wdWxsYmFjay1zdG9ja3M_dXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPWNvbnRlbnRtYXJrZXRpbmcmdXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPTUtcHVsbGJhY2tzJmFpZD0xMDcwMSZwYWlkPTEwNzAxJndhaWQ9MTA3MDEmc291cmNlPWVzYW1uYndkZzA1MDAxMzQmcHNvdXJjZT1lc2FtbmJ3ZGcwNTAwMTM0Jndzb3VyY2U9ZXNhbW5id2RnMDUwMDEzNCZscD10aXRsZQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6c111838> The Motley Fool <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZm9vbC5jb20vbW1zL21hcmsvZS1zYS1wdWxsYmFjay1zdG9ja3M_dXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPWNvbnRlbnRtYXJrZXRpbmcmdXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPTUtcHVsbGJhY2tzJmFpZD0xMDcwMSZwYWlkPTEwNzAxJndhaWQ9MTA3MDEmc291cmNlPWVzYW1uYndkZzA1MDAxMzQmcHNvdXJjZT1lc2FtbmJ3ZGcwNTAwMTM0Jndzb3VyY2U9ZXNhbW5id2RnMDUwMDEzNCZscD1pbWFnZQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5e8fb871>
No, you can’t go back in time to get the best deal on certain stocks before their prices skyrocket.

But some things are worth the wait. And right here, right now, you can do the next best thing: Score great deals on some potentially promising stocks that have hit some low, low, low prices, but still show solid signs for future success.

In fact, the experts at The Motley Fool <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZm9vbC5jb20vbW1zL21hcmsvZS1zYS1wdWxsYmFjay1zdG9ja3M_dXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPWNvbnRlbnRtYXJrZXRpbmcmdXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPTUtcHVsbGJhY2tzJmFpZD0xMDcwMSZwYWlkPTEwNzAxJndhaWQ9MTA3MDEmc291cmNlPWVzYW1uYndkZzA1MDAxMzQmcHNvdXJjZT1lc2FtbmJ3ZGcwNTAwMTM0Jndzb3VyY2U9ZXNhbW5id2RnMDUwMDEzNCZscD10ZXh0MQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C24ecadee> have identified five specific stocks that fit the bill, even though their current prices may be low.

Sign up for Stock Advisor <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZm9vbC5jb20vbW1zL21hcmsvZS1zYS1wdWxsYmFjay1zdG9ja3M_dXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPWNvbnRlbnRtYXJrZXRpbmcmdXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPTUtcHVsbGJhY2tzJmFpZD0xMDcwMSZwYWlkPTEwNzAxJndhaWQ9MTA3MDEmc291cmNlPWVzYW1uYndkZzA1MDAxMzQmcHNvdXJjZT1lc2FtbmJ3ZGcwNTAwMTM0Jndzb3VyY2U9ZXNhbW5id2RnMDUwMDEzNCZscD10ZXh0Mg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7b15271c> to get the deets on these stocks.



WORLD

Tour de headlines <#>
New Alzheimer’s drug heads to the pharmacy. The FDA approved <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY25uLmNvbS8yMDIzLzAxLzA2L2hlYWx0aC9sZWNhbmVtYWItZmRhLWFwcHJvdmFsL2luZGV4Lmh0bWw_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2b3d9475> Leqembi, a drug that may slow down cognitive decline in early Alzheimer’s patients. Key word: may. Clinical trials of the drug weren’t as conclusive as some medical experts would like, but Leqembi’s approval was fast-tracked since few treatments exist for the disease. The FDA has been criticized for granting the same accelerated approval to another unproven Alzheimer’s drug, Aduhelm, in 2021.

ChatGPT expelled from schools. New York City public schools, the largest school district in the US, banned <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.> the AI text generator from school devices and networks this week, hoping to keep kids from cheating by getting ChatGPT to write that book report for them. Of course, students can still use it to fire off their term papers at home, but the move shows how worried educators are about the tool’s potential. They may not need to be: A Princeton student recently built an app to help teachers detect cheating with the chatbot.

SPORTS

A rattled NFL returns to the field <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vZGFpbHkvc3Rvcmllcy8yMDIzLzAxLzA2L2EtcmF0dGxlZC1uZmwtcmV0dXJucy10by10aGUtZmllbGQ_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldyZtaWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmY/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb5474202> Cooper Kupp #10 of the Los Angeles Rams takes to the field before a game against the San Francisco 49ers at SoFi Stadium <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vZGFpbHkvc3Rvcmllcy8yMDIzLzAxLzA2L2EtcmF0dGxlZC1uZmwtcmV0dXJucy10by10aGUtZmllbGQ_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldyZtaWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmY/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Db5474202> Harry How/Getty Images
The final weekend of the NFL’s regular season is typically among the most exciting dates on the sports calendar each year, featuring high-stakes games where teams jockey for playoff spots and higher seeds in the postseason.

And that’ll happen again today when Week 18 kicks off, albeit under the giant cloud of Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin’s cardiac arrest during a game Monday—a horrific injury that has shaken players, coaches, and fans of the game.

Hamlin update: He had his breathing tube removed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZXNwbi5jb20vbmZsL3N0b3J5L18vaWQvMzUzOTE4MTIvYmlsbHMtZGFtYXItaGFtbGluLWJyZWF0aGluZy1vd24tdHViZS1yZW1vdmVkP3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1tYiZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7378db86> and has been talking and FaceTiming with family and his teammates. “I love you, boys,” he told his fellow Bills players yesterday.

Meanwhile, the NFL has announced a few tributes and changes in light of the incident:

Teams have been given a number of options to support Hamlin, including painting “3” (his jersey number) in Bills colors on their 30-yard line.

After canceling the Bills–Bengals game in which Hamlin collapsed, the NFL unveiled a complex set of scenarios for the playoffs, which include the AFC Championship Game potentially being played at a neutral site.

Big picture: While Hamlin’s collapse has prompted reflection over the violence of the NFL, new viewership data <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuc3BvcnRpY28uY29tL2J1c2luZXNzL21lZGlhLzIwMjMvbmZsLWdhbWVzLWFjY291bnQtZm9yLTgyLW9mLTEwMC10b3AtdHYtYnJvYWRjYXN0cy0xMjM0NzAwMzgxLz91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bWImdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8baeacfc> from Sportico shows that pro football still maintains “hegemonic dominance over the domestic media market.” NFL games represented 82 of the top 100 TV programs in the US last year.—NF

SOCIAL MEDIA

A romance author faked her own death <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vZGFpbHkvc3Rvcmllcy9pbmRpZS1yb21hbmNlLWF1dGhvci1mYWtpbmctaGVyLW93bi1kZWF0aD91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bWImdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3Jm1pZD03Y2QzZDdlZmNiMmI1ZDFhNmNiZTBiZjA5MzFmNGIyZg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C578d45ae> Susan Meachen's book cover for "Love to Last a Lifetime" on background of faded roses. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vZGFpbHkvc3Rvcmllcy9pbmRpZS1yb21hbmNlLWF1dGhvci1mYWtpbmctaGVyLW93bi1kZWF0aD91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bWImdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3Jm1pZD03Y2QzZDdlZmNiMmI1ZDFhNmNiZTBiZjA5MzFmNGIyZg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D578d45ae> Photo Illustration: Dianna “Mick” McDougall, Source: Amazon
In the biggest scandal to hit Facebook since we got banned for offering a bag of half-eaten tortilla chips in our neighborhood Buy Nothing group, indie romance author Susan Meachen posted <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuYnV6emZlZWRuZXdzLmNvbS9hcnRpY2xlL2tlbHNleXdlZWttYW4vc3VzYW4tbWVhY2hlbi1hdXRob3ItYWxsZWdlZC1kZWF0aC1ob2F4P3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1tYiZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C65d66de9> that she’s actually alive.

She faked her own death for over two years. Meachen is/was/??? known in the romance writing world for self-publishing over a dozen books and running a successful niche Facebook group. In 2020, a post supposedly written by her daughter claimed that she had died by suicide because of bullying from other authors.

Then, on Monday, Meachen posted in the same Facebook group that was used to announce her death that she was alive and ready to start writing again, ending her post with “Let the fun begin.”

While her friends and fans were glad to find out she was alive, they were also horrified. Some asked where the money they crowdfunded for funeral costs went. After Meachen’s supposed death, the community even edited her final novel for free and helped promote it in her honor.

What the twist? No one’s quite sure why Meachen did this. The only explanation she offered in her post was, “My family did what they thought was best for me.”—MM

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators <#> A pickleball paddle and ball with someone about to serve Photo Illustration: Dianna “Mick” McDougall, Source: Getty Images
Stat: It looks like the pickleball–tennis wars at your local courts are just getting started. The upstart sport’s popularity <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY25iYy5jb20vMjAyMy8wMS8wNS9waWNrbGViYWxsLXBvcHVsYXJpdHktZXhwbG9kZXMtd2l0aC1tb3JlLXRoYW4tMzYtbWlsbGlvbi1wbGF5aW5nLmh0bWw_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7ad18c92> grew from gherkin-sized to full sour last year: 36.5 million people played the sport in 2022, per the Association of Pickleball Professionals, a 630% bump from the 5 million who played in 2021. Pickleball is also becoming a big business, attracting investors like LeBron James and Tom Brady and sponsors like Anheuser-Busch and Skechers.

Quote: “The hose line got so full of butter they couldn’t hang on to it any more.”

Troy Haase, the fire chief of Portage, Wisconsin, might switch to margarine after the experience his team had fighting a fire <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cudGhlZ3VhcmRpYW4uY29tL3VzLW5ld3MvMjAyMy9qYW4vMDUvYnV0dGVyLXdpc2NvbnNpbi1kYWlyeS1wbGFudC1jYW5hbC1tZWx0ZWQ_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf8d6f094> at a dairy plant this week. The fire started in the facility’s butter storage room, sending melted butter flowing “three inches thick” down the stairs that led to it—which firefighters struggled to crawl up while hanging onto a slippery hose. Nobody was hurt in the blaze, but the butter river did make its way into storm drains, clogging a historic canal.

Read: Meet the “Anna Delvey of Vietnam” as her scams unravel. (Vice <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cudmljZS5jb20vZW4vYXJ0aWNsZS84OHFqN3ovYW5uYS1kZWx2ZXktdGluYS1kdW9uZy12aWV0bmFtP3V0bV9zb3VyY2U9ZW1haWwmdXRtX21lZGl1bT1lZGl0b3JpYWwmdXRtX2NvbnRlbnQ9ZGFpbHkmdXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPTIzMDEwNQ/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6b616746>)

WHAT ELSE IS BREWING

Southwest Airlines <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.> said its holiday flight cancellation bonanza will shave as much as $825 million off its earnings, giving it a loss for the fourth quarter.

McDonald’s <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY25iYy5jb20vMjAyMy8wMS8wNi9tY2RvbmFsZHMtcGxhbnMtcmVvcmdhbml6YXRpb24tam9iLWN1dHMuaHRtbD91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bWImdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C52da4e8a> is planning layoffs as the fast-food giant reorganizes to speed up the pace of restaurant openings.

Hackers <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cudGhldmVyZ2UuY29tLzIwMjMvMS82LzIzNTQyMDM4L3R3aXR0ZXItaGFjay0yMDAtbWlsbGlvbi1lbWFpbC1hZGRyZXNzZXMtdXNlcm5hbWVzLWFmZmVjdGVkP3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1tYiZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C237a115b> have leaked the emails linked to over 200 million Twitter accounts. No word on whether elon@tesla.com was one of them.

Jen Shah <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubmJjbmV3cy5jb20vcG9wLWN1bHR1cmUvcG9wLWN1bHR1cmUtbmV3cy9saXZlLWJsb2cvamVuLXNoYWgtc2VudGVuY2luZy1saXZlLXVwZGF0ZXMtcmNuYTY0NTczP3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1tYiZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce878a491>, a star of Real Housewives of Salt Lake City, was sentenced to six and a half years in prison for fraud over an alleged telemarketing scam.

Open House

Welcome to Open House, the only newsletter section that’s not actually as smart as it seems. We’ll give you a few facts about a listing and you try to guess the price.

Netflix via ZillowNew year, new gimmick. Today’s home <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30179621.3048557/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuemlsbG93LmNvbS9ob3VzZS9nbGFzc29uaW9uLz91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bWImdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C93174439> is a FAKE listing for the Greek island commune from Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery. And even if you can’t actually live in this 29,000 square-foot, cleanish energy-powered smart home, it’s still fun to pretend. Amenities include:

17 beds, 22 baths

Glass onion atrium (obviously)

A million hot takes on whether it’s good satire or not

How much for the fake island?

AROUND THE BREW

The Ascent <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZm9vbC5jb20vbW1zL21hcmsvdGEtY2MtY2l0aXNpbXAvP3V0bV9zaXRlPXRoZWFzY2VudCZ1dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249dGEtY2MtY28tbWItY2l0aXNpbXAtMDEwNjIwMjMtNS1uYS1uYSZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPWNwYyZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1iJmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6b8df858> 
Good morning. The US House of Representatives still does not have a speaker since a small faction of rebels in the Republican party keep blocking Rep. Kevin McCarthy from securing the 218 votes needed to clinch the position.

And after going 0–11 in votes so far, McCarthy is racking up a losing streak that’s verging on Process-era Philadelphia 76ers territory. In fact, the only times the House has needed more ballots to choose a speaker was before the Civil War.

Will today be the day for a breakthrough, or just another scene from Groundhog Day? We’ll find out when the House reconvenes at noon ET today.

—Matty Merritt, Max Knoblauch, Jamie Wilde, Neal Freyman

Markets: Even in 2023, we’re still on that “good news is bad news” grind. Stocks dipped <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY25iYy5jb20vMjAyMy8wMS8wNC9zdG9jay1mdXR1cmVzLWFyZS1kb3duLXNsaWdodGx5LWFzLWludmVzdG9ycy1jb250ZW1wbGF0ZS1mZWQtbWludXRlcy1lY29ub21pYy1kYXRhLmh0bWw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca1648de4> after new reports showed that the US jobs picture has remained stronger than anticipated—a sign that the Fed will keep hiking rates to slow inflation. We’ll get the clearest sense of the labor market this morning, when the government drops December’s jobs report. US employers are expected to have added 200,000 jobs last month.

Stock spotlight: After crypto-focused bank Silvergate Capital revealed that its finances got rocked by FTX’s implosion, its stock got rocked <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cud3NqLmNvbS9hcnRpY2xlcy9zaWx2ZXJnYXRlLXJhY2VkLXRvLWNvdmVyLTgtMS1iaWxsaW9uLWluLXdpdGhkcmF3YWxzLWR1cmluZy1jcnlwdG8tbWVsdGRvd24tMTE2NzI4OTUyMDc_bW9kPWhwX2xpc3RhX3BvczE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C802a8366> on the NYSE. The bank suffered $8.1 billion in customer withdrawals following FTX’s collapse and needed to sell assets at huge losses to meet those obligations.

 

ANTITRUST

FTC to noncompete agreements <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vZGFpbHkvc3Rvcmllcy9mdGMtd2FudHMtdG8tZ2V0LXJpZC1vZi1ub25jb21wZXRlcz91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bWImdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3Jm1pZD03Y2QzZDdlZmNiMmI1ZDFhNmNiZTBiZjA5MzFmNGIyZg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb0b0ce89> Finish Him!! screen on Mortal Kombat <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vZGFpbHkvc3Rvcmllcy9mdGMtd2FudHMtdG8tZ2V0LXJpZC1vZi1ub25jb21wZXRlcz91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bWImdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3Jm1pZD03Y2QzZDdlZmNiMmI1ZDFhNmNiZTBiZjA5MzFmNGIyZg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Db0b0ce89> Midway Games via Giphy
While the House has spent the last week in Jackass Forever mode, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) got serious and proposed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly90aGVoaWxsLmNvbS9idXNpbmVzcy1hLWxvYmJ5aW5nLzM4MDA0ODUtZnRjLXVudmVpbHMtcHJvcG9zYWwtdG8tYmFuLW5vbmNvbXBldGUtY2xhdXNlcy8_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2fb8ed25> a new rule yesterday that could impact everyone from Big Tech execs to unpaid social media interns. The potential rule would ban noncompete agreements, a common mechanism used by companies to keep employees from jumping ship and working for competitors.

It’s been a long time coming

In a 2021 executive order, President Biden asked the FTC (led by antitrust shark Lina Khan) to target noncompetes. And the proposal the agency came up with flexes more muscle than it has in the past: The plan would make all new and existing noncompetes illegal, as well as require companies to inform employees that any previous noncompete agreements are void.

Why are noncompetes a thing? They’re pitched as a way to protect trade secrets so someone working at Domino’s doesn’t leave and design a pizza tracker app for Pizza Hut (okay, not a bad idea). But as noncompetes have flooded industries across the board, the FTC—and even the Treasury Department <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuYnVzaW5lc3NpbnNpZGVyLmNvbS9jb21wYW5pZXMtcGF5LXdvcmtlcnMtbGVzcy10aGFuLXdvcnRoLWJpZGVuLXdhbnRzLXRvLWNoYW5nZS0yMDIyLTM_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7b584225>—say these clauses are essentially trapping workers in lower wages. Putting an end to the practice could boost wages by $300 billion every year, and release workers from career inertia, per the FTC.

Noncompetes are truly everywhere: In one high-profile case in 2016, Jimmy John’s settled a lawsuit with the Illinois state attorney general’s office, saying it would not enforce its noncompete that barred workers from making subs (and sub-adjacents) within a three-mile radius of any JJ shops for two years. As if Jersey Mike’s would even need those dry sandwich secrets.

Looking ahead…the FTC’s 3–1 vote in favor of the proposed rule is the first step of the agency’s rulemaking process. Next up is 60 days of public comment. But there’s no date set for a final vote, and the plan is sure to face challenges even if it does cross the finish line. The US Chamber of Commerce—which represents a lot of big, powerful corporations—threatened legal action against such a change in 2021.—MM

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZmFjZWJvb2suY29tL3NoYXJlci5waHA_dT1odHRwczovL21vcm5pbmdicmV3LmNvbS9kYWlseS9zdG9yaWVzL2Z0Yy13YW50cy10by1nZXQtcmlkLW9mLW5vbmNvbXBldGVzJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9ZmFjZWJvb2tfc2hhcmU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C633e5d8c>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cDovL3d3dy5saW5rZWRpbi5jb20vc2hhcmVBcnRpY2xlP3VybD1odHRwczovL21vcm5pbmdicmV3LmNvbS9kYWlseS9zdG9yaWVzL2Z0Yy13YW50cy10by1nZXQtcmlkLW9mLW5vbmNvbXBldGVzJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bGlua2VkaW5fc2hhcmU/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb7201bf2>   <mailto:?subject=Check%20out%20this%20story%20from%20Morning%20Brew%21&body=FTC%20to%20noncompete%20agreements%3A%20https%3A%2F%2Fmorningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2Fftc-wants-to-get-rid-of-noncompetes%3Futm_campaign%3Dmb%26utm_medium%3Dnewsletter%26utm_source%3Dmorning_brew%0A%0AWant%20more%20great%20content%3F%20Subscribe%20to%20Daily%20Brew%20%E2%80%94%20Delivering%20the%20latest%20business%20news%20from%20Wall%20St.%20to%20Silicon%20Valley%20daily.%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fr%2F%3Fkid%3Df2654ef3%26utm_source%3Demail_share%0A> 

TOGETHER WITH THE ASCENT

Zero in on the perfect card <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZm9vbC5jb20vbW1zL21hcmsvdGEtY2MtY2l0aXNpbXAvP3V0bV9zaXRlPXRoZWFzY2VudCZ1dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249dGEtY2MtY28tbWItY2l0aXNpbXAtMDEwNjIwMjMtNS1uYS1uYSZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPWNwYyZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1iJmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C73526cec> The Ascent <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZm9vbC5jb20vbW1zL21hcmsvdGEtY2MtY2l0aXNpbXAvP3V0bV9zaXRlPXRoZWFzY2VudCZ1dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249dGEtY2MtY28tbWItY2l0aXNpbXAtMDEwNjIwMjMtNS1uYS1uYSZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPWNwYyZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1iJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfefdd4ea>
Ya know that ol’ needle-in-a-haystack saying? That’s what it feels like to look for a new credit card with benefits you’ll actually use—nearly impossible, and as boring as the cliché itself.

But your search is over: This card has it all <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZm9vbC5jb20vbW1zL21hcmsvdGEtY2MtY2l0aXNpbXAvP3V0bV9zaXRlPXRoZWFzY2VudCZ1dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249dGEtY2MtY28tbWItY2l0aXNpbXAtMDEwNjIwMjMtNS1uYS1uYSZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPWNwYyZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1iJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C03b68a68>. What’s the scoop? Peep this one’s features:

0% intro APR on balance transfers for 21 months (that’s one of the longest on the market, BTW)

an additional, lengthy 0% intro APR on purchases

$0 annual fee

Oh, and that’s not all it offers, either. But don’t take our word for it—dig in to this expert review <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZm9vbC5jb20vbW1zL21hcmsvdGEtY2MtY2l0aXNpbXAvP3V0bV9zaXRlPXRoZWFzY2VudCZ1dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249dGEtY2MtY28tbWItY2l0aXNpbXAtMDEwNjIwMjMtNS1uYS1uYSZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPWNwYyZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1iJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc541ca34> for the full details.

Apply for this zero-interest card here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZm9vbC5jb20vbW1zL21hcmsvdGEtY2MtY2l0aXNpbXAvP3V0bV9zaXRlPXRoZWFzY2VudCZ1dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249dGEtY2MtY28tbWItY2l0aXNpbXAtMDEwNjIwMjMtNS1uYS1uYSZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPWNwYyZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1iJmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C897a896a>.



WORLD

Tour de headlines <#> Allegiant Stadium pays tribute to Damar Hamlin on its facade Ethan Miller/Getty Images
Damar Hamlin is awake. Doctors at the University of Cincinnati Medical Center said the Buffalo Bills safety had woken up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly9hcG5ld3MuY29tL2FydGljbGUvYnVmZmFsby1iaWxscy1kYW1hci1oYW1saW4tdXBkYXRlcy1jMDg2ZTQ3MmIxMGI0ZTc5Y2QyNDUwMmJjYmYyZTA5Yj91dG1fc291cmNlPWhvbWVwYWdlJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09VG9wTmV3cyZ1dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249cG9zaXRpb25fMDI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf1190b4a> on Wednesday night, two days after he had gone into cardiac arrest during an NFL game and was sedated. Hamlin has been able to communicate via writing, and his first question was whether the Bills won their game against the Cincinnati Bengals. The doctors responded: “The answer is yes, Damar, you won the game of life.” That Bills–Bengals game has been canceled by the league, but NFL teams are still preparing to play in an anything-but-normal Week 18 this upcoming weekend.

Pineapple Express slams California with wind and rain. A weather event known as a Pineapple Express storm has caused thousands of power outages and at least two deaths in California, which has been under a state of emergency since Wednesday. The storm brings <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubnByLm9yZy8yMDIzLzAxLzA1LzExNDcxMDI5NjgvY2FsaWZvcm5pYS1zdG9ybS13ZWF0aGVyLXBpbmVhcHBsZS1leHByZXNzLWF0bW9zcGhlcmljLXJpdmVyP3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1tYiZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2e657d59> with it 100+ mph winds and buckets of rainfall, which has led to flash flooding and landslides in parts of the state. Parts of Northern California were evacuated or placed under weather advisory, and forecasters have warned that more storm systems are expected to hit the area next week.

Drama at the southern border ahead of Biden’s visit. The president is planning to visit the US–Mexico border for the first time in his tenure on Sunday, and before his trip he announced tighter restrictions <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly9hcG5ld3MuY29tL2FydGljbGUvcG9saXRpY3MtbWV4aWNvLWltbWlncmF0aW9uLWFmMDY0M2E0ZmI4ZjQ1Mzg4ZmUyNDdlNDRjOWIyYzVlP3V0bV9zb3VyY2U9aG9tZXBhZ2UmdXRtX21lZGl1bT1Ub3BOZXdzJnV0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1wb3NpdGlvbl8wNA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc650513e> on migrants who try to come into the US without authorization, telling them to apply for asylum in their home countries instead. Meanwhile, Mexico arrested the son of drug lord “El Chapo,” who is himself allegedly one of the top traffickers of the deadly opioid fentanyl.

RETAIL

Bed Bath & Beyond says it’s reached its limit <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vZGFpbHkvc3Rvcmllcy9iZWQtYmF0aC1iZXlvbmQtcG90ZW50aWFsLWJhbmtydXB0Y3k_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldyZtaWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmY/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D3658471a> Bed Bath & Beyond bankruptcy <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vZGFpbHkvc3Rvcmllcy9iZWQtYmF0aC1iZXlvbmQtcG90ZW50aWFsLWJhbmtydXB0Y3k_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldyZtaWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmY/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E3658471a> Photo Illustration: Dianna “Mick” McDougall, Source: Getty Images
Big January-in-the-Northeast vibes out of Bed Bath & Beyond yesterday, as the company announced <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubnl0aW1lcy5jb20vMjAyMy8wMS8wNS9idXNpbmVzcy9iZWQtYmF0aC1iZXlvbmQtYmFua3J1cHRjeS5odG1sP3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1tYiZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce6c88968> in a public filing that it has “substantial doubt” about its ability to continue and could potentially file for bankruptcy.

BBBY expects to report a 33% sales decline compared to Q3 last year (which included Black Friday). The company anticipates losses to reach $385.8 million—a 40% spike from last year—and warned that it may not have cash for suppliers and lease agreements in the coming months. In response, shares fell to their lowest level in ~30 years, marking a 96% decline from the stock’s recent peak during its period in the memestock limelight (more on that in a bit).

What happened? Maybe shoppers are just less impressed by towels these days. But more likely the retailer also committed a self-own by replacing big brands with private labels amid supply chain snarls and at a time when pandemic-era shoppers wanted to shell out for a Kitchen-Aid. Sales fell flat due to supply chain issues and underinvestment in the BBBY website.

There was also the issue of meme stock investor Ryan Cohen, who announced a ~10% stake in the company in March, which prompted retail investors to also pile in. In August, however, Cohen exited <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubW9ybmluZ2JyZXcuY29tL2RhaWx5L3N0b3JpZXMvYmVkLWJhdGgtYW5kLWJleW9uZC1tZW1lLXN0b2NrLXJlYm9vdD91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bWImdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3Jm1pZD03Y2QzZDdlZmNiMmI1ZDFhNmNiZTBiZjA5MzFmNGIyZg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C57dbc378> his position and shares plummeted 45%.—MK

If you’re shopping for more retail news, sign up for Retail Brew <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cucmV0YWlsYnJldy5jb20vP3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1tYiZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXcmbWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJm/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7ed2ea08>.

FOOD & BEV

Everyone’s becoming a non-alcoholic <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vZGFpbHkvc3Rvcmllcy8yMDIzLzAxLzA1L25vbmFsY29ob2xpYy1iZWVyLXdpbmUtYW5kLXNwaXJpdHM_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldyZtaWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmY/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C77a5cba3> 0% ABV labeled beer taps <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vZGFpbHkvc3Rvcmllcy8yMDIzLzAxLzA1L25vbmFsY29ob2xpYy1iZWVyLXdpbmUtYW5kLXNwaXJpdHM_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldyZtaWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmY/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D77a5cba3> Francis Scialabba
Nonalcoholic beer, wine, and spirits are grabbing headlines because it’s Dry January—the month when people stop drinking <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubnByLm9yZy9zZWN0aW9ucy9tb25leS8yMDIzLzAxLzAzLzExNDQ2MjE2NDEvbm9uYWxjb2hvbGljLWJlZXItd2luZS1zcGlyaXRzLWRyeS1qYW51YXJ5P3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1tYiZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cef080b18> and the worst time to go on a family vacation. But it turns out that drinking 0% ABV lagers has turned into a year-round phenomenon for health-conscious customers.

Retail sales of nonalcoholic beverages grew more than 20% last year, and 120% over three years, per Nielsen.

IWSR Drinks Market Analysis estimates <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZm94YnVzaW5lc3MuY29tL2xpZmVzdHlsZS9iZXlvbmQtZHJ5LWphbnVhcnktcmlzZS1ub24tYWxjb2hvbGljLWRyaW5rcy1hZHVsdC1iZXZlcmFnZS1tYXJrZXQ_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B33d66f62> the sector will expand more than 25% in the US by 2027.

Beer giants Ab Inbev and Heineken have launched <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY25iYy5jb20vMjAyMi8xMi8zMC9ub24tYWxjb2hvbGljLWJlZXItc2V0LXRvLWNvbnRpbnVlLXRvLWdyb3ctaW4tMjAyMy5odG1sP3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1tYiZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6a21cab6> O’Douls competitors, and so have nonalcoholic breweries like Athletic Brewing Co.—which recently raised $50 million from Keurig Dr. Pepper. Alcohol-free wine and spirits represent much smaller pieces of the category’s sales pie, but new brands pedaling adaptogens, nootropics, and whatever else Erewhon marks up have been launched by celebs including Bella Hadid and Katy Perry.

Meanwhile, sales of alcoholic beer and wine have declined year over year, and alcoholic spirit sales grew less than 1% annually.

That’s not to say people are teetotaling. Actually, over eight in 10 people who buy nonalcoholic drinks also buy alcoholic drinks. Plus, the nonalcoholic drinks sector, despite its recent growth, is a shot glass to Big Alcohol’s das boot, with the former representing a tiny 0.47% of the broader buzzed industry.—JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZmFjZWJvb2suY29tL3NoYXJlci5waHA_dT1odHRwczovL21vcm5pbmdicmV3LmNvbS9kYWlseS9zdG9yaWVzLzIwMjMvMDEvMDUvbm9uYWxjb2hvbGljLWJlZXItd2luZS1hbmQtc3Bpcml0cyZ1dG1fc291cmNlPWZhY2Vib29rX3NoYXJl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C571bbfc1>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.>   <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cDovL3d3dy5saW5rZWRpbi5jb20vc2hhcmVBcnRpY2xlP3VybD1odHRwczovL21vcm5pbmdicmV3LmNvbS9kYWlseS9zdG9yaWVzLzIwMjMvMDEvMDUvbm9uYWxjb2hvbGljLWJlZXItd2luZS1hbmQtc3Bpcml0cyZ1dG1fc291cmNlPWxpbmtlZGluX3NoYXJl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf27c1c16>   <mailto:?subject=Check%20out%20this%20story%20from%20Morning%20Brew%21&body=Everyone%E2%80%99s%20becoming%20a%20non-alcoholic%3A%20https%3A%2F%2Fmorningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2023%2F01%2F05%2Fnonalcoholic-beer-wine-and-spirits%3Futm_campaign%3Dmb%26utm_medium%3Dnewsletter%26utm_source%3Dmorning_brew%0A%0AWant%20more%20great%20content%3F%20Subscribe%20to%20Daily%20Brew%20%E2%80%94%20Delivering%20the%20latest%20business%20news%20from%20Wall%20St.%20to%20Silicon%20Valley%20daily.%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fr%2F%3Fkid%3Df2654ef3%26utm_source%3Demail_share%0A>

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators <#> A pill filled with money Francis Scialabba
Stat: New medicines launched by US drugmakers reached a median price of $222,003 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cucmV1dGVycy5jb20vYnVzaW5lc3MvaGVhbHRoY2FyZS1waGFybWFjZXV0aWNhbHMvdXMtbmV3LWRydWctcHJpY2UtZXhjZWVkcy0yMDAwMDAtbWVkaWFuLTIwMjItMjAyMy0wMS0wNS8_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Caa29d7be>last year, according to Reuters. These astronomical prices were fueled by three uber-expensive gene therapies approved by the FDA—one of them, from Hemgenix, costs $3.5 million, making it the most expensive drug ever. Congress did cap annual drug price increases via the Inflation Reduction Act, but that doesn’t cover the cost of new medications. Drugmakers, meanwhile, say the cost of their drugs doesn’t reflect what patients pay out-of-pocket for them.

Quote: “Maybe we cried too much last year.”

The CFO of Walgreens acknowledged that the company was being overdramatic <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY25iYy5jb20vMjAyMy8wMS8wNS93YWxncmVlbnMtbWF5LWhhdmUtb3ZlcnN0YXRlZC10aGVmdC1jb25jZXJucy5odG1sP3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1tYiZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXc/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cee32fdb4> about the effects of theft on its business. Last year, the retailer warned that increased theft (or “shrinkage,” in industry terms) would account for a meaty 3.5% of sales, so it hired private security guards and barricaded toiletries like they were the “Mona Lisa.” But apparently the level of shrinkage hasn’t been significant and those guards weren’t effective, so it’s winding down its use of private security companies.

Read: The “breakthrough” obesity drugs that have stunned researchers. (Nature <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubmF0dXJlLmNvbS9hcnRpY2xlcy9kNDE1ODYtMDIyLTA0NTA1LTc_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C500ee4d6>)

WHAT ELSE IS BREWING

South Carolina’s Supreme Court <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly9hcG5ld3MuY29tL2FydGljbGUvYWJvcnRpb24tcG9saXRpY3MtaGVhbHRoLXNvdXRoLWNhcm9saW5hLXN0YXRlLWdvdmVybm1lbnQtNmNkMTQ2OWRiYjU1MGM3MGI2NGEzMGYxODNiZTIwM2M_dXRtX3NvdXJjZT1ob21lcGFnZSZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPVRvcE5ld3MmdXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPXBvc2l0aW9uXzA4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdaaaf290> struck down an abortion ban after about six weeks of pregnancy, saying it violates the state constitution.

ChatGPT’s creator <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cud3NqLmNvbS9hcnRpY2xlcy9jaGF0Z3B0LWNyZWF0b3Itb3BlbmFpLWlzLWluLXRhbGtzLWZvci10ZW5kZXItb2ZmZXItdGhhdC13b3VsZC12YWx1ZS1pdC1hdC0yOS1iaWxsaW9uLTExNjcyOTQ5Mjc5P21vZD1ocF9sZWFkX3BvczY/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C58f98fda>, OpenAI, is considering selling shares at a valuation of around $29 billion, which would make it one of the most valuable private US startups, per the WSJ.

Russian President Vladimir Putin <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly9hcG5ld3MuY29tL2FydGljbGUva3lpdi1ydXNzaWEtdWtyYWluZS13YXItZ292ZXJubWVudC03YTRkZjQ5ODcwN2JiMDQ3ZDJhMzIyMDA1Yzg2MWZkMD91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bWImdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7cc1da2d> ordered his military to observe a 36-hour ceasefire for Orthodox Christmas. Ukrainians dismissed it as propaganda to buy time for Russian troops to regroup.

Delta <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly90ZWNoY3J1bmNoLmNvbS8yMDIzLzAxLzA1L2RlbHRhLWxhdW5jaGVzLWZyZWUtd2lmaS8_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C78f9425e> is launching free wi-fi for members of its frequent flier program starting Feb. 1.

Here’s all the stock trades <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30167710.3067832/aHR0cHM6Ly91bnVzdWFsd2hhbGVzLmNvbS9wb2xpdGljcy9hcnRpY2xlL2NvbmdyZXNzLXRyYWRpbmctcmVwb3J0LTIwMjI_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPW1iJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B5bc20f12> members of Congress made last year.

Friday puzzle

This is an unusual paragraph. I’m curious as to just how quickly you can find out what is so unusual about it. It looks so ordinary and plain that you would think nothing was wrong with it. In fact, nothing is wrong with it! It is highly unusual though. Study it and think about it. You still may not find anything odd. But if you work at it a bit, you might find out. Try to do so without any coaching.

ANSWER

There is no letter “e,” which is the most commonly used letter in the English language.
